description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, Aug. 1 During the last quartercentury, the roster of tennis regulars who have faced one another across the net at Dr. Herb Baron's allweather private court here reads like a who's who of the Eastern Lawn Tennis Association's senior bracket (Jersey division), rounded out with a sprinkling of procelebrity greats.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SLEEPER 2 The insomniacs return this weekend for another nocturnal bicycle ride  this time it's a jaunt up the New Jersey Palisades to the George Washington Bridge for a breathtaking view of the Manhattan skyline.

title: N.F.L. Peace Talks Break Down Again
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP)Negotiations in the National Football League labor dispute broke down again today and were recessed until next Tuesday because an agreement can't be consummated at this time.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Aug. 1 (AP)No legal action is expected in a case involving six Notre Dame football players who were under criminal investigation last week after an 18yearold woman alleged she had been raped, says the St. Joseph County prosecutor.

title: House. Impeachment Numbers Game: First You Take 248, Subtract 187...
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Everybody had a number but nobody had a count today in the House of Representatives.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, AUGUST 2, 1974
description: All civil rights have been restored, said Panayotis Lambrias, Under Secretary for Press and Information, as Greece took a major step in restoring democratic government by reinvoking the Constitution that had been in force before the military coup of 1967. However, the provisions of the Constitution relating to the monarchy were temporarily suspended. [1:1.]

title: TOKYO SAYS SEOUL FAILS TO KEEP VOW
description: TOKYO, Aug. 1 (AP)South Korea has not fulfilled its promise to solve the controversial kidnapping of the South Korean opposition leader, Kim Dae Jung, Foreign Minister Toshio Kimura charged today.

title: Doctor on Watch For Breakin Slays Girl He Delivered
description: ELKIN, N. C., Aug 1 (UPI) A doctor who staked out his office because of drug burglaries shot and killed a girl whose birth he attended 18 years ago, the police said today.

title: Most Retail Chains Improve Sales Gains
description: Sales of the country's largest retail chains continued on a strong note in July, with one dramatic exception. Sears, Roebuck & Co., the nation's largest retailer reported yesterday that its July sales were up only 3.1 per cent over the year before. The gain is less than half the inflation factor and much below Sears' typical 1974 monthly gain.

title: Baltimore Suspends 48 More Policemen For Roles in Strike
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 1The city police commissioner suspended 48 more policemen today for participating in the recent fiveday strike.

title: U.N. Votes a Wider Role For Cyprus Truce Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 1The Security Council adopted a resolution today that enables the United Nations peacekeeping force on Cyprus to assume expanded duties under the Geneva agreement.

title: U.S. Said to Order C.I.A. To Curtail Role in Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Central Intelligence Agency has reportedly been instructed by top officials of the Nixon Administration not to interfere in the internal affairs of Greece or to play favorites among Greek politicians.

title: WALTER J. SEELEY
description: Walter J. Seeley, dean of Duke University's School of Engineering from 1953 to 1963 and former James B. Duke Professor of Electrical Engineering, died Monday in Durham, N.C., at the age of 79.

title: Jerseyan is Cycling Winner
description: NORTH BROOK, Ill., Aug, 1Steve Woznick of Ridgefield Park, N. J., won the national senior men's kilometer championship in bicycling last night for the third consecutive year. Woznick, a 24yearold bicycle store manager, covered the distance in 1 minute 9.83 seconds and will compete in the world championships in Montreal beginning Aug. 14.

title: HOUSE CHIEFS PICK AUG. 19 TO START DEBATE ON NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The leadership of the House of Representatives decided tentatively today that Representatives would start to debate the impeachment of President Nixon on Aug. 19 and allow gaveltogavel television coverage through the final vote at the end of the month.

title: City's Urban. League, in Debt, Gets Time to Pay U.S. Taxes
description: The Urban League of Greater New York, plagued by debts totaling more than three quarters of a million dollars, has made an arrangement with the Internal Revenue Service to pay off in small amounts the portion of that figure owed in payroll withholding taxes.

title: ANTITRUST CHIEF STARTS BIG DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 Thomas E. Kauper, bead of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division, said today that his office was launching a major new effort aimed at uncovering pricefixing and other anticompetitive actions in major national industries.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Pillow Puffery, With Top Dancers
description: LEE, Mass., Aug. 1Kitsch ballets simulate serious artistry with clich plots and technical showiness that almost inevitably delights audiences. For three outstanding performers such as Judith Jamison, Miguel Godreau and John Parks to allow such puffery to dominate their appearances at the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival this week is cause for some concern. They shared a program with the Indian dancer Nara Najan, and while they dancea well, they showed a dearth of imagination.

title: Contract Awards
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation has received a $45.9million Navy contract for pilot production of the Harpoon missile.

title: GEN. JOHN F. LEE JR.
description: TOTOWA, N.J., Aug 1 (UPI) Brig. Gen. John F. Lee Jr., who retired from the Army in 1940, died Tuesday at the Jersey Shore Medical Center in Neptune. He was 79 years old.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.4 billion tonmiles, 1.5 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 524,087 cars, per cent below last year.

title: JOHNSON TO PUSH BROADCAST WORK
description: Neither the broadcasting industry nor the Federal Communications Commission is rid of Nicholas Johnson.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Most Wanted Man Seized
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (UPI)  One of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's 10 most wanted fugitives was captured in downtown Des Moines, Iowa, late yesterday, the Bureau announced today. He is Lendell Hunter, 21 years old, a convicted rapist, kidnapper and burglar. He was arrested without incident, the F.B.I. said.

title: Common Market Critical Of French Beef Program
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 1  Action by France and Belgium this week to quiet farmers' protests by aiding beef raisers is viewed by Common Market authorities as a threat to the principle of a common agricultural policy.

title: Rostropovich Lists Series Of Cello Concerts in Capital
description: Mstislav Rostropovich, the Soviet cellist, will appear for 14 performances next season at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington. Mr. Rostropovich's appearances will be split between five concerts during 11 days, beginning Feb. 28, and nine concerts during three weeks, beginning June 27.

title: Just the Facts, Please
description: There are a number of journalists who believe it's all over for the President. They have counted noses in the Congress, checked their wind socks for the direction of national sentiment, read the rumblings of their own and other journalistic stomachs and concluded that impeachment is certain in the House, conviction ordained in the Senate. The trouble is not that they believe that, but that more and more of them are saying so publicly.

title: Bomb Hits Belfast Store
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 1 (AP) bomb exploded at one of Belfast's biggest department stores today, but the police reported no casualties. The area around the store had been cleared before the bomb exploded. The store, the Belfast Coop, has been frequent target for terrorists of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Comment on Crabiel Is Put Off by Byrne; Law Bars Removal
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1Reaction from Governor Byrne to the indictment yesterday of his Secretary of State on bidrigging charges has been delayed until tomorrow while the Governor and his aides ponder a new problema constitutional prohibition against dismiss sing a sitting Secretary of States.

title: A Catholic Bishop in Korea On Trial for Aiding Dissent
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 1 Bishop Daniel Chi Flak Soun, an outspoken Roman Catholic prelate, was taken before a closed military court today on charges of providing money to dissident students planning the violent overthrow of the Government.

title: HOUSE CHIEFS PICK AUG. 19 TO START DEBATE ON NIXON
description: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The leadership of the House of Representatives decided tentatively today that Representatives would start to debate the impeachment of President Nixon on Aug. 19 and allow gaveltogavel television coverage through the final vote at the end of the month.

title: Armored Truck Reported Sought for Prison Escape
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., Aug. 1Fred Gomez Carrasco demanded an armored truck today to use to escape from the Huntsville State Prison, according to daughter of one of 13 hostages he and two other armed inmates have held in the prison library for eight days.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Bypass...
description: Among the more preposterous ideas issuing from President Nixon's White House to contain the political damage from Watergate is the suggestion that Mr. Nixon might simply ask the House of Representatives for a perfunctory and pro forma vote for impeachment, without debate, to speed up the process and leave the real deliberation to the subsequent Senate trial.

title: Dance
description: American Ballet Theater's first performance this season of Divertissements From Napoli and Antony Tudor's Undertow provided the occasion Wednesday night at the New York State Theater for the first appearance here by Fernando Bujones since he won a gold medal at the Varna international ballet competition in Bulgaria.

title: China Rehabilitates 13 Officers Purged in Cultural Revolution
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 1China celebrated Army Day today with a big display of unity and disclosed the rehabilitation of highranking military officers purged during the Cultural Revolution.

title: SHARP RISE FOUND IN GROCERY PRICES
description: Higher prices for meat, eggs and sugar helped raise the family grocery bill an average of 4 per cent during July, an Associated Press market basket survey shows. The increase was the worst in more than a year, and there are indications of more price rises ahead.

title: Mobil Calls Article About Oil in Times Highly Misleading
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation yesterday called an article that appeared in The New York Times Monday highly misleading.

title: For a Brazil Tribe, A New Will to Live
description: MERURE, Brazil  The Bororos, a oncestrong tribe that reached such a state of general despair four years ago that its women temporarily rendered themselves sterile, have begun to bear children again.

title: Greek Cypriote Forces Are Driven. From Two Villages by Turkish Guns
description: AYIOS ERMOLAOS, Cyprus, Aug. 1Turkish artillery drove Greek Cypriote forces out of two small villages here today as ceasefire violations continued in Cyprus for lack of effective United Nations supervision.

title: Music: Naumburg Symphony in Park
description: The New York Philharmonic Orchestra has averaged some 100,000 people for its Central Park concerts this year. The Naumburg Symphony Orchestra drew about 500 (at the very most) for the third of its four 1974 summer concerts, Wednesday night at the Central Park Mall. This would seem to mean that the public thinks that the Philharmonic is 200 times better than the Naumburgersor at least that 200 times more people think the Philharmonic worth going to. To judge from Wednesday's concert, that's a slightly exaggerated discrepancy. One wouldn't want to destroy the pleasant ambiance of the casually attended Naumburg concerts. But Wednesday's effort deserved a bigger audience.

title: 2 Die as Tug Rams Barges Into World's Longest Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 1 (UPI)  A tugboat captain suspected of sleeping at the wheel today rammed four empty barges into the world's longest bridge, toppling 260 feet of roadway and pitching a car and pickup truck into the water.

title: Byrne Stays Comment on Indicted Aide
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1Reaction from Governor Byrne to the indictment yesterday of his Secretary of State on bidrigging charges has been delayed until tomorrow while the Governor and his aides ponder a new problema constitutional prohibition against dismissing a sitting Secretary of States.

title: Japan Concedes Presence Of Three U.S. Radar Sites
description: TOKYO, Aug. 1 (Reuters)The Foreign Ministry conceded today that the United States had three overthehorizon radar sites in Japan to give early warning of a missile attack.

title: Deep Trouble for Byrne
description: Governor Byrne's Democratic administration in New Jersey is in deep political trouble. Already confronted by a querulous, defiant Legislature that sought to humiliate him last week when the State Senate rejected his taxreform program, the Governor must now grapple with new charges of political corruption involved in the indictment of Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel.

title: Conrad S. Hooper, 62, Dies; B. Altman & Co. Executive
description: Conrad S. Hooper, a vice president and, a director of B. Altman & Co., the department store, died yesterday. He was 62 years old and lived at 85 East 85th Street.

title: Ford, Also a Steelmaker, Pressing Mill Expansion
description: DETROIT, Aug. 1 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company, best known as the nation's No. 2 automaker after the General Motors Corporation, also is the 11th largest producer of steel in the United States.

title: Bridge: Summer Nationals Here Set No New Attendance Record
description: In ever yway but one, the Summer Nationals in New York last month were a great success, and a tribute to the considerable organizing efforts made by many dedicated officials and volunteers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Scandals of the Past: The Difference

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
People and Business
description: Felix E. Larkin, who has been president and chief operating officer of W. R. Grace & Co. since 1971, yesterday was elected chairman. J. Peter Grace, who has been chairman and chief executive officer, has returned to the office of president and continues as chief executive officer. Mr. Larkin, who is 64 years old, joined W. R. Grace in 1951. Mr. Grace, 61, has been chief executive orficer of the company since 1945.

title: Regalado, Heard and J. C. Snead Pace Golf on 68's
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 1Vic Regalado, who says he is the only authentic Mexican on the American pro golf tour, shot a 3underpar 68 today and shared the lead with Jerry Heard and J. C. Snead after the first round of the $200,000 Pleasant Valley Classic.

title: Reinecke Will Resign
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 1Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke, his once promising political career apparently destroyed by a Federal perjury conviction, promised today that he would resign voluntarily but did not say whether that would be soon or just before legal action would force him out a month from now.

title: Nissan Export Outlays Cut
description: TOKYO, Aug. 1 (Reuters)The Nissan Motor Company, Ltd., makers of the Datsun, announced today it would reduce its export shipments to the United States by about onethird this October. The company said the decision resulted from sluggish sales on the American market. Nissan said it was considering a cut of about 10,000 units, to 20,000, a month.

title: RAIN CUTS PRICES OF CORN FUTURES
description: Rains came to the dry Midwest soybean and corn belts yesterday, dampening enthusiasm for futures contracts. Corn and soybean prices dropped sharply, down the limit in most cases, on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 29

title: La Prevoyante Returns To Winning Style at Spa
description: SARATOGA SPRNIGS, N. Y., Aug. 1La Prevoyante, who performed so magnificently at Saratoga two years ago, showed her liking again today for this course. Competing in a sixfurlong sprint against five other older fillies, Louis Levesque's Canadianbred star flashed to victory in the second fastest time recorded for the distance here.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, AUGUST 2, 1974
description: All civil rights have been restored, said Panayotis Lambrias, Under Secretary for Press and Information, as Greece took a major step in restoring democratic government by reinvoking the Constitution that had been in force before the military coup of 1967. However, the provisions of the Constitution relating to the monarchy were temporarily suspended. [1:1.]

title: Painful Korean Issue in U.S.: Seoul's Curbs on Dissenters Stir Opposition to Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The widespread South Korean crackdown on political dissidents has sparked a painful debate in Washington on how the United States should conduct its relalations with President Park Chung Hee.

title: SALLY EATON SINGS BALLADS AND BLUES
description: Sally Eaton, an alumna of Hair who has been performing with Cliff Grisham, pianist and singer, for the last year, is making an inadvertent debut as a single this week and next at Reno Sweeney. When Mr. Grisham was hospitalized with hepatitis just before their scheduled opening at the West 13th Street room, Miss Eaton enlisted Lew Friedman, owner of Reno Sweeney, as her pianist, developed a new repertory of solo numbers and went on by herself as the opening act to Holly Woodlawn.

title: U.N.Votes a Wider Role For Cyprus Truce Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 1The Security Council adopted a resolution today that enables the United Nations peacekeeping force on Cyprus to assume expanded duties under the Geneva agreement.

title: Merrill to Remove Amex Wall Tickers
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the colossus of the brokerage world, plans to remove its American Stock Exchange wall tickers to cut costs.

title: Books of The Times
description: PURSUIT, The Chase and Sinking Of the Battleship Bismarck. By Ludovic Kennedy. 254 pages. Illustrated. Viking. $10.

title: John Peckham, Who Set Up FilmProducing Firm, Dies
description: John L. Peckham, president of Peckham Productions, Inc., a filmproducing organization, died Wednesday of lung cancer at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine Hospital. He was 45 years old and lived at 230 Bedford Road, Greenwich, Conn.

title: Do ESP Horseplayers Have Future?
description: People capable of ESP have been known to sense what's inside a sealed envelope, Score beyond chance in cardguessing tests or read somebody else's thoughts.

title: NIMA ADLERBLUM, PHILOSOPHER, 92
description: Dr. Nima H. Adlerbium, a writer on philosophy who was instrumental in disseminating the teachings of John Dewey, died July 25 at the King David Hotel in Jerusalem. She was 92 years old.

title: Outflow of Deposits Slow at Franklin
description: The outflow of deposits from the troubled Franklin National Bank has slowed to the lowest rate since the bank's problems became public last May, according to figures released yesterday by the New York Clearing House Association, a bankindustry group.

title: CONGRESS PASSES SCHOOL DATA BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) Congress has approved a bill to give parents the right to inspect, challenge and protect school records about their children.

title: Arab Couples in America Find Differences Between the Ways of Life Surmountable
description: Nabila Elagizy was serving sugarsprinkled pastry and sweet coffee in the dining room of the whiteshingled house in Clifton, N.J.

title: INTEREST IN A105 GROWING ABROAD
description: A number of Western European, Middle Eastern and South American governments are studying the purchase of A10 close support planes produced by the Fairchild Republic division of Fairchild Industries, Inc., according to reliable sources.

title: ... And BugOut
description: So now it seems there is another mysterious gap in those Presidential tape recordings. This one lasts five minutes and twelve seconds during a meeting of April 17, 1973, just as Mr. Nixon and his closest aides were deciding how to tell the American public why intensive new inquiries were being made in the Watergate case.

title: Weekend Fishing Good For Fluke and Bluefish
description: One of the happiest events in saltwater angling along the East Coast this season is the return of the fluke, or summer flounder, in great numbers. Excellent catches of these tasty fish are being made all the way from southern New Jersey to Cape Cod, and in many instances the fluke, particularly in early evening, move right in on the beach to feed.

title: A Time of Perplexity for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1At the Nixon White House favorite saying is Skip the details and examine the bottom line for the real meaning. The bottom line of statements emanating from the President's aides this week is that Mr. Nixon has made some serious tactical errors in his efforts to avoid impeachment, has few options left to exercise and is still searching for a new strategy.

title: WALTER J. SEELEY
Tiny Dose of Methadone Found In Autopsy on L.I. Woman, 19
description: The Nassau County Medical Examiner said yesterday that he had found a very small amount of methadone in the body of a 19year old woman who was found dead Tuesday in the Westbury, L.I., apartment of her boyfriend.

title: Earthquakes in the Mojave
description: PASEDENA, Calif., Aug. 1 (UN)  A sparsely populated area of the Mojave Desert has been shaken by 11 light earthquakes in two days. The Caltech Seismological Observatory said that three more quakes rippled yesterday through the 60mile area between Ludlow and the Twenty Nine Palms Marine Corps base, about 120 miles east of Los Angeles, On Tuesday eight temblors struck the area in 1 hour 14 minutes.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Tigers Top Brewers, 20, On Fryman's OneHitter
description: Woodie Fryman, a 34yearold lefthander from Ewing, Ky., pitched a onehitter and struck out a personal season high of 10 batters to spark the Detroit Tigers to a 20 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers last night in County Stadium.

title: Reserve Report
description: DAILY AVERAGES

title: ALLIANCE OF JEWS AND BLACKS URGED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 1The 64th annual convention of the Nationale Urban League ended last night with a plea for reestablishment of the alliance between blacks and Jews.

title: For a Brazil Tribe, A New Will to Live
description: MERURE, Brazil  The Bororos, a oncestrong tribe that reached such a state of general despair four years ago that its women temporarily rendered themselves sterile, have begun to bear children again.

title: A Giant Caught in Web of N.F.L. Strike
description: Dramatizing the agony of the marginal player, Willie Young conceded yesterday that he rejoined the New York Giants because he was afraid of losing his job.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER DIP
description: The continued bearish outlook for the economy again depressed most issues yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Bloomington, Minn.Rodney Bobick, 227 pounds, Bowlus, Minn., outpointed Ron Stander, 239, Council Bluffs, Iowa, 10 rounds.

title: 2 Perot Executives Gave Mills $100,000,Watergate Files Show
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) Two top executives of the computer company of H. Ross Perot, a Texas millionaire, secretly funneled $100,000 through dummy committees into the 1972 Presidential campaign of Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, according to Watergate files.

title: OffDuty Lifeguard Saves a Woman, 54, In Leap Off a Ferry
description: An offduty lifeguard dived off a Staten Island ferry boat yesterday afternoon and rescued a 54yearold mental patient who had leaped into the water in her second apparent suicide attempt from a ferry boat this week

title: U.S. Auto Output Drops by 22.5%
description: DETROIT, Aug. 1American auto plants built 546,982 cars last month, down 22.5 per cent from the 705,821 cars built in July, 1973.

title: Reserve Rejects Linking Of Credit to Priorities
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Federal Reserve Board has rejected proposals, which have received mounting Democratic support, for new devices to allocate credit among borrowers according to national economic priorities.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: All Said and Done by, Simone de Beauvoir (Putnam, $10). Volume five of an autobiography covering 196272.

title: Israel Willing to Compromise With Jordani, Allon Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel said today that his country was ready to negotiate a fair compromise with Jordan as part of the movement toward a Middle East settlement.

title: Short Eyes Closes Sunday
description: Short Eyes, the Miguel Piero prison drama will end its run Sunday afternoon. The prizewinning New York Shakespeare Festival play will have given a total of 156 performances

title: Market Place: Lawyer Scores Plan for Pennsy
description: Richard M. Ader suggests there is a difference in the way the United States acts when foreign governments expropriate American property and the way it is authorized to act by law in what he sees as expropriation of rail property.

title: Stage: Hernani Thrills at Open Eye
description: It is downright thrilling, except for a climactic death scene that takes forever, to watch what a small Off Off Broadway troupe has done with an old Victor Hugo play, his melodrama of royal intirigue and honor titled Hernani. Until the very end, Gamma Productions adhieves a small miracle of crisply vivid, compelling theater, when every word counts. Performances are Thursdays through Sundays at the Open Eye showcase, 78 Fifth Avenue (near 14th Street; CH 33880).

title: Tennessee Ally of Baker Wins G.O.P. Primary for Governor
description: NASHVILLE, Friday, Aug. 2 Lamar Alexander, a 34yearold Nashville lawyer and political ally of United States Senator Howard H. Baker Jr., defeated three other Republican candidates for Governor in yesterday's cluttered Tennessee primary election.

title: 2 TEXTILE UNIONS TO SUPPORT CAREY
description: The Amalgamated Clothin Workers and the Textile Work ers Union endorsed Represent ative Hugh L. Carey for th?? Democratic nomination fo Governor yesterday and prom ised to give him every assist ance within our power.

title: Botwinick to Head Brooklyn Museum
description: Michael Botwinick, assistant director for art at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, was approved yesterday as director of the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Signal from Lisbon
description: The announcement by President Antonio de Spinola the promulgation of a new law permitting Portugal to free Angola, Mozambique and GuineaBissau gives proof that Lisbon has developed a clear policy line on independence for its African colonies.

title: ADOLPH HOLMES DIES, URBAN LEAGUE AIDE
description: Adolph Holmes, since 1972 deputy executive director for program and field operations of the National Urban League, died Wednesday of a heart attack in San Francisco, where he was attending the league's annual conference. His age was 55 and he lived in Teaneck, N.J.

title: U.S. Said to Order C.I.A. To Curtail Role in Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Central Intelligence Agency has reportedly been instructed by top officials of the Nixon Administration not to interfere in the internal affairs of Greece or to play favorites among Greek politicians.

title: Noroton Club Gains Girl's Sailing Title
description: NOROTON, Conn., Aug. 1 Noroton Yacht Club, with Sally Campbell as skipper, won the girls' sailing championship of Long Island Sound today for the second year in a row.

title: The Beginning But Not the End
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The conventional view here now is that this is the beginning of the end for President Nixon, but between the beginning and the endbetween voting articles of impeachment in the House Judiciary Committee and voting conviction in the Senatelie many political struggles and legal tangles that could go on for months.

title: Met (Head) and Louvre (Torso) Reunite Pieces Of Rare Sumerian Statue for Rotating Exhibitions
description: A rare neoSumerian statue, believed by scholars to have been separated in ancient times into a head and body, will be seen intact by the public for the first time in possibly as much as 4,000 years both here and in Paris.

title: The Pop Life
description: Roxy Music is one of the most interesting bands to have emerged from Britain in years, as its recent appear ance here proved. And now, solo albums by its leader and its principal former member have come along to reinforce that interest.

title: BUSINESS LOANS IN CITY EDGE UP
description: Business loans rose slightly in New York City during the week ended Wednesday and corporate borrowings increased more in Chicago. Federal Reserve banks reported yesterday as they released statistics that failed to add up to any dramatic change in banking and credit conditions.

title: Beame and Codd Promise New Efforts to Prevent Rape, but Women's Group Assails Lack of Funding
description: Responding to demands made by the Women's Rape Coalition, Mayor Beame and Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd detailed new efforts yesterday to expand rapeprevention services, improve treatment of victims and change laws so it can be easier to prosecute sexcrime offenders.

title: Weather: The Month of August
$35,000 Dairy Coop Fine Levied for Election Outlays By ANTHONY RIPLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The nation's largest dairy cooperative was fined the maximum amount of $35,000 today after pleading guilty to a sixcount criminal information alleging that it conspired and willfully made illegal campaign contributions in 1968, 1970 and 1972.

title: Dow Declines 6.33 to 751.10Only 4 Issues List New '74 Highs
description: The stock market posted its sixth consecutive decline yesterday in continued lackluster trading as an absence of favorable economic news continued to depress prices.

title: State Freeing Some Mentally Ill Convicts
description: Scores of mentally disturbed criminalssome of whom committed homicideare released almost routinely by the maximumsecurity Matteawan State Hospital to other state mental institutions, which, in turn, are discharging many of the inmates into communities for rehabilitation.

title: GREECE RESTORES 1952 CONSTITUTION WITH CIVIL RIGHTS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 1The Greek Government tonight reinstated the Constitution that had been in force before the military coup of 1967.

title: J. HARRIS WARD DIES; EXHEAD OF UTILITY
description: J. Harris Ward, who retired last year as chairman of Commonwealth Edison Company, died Sunday in Chicago, where he lived. He was 66 years old and also had a home in Lake Forest, Ill.

title: Citicorp Leasing Unit Weighing Canadian Tie to Hamilton Group
description: Citicorp Leasing International, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Citicorp, the parent of the First National City Bank, is discussing a joint venture with the Hamilton Group, Ltd., of Burlington, Ontario, to widen the scope of their leasing operations in Canada and other cities throughout the world. It was proposed that the two companies combine their resources in a strengthened partnership with Citicorp holding 60 per cent and Hamilton 40 per cent.

title: The Missing Articles
description: WASHINGTONAlthough the House Judiciary Committee has performed an historic public service, there are some disturbing implications in its debates and in its failures to act.

title: East Germans Told of Nixon
description: EAST BERLIN, Aug. 1 (Reuters)East Germans received press reports today on the ramifications of impeachment and the trials and tribulations of President Nixon. The officially controlled press had largely ignored the Watergate developments until the recent impeachment votes of the House Judiciary Committee.

title: BELL UNION READY TO STRIKE MONDAY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 Glenn E. Watts, the presiden of the Communications Work ers of America, said today tha 500,000 of his union's member were determined and poise?? to go on strike Monday against the Bell Telephone System unless there was a settle ment.

title: PENNSY WILL UTILIZE GRACE ON PAYMENTS
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad said yesterday that they would exercise grace periods permitted under applicable agreements for the payment of some $17million of interest installments and rentals payable this month, including $8million of which was due yesterday.

title: Forum and Rite Celebrate Nonparenthood
description: Three women in white danced a nonfertility rite at the Central Park lake near 59th Street yesterday, and a novelist and a feminist were crowned with laurel leaves as nonparents of the year.

title: Text of Goldin Statement on City Report
description: Following is the text of a statement by Harrison J. Goldin dictated from London.

title: Goldin Says Aide Altered Books on Scoppetta Order
description: Controller Harrison J. Goldin charged yesterday that the city's Investigation Commissioner instructed a civil servant in the Controller's office to make entries in the Controller's books that were not there when Mr. Goldin's auditors looked at them.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP)The interest rate on new loans from the World Bank will be increased to 8 per cent, the bank's board of executive directors announced today. The board also said it would recommend transfer of $100million from the bank to the International Development Association, a bank affiliate that makes lowinterest loans to needy nations.

title: Cubs Overcome 2,682 Banners And Mets, 74 in 10 and 31
description: It may have been an omen. The overall winning sign chosen at Banner Day during the twilightnight doubleheader between the Mets and the Chicago Cubs last night pictured Snoopy at second, Charley Brown on the mound and other Peanut comicstrip characters at the other positions.

title: King Hussein to Make First Visit to Canada
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 1  King Hussein of Jordan will make his first visit to Canada next week, the Government announced today.

title: Rail Car Orders Fall
description: The nation's railroads ordered 6,302 new freight cars in June, compared with 7,210 in May and 11,664 in June of last year, according to the American Railway Car Institute and the Association of American Railroads. The order backlog as of July 1 was 89,320.

title: Court Backs Bank Credit For Interstate's Toy Unit
description: Interstate Stores, Inc., has obtained court approval for a $10million line of credit from a consortium of six major banks for the Interstate toystore subsidiary, ToysRUs, according to Joseph R. Crowley, trustee, and Herbert B. Siegel, president and trustee. Interstate is functioning under the Chapter X provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Adm. Harry Manning Dies; Captain of United States
description: Vice Adm. Harry Manning, who commanded the superliner United States on her recordbreaking maiden voyage across the Atlantic, died yesterday at his home, 183 Chestnut Ridge Road, Saddle River, N.J. He was 77 years old.

title: Leftist Peronist Legislator Is Shot to Death on Street
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug 1The leading leftwing Peronist in Congress, Rodolfo Ortega Pea, was killed by machinegun fire late last night as he and his wife stepped out of a taxi near the downtown section of the capital. His wife was slightly injured by glass shattered by the bullets.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., confirmed yesterday plans to remove its American Stock Exchange wall tickers as a costcutting measure. Details on Page 36.

title: Cardinal Antoniutti Dead at 75; A Prominent Vatican Diplomat
description: ROME, Aug. 1Ildebrando Cardinal Antoniutti, a former papal diplomat, died today in an automobile accident near Bologna, the Vatican announced today. He was 75 years old.

title: ANTITRUST CHIEF STARTS BIG DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 Thomas E. Kauper, head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division, said today that his office was launching a major new effort aimed at uncovering pricefixing and other anticompetitive actions in major national industries.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police Curb Seizing of Pushcarts

title: $35,000 Dairy Coop Fine Levied for. Election Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The nation's largest dairy cooperative was fined the maximum amount of $35,000 today after pleading guilty to a sixcount criminal information alleging that it conspired and willfully made illegal campaign contributions in 1968, 1970 and 1972.

title: How Good Is Detente?
description: The critical issue raised by East Germany's attempt to block establishment by Bonn of an environmental agency in West Berlin is one that affects the fundamentals of the SovietAmerican relationship. East German violations of the 1972 quadripartite argeement guaranteeing unimpeded access to Berlin pollute the overall politics of dtente.

title: KENNETH B. BOURNE
description: Kenneth B. Bourne, a retired special agent here for the New York Life Insurance Company, died Wednesday in Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester, where he had been living. He was 66 years old.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: Investors wanted to form a partnership In the Purchase of thoroughbred broodmares, the produce to be sold at ton Yearling sales,. This Is not a gefrichquick scheme but a long term investment with many tax advantages, I have the farm, Personnel & knowhow and will put up my own money with yours, Call or write Fentondale Farms, 6 ladstone, NJ 07934 or call 201234.2477 or 201.234.2411.

title: 8 Held as Gun Runners Following Bronx Raids
description: A loansharking victim, Lucy police raids, eight men were arrested in the Bronx yesterday on charges of gunrunning and loansharking.

title: People in Sports
description: After watching Rodney Bobick pound out a onesided 10round decision over Ron Stander in Bloomington, Minn., for his 25th straight professional victory Wednesday night, Angelo Dundee, the seasoned trainer, has invited the 22yearold heavyweight to Miami Beachbut not for a vacation.

title: Inflation, the Scourge of Latin America, Takes Hold in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITYSix pesos for a kilo of tomatoes, the market fruitvendor shouted, and 8 pesos if you pick them yourself.

title: Political Couchmanship
description: Unfortunately, the Hippocratic Oath and its corollaries must be out of style, judging by the plethora of articles by psychiatrists and psychotherapists making diagnoses on people they have never examined.

title: Greening of the Pavement People
description: STAMFORD, Conn.The recent unexpected defeat in Congress of the Land Policy and Planning Assistance Act of 1973, popularly known as the Land Use Bill, which was designed in a modest way to redirect patterns of American growth, deprived the nation of an important chance to deal with one of the major sources of America's current difficulties, the continued misuse of the land on which we live.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time

title: CaptivityBred Falcons Get Survival Lessons
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Aug. 1Two fledglings, peregrine falcons bred in captivity this spring, have been released here to learn to swoop and soar and hunt as the first lesson in their survival training for freedom.

title: DOROTHY H. SPRONCK
description: Dorothy Hanson Spronck, administrative secretary of the Audio Engineering Society, died Monday at the New York University Medical Center, following a stroke suffered some days earlier. She was 56 years old and lived at 14848 88th Avenue in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Goldin Says Aide Altered Books on Scoppetta Order
description: Controller Harrison J. Goldin charged yesterday that the city's Investigation Commissioner instructed a civil servant in the Controller's office to make entries in the Controller's books that were not there when Mr. Goldin's auditors looked at them.

title: CITY TO INCREASE INTEGRATION BID
description: ALBANY, Aug. 1New York City's central Board of Education will increase its efforts to desegregate Brooklyn's high schools by establishing specialized schools and by offering a wide range of advanced and unusual courses, according to a report to the State Board of Regents.

title: Squabbles Delay Ocean Parkway Repaving
description: A yearold squabble among Federal, state and city officials is holding up the repaving of one of the city's most beautiful  and most potholed  boulevards, Ocean Parkway in Brooklyn.

title: Penn Central Must Close Some Tracks as Unsafe
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Citing poor track conditions as the probable cause of two reCent train accidents that injured 30 passengers, the Federal Railroad Administration ordered today that 67 miles of Penn Central track be closed to all traffic.

title: ELIZABETH MAYOR KEEPS RIOT REPORT
description: ELIZABETH, NJ, Aug. 1Mayor Thomas G. Dunn announced today that although he had received a 1,000page report on the July 4 riot in a city park that, injured 11 policemen and 5 civilians, he would neither release it nor even read it himself in the immediate future.

title: Ethiopian Military Says Endalkachew Was Seized
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 1 (AP)Former Premier Endalkachew Makonnen and other. Prominent Ethiopians, including a royal adviser and two Supreme Court justices, have been arrested, the military announced today. It did not say when they were seized. nounced today. It did not say when they were seized.

title: Books of The Times
description: PURSUIT. The Chase and Sinking of the Battleship Bismarck. By Ludovic Kennedy. 254 pages. Illustrated. Viking. $10.

title: Papers Debate Use of Reader's Advocate on Staff
description: Should newspapers defend themselves to their readers, or explain themselves, or even appoint their own inhouse critics to review themselves?

title: Saigon Welfare Plan Aims at Reducing Abandonment of Children
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 1  Something very minor but very important happened not long ago in a wooden shack with a dirt floor near the vast garbage dumps at the edge of Saigon. Mrs. Tang A. Kieu, who lives there with her six children, was given $24.

title: GOLD RISES TO $160; DOLLAR IS ERRATIC
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 1 (UPI)Gold rose to a close of $160 an ounce in London today, while the dollar moved erratically on world money markets. It touched a high for the year in Tokyo to close at 299.50 yen, up 1.15 from yesterday, and low of 4.6725 francs for the year in Paris, although it closed at 4.69875 francs, up 0.02 from yesterday.

title: HOUSE PANEL BACKS FUNDING ON DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP)  The House Appropriations Committee approved today $78.97billion funding for defense, $3.35billion less than President Nixon's budget recommended.

title: Notes on People
description: The director of the Peace Corps, Nicholas W. Craw, has resigned, effective the end of the month. Mr. Craw, a 37yearold bachelor who is an heir to the Smith & Wesson firearms fortune, was in the job slightly less than a year. A Republican from Charlottesville, Va., he has served for three years in other programs, including VISTA and the Office of Economic Opportunity. We're in good shape, he said of the Peace Corps, which he maintained has been growing solidly and steadily since its low point of 1972.

title: PAN AM AIR PLANS TO LEASE SOME JETS
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday that it planned to lease instead of buy the first five of a fleet of Boeing 747SP jumbo jets ordered last September.

title: W.F.L. Gate Off
description: Football coaches always play one game at a time and consider it a violation of their profession to look past the next opponent. General managers, however, have no such restrictions, so Bob Keating already is working on his game plan for the New York Stars' game in two weeks.

title: World Football League
description: LAST NIGHT GAME

title: $3.8Million on Air Pollution
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug 1 (AP)The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company announced today that it was spending $3.8million on installation of three air pollution control devices, at its production complex here.

title: BLUE CROSS SEEKS U.S. EMPLOYE CHANGE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) Blue CrossBlue Shield is proposing to cut its coverage of mental illness for five and onehalf million Federal employes and their family members, a Blue Cross spokesman says.

title: NIXON AIDES LEANING TO PAYPRICE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Administration believes that some sort of Government agency is needed to monitor wage and price movements and is leaning toward the idea of asking Congress for legislation creating a small Federal office to do this.

title: Rinaldi Defense Asks Dismissal Of Perjury Case Against Judge
description: A defense attorney in the Brooklyn perjury trial of State Supreme Court Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi called yesterday for the dismissal of the indictment on the ground that the prosecution had failed to provide the required corroboration of the alleged perjury.

title: WINS ACCESS TO U.S. DOCUMENTS
description: Justice Department lawyers, under prodding by a judge, agreed here yesterday to allow defense attorneys for the International Business Machines Corporation to have access to previously restricted Government documents.

title: ASCAP Reaches Accord With Soviet on Copyrights
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 1 (UPI)The American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers reached preliminary agreement today with the Soviet Copyright Agency to have the agency represent its 22,000 members in the Soviet Union, Stanley Adams, president of ASCAP, said.

title: $3.8Million on Air Pollution
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 1 (AP)The Goodyear Tire & Rubber company announced today that it was spending $3.8million on installation of three air pollution control devices at its production complex here.

title: ALLIANCE OF JEWS AND BLACKS URGED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 1The 64th annual convention Of the National Urban League ended, last night with a plea for reestablishment of the alliance between blacks find Jews.

title: DIVIDENDS RAISED BY 3 BIG CONCERNS
description: Three major companies raised their dividends yesterday. They included the Anaconda Company, the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation and the Marathon Oil Company, all of which had substantially higher earnings in the second quarter and first half of this year.

title: F.D.A. Is Urged to Curb Sugar in Breakfast Cereal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1A consumer group, backed by several health organizations, petitioned the Food and Drug Administration today to set standards for the amount of sugar permissible in packaged breakfast cereals.

title: 68% in Survey Think Nixon Is Doing Fair or Poor Job
description: President Nixon's overall job rating, based on a poll taken before the impeachment vote by the House Judiciary Committee, was 68 per cent negative but up 3 percentage points from his rating in June, when he equaled his alltime low, the Harris survey said yesterday.

title: Southmen Rally to Top Sun, 2515
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 1 (AP)  Willy Spencer and J. J. Jennings scored touchdowns within a fourminute span of the third period tonight, rallying the Memphis Southmen to a 2515 victory over the Southern California Sun in a World Football League game.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Concert in Queens Tonight
description: Last week's rainedout New York Philharmonic concert in Cunningham Park, Queens, has been rescheduled for tonight at 8:30 o'clock. Andre Kostelanetz will conduct Berlioz's Roman Carnival Overture, Franck's Symphony, Respighi's Pines of Rome and Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture, which will he accompanied by a fireworks display.

title: Exchange Firms Show $26.6  Million Deficit in Jane Before Taxes
description: Member firms of the New York Stock Exchange suffered a net aggregate pretax loss of $26.6million in June, bringing their sixmonth losses to $45.9million, the exchange reported yesterday.

title: GREECE RESTORES 1952 CONSTITUTION WITH CIVIL RIGHTS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 1The Greek Government tonight reinstated the Constitution that had been in force before the military coup of 1967.

title: France and Iran Pact Set
description: PARIS, Aug. 1 (UPI)France and Iran have signed a definitive agreement under which Iran would pay $1billion into the Bank of France as an advance against the future delivery of French goods, the Finance Ministry said today. The first payment of $300million will be made before Oct. 1.

title: Advertising: A Bacardi Martini
description: How do you get a fairsized, twocolor ad on the front page of The New York Times, The Daily News and The Wall Street Journal? Simple, buy the paper, stick the ad to it, then give them away.

title: For Getting a Grip on Biking
description: Last winter, when Robert Prescott went bicycling with his 6yearold son Michael, he had a bit of difficulty wheeling down the lanes near his home in Suffern, N.Y. His feet kept slipping of the pedals.

title: PRICES ARE DOWN IN CREDIT MARKET
description: The mood of the credit markets was a bit more pessimistic yesterday and prices of the bettergrade, fixedincome securities tended to sag in lackluster trading. The poorer insues were ignored. Some of the sentiment was reflected in the negotiated sale of $130million of Georgia Power Company bonds through Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co.

title: Pollard Ahead in Germany
description: KREFELD, Germany, Aug. 1 (AP)Eddie Pollard of Ireland shot a fourunderpar 68 today for a onestroke lead in the opening round of the $42,000 German open golf championship.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Public Service Commission yesterday authorized the Consolidated Edison Company to increase gas rates by $31.3million, or an average of 19.5 per cent, for its 1,187,000 customers in Manhattan, the Bronx and parts of Queens and Westchester County. The minimum monthly charge, which covers the first 300 cubic feet of gas used, will rise by 54 cents.

title: E.P.A., Citing Risks of Cancer, Bars 2 Widely Used Pesticides
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2  A halt in the manufacture of aldrin and dieldrin, the two most widely used pesticides in United States, was ordered today by the Environmental Protection Agency on a finding that their use poses an imminent hazard to the public health.

title: India's Farmers Hit by Fertilizer Scarcity
description: CHANDIGARH, India, July 28  Charm Singh Maan, one of the farmers of the Punjab, India's most productive state, is frightened.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, AUGUST 3, 1974

title: Dave Anderson
description: Mushky Jackson talks as if he were invented by Damon Runyon; instead he merely was discovered by Runyon and perpetuated by Dan Parkerwith reason, Once in the Madison Square Garden boxing office, three visitors were arguing about the legality of an episode deep in the past.

title: 2 Real Estate Trusts To Omit Dividends For Second Quarter
description: Two realestate investment trusts with heavy investments in new construction mortgage loans announced yesterday that they would not pay dividents for the second quarter of this year because of increasing pressure on their portfolios.

title: Boswell Debut in Right Casualty of Met Rainout
description: Despite Jane Jarvis playing With a Little Bit o' Luck over and over on the Shea Stadium organ last night, the rains failed to abate enough for the Mets to play the final game of the threegame series with the Chicago Cubs. No date was set for the makeup game.

title: Progress Slow at Sea Law Parley; Many Speak Privately of Stalemaie
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug, 2The Parque Central, a complex of futuristiclooking skyscrapers designed for totally selfcontained living, has been inhabited since late June by about 4,000 people whose almosttotal daily concern is the sea that lies seven miles beyond the mountains that ring Caracas.

title: Argentine Police Seize 200 At Funeral of Slain Leftist
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 2 (AP) Mourners in the funeral procession of an assassinated leftwing, congressman clashed repeatedly with the police today. More than 200 people were reported arrested.

title: People in Sports
description: Willie Spencer, a 20yearold running back without any college experience, professes to be unworried about the competition from Larry Csonka and Jim Kiick, when the two Miami Dolphins join him on the Memphis Southmen next season. I've got one thing, and he's got one thing, Spencer said of downs in Memphis's World Football League victory over Southern California Thursday night.

title: 67 CITY LOBBYISTS LIST THEIR FEES
description: Sixtyseven lobbyists registered with the city have, for the first time, filed a quarterly financial report showing fees paid by clients.

title: Materials Stockpiled To Clean Up Oil Spills
description: TRENTON, Aug. 2 (UPI)The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection said today that a special task force had stockpiled boors shovels and chemical dispersants at four strategic locations in the state to cope with oil spills.

title: HALPERIN SAYS TAP WAS UNAUTHORIZED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) Morton H. Halperin, a former aide tb the National Security Council, said today that his telephone was tapped three days before the tap was legally authorized.

title: E.P.A., Citing Risks of Cancer, Bars 2 Widely Used Pesticides
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2  A halt in the manufacture of aldrin and dieldrin, the two most widely used pesticides in United States, was ordered today by the Environmental Protection Agency on a finding that their use poses an imminent hazard to the public health.

title: Nassau Warns Swimmers Against Pollution in Canals
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 2The Nassau County Department of Health today cautioned residents not to swim in canals.The advice accompanied a laboratory report showing, that a wide range, of coliform values had been found in bacteriological samples collected in the cityowned Ouimet Canal in Long Beach. The concentrations of coliform organisms ranged from 23 to greater than 240,000 per 100 milliliters of water.

title: Smith Gains, Tanner Bows at Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 2 (UPI)Stan Smith and Manuel Orantes swept into the quarterfinals of the $100,000 First National tennis classic today, but Roscoe Tanner was upset by Guillermo Vilas of Argentina.

title: Foreground, Bosch
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In Santo Domingo on May 30 they celebrate the assassination of the tyrant Gen. Rafael Trujillo. That evening I visited the man they call the Professor  the scholar, novelist, and former President, Juan Bosch, who provided the only hope of democratic government the Dominican Republic has known in modern times.

title: TRAVELERS CORP. LISTS RISE IN NET
Two Dance Festivals Keep Charles Reinhart Stepping
description: For the first time, the country's two most important summer dance festivals are under the same management. One is the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, founded in 1933 by the late Ted Shawn in Lee, Mass. The second is Connecticut College's American Dance Festival, founded in 1948 in New London as the successor to the prewar moderndance center at Bennington College.

title: Regents Policy Is Strengthened On Campus Racial Separatism
description: ALBANY, Aug. 2  The Board of Regents today strengthened its policy against racially separate living arrangements or ethnicstudy programs on campuses in the state by empowering the Commissioner of Education to withdraw accreditation from a college that maintains such arrangements.

title: Antiques: Met Fall Show
description: Throughout the summer the storage rooms at the Metropolitan Museum of Art have been filling with the extraordinary selections for the upcoming, doublebarreled exhibition intended as a tribute to the role played by art and antiques dealers in forming museum and private collections.

title: Opera: A Cavalli Bridges 300 Years
description: For a composer whose 42 operas were considered dead, buried and even unperformable less than a generation ago, Pier Francesco Cavalli (160276) seems to be enjoying a spectacular comeback. The Glyndebourne Festival in Britain has been the principalif hardly the onlyfocus of the Cavalli revival in recent years with two immensely successful productions to its credit. Now the Sante Fe Opear has stepped into the act, and Thursday night the company presented the first staged performance in at least 300 years of the composer's seventh opera, L'Egisto, written in 1643.

title: SLUDGE DISPUTED AT L. I. HEARING
description: WANTAGH, L. I., Aug. 2Several government officials today contradicted the position of a Brooklyn College professor, Dr. William H. Harris, that a mass of sewage sludge is creeping close to the Long Island beaches.

title: Another NATO Headache
description: The NATOWarsaw Pact negotiations on force reductions in Central Europe have introduced many strains into the Atlantic alliance, none greater than the angry controversy now under way over Holland's plans for unilateral cutbacks in its own military forces. The Dutch proposals have stirred fear of a contagion of defense reductions in NATO countries under the double influence of dtente with the East and economic difficulties in the West.

title: World Football League
description: THURSDAY NIGHTS GAME Memphis 25, Southern California 15.

title: Chemists Salute Priestley, 1774 Discoverer of Oxygen
description: American chemists have been celebrating this week in central Pennsylvania an event that revolutionized chemistry 200 years agothe discovery of oxygen.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: F.C.C. Orders a SpeedUp In Comsat Rate Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 2 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission announced today that it had ordered a speedup of hearings on rates charged by the Communications Satellite Corporation.

title: City Is Given $325,000 to Study Ways to Cut Employe Corruption
description: The city will begin a systematic effort this fall to work out ways of eliminating opportunities for dishonesty among public employes.

title: Mayor Beame Moves to Avert Strike by City's Taxi Drivers
description: Mayor or Beame moved yesterday to avert a possible breakdown in taxi service next week that, he warned, would seriously disrupt the city's economic life.

title: 6.8 Million Homes Tuned to Debates, ABC Study Shows
description: Viewers in more than 6.8 million households watched each day of the House Judiciary Committee's impeachment debate on network television, according to a special ratings study commissioned by the American Broadcasting Corporation and disclosed yesterday.

title: Spokesman Terms Nixon Underdog in Current Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2President Nixon was described by a spokesman today as an underdog in the Congressional impeachment move.

title: Baltimore's Example
description: It is refreshing to find an official who considers public employees bound to their sworn duty under the law whether or not they belong to unions. When Baltimore's Police Commissioner Donald D. Pomerleau warned striking members of his force that a settlement would include no amnesty, observers tended to be skeptical. Government leaders always say things like that during an illicit strikeand almost always forget about them afterward in the general eagerness to get things back to normal.

title: Kent State Trial Delayed
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 2 (AP)The trial of eight former Ohio National Guardsmen indicted in the shootings in 1970 of four students at Kent State University has been deferred from Sept. 30 to Oct. 15.

title: City's Loss on OTB Tax Put at $200,000 a Week
description: New York City is losing about $200,000 a week in revenue as a result of the 5 per cent surtax it imposed on offtrack payoffs, figures furnished yesterday by the Offtrack Betting Corporation indicate.

title: Byrne Proposes Indicted Aide Go on Leave Pending His Trial;
description: TRENTON, Aug. 2Governor Byrne today publicly told Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel, who was indicted Wednesday on charges of rigging highwayconstruction bids, that it would be in the best interest of New Jersey if he took a leave of absence without pay until the charges against him were resolved.

title: PRICES WEAKEN IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market continued to weaken yesterday in slower trading.

title: 2 INQUIRIES BEGUN ON GOLDIN CHARGE OF ALTERED BOOKS
description: Two rival inquiries began yesterday into charges by Controller Harrison J. Goldin that the city's Investigation Commissioner had told a civil servant to put entries into a ledger that had not been there when auditors found $5.4million in discrepancies.

title: Interstate Stores Tries Surgery for Survival
description: In Rockford, III., it is known as the Rockford Dry Goods Store. In Paducah, Ky., it is the Paducah Dry Goods Company. In Oak Ridge and Knoxville, Tenn., it is the Knox Dry Goods Company. All are the dominant stores in their communities.

title: POTOMAC ELECTRIC ADDS TO OUTLAY CUT
description: The Potomac Electric Power Company announced yesterday a new construction reduction of $215million in its capital outlays through 1977. W. Reid Thompson, chairman and president, said the cutbacks included twoyear extensions of our first nuclear generating station at Douglas Point in Charles County, Md.

title: 2 AIRLINES SEEKING TO SWAP ROUTES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) Allegheny and Eastern Airlines announced an agreement yesterday on a route swap that will bring new air service to Albany.

title: Why, Out Grundy Center Way, They're Doing Up the Houses Just as Pretty as a Rainbow
description: BUFFALO CENTER, IowaThe traditional white farmhouse, long an American institution and symbol of rural innocence, is gradually giving way to bright tones, fashion tints and earthtone shades.

title: Improved Device Reads Printed Matter for Blind
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2A machine that was patented this week on behalf of the Veterans Administration reads printed matter for the blind. Called the Cognodictor, it recognizes and rapidly pronounces one letter after another, grouping them by words. The inventors, to whom Patent 3,827,025 was granted, are Hans A. Mauch, president of Mauch Laboratories, Dayton, Ohio, and Glendon C. Smith, senior project engineer.

title: Migrant Crew Chief Sued
description: SPARTANBURG, S. C., Aug. 2 (UPI)A suit has been filed in Federal court here on behalf of four Puerto Rican migrant workers who said a crew chief at a peach farm held them in peonage and violated their civil rights. Pablo Canales, a native of Puerto Rico and crew leader of the workers at the Cox farm in Spartanburg County, was charged with prohibiting them from leaving the farm. He contended they owed him money.

title: Giants' Owner to View Club Against Oilers
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 2  The National Football League may open its regular season without a settlement in the player strike, Wellington Mara, president of the New York Giants, said tonight.

title: Judge Orders Refunds to 2,000 For Canceled Charter Flights
description: A Federal judge ordered the ScottishAmerican Association, Inc., yesterday to refund by next Wednesday the $292 air fares paid by 2,000 or more wouldbe travelers for canceled charter flights to London and Glasgow.

title: C.I.A. Chief Doubts Soviet Navy Plans Indian Ocean BuildUp
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 William E. Colby, Director of Central Intelligence, said in Congressional testimony made public today that, contrary to Pentagon concern, the Soviet Union was unlikely to build up its Indian Ocean fleet significantly unless the United States built up its fleet there first.

title: Burns Leads, Porter Golf
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Aug. 2 (UPI)George Burns 3d continued his domination of a field of 72 amateurs today in the 16th annual Porter Cup golf tournament at the Niagara Falls Country Club. The Port Washington, L.I., resident shot a oneunderpar 69 for a twoday total of 136 and a twostroke lead over Curtis Strange and Robert Ault.

title: DEBATE WIDENING ON BOTTLE LAW
description: One afternoon last spring, two buses pulled up at the state Capitol at Lincoln, Neb., loaded up with state legislators and public officials, and took them 60 miles to Omaha for a festive evening, courtesy of the Falstaff Brewing Company.

title: AGENT IS INDICTED IN 2 GAS DEATHS
description: The managing agent of a Bronx apartment building has been indicted for criminally negligent homicide stemming from the deaths of two tenants from poisonous coalgas fumes, District Attorney Miro Merola disclosed yesterday.

title: Bishop Raymond A. Lane Dead; A Maryknoll Superior General
description: Bishop Raymond A. Lane, former Superior General of the Maryknoll Society and missioner to the Orient, died Wednesday in St. Mary's Hospital, San Francisco. He was 80 years old and lived in the Maryknoll retirement house in Mountain View, Calif.

title: Civil Rights Slowdown
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The summer of 1974 will go down in the history of the civil rights movement as one of reflection rather than activism. With the exception of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference's convention that opens Aug. 13 in Atlanta, the annual summer meetings of the nation's major civil rights organizations are over. The meetings, for the most part, were quiet and introspective.

title: InterAmerican Unit Bids Chile Improve Conditions of Detention
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 2 (Reuters)  A human rights committee from the Organization of American States called today on the Chilean military Government to ban the application of physical and psychological pressure on detainees.

title: NO. AMER. SOCCER LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Tennessee G.O.P. Winner Seeks To Minimize Issue of Watergate
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 2  The newly nominated Republican candidate for Governor of Tennessee, Lamar Alexander, followed up his primary victory yesterday by moving quickly today to try to minimize what is likely to be the major issue in the upcoming campaign: Watergate.

title: Levitz July Sales Off
description: The Levitz Furniture Corporation said yesterday its July sales dropped. 3.5 per cent to $30.5million from $31.6million. The Miamibased retail chain said that its sixmonth sales through July were down 1.8 per cent to $182.7million from $186.1million. Levitz had 55 furniture warehouseshowrooms at the end of July compared with 54 the year before.

title: ARTICLE ON THE C.I.A. IN GREECE ATTACKED
description: Andreas Papandreou, a former Greek Cabinet Minister and an exiled leader of the Greek political left, released a statement yesterday charging The New York Times with an attempt to damage [his] political reputation in an article published in yesterday's editions.

title: Tokyo Stock Prices Drop
description: TOKYO, Aug. 2 Stock prices registered their heaviest plunge of the year here today amid a wave of selling.

title: The Opera
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 2Even Star's Starlight Jewel got a credit listing at the American premiere of Dvorak's Tvrde Palice yesterday afternoon at the Newport Music Festival. Star's Starlight Jewel is a mulch cow, and out she was led, groomed, beautiful, eyes rolling a bit from stage fright. After all, there were about 200 people watching her.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given In Eastern Daylight Time
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KARLSTAD, Sweden, Aug. 2 (UPI)American athletes set three track records in the annual Tingsvalla track and field games tonight as Al Feuerbach, Steve Williams and Charles Foster won their events.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: JAWORSKI STUDIES 2 ALTERED MEMOS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2While the Watergate special prosecution has been accumulating evidence on suspicion gaps in White House tapes, they have also come across at least two instances where White House memorandums have been altered.

title: Castro Said to Foresee a Thaw With U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba envisions a resumption of normal relations with the United States, and he has told two American interviewers the sequence he has in mind, covering such details as trade and tourism.

title: IN JOB ONLY 18 DAYS, FEDERAL AIDE QUITS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) John W. Weber has submitted his resignation from the Federal Energy Administration, only 18 days after the Senate confirmed him as assistant administrator for operations, regulation and compliance, an agency spokesman said today.

title: Weather in City for July
State and City Legislative Units to Study Matteawan Transfers
description: State and city legislative committees announced yesterday that they would open inquiries into the policy of routinely transferring inmates from the maximumsecurity Matteawan State Hospital to state mental institutions from which many are being released into communities for rehabilitation.

title: Stock Cars in Poconos: NewStyle Love Affair
description: LONG POND, Pa., Aug. 2On a desolate piece of Yankee landscape, with nary a Confederate flag to wave in Southern breezes, the good old boys set up shop today in an attempt to show that bammin' and frammin' can be compatible with honeymooning.

title: This Blessed Plot, This Earth, This Park
description: NEW YORK CITY has more public parks, betterdesigned parks andwho would believe itspends more money on them than any city in the world. Really? Yes, really, but our senses in New York tell us something entirely different. We see before us parks that are degenerating, abused and unkempt. How did the parks get that way? Must they be?

title: Search Pressed for Missing Paper Boy
description: MOUNT LAUREL, Aug. 2Scuba divers, a bloodhound, a helicopter, 40 volunteers from nearby McGuire Air Force Base, two Boy Scout troops, two fire companies and a number of private citizens joined the state and local police today in a widespread search for a 14 yearold Mount Laurel boy missing since Monday.

title: HOUSE VOTES AUDIT OF BUSINESS AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) The House has authorized a fullscale audit of the Small WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) The House has authorized a fullscale audit of the Small Business Administration, an agency shaken by scandals in its loan and minority business programs in the last year.

title: Waldheim Meets With Lisbon Leaders On Freedom for African Territories
description: LISBON, Aug. 2Secretary General Waldheim arrived here today to help Portugal decolonize the country's African territories.

title: Casino Battle Is Focusing On Morals and Economics
description: The battle over the proposed constitutional amendment to legalize casino gambling in New Jersey is shaping up as a powerful confrontation over moral and economic issues, with opponents beginning to move on the defensive and proponents cautioning their ranks against complacency.

title: Auto Used as Weapon
description: TAMPA, Fla., Aug. 2 (AP)The police said today that detective had used his auto to knock down and capture an escaped convict who had wrestled a gun away from, a patrolman and fired shots at four policemen and a woman civilian. Officers said that Dane Clark Howell, 26 years old, was charged with five counts of assault with intent to murder.

title: Forego Out Of Whitney At Saratoga
Charisma Sets Pace In Sailing
description: JAMESTOWN, R. I., Aug. 2 The New York Yacht Club cruise, racing down Buzzards Bay 81 strong in the fog, had some thrills and chills today. Splitting tacks in a light osuthwest breeze en route from Marion, Mass., to the finigh off Newport, the fleet crossed through a Buzzards Bay regatta of about 50 boats in small cruising classes like Tartans headed in other directions. There were many misses and fortunately no hits.

title: Defense Rests and Prosecution Plans Rebuttal in Rinaldi's Trial
description: The defense rested its case at midday yesterday in the perjury trial of Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi, and the trial was adjourned until Monday at the request of the prosecuting attorneys, who said they wanted time to prepare rebuttal evidence.

title: DEAN SENTENCED TO 1 TO 4 YEARS IN COVERUP CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2John W. Dean 3d, once President Nixon's legal counsel and now his chief accuser in the Watergate affair, was sentenced today to a minimum of one year in prison and a maximum of. four years for his admitted role in the Watergate coverup.

title: Apologies on Flag Burning
description: EAST LIVERPOOL, Ohio, Aug. 2 (UPI)On orders from a juvenile court judge, two teenage girls apologized yesterday in a newspaper advertisement for burning an American flag. Vickie Sue Noland, 15 years old, and Francis Mia Curran were also ordered by Judge Guy Mauro to attend the raising and lowering of the flag at City Hall for one week, observe a curfew for the next six months and not communicate with each other by telephone, letter or in person for one year.

title: SOCAL INCREASES PRICE OF GASOLINE
description: The Standard Oil Company of California announced yesterday a 1centkgallon increase in the wholesale price of gasoline. Two other major oil companies, the Shell Oil Company and Texaco, Inc., announced similar increases on Thursday.

title: Impeachment Defined in Soviet But Without Mention of Nixon
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2 (Reuters)A leading Soviet news magazine, Novoye Vremya, published a short article in its latest issue today to explain the meaning of the word impeachmentwithout once mentioning that this was a possible fate confronting President Nixon.

title: Futures Trading Set Record in Latest Year
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) Futures trading in agricultural commodities set records in the latest fiscal year, which ended June 30, the Commodity Exchange Authority reported today.

title: City WorkRelief Program Ruled Legal
description: The city's Work Relief Employment Program, which provides paid employment for 10,000 homerelief recipients, yesterday was ruled legal, and not a new spoils system.

title: Racial Slippage
description: Two recent reports indicate that as the nation's interest has turned away from its racial problems over the last few years, much of the positive momentum generated during the sixties has been dissipated.

title: House Votes $49.9Million To Finance Radio Stations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) The House today voted 27858 to approve a $49.9million authorization to finance Radio Free Europe, Radio Liberty and the Board for International Broadcasting, which oversees the stations.

title: Napoles Fights Lewis Today
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 2 (AP)Jose Napoles of Mexico, the world welterweight champion, will defend his title tomorrow against Hedgemon Lewis of Detroit. It will be the second challenge by the 28yearold Lewis. Napoles won a decision in their first battle, Dec. 14, 1971, in Los Angeles.

title: A Lawyer in RaceFixing Case Cited for 25 Acts of Contempt
description: One of the defense lawyers in the Brooklyn superfecta racefixing case was cited for 25 instances of reprehensible and contemptuous behavior by Federal District Judge Orrin G. Judd, who presided over the trial, it was announced in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Ticket Loss Loses Lottery Winnings

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WEST CALDWELL, Aug. 2Albert Cicerone, who has retired from the Prudential Insurance Company, has slowed down to a walk.

title: Research Showing Sludge Off L.I. Refuted at Hearing.
description: WANTAGH, L. I., Aug. 2Several government officials today contradicted the position of a Brooklyn College professor, Dr. William H. Harris, that a mass of sewage sludge is creeping close to the Long Island beaches.

title: Teleprompter Opens Center
description: Teleprompter Manhattan Television, which serves upper Manhattan, will open a new production center next Wednesday at Teleprompter Manhattan headquarters, 5120 Broadway. The facility will be used to produce programs for Channel 10 for commercial and industrial poduction.

title: Canada Removes Ban On Meat From the U.S.
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 2 (Reuters) The Canadian Government announced today that it was lifting its fourmonthold ban on meat imports from the United States.

title: WILLIAM A. SALZMANN
description: William A. Salzmann, retired vice president and treasurer of Funche, Edy & Co., a subsidiary of the Cunard Line, who served 51 years with the company, died yesterday in the Paterson General Hospital, Wayne, N.J. He was 92 years old and lived in Englewood, N. J.

title: Action Is Delayed On Disclosure Bill For East Hampton
description: EAST. HAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 2The Town Board deferred a decision today on a proposal by Supervisor Judith Hope that nine key officials, their wives and their children make full public disclosure of their incomes, assets and dealings with the town.

title: Oil Prices Spur Nuclear Power
description: VIENNAExperts of the International Atomic Energy Agency estimate that the increase in world oil prices has opened a $4.9billion equipment market for small and medium nuclear power reactors in developing countries.

title: Million in Repairs Could Delay Reopening of Pasadena Museum
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2Norton Simon, the financier who recently assumed responsibility for running the financially troubled Pasadena Art Museum, has discovered structural and operational defects in the building that could cost as much as $1million to correct and that may delay the reopening of the museum until the spring of 1975.

title: Panel Votes Bill on Pennies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 2 (AP) A bill approved today by the House Banking Committee would authorize the Treasury Department to reduce the copper in pennies if the price of copper rose to the point where the metal value of the coin exceeded one cent, Pennies are now 95 per cent copper and 5 per cent zinc.

title: Ship Fire Kills 2
description: LONDON, Aug. 2 (Reuters) Two people were reported killed and two others missing do a fire aboard the Swedish motor ship Eos in the North Sea off West Germany today, Lloyd's shipping agency said here. The 1,600ton vessel put out a distress call for immediate assistance and 15 of the 17 crew members had abandoned ship, a spokesman said.

title: U.S. Financial Subsidiaries File Bankruptcy Petitions
