description: WASHINGTONThe story is told of a Russian pogrom of a century ago, when bands of Cossacks liked to wreak carnal carnage on the women of villages through which they marauded. As they laid hands on an aged woman, her greatgrandchildren pleaded that she be spared until the old lady delightedly snapped Shut up!  a pogrom is a pogrom.

title: E. Germans Excel In Junior Rowing
description: RATZEBURG, West Germany, Aug. 4 (AP)  East German rowers dominated the finals of the World junior rowing championships today, capturing five gold medals and three silvers. The East German gold medals were won in pairs with cox, fours with cox, fours without cox, pairs without cox and sculls.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4More than two years after the Watergate breakin and less than two weeks before it considers the possible impeachment of President Nixon, the House of Representatives will take up this week legislation to overhaul drastically the way the nation finances its election campaigns.

title: GALLO AIDE SLAIN AT A DICE TABLE
description: A Brooklyn synagogue's fundraising Las Vegas Nite program ended in violence early yesterday when a reputed associate of the socalled Joey Gallo group in organized crime was killed by a shot in the head, apparently fired from outside the building.

title: Coastal States Is Accused. Of Defaulting on Deliveries
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 4 (UPI)The Central Power and Light Company filed a $625million suit against the Coastal States Gas Producing Company Friday, charging it defaulted on naturalgas deliveries.

title: Cosmos Win, 21, In Home Finale
description: Malcolm Daweg and Joey Fink scored a goal apiece to lead the New York Cosmos to a 21 North American Soccer League victory yesterday over the St. Louis Stars at Downing Stadium on Raudells Island.

title: MRS. MEIR DENIES TALK WITH HUSSEIN
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 4Former Premier Golds Meir denied tonight an NBC television report that she had consented to restore most of the occupied West Bank of Jordan to King Hussein.

title: Extortion Suspect Seized
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 4 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced the arrest of a Michigan machine operator charged with attempting to extort $2million from Exxon Chemical Company, U.S.A. The Suspect, Budimir Damnjanovic, 27 years old, of Utica, Mich., was picked up late yesterday in a heavily wooded area near Rochester, Mich., as he tried to collect the money from a F.B.I. agent posing as an Exxon courier, the authorities said.

title: Kilroy Is Everywhere
description: Fifteen years ago, Dr. Louis B. Leakey discovered the skull of a previously unknown form of humanoid creature, a find that seems to have stretched man's lineage back some 14 million years.

title: Fire Forces the Evacuation of 80 Hospital Patients
description: A fire in the psychiatric unit of the Morris J. Bernstein Institute at Second Avenue, between East 17th and 18th Streets, forced the evacuation of more than 80 patients during the noon hour yesterday.

title: Governor of Oklahoma Is Linked to Kickback
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Aug. 4Wellplaced sources say a Federal grand jury has been told that secret meetings in a New York apartment, a Tulsa motel and the Oklahoma Governor's mansion preceded the award of a lucrative bond underwriting contract in return for a $25,000 kickback to Gov. David Hall of Oklahoma.

title: Miss Haynie Golf Victor By 5 Shots
description: HORSHAM, Pa., Aug. 4 (UPI)Sandra Haynie, the United States women's open. champion, carded a finalround 73 today to finish five strokes ahead of the field in capturing the 54hole George Washington women's golf tournament at Hidden Springs Country Club.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MA NON TROPPO Return with us now to those bygone days of the 18th century and the Mostly. Mozart Festival at Lincoln Center. There is nothing, in New York, that embodies such a marvelous blend of informality and elegance as this annual tribute to Mozart.

title: Upstate, a Doctor of Past and Present
description: WESTERLO, N.Y.  One drives through the Helderberg Mountains area south of Albany through towns with names like Slingerlands and New Scotland. Eventually one reaches the village of Westerlo, whose population the natives estimate at 300. Dr. Perkins's house? It's over there, replied a man at the garage. But she won't be home unless she's expecting you.

title: Bloomfield College Bankruptcy Planned
description: BLOOMFIELD, N.J., Aug. 41Officials of financially ailing Bloomfield College are expected to file a petition, for bankruptcy proceedings in Federal court in Newark tomorrow, sources at the fouryear undergraduate institution have disclosed.

title: Regalado Wins by Shot at Sutton on 278
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 4The nicest thing about winning a golf, tournament, aside from that fat $40,000 pay check, is that it means the end of those grim Monclays when a rabbit has to qualify his way into each tournament he plays. There is more pressure there than in the tournament itself.

title: PORTUGAL READY TO GRANT GUINEA ITS INDEPENDENCE
description: LISBON, Aug. 4  Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations announced today that Portugal was ready to recognize Portuguese Guinea as an independent nation and to support its entry into the United Nations.

title: MEDIATOR PUSHES CITY TAXI TALKS
description: The state mediator in the city's taxi dispute conferred with union and management representatives yesterday in an effort to avoid a shutdown threatened for midnight tonight.

title: Kidnapper of Editor in Atlanta Is Guilty in $700,000 Extortion
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 4 (UPI) William A. H. Williams, accused kidnapper of the Atlanta Constitution's editor, Reg Murphy, was found guilty of extortion tonight by a Federal jury that deliberated four hours.

title: Proprietary Homes Called Snake Pits
description: Mental patients released from state institutions and placed in hotelsized proprietary homes are entitled to a $5 weekly allowance from the $375amonth Government check they sign over to the homes.

title: Phone Strike Averted
description: Negotiators for the Bell Telephone System and the Communications Workers of America representing 500,000 telephone workers reached an agreement on the terms of a new threeyear contract, averting a nationwide strike. Page 9.

title: Boy, Pushed in Bay, Girl Rescuer Drown; Youth, 14, Charged
description: A 14yearold boy was charged yesterday with killing a 10yearold boy, who was pushed into Jamaica Bay and then drowned with a 12yearold girl who tried to save him.

title: Ellen Spielman Wed to Bernard Gitler
description: Ellen Ann Spielman, who is in her second year at the Cornell University Medical College, and Bernard Gitler, a thirdyear student there, were married yesterday. Both received bachelor's degrees in chemistry and life sciences from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where they were elected to Phi Beta Kappa.

title: Goodyear Plans to Trim Capital Spending by 10%
description: DETROIT, Aug. 4The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, despite record earnings this year, says it is cutting its 1974 capital spending by 10 per cent to about $280million.

title: Industry Plagued by Shortages, Particularly of Steel
description: Despite a slowdown in the rate of business growth, the nation's manufacturers are faced with a broad array of material shortages, a highly regarded business survey reported over the weekend.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In recent, years the public has been a, diligent advocate of ecological control and has supported almost blindly the demands of the environmentalists in their efforts to alleviate pollution. Congress, responding to the wishes of the public, has reciprocated with legislation forcing industry to adapt immediately to environmental norms no matter what the price.

title: Red Smith
description: STURGEON BAY, Wis., Aug. 4Early in the morning the commercial fishermen put out from the east shore of Door County to visit their pond nets. Door County, sometimes called Swinging Door County, is a jagged spear of limestone that divides the waters of Lake Michigan on the east from those of Green Bay on the west. This was the doorway to. New France almost twoandahalf centuries ago for men, like Jean Nicolet and Jacques Marquette,. Who came by canoe up the St. Lawrence and through the Great Lakes to dicker for the skins of beavers and the souls of Indians. Today the area is visited mostly by sportsmen bent on piscicide for the coves and bays that notch both sides the peninsula provide smallmouth bass fishing that is sometimes spectacular.

title: Denyer Ineptness Helps in 4119 Victory
description: If the Jets 4119 opening exhibition victory over the Denver Broncos was typical of what the National Football League owners have in mind for the 1974 season, the striking players and the neophyte World Football League have it made.

title: Tug Beached After Collision
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 4 (UPI)A handful of men aboard the Navy tug Lipan managed to safely beach the vessel today after most of her crew were forced into lifeboats when the tug collided with a 634foot tanker in Juan de Fuca Straits, between Vancouver Island and the mainland of the state of Washington.

title: Polo Results
description: (Bethpage State Park)

title: SIMON BARS SHIFT IN FISCAL POLICY, BACKS JOBLESS AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4Treasury Secretary William E. Simon suggested today that the Nixon Administration would persist in its policy of budget and monetary restraint even if unemployment went above 6 per centthe level that has been considered recessionary.

title: Face Factory: Profits as Peachy Keen as Its Lipstick?
description: The cosmetics and fragrance industry is built on legends of superheroinesand one notable supermanwho started with nothing, whipped up a batch of cold cream or nail polish in a back room and promptly amassed a fortune.

title: The Dance
description: With the last class taken, the final conference attended and the closing performance presented, the American Dance Festival ended its 27th year at Connecticut College on Saturday.

title: POLES LOOK BACK ON COLONIAL ROLE
description: SOMERVILLE, Aug. 4Several thousand PolishAmericans gathered at the Polish. Falcon camp in the countryside south of here today to celebrate the 200th anniversary of their countrymen's involvement in American history.

title: Concert
description: KATONAH, N.Y., Aug. 3Eugene Fodor's New York area debut at the Caramoor Festival here tonighthis first public performance anywhere since sharing second prize (the top honor awarded) a month ago at the Tchaikovsky violin competition in Moscowturned predictably into a media event.

title: Bardin Will Review Pricing Of State Water Supplies
description: TRENTON, Aug. 4 (AP)David J. Bardin, State Protection Commissioner, said he was reviewing the state's pricing of water and water rights with an eye toward making them more expensive. They are remarkably low and ought to he revised upward, Mr. Bardin said yesterday.

title: NIXON CALLS AIDES IN POSSIBLE MOVE ON IMPEACHMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4President Nixon summoned his chief lawyer, aides and speech writers to his retreat at Camp David, Md., today, arousing speculation that some new move was contemplated as a result of the Congressional impeachment drive.

title: Baffled as Ever, Rothko Court to Reopen
description: One of the most complex though fascinating trials in the history of modern art will resume today, when Frank Lloyd, head of Mariborough Gallery and one of the powerful figures in the art world, takes the stand. Mr. Lloyd will continue the testimony interrupted last June, when a recess was called to accommodate vacation and professional commitments.

title: Rain, Rookies Sprinkle Wet Astrodome
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 4O.K., so the Houston Oilers beat the New York Giants, 167, last night. Does this mean that the Giants now become the worst team in the National Football League?

title: Harvey Feldmeier, Miss Garbett Wed
description: Arlene Garbett and Harvey Feldmeier were married here at noon yesterday in Temple EmanuEl by Rabbi Ronald Sobel.

title: Republicans Back Rangel For Reelection to House
description: The Republican party of Manhattan announced yesterday that for the second time in a row it had endorsed Representative Charles B. Rangel, a Harlem Democrat, for reelection.

title: Dietz Wins In Trials For Rowing
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 4 Jim Dietz of the New York Athletic Club rowed a strong 32 today to win the elite singles trials for the world championship that will be held next month in Lucerne, Switzerland. Ditez's time was 7 minutes 20.5 seconds.

title: Montanez and Schmidt Give Phillies Clout in East
description: Willie Montanez and Mike Schmidt are writing a new version of the Philadelphia Story with their booming bats.

title: Sikhs Hail Return of 1940 Martyr's Remains to Punjab
description: CHANDIGARH, IndiaThe coffin of Udham Singh, draped in garlands and carnations, moves slowly along the flat, wet roads of the Punjab. Thousands of Sikhs, bearded and turbaned as always, line the road and surge around the van carrying the coffin of their martyr, who was hanged by the British colonial rulers in 1940, on its final pilgrimage through this northwestern state.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The campus police plan to picket Rutgers University this morning to demand the right to carry weapons while on duty. Daniel Meltzer, president of Local 373 of the International Brotherhood of Police Officers, said policemen from the university's New Brunswick, Camden and Newark campuses would participate in the protest, which he said was also designed to press their demand to have the name of the force changed to Rutgers Police Department.

title: JAPAN EXPORTS SET RECORD DURING JULY
description: TOKYO, Aug. 4 (Reuters) Japan's exports in July totaled a record $5.7billion, up 60.8 per cent from July, 1973, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today in preliminary report.

title: Regazzoni Easy Winner Of German Grand Prix
description: NUERBURGRING, West Germany, Aug. 4  Clay Regazzoni was too far away from the other drivers today to bother anybody as he turned a leisurely Sunday drive in his Ferrari into victory in the German Grand Prix.

title: Red Sox Top Yanks For Tiant's 17th, 73
description: The New York Yankees, oneday revolt against the Boston Red Sox subsided yesterday when Lpis Tiant pitched Boston to a 73 victory and became the major leagues' first 17game winner of the season.

title: Samuels Begins Campaign to Strengthen Cuomo's Race for 2d Spot on Ticket
description: Howard J. Samuels has started what some politicians view as a rescue operation for Mario M. Cuomo, the Queens lawyer who is his choice for Lieutenant Governor. SamuelsCuomo '74 signs went up on 2,000 city buses over the weekend as the start of an intensive effort by Mr. Samuels to link himself and Mr. Cuomo in the hope that they can both win the Democratic primary next month.

title: NEW GROUP FORMED BY THEATER CRITICS
description: Critics, scholars and editors representing publications and institutions from coast to coast ended two days of meetings yesterday at the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center in Waterford, Conn., by forming a new organization, the American Theater Critics Association.

title: Good Start in Greece
description: In less than two weeks, Constantine Caramanlis and the wide spectrum of democratic forces supporting his Government of National Unity have transformed the political climate in Greece. Mr. Caramanlis is no miracle worker, butgiven the political realities in Greece after seven years of military dictatorship, plus the Cyprus crisisit is difficult to see how the 67yearold Premier could have progressed any more rapidly toward the restoration of national consensus, freedom and political democracy.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following Is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Thieves Robbing Nightclub Take a Beer Break on Job
description: RICHMOND, Calif., (UPI)Two thieves set 'em up for themselves at the El Bohemio Club.

title: Books of The Times
description: PROUST AND HIS WORLD. By William Sansom. 128 pages. Illustrated. Scribner's. $7.95.

title: PERCY SEEKS CURB ON FEDERAL POLICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (UPI)  Senator Charles H. Percy said today he had asked for an accounting of all the intelligence, police and investigative agents hidden within the Federal Government so Congress can bring them under its control.

title: Going to the Dogs
description: For the equivalent of a mere 30 million fares, those dour New Yorkers who are offended by subwaycar graffiti may soon be rid of them. In fact, if the Metropolitan Transit Authority's plans work out, there should be enough left over to belay Alpo for the police dogs it training to chase out of their trainyard studios the artists who subscribe to this indigenous school of painting.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Boston Red Sox, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 8 P.M.)

title: Nudity on Increase at Public Beaches Here
description: FAIR HARBOR, LI., Aug. 4 There has been much talk of coverup on New York City and Long Island beaches this summer.

title: Ballet: Canadians' Flair
description: Rudolf Nureyev took an uncharacteristic break in his marathon of appearances with the National Ballet of Canada in its current threeweek season at the Metropolitan Opera House. Yesterday afternoon, the only time Mr. Nureyev would not be dancing, the role of Siegfried in the company's production of Swan Lage was taken by Sergiu Stefanschi, the young Rumanian.

title: Transit Officer Stabbed on El Steps; Fires Four Shots at Fleeing Attacker
description: A 55yearold Transit Authority patrolman on his way to work was stabbed in the chest on the stairs of an elevated subway station in Brooklyn yesterday afternoon when he tried to resist a knifewielding robber who had taken his wallet.

title: It's Public Telephone Number One
Stock Trading Rose in '73
description: More than $178billion worth of stocks were traded on United States stock exchanges in 1973, almost three times the $72billion of 10 years ago. J. Henning Hilliard, chairman of the Securities Industry Association, linked the increase to longrange gains in stock values and an increase in the number of shares available on the exchanges.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Laundry Mark Aids In Capture of 2 Men In Chemist's Murder
description: A laundry mark on a laboratory smock enabled detectives here to identify a murdered chemist whose body had been brought all the way from Washington and dumped in a weoded section of Prospect Park in Brooklyn.

title: Dr. Anastasios Stamboulis, Engineer at Polytech, Dead
description: Dr. Anastasios P. Stamboulis, assistant professor of operations research at Polytechnic Institute of New York, died Sunday in River View Hospital, Red Bank, N. J., after suffering a coronary occlusion at his home, 31 Thorne Place, New Monmouth, N. J. He was 41 years old.

title: President Considered Resigning But Rejected Idea, Aides Assert
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Pres. ident Nixon seriously considered the possibility of resigning during a meeting at Camp David yesterday, but discarded it at least for the time being, White House officials said today.

title: To and From the Azores, Sailing in 30Foot Ketch
description: CAPE MAY, Aug. 5 (AP) Marvin Creamer, a geography professor, knows how to put his lessons to good use; he has just returned from a twomonth, 5,000mile voyage to the Azores on a 30foot sailboat.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: MUSLJMS IN SIEGE GET PRISON TERMS
description: Four Sunni Muslims convicted of murder, kidnapping, robbery and other charges stemming from the holdup and siege of a Brooklyn sporting goods store 18 months ago were sentenced in Brooklyn Supreme Court yesterday to prison ternis of from 25 years to life.

title: RICE PRICE SUPPORT IS RAISED TO $7.54
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) Rice farmers will have their 1974 crop supported at $7.54 per 100 pounds, the minimum that can be set under Federal law, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: A New South?
description: WASHINGTONEver since newspaperman Henry Grady coined the term in a speech in 1886, observers about once a decade have been describing the rise of a new South.

title: LLOYD IS PRESSED ON ROTHKO SALES
description: Frank Lloyd, one of the world's leading art dealers, completed yesterday 11 days of testimony in reply to questions from the lawyer for the daughter of the late Mark Rothko, the abstractexpressionist painter, in Surrogate's Court here. Mr. Lloyd was immediately subjected to questioning by Gustav Harrow, an assistant attorney general for the state, who will continue today.

title: New YorkAlbanyMontreal Train Is Resumed With a Festive Air
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 5After a threeyear lapse, rail passenger service between New York and this Canadian City by way of Albany, the Adirondacks and the Champlain Valley was restored today with a ceremonial run that was greeted by bands, bunting flag  waving crowds, orating politiciansand an impromptu strike that failed to halt the inaugural trip of the new Adirondack.

title: Both Sides Harass U.N. Force on Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 5Not since President Gamal Abdel Nasser of Egypt ordered the United Nations emergency force to leave the ceasefire line with Israel in 1967 has United Nations peacekeeping group been pushed around so unceremoniously as on Cyprus.

title: Francis R. Appleton Jr., Head of Law Firm, Dead
description: Francis Randall Appleton Jr., for many years senior partner in the law firm of Appleton, Rice & Perrin here, died Sunday at his family home in Ipswich, Mass. He was 89 years old and lived at 700 Park Avenue.

title: Soviet Paper Says Athens Retains Political Prisoners
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5 (Reuters) The Soviet Union asserted today that political prisoners were still being held in Greek jails and that thousands of Greeks were being denied citizenship despite liberalization moves by the new civilian Government in Athens.

title: Youth Finds Body of Huge Turtle Drifting Off Queens
description: A youth dragged ashore at Breezy Point, Queens, an 1,100pound Atlantic sea turtle, apparently dead only a short time, after he spotted it drifting a quarter of a mile offshore.

title: The President's Men
description: On Jan. 5, 1973, when the thirdrate burglary of Watergate seemed destined for nothing more than a modest footnote in the political annals of the Republic, President Nixon unveiled his program to revitalize and streamline the Federal Government in preparation for America's third century. That illfated program, the visions of leadership, the aspirations of a President elected by the most sweeping landslide in the nation's historyall this now lies in ruins.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Letter From Italy
description: MILAN, ItalyA new word has finally insinuated itself into the lingua franca of the press, radio and television along the Mediterranean littoral: L'impeachment. Like the borrowed words te drugstore or gli glamor stocks, there is no real substitute in the languages or political systems of Europe to describe the American impeachment process.

title: Yemeni, 20, Killed In Brooklyn Holdup At Father's Store
description: A 20yearold Yemeni was shot to death yesterday during a holdup in his father's candy store in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn.

title: VineSellers' a Contrast For Riverdale Audience
description: Baseball players, joggers and bicyclists moved over and made room for theater lovers last weekend in Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx, as the New York Shakespeare Festival Mobile Theater rolled in with two free evening performances of Ron Milner's What the WineSellers Buy.

title: Rutgers Police Seek Right to Be Armed on All Shifts
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Aug. 5 (UPI)  More than 30 offduty campus police officers at Rutgers University picketed the university with their wives and children today for the right to carry weapons 24 hours a day.

title: Our Talisman Takes Saratoga Special by 3 Lengths
President's Statement About Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Following is a statement by President Nixon announcing his decision to make public the transcripts of three recorded conversations with H. R. Haldeman on June 23, 1972:

title: The Ballet: La Bayadere
description: Like Natalia Makarova, whom he partnered last night in his second appearance with American Ballet Theater, Mikhail Baryshnikov was considered a dancer's dancer when still a member of Leningrad's Kirov Ballet.

title: Goldin Stands By Charge on Scoppetta
description: Cutting short his vacation abroad to return to his desk yesterday, Harrison J. Goldin promptly stood by his charges that the city's Investigations Commissioner had instructed civil servant to make entries city ledgers after the fact.

title: Detective Writers Begin to Discard Some Fictions About Women
description: I was leaning against the bar in a speakeasy, Dashiell Hammett's classic 1933 mystery, The Thin Man, begins, when a girl . . . came over to me. She was small and blond, and whether you looked at her face or at her body in powderblue sports clothes, the result was satisfactory.

title: McGraw Comes to Rescue With Bat And Arm as Mets Defeat Expos, 104
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 5The shelling of a precedent con tined tonight as the Montreal Expos jumped on Tom Seaver, the Mets' two  time Cy Young Award pitcher, for six hits, five walks and four runs. But a counterattack led by Tug McGraw brought victory to New York by the score of 104, the Mets' fifth straight over the Expos.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: HORSES & EQUIPMENT

title: JAMES J. REGAN
description: James J. Regan, senior partner in the law firm of Choate, Regan, Davis & Hollister here, died Saturday on vacation in Buffalo. He was 69 years old and lived in Port Washington, L. I.

title: Being Hooked: No Key to Reality
description: BOSTONLike any other complex phenomenon, the counterculture is loaded with contradictions, such as the tension that exists between its contempt for industrial technology and its reliance on that technology for its music. None of these contradictions is sharper than the one between the ecologically related cult of the natural and the counterculture's propaganda for mindaltering drugs.

title: State Allows Prisoners To Form LegalAid Unit
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5Prisoners at the Bordentown Correctional Institution were told by state officials today that they could ;establish their own inmates legal aid association, to act in their behalf in disputes with prison authorities or state officials.

title: Yankees Win, 80; May Star
description: Obviously unimpressed by the fact that the Red Sox generally have been marching through Yankee pitching this season with surprising ease, Rudy May, the stylish southpaw New York obtained from the Angels last June, demonstrated last night he wasn't joining the parade.

title: WHITE PLAINS SPLIT ON CHOICE OF MAYOR
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 5The White Plains City Council deadlocked 3 to 3 tonight on voting for a Mayor to replace Carl J. Delfino, who died July 21. Acting Mayor Michael J. Keating will now continue in office until the November elections, or until the Council opens up the nominations again, possibly at its Aug. 19 meeting.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Department of Justice disclosed yesterday that an agreement under which the General Electric Company was to divest its stockholdings in Honeywell, Inc., in stages by mid1978 had been modified so that the stock would not have to be sold off in stages. G.E. was told in 1970 that the Government would not block its sale to Honeywell of its data processing business if G.E., in return, got rid of the Honeywell stock it received as payment. The terms called for G.E. to divest itself of the stock at specified periods through mid1978.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: ARTHUR SCHINDELHEIM
description: Dr. Arthur Schindelheim, who headed the bureau of dentistry of the city's Department of Health from 1965 to his retirement in 1972, died Sunday in West Palm Beach, Fla., where he had been living. He was 70 years old.

title: Annexations Recognized
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5 (AP)Australia has officially recognized Soviet sovereignty over Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia, the Baltic states annexed by the Soviet Union in 1940, the Australian Embassy here said today.

title: President Still Hopeful That the Senate Will Vote for Acquittal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5In a sharp setback to his fight against impeachment, President Nixon admitted today that six days after the Watergate burglary he ordered a halt to the investigation of the breakin for political as well as national security reasons and that he kept the evidence from his lawyers and supporters on the House Judiciary Committee.

title: LINDSAY DROPPED AS MS ANALYST
description: John V. Lindsay's endorsement of Howard J. Samuels for the Democratic Gubernatorial nomination over the weekend has slightly set back the former Mayor's burgeoning showbusiness career.

title: Cab Strike Averted
description: A possible taxi strike was averted last night for at least three days, Page 66.

title: CONSPIRACY LAID TO STEELMAKERS
description: TAMPA, Fla., Aug. 5 (AP)Four steel companies and four of their officials were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of violating antitrust laws by conspiring to distribute contracts among the companies during a 12year period.

title: Brezhnev Meets Communist Chiefs Of Eastern Europe
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5An announcement today that the Hungarian Communist party leader, Janos Kadar, had been meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev in the Crimea made it clear that an informal annual meeting of East European leaders had taken place.

title: House Votes to Ban U.S. Aid If Turks Don't Curb Opium
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) By a voice vote, the House of Representatives proposed today that foreign aid to Turkey be cut off unless safeguards could be made to insure that heroin from the country's poppy crop was not smuggled into the United States.

title: Ford Seeks to Stand Aloof in Impeachment Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Vice President Ford issued a statement tonight that appeared to be an attempt to disengage himself entirely from the final struggle between the executive branch and the legislative branch concerning President Nixon's impeachment.

title: ABRAHAM KRANKER

Pfister served for 20 years in the front office of the Dodger and New York Yankee organizations.

National Football League exhibition game before 15,379 rainsprinkled fans.

title: 42 Hurt as Bus Hits Truck
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Aug. 5 (UPI)Fortytwo persons were injured today when a bus rammed the rear of a flatbed truck on Interstate 94 west of here. All 41 passengers and the driver of the Indian. Trails bus were taken to nearby hospitals for treatment. The driver, Edwin L. Bostic of Owosso, Mich., told the police that he had not seen the slowermoving truck.

description: LISBON, Aug. 5Portugal's military leaders, after announcing an extensive program to free the African territories, put the country on notice today that those who criticized the armed forces would be severely punished.

description: Hamilton Fish Sr., who was a Republican Congressman for 25 years, released a letter yesterday criticizing his son, Representative Hamilton Fish Jr., for voting to recommend the impeachment of President Nixon last week in the inquiry by the House Judiciary Committee.

description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Aug. 5 (UPI)  The Jacksonville Sharks of the World Football League, who drew over 100,000 fans to their first two games this season, admitted today that 44,000 of the tickets were complimehtary.

title: Goldenrod, Already!
description: Don't look now, but that flash of bright yellow at the roadside is goldenrod. The first goldenrod. And you know what goldenrod means. It means September and October. It means autumn. Not immediately, but not too far away. This is August, after all. Summer is passing. Daylight today is almost an hour shorter than it was at the seasons' turn.... Goldenrod, in bloom already.

title: Canadian Pacific Loss Seen In New U.S. Air Accord
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 5 (AP)Canadian Pacific Air Lines, Ltd., a subsidiary of Canadian Pacific, Ltd., said it stood, to lose $13million a year in revenue while Air Canada will gain $26million annually when all the new CanadianUnited States air routes were in operation.

title: Chess: Black Must Choose Between Defense and Counterefforts
description: There are, in general, two basic ways of conducting the black pieces: pure defense or active counterplay. Considering that White has the slight advantage of the first move, the strategy of pure defense would seem to be more logical, but it does demand iron nerves and a flair for stubborn resistance: Moreover, while pure defense does call into question White's ability to expand his minimal initiative into a tangible superiority, it does not pose a threat to that initiative.

description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., Aug. 5  A preliminary autopsy report shows clearly that two convicts involved in Saturday night's escape attempt from the state prison here shot themselves, Justice of the Peace J. W. Beeler said today.

BURLINGTON SETS WOOLMILL SALE
description: Burlington Industries, Inc., land Homestead Woolen Mills (announced yesterday that an agreement had been negotiated for the sale of Burlington's woolen fabric mill in Cleveland, Tenn., to Homestead for an undisclosed sum Burlington announced on June 5 that it would discontinue its woolen business and that efforts were being made to sell it. Burlington will continue to manufacture worsteds, made of tightly spun wool yarns, at three other sites.

Notes on People
description: Dr, Keith Simpson, a British pathologist, and Gavin Thurston, a London coroner, issued a report yesterday that ruled out the theory that Mama Cass. Elliot choked to death on a ham sandwich. Rather, they said, the 35yearold singer, who was found dead in bed in London last week, succumbed to a heart attack brought on by being overweight.

title: Federal Refundings Stir Worry for Thrift Units
description: Moneymarket experts voiced grave fears about the financial health of savings banks and thrift institutions yesterday as they surveyed the public's mounting interest in the massive Federal refunding operations this week. The Treasury is raising $4.6billion and Federal agencies an additional $1.8billion this week to refund maturing obligations and pick up some extra cash. Not only will most of the Treasury issues carry a record 9 per cent interest rate, but they will also be available in denominations of $1,000.

title: Local School Board to Try To Suspend Fuentes Again
description: The Community School Board of District 1, at a special meeting on Thursday, will renew its efforts to suspend Luis Fuentes, the district superintendent, on charges of insubordination and mismanagement.

title: Port Unit Swears In Gilbert
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5 (UPI)Milton A. Gilbert, a wealthy Teaneck businessman, was sworn in today as a Commissioner of the Port of New YorkNew Jersey Authority. Mr. Gilbert, 57 years old appointed by the late President Lyndon B. Johnson as an Economic Commissioner for Europe in 1967. He also was a member of the board of directors of the New York City Public Development Corporation.

title: Needham Says He Hopes to Convince S.E.C. to Allow 10% Increase
description: The board of the New York Stock Exchange, whose traditional ratefixing powers are scheduled to expire in less than a year, announced yesterday that it would appeal for one more rate increase for its members.

description: HONG KONG, Aug. 5 (Reuters)China announced today the, death of Hsieh Fumin, member of the standing committee of the National People's Congress and chairman of its nationalities committee. He was 64 years old.

description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5 (Reuters) Viktor P. Nekrasov, a prizewinning Soviet author who fell into official disfavor for liberal views, has been given an exit visa to live abroad for two years, friends disclosed yesterday.

description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 5 (AP) Jim Wilson has resigned as general manager of the Milwaukee Brewers to head the new Major League Central Scouting Bureau, an organization formed by 17 teams to pool efforts to obtain new talent.

title: Arabs Boycotting Sony
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 5 (AP)  The Japanese concern Sony was blacklisted today for dealing with Israel, Arab boycott headquarters here announced. The office said that the concern, which manufactures electronic equqipment and has substantial investments in Arab countries, failed to reply to a warning a year ago to stop dealing with Israel.

title: 2 Americans Held in Calcutta Jail for Over a Year in Bizarre Case
description: CALCUTTA, India, Aug. 5 Two young Americans, who have been in a Calcutta prison for more than a year, are on a hunger strike in advance of a trial that has stirred tensions between the United States and India.

description: Representative Henry S. Reuss, Demcorat of Wisconsin, came up with a suggestion yesterday on the troubled Franklin National Bank having the United States Government take over and run the institution for a few years as a yardstick bank.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI)  House action on a bill to raise 1974 tobacco price supports by 10 per cent was postponed today, perhaps peilmanently. The bill had been scheduled for debate today under a suspension of rules procedure, which reqquires a twothirds vote for passage.

description: LONDON, Aug. 5It had been a long six years since I had seen Valery Panov. Then we were drinking Georgian champagne in a bar at Leningrad's Kirov Theater. Now we were drinking French champagne in a London restaurant. Mr. Panov looked sadder and wiser, but oddly enough more confident. He and his wife, Galina Ragozina, had come through.

title: Dow Corning to Expand
description: The Dow Corning Corporation announced yesterday plans to build a $46million silicon plant at Carrollton, Ky. The plant, intended to double the company's capacity for both polycrystalline silicon and semiconductor grade trichlorosilane, is scheduled to be completed in July, 1977.

description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 5 (UPI)The first 1975 car in the nation equipped with a catalytic converter pollution control device rolled off the assembly line today at the Ford Motor Company plant here.

description: BRETTON WOODS, N.H., Aug. 5From many corners of the world the stars have come to this mountain resort to play tennis.

title: India Alerts Army As Floods Worsen In Northern Areas
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 5 (AP)Army units have been alerted to deal with the deteriorating flood situation in parts eastern Assam State and West Bengal State, a Government spokesman said today.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Aug. 6 (UPI)  Communist forces bombarded South Vietnam's second largest city, Da Nang, with rockets early today. It was the fourth attack in 18 days.

title: REPORT CRITICIZES EMBASSY IN SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5  A staff report issued today by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee criticizes the United States Embassy in Saigon for reports that were described as adhering too closely to the official line of the Saigon Government.

description: NEWARK, Aug. 5 (UPI) The state will investigate complaints that warm water pushed out of a nucleargenerating station at the Jersey shore has increased the population of shipworms, which bore into pilings, docks and bulkheads, an official said today.

title: Nixon Urged by Jackson To Form Economic Council
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Aug. 5 (UPI) Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, said today that President Nixon had been so crippled by scandals that he could not deal with the nation's financial matters, and should form an economic council headed by Vice President Ford to direct Federal economic policies.

title: New Jersey Sports A Big Splash
description: MONTCLAIR, Aug. 5Water polo in the East, many has yet to break into the mainstream of sports activity. Yet a dedicated group of boys from the Montclair Aquatic Club has been making waves in that area as they prepare for their second straight trip to the national junior Olympic championships.

title: TALKS BRING HOPE TO MOZAMEICANS
description: VILA GOUVEIA, Mozambique, Aug. 5In the wake of sporadic incidents of ambush and sabotage, this tiny community, like many others, is making its own contacts with antiPortuguese forces.

title: Wedding in Capital For Joyanne Carter
description: Joyanne Barrett Thomas Carter and Bruce George Sundlun, a Washington lawyer, were married yesterday at the bride's home in Washington. United States District Court Judge Richmond Keech performed the ceremony in the presence of the immediate families.

title: July Car Sales Off
description: DETROIT, Aug. 5Sales of United States auto makers totaled 690,904 cars in July, off 17.8 per cent from the same month in 1973, but the annual sales rate climbed to 9.7 million, the best of any month in 1974.

title: Costlier Ring
description: Inflation, eating away the buying power of workers' wages with no sign of check by a leaderless Government, has made it axiomatic that each new labor agreement in a key industry will result in pay increases so substantial that they will help force living costs higher still.

title: Court Authorizes Bohack To Borrow Up to 5Million
description: The Bohack Corporation announced yesterday that the judge overseeing its bankruptcy proceedings signed an order authorizing it to borrow up to $5million from its lending institutions, but no details were given.

description: Angered when Puerto Rican junior lightweight boxer Eduardo Santiago was awarded only a draw by the judges in his bout with Brooklyn boxer Domenico Monaco, some 1,800 fight fans in the Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden went on a rampage last night, tossing bottles, breaking windows, ripping up seats and ceiling tiles and breaking glass doors.

Mr. Robison, the state's senior Republican member of the House, said he regarded Mr. Nixon's statement as equivalent to a plea of guilty,

The victim, Jeffrey Thompson, was found' by his mother, Bernadine, when she returned.

title: New Jersey Briefs

Jordan's plans to revamp 2,200 acres of decaying Hudson River waterfront in Jersey City received a major setback yesterday when Hartz Mountain Industries, Inc., dropped plans to develop a 520acre industrial plot. The company, which had planned to develop the Caven Point section north of the Statue of Liberty for light industrial use, announced at its headquarters in Secaucus that it could not proceed immediately with the $100million development.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, AUGUST 6, 1974
description: In a sharp setback to his fight against impeachment, President Nixon admitted that six days after the, Watergate burglary he ordered a halt to the investigation of the breakin for political as well as national security reasons and that kept the evidence from his lawyers and supporters on the House Judiciary Committee. He said this in a statement accompanying the release of transcripts of three conversations of June 23, 1972, which he said might further damage his case against impeachment. [1:8.] Excerpts from statements by President Nixon, made on May 22, 1973, and April 29, 1974, regarding what he said was his knowledge of the Watergate breakin and the subsequent coverup appear on Page 16.

title: STATE WOULD BAR INQUIRY ON COURT
description: A New Jersey official said yesterday the state would go to the United States Supreme Court in an effort to prevent a scheduled court hearing into charges that present and former New Jersey Supreme Court justices coerced a former municipal judge into testifying against himself.

title: CocaCola Net at Record in the Quarter
RICHARD MANVILLE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 Richard H. Manville, a zoologist, died yesterday of heart failure at his home in Arlington, Va. He was 63 years old.

title: Court to Make an Example Of the Wanderlustful Boy
description: The Mount Laurel police, in an apparent effort to discourage the wanderlust in other teenagers, intends to charge 14yearold John Burns as a runaway when his case comes up in the Burlington Country Juvenile and Domestic Court this week.

title: City to Close Off a Part Of West Side Highway
description: The southbound lanes of the West Side HighwayHenry Hudson Parkway between 96th and 79th Streets will be closed from 10 A.M. today through Wednesday, to construct a temporary vehicular crossover on the highway at 80th Street, Transportation Administrator Michael J. Lazar said yesterday:

title: MRS. CHARLES CRAWLEY
description: Nelle Kline Crawley, widow of Charles E. Crawley, a stockbroker, died Sunday in Southampton, L. I., where she had a summer home. She was 85 years old and lived at 1 East 66th Street.

title: Colson Asks Postponement Of Action to Disbar Him
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 5 (AP)Charles W. Colson, the imprisoned former special counsel to President Nixon, asked the Virginia Supreme Court today to postpone any action on a petition seeking his disbarment.

title: High Tides Around New York
Ocean Rock Hunt Seeks Clues to Activity Inside Earth
description: ABOARD RESEARCH SHIP KNORR, at Sea  A treasure hunt is under way here in the midAtlantic. Clues to where the treasure may lie are provided by cryptic maps and by sonic beacons whose signals must be digested by a computer.

title: ANNA HUEBNER
description: Anna Ismelda Mathews Huebner, a retired public school principal here who in 1968 was married to Lieut. Gen. Clarence R. Huebner, U.S.A., retired, died on Friday in Washington. She was 97 years old.

title: Island in Hawaii Has No Aloha for Big Jets
description: WAILUKU, Maui, Hawaii, July 29  On this serene island where invading warriors of King Kamehameha the Great conquered native Maui soldiers in a battle 176 years ago, there is another battle raging these days over another threatened invasion this time, by jumbo jets.

title: Goldin Stands By Charge on Scoppetta
description: Cutting short his vacation abroad to return to his desk yesterday, Harrison J. Goldin promptly stood by his charges that the city's Investigations Commissioner had instructed a civil servant to make entries city ledgers after the fact.

title: Pennsy's Revenues Rose to $1.1Billion In First Half of '74
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company's operating revenues in the first half of the year soared to $1.1billion, a gain of more than $122million over the like period of 1973. The increase largely reflected a series of freightrate increases, culminating with the industry's 10 per cent general increase of June 20.

title: Bloomfield College Files A Petition in Bankruptcy
description: NEWARK, Aug. 5Bloomfield College today filed bankruptcy proceedings here under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act and asked that a Federal bankruptcy referee name within the next few days a receiver to handle reorganization of the private college.

title: Palestinian Denounces Faisal In a Widening Rift on Policy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 5A Palestinian guerrilla leader underscored the deteriorating relations between the Palestine Liberation Organization and Arab governments today, criticizing King Faisal of Saudi Arabia and warning against attempts to sabotage the guerrilla movement's position in Lebanon.

title: Significant Decline Noted for Giantand Jet Games.
description: New York pro football fans, who appear turned off by the National Football League players' strike, also apparently tuned out the telecasts of the opening exhibition games involving the Giants and Jets last weekend.

title: Memorex Suit Is Dismissed
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Aug. 5 (UPI)  The Memorex Corporation announced today that a suit brought against it by the Wabash Tape Corporation of Huntley, III., has been dismissed by the parties. The suit, filed in the United States District Court in San Francisco 10 months ago, charged breach of contract and abuse of trade secrets by Memorex and three former Wabash employes now employed by Memorex.

title: ELECTION BILL SENT TO FLOOR OF HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The House Rules Committee sent major campaignfinancing bill to the House floor today under proposed ground rules that would sharply limit amendments.

title: BUSINESSMAN DENIES REPORTED NIXON LINK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Donald M. Kendall, chairman of Pepsico, Inc., denied today that he had had contact with President Nixon about the financial benefits of resigning as opposed to being impeached and losing a, trial by the Senate. nancial benefits of resigning as opposed to being impeached and losing a, trial by the Senate.

title: Prices Rise Slightly Here but Surge on the Coast After Release of Tapes
description: The battered stock market moved higher yesterday, propelled by rumors that some announcement about the impeachment situation would come from the White House after the close of trading.

title: TAPES RELEASED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5In a sharp setback to his fight against impeachment, President Nixon admitted today that six days after the Watergate burglary he ordered a halt to the investigation of the breakin for political as well as national security reasons and that he kept the evidence from his lawyers and supporters on the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Evacuated Residents Return
description: PEOTONE, Ill., Aug. 5 (UPI)Most of 500 residents here, who were evacuated when a freight train derailment released potentially lethal ether, returned to their homes today about 10 hours after the incident. There were no injuries in the derailment of the Illinois Central Gulf freight train. Firemen hosed down the leaking tanker carrying 30 tons of the dangerous ether and highly explosive glycol ethylene, commonly called ethyl.

title: SOVIET ASKED TO ACT ON BERLIN TRAFFIC
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5  The United States, Britain and France complained formally today to the Soviet Union over the recent sporadic hindrance by East German authorities of traffic between West Germany and Berlin.

title: MILITARY FUND BILL SIGNED AND ASSAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI) President Nixon signed today, but sharply criticized, a $22.2billion military bill providing money for United States defense projects and funds to pay for military aircraft for South Vietnam.

title: Joseph Durso
description: It's been a bad week, for the greedy in sports, which includes practically everybody, but that may still be the most promising news we've had in a long time. The striking football players, who figured to disrupt the first round of exhibition games, found the 11 stadiums halffilled. Their owners, who figured to offer the public nongames at realgame prices, found the stadiums half empty. The World Football League, which figured to create an instant major league, was caught padding the turnstile totals. And the politicians in New York, who figured that offtrack betting would solve their money problems, found the new 5 per cent surtax bringing, in less money than before. Since everybody took a bath, you might expect that somebody might come out of this mess with clean hands, and that's the promising side. But as long as there's an idle dollar around, don't count on it. The baseball people, who apparently don't read the football or racing news, will gather this week to consider expanding their playoffs from four teams to eight. You know, play six months merely to narrow doviin the field and then sock It to the customers before the snow flies.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time
description: Incoming Passenger and Mall Ships

title: U.S. Attorney Calls Hall Inquiry Limited
description: The United States Attorney in Oklahoma City declared yesterday that the grand jury investigation into a 1970 campaign contribution of $25,000 to Gov. David Hall of Oklahoma extended neither to the conduct of the Wall Street investment firm of Loeb Rhoades & Co., which later won a lucrative contract, nor to that of Maurice Sonnenberg, a New York industrial consultant who helped Oklahoma officials make contact with the firm.

title: Ford Opposes an Amnesty For Deserters or Evaders
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 5 (AP) Vice President Ford condemned any unconditional blanket amnesty for Vietnam deserters or draft evaders, drawing a roar of applause from an audience of veterans today.

title: Office Building Roof Collapses in Miami
description: MIAMI, Aug. 5 (AP)Six persons were crushed to death and a seventh was trapped and feared dead today when the roof of a Federal office building in downtown Miami collapsed sending tons of concrete and several parked cars crashing through the offices below.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES OFF DAILY LIMIT
description: Traders of soybean and corn futures seemed confused yesterday, with the confusion showing a wildly erratic swing in prices on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Isle Off S.I. May Vanish Into Landfill
description: New York City, which occupies 205,040 acres, appears destined to become 20 acres smaller.

title: Taxicab Strike Is Averted as Fleets Extend Contract
description: Representatives of the city's taxifleet owners agreed to a 72hour extension of their labor contract late last night, thereby averting a drivers' strike threatened for midnight.

title: SETTLEMENT SIGNED IN STOCK FRAUD CASE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 5 (AP)  A Federal judge signed $475,000 outofcourt settlement today in a stock fraud case that includes former Gov. William Scranton as one of the defendants.

title: LYMAN B. FRIEZE
description: Lyman B. Frieze, retired president of the Duplan Corporation and a former vice president of the National Federation of Textiles, died yesterday at his home; 100 Circle Road, Dongan Hills, S. I. He was 80 years old.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Commission on human rights, subcommission on prevention of discrimination and protection of minorties 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Chinese Said to Discuss Draft of New Constitution
description: PEKING, Aug. 5 (Reuters)Drafts of a new Constitution to replace the one adopted by China 20 years ago are being circulated for discussion, reliable sources here said today.

title: Wiggins For Impeachment; Others in G.O.P. Join Him
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Representative Charles E. Wiggins, President Nixon's strongest defender during the House Judiciary Committee's impeachIment proceedings, and many other influential House Republicans announced today that they would vote for impeachment.

title: Meany Assails Inflation Fight; Says Ford Could Do Better Job
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 5  George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, sharply attacked the Administration's antiinflation policies today and expressed the view that there could be a quicker solution to the nation's economic problems if Vice President Ford was at the helm.

title: Advertising: Today's. Problems
description: Since 1964 Marsteller, Inc., has held an annual seminar for its middlemanagement employes at which problems of agencies in general and this agency in particular are discussed.

title: Ford Study Cites Cut in Arts if Funds Lag
description: At a time when more and more Americans are turning to the performing arts, the United States is faced with the prospect of fewer performing arts groups unless private, corporate and governmental financial support grows more rapidly than ever before.

title: Installment Credit in June For Consumers Up Slightly
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 Consumer installment credit rose by $1.09billion in June, a little less than the $1.26billion increase in May, the Federal Reserve board reported today.

title: Girl, 2, Survives Fall Of 10 Stories in Harlem
description: A 2year old girl fell 10 stories and lived yesterday, after locking her mother out of their Harlem apartment, the police said. The girl, Sharay Vaughan, of 212 West 129th Street, apparently landed in a clump of bushes. She was treated at Harlem Hospital for a broken ankle.

title: Fight Close For Playoffs
description: Although it is enthusiastically accepted in some places and unattended in others, play in the North American Soccer League this season has one thing In commoncompetition.

title: Officer Phillips's Second Trial In Slayings Is Put Off for Today
description: The second murder trial of Police Office William R. Phillips, the star witness at the Knapp Commission hearings on police corruption, is scheduled to begin today, after being adjourned yesterday over a matter of some delicacy. Officer Phillips has been accused of slaying a prostitute and a pimp on Christmas Eve, 1968.

title: Nixon Ordered That the F.B.I. Be Told: Don't Go Any Further Into This Case
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Six days after the Watergate breakin, President Nixon, informed that his campaign director had urged the illegal bugging operation, ordered that the Federal Bureau of Investigation be told: Don't go any further into this case period!

title: The Nixon Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5President Nixon said a great deal to the nation in his twopage statement this afternoon. He said that he was indeed aware immediately after the Watergate breakin of the advantages of concealing the Nixon connections of the Watergate Burglars; and he said that he had given erroneous information to the House Judiciary Committee.

title: ROUSE VOTES END OF NOKNOCK LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) The House passed a drugcontrol bill today authorizing $480million for a threeyear continuation of the 1970 Controlled Substances Act while repealing the law's controversial noknock provision.

title: REPORT CRITICIZES EMBASSY IN SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5  A staff report issued today by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee criticizes the United States Embassy in Saigon for reports that were described as adhering too closely to the official line of the Saigon Government.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NIXON ADMITS ORDER TO HALT INQUIRY ON WATERGATE 6 DAYS AFTER BREAKIN; EXPECTS IMPEACHMENT; SUPPORT EBBS

title: BYRNE SIGNS BILLS ON PAROCHIAL AID
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5 (AP)Governor Byrne today signed legislation he said provided constitutional method for the state to disburse $4.5million for private and parochial school aid. The legislation marks the state's fourth attempt in less than 10 years to find a constitutional means of providing parochial school aid.

title: Villagers Driven From Cyprus Homes Charge Murder and Rape by Turks
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 5Greek Cypriotes from small villages around Kyrenia told stories today of murder, rape and looting by the Turkish Army after its invasion of Cyprus. The villagers are among 20,000 civilians driven from their homes by the Turks along the northern coast of the island.

title: General Motors to Pay Usual 85Cent Dividend
description: Despite a decline of nearly 62 per cent in profits in the second quarter, the General Motors Corporation said yesterday that it would pay a dividend of 85 cents a share Sept. 10 to shareholders of record Aug. 15the same dividend paid in March and June.

title: OPEC Experts in Meeting On Aiding Other Countries
description: VIENNA, Aug. 5 (Reuters) Experts from the world's biggest oilexporting countries met in Vienna today to discuss a centralized plan for helping developing countries, which are short of funds.

title: Contract Awards
description: The General Electric Company received four Navy and Air Force contracts yesterday totaling $1953million. The largest was a $125.6anillion contract to the General Electric's Knolls Atomic Power Laboratory for naval nuclear components.

title: Issues in Taxi Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTS: Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, representing 60 fleets with 6,000 cabs; Local 3036, Taxi Drivers Union, representing 30,000 drivers. And, by reason of its control over taxi industry revenues; the City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

title: Treasury Bills Rise At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 The rates of Treasury bills rose today as the Government borrowed $2.7  billion on 91  day obligations and $2billion of 180day paper. The offering of 91day bills was raised by $200million.

title: Religious Gambling Linked By Police to Mob Control
description: Police Department officials said yesterday they believe?? that some religious organizations in Brooklyn and Queens that ran Las Vegas Nite gambling programs were being used by organized crime.

title: Moment for Reform
description: Among the last major bills the House of Representatives will consider before taking up the impeachment President Nixon is a vital one to reform the financing of political campaigns. The timing is appropriate. There is hardly a strand in the web that now envelops the President that does not have its origin in campaign moneyfrom the illegal contributions of the dairy cooperative to the laundered cash that financed the Watergate breakin.

title: People in Sports
description: North Carolina State suffered a major blow in its bid to retain the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship yesterday when the fastmoving Tom Barker showed up at the University of Hawaii. The 7foot Barker had signed an Atlantic Coast Conference letter of intent and was scheduled to replace Tom Burleson as the Wolfpack center. In the last two years Barker has been to four schools. As a freshman, Barker became unhappy at the University of Minnesota and four divisions plus two wild card teams will be in the playoffs. Dallas has captured the Central Division, but it will try to gain the maximum number of points so that it can automatically advance to the semifinals and have the home advantage. Both wild card teams could come from the Western Division.

title: Wiggins for Impeachment; Others in G.O.P. Join Him
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 Representative Charles E. Wiggins, President Nixon's strongest defender during the house Judiciary Committee's impeachment proceedings, and many other influential House Republicans announced today that they would vote for impeachment.

title: Text of Controller's Statement on the Audit Dispute
description: The following is the text of yesterday's statement by Controller Harrison J. Goldin:

title: SHOP TALK They Man the Store And Make the Crafts
description: A customer dropping in at A Show of Hands to ask about something in the window that has taken his fancy may be waited on by the very person who made it. Because this is no ordinary crafts outlet, but a collective 35 artists and craftsmen who produce everything for the shop and take their turn behind the counter, too.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MONKEY SHINES The best show in town is thought by some to take place early in the morning at the Central Park Zoo. There, before the zoo officially opens, workmen proceed to wash out the cages, and Patty Cake, the baby gorilla who will be 2 years old Sept. 1, proceeds to cut up.

title: Forts Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 4 DEATH SENTENCES COMMUTED IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 5 (Reuters)A military judge today commuted death sentences given to three Air Force men and a civilian by a court martial last week.

title: ENATORS STUDYING OVERHAUL OF RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) The Senate Rules Committee net in closed session today to leer proposals for overhauling he rules of an impeachment rial.

title: Taxi Commission Disputes Industry Data
description: The city's Taxi and Limousine Commission, while considering the fleettaxi industry here to be in an unhealthy condition, strongly questions the fleets' contention that they are losing $30,000 a day $10  million to $11  million a yearand is holding up their bid for 20.5 per cent fare increases.

title: A Call for Resignation
description: CONCORD, N.H., Aug. 6 (UP) Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr., one, of President Nixon's staunchest allies during the twoyear Watergate ordeal, called today for the President's resignation. With his admission of guilt, I would hope that the President would put country above self and resign at once, Mr. Thomson said.

title: New Theater in Park Is Planned to Replace Delacorte
description: Parks Department officials and Joseph Papp, producer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, reached tentative agreement yesterday on plans for building a new 2,500seat openair theater in Central Park.

title: Qaddafi Is Accused by Sadat Of Plots and Recall of Planes
description: CAIRO, Wednesday, Aug. 7 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat has accused the Libyan leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, of having conspired to blow up a presidential retreat in Egypt, it was reported here early today.

title: Swimmers Doing What's Suitable
description: Did she or didn't she? have become the magic words in American women's swimming this year.

title: VIETCONG CHARGE U.S. AIR STRIKES
description: PARIS, Aug. 6The Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government of South Vietnam charged again today that American pilots were still flying combat missions over Communistcontrolled areas north of Saigon.

title: KLEIN SURPRISED AND HURT BY NIXON
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6Herbert Klein, President Nixon's former communications director, said today that he was surprised and hurt by some of the comments Mr. Nixon made about him in the White House transcripts released yesterday.

title: Dealing With Moscow: EastWest Experts View Value and Risks
description: Last month, following the summit meeting between President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, Secretary of State Kissinger said that he expected a national debate on the meaning of security in the nuclear age and on the value and risks of closer ties with the Soviet Union.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israel is now prepared to open talks with Jordan involving some military withdrawal from the Jordan River and some Jordanian civilian administration in the occupied West Bank area, according to senior officials in Jerusalem. According to Government sources, preliminary contacts began in late May when Secretary of State Kissinger arranged a secret desert meeting between King Hussein of Jordan and Premier Golda Meir and Defense Minister Moshe Dayan before they left office. [1:12.]

title: MOTHER CRITICIZES INDIA ON SON'S CASE
description: LEONIA, N.J., Aug. 6 (UPI)A Leonia widow whose son and another man are on a hunger strike in a jail in India after being held for 16 months on espionage allegations says the case against her son is based on vague rumors.

title: Transcript of the Statement by Rhodes
description: Following is the transcript of a statement yesterday by Representative John J. Rhodes of Arizona, the House minority leader, telecast from the House Judiciary Committee hearing room in Washington, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: About New York
description: The two men were lying prone on the grass in Prospect Park, playing chess under the wide umbrella of one of the big trees shading the blacktop path that climbs to the Litchfield Mansion.

title: New Theater in Park Is Planned to Replace Delacorte
description: Parks Department officials and Joseph Papp, producer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, reached tentative agreement yesterday on plans for building a new 2,500seat openair theater in Central Park.

title: Fish Tests Sentiment on Nixon in District
description: CARMEL, N.Y.  Driving north from Washington last Friday. Representative Hamilton Fish Jr. was, in his words, uneasy.

title: Handicapped Campers
description: For all of the almost 3,000 children the Fresh Air Fund has sent to camp this summer the experience offers something special, but for none more so than the 180 who are physically handicapped. Camp Hidden Valley where they are enjoying weeks away from the hot city streets is one of the few facilities in the country where handicapped children can enjoy camp life together with children who do not suffer similar disabilities. For both groups of children, the experience is not only great fun, but one in which a great deal of learning occurs.

title: Inducing Mr. Nixon to End His Seventh Crisis
description: PHILADELPHIAThe House of Representatives will be considering articles of impeachment shortly. Democratic government, indeed most government, is based upon the confidence of the people. Without a large measure of it, no leader in a democratic society can govern effectively.

title: Indian Youths and Benefactors Picnic
description: Eleven young Sioux, Navajo and ShoshoneBannock Indians and an Eskimo held a picnic on Central Park's Sheep Meadow last night with executives of the Union Carbide Corporation.

title: Detente: Value, Risk
description: Four public figures with interests in EastWest relations, in a panel discussion arranged by The New York Times, consider the meaning of security in the nuclear age and the value and risks of dtente. Page 33.

title: Weicker Vows Filibuster To Curb Use of Tax Data
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 Senator Lowell P. Weicker charged today that Administration lobbyists had swarmed all over the halls of Congress in an attempt to defeat a proposal of his that was aimed at preventing a recurrence of one of the offenses with which President Nixon is charged political use of the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Miami Tourism Hit Hard
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 6 (AP)  Although south Florida tourism is generally down, Miami Beach experienced its sharpest drop in the last two decades this last June, an economist says. Hotels and motels were 39 per cent occupied during that month, according to study made by E. D. LaCombe, vice president and economist for First Federal Saving and Loan Association.

title: Stewardess Is Reinstated But Weight Policy Stands
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6 (AP) A former Continental Airlines stewardess has won reinstatement and back pay from a Federal court for being dsmissed for being overweight, but the judge refused her demand that the airline rescind the weight policy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Presidency: Undemocratic Succession

title: Congress Gets Same Rating As Nixon in Harris Survey
description: While Congress and President Nixon grapple over the impeachment issue, Louis Harris, the poll taker, says that Americans interviewed in a poll give them both an equally low rating of 29 per cent.

title: No Discrimination Found In New Council Districts
description: The Justice Department in Washington informed State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday that it had found no racially discriminatory effects in the creation of 33 new councilmanic districts called for by a recent revision of the New York City Charter.

title: DECLINE IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6President Nixon's support in the Senate crumbled today and with it, apparently, his chances of surviving for long in the Presidency.

title: Court Surgery Revives Obscenity Law in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Aug. 6The State Supreme Court ruled today that a 1971 New Jersey antiobscenity law previously declared unconstitutional coulc be revived if it incorporated the standards of obscenity set out in the United States Supreme Court's opinion on the subject last year.

title: Boxer Is Hospitalized
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug 6 (AP)  A former national Golden Gloves champion, Lamont Lovelady, was hospitalized today after being knocked out in the sixth round of his welterweight fight against Melvin Dennis last night. Hospitals officials said Lovelady sustained a concussion and a fractured right hand.

title: TRIAL BY POLICE STARTS FOR SHEA
description: The departmental trial of Police Officer Thomas J. Shea, who was acquitted by a criminal court in the slaying of 10yearold Queens boy, began yesterday despite objections of the police officer and his lawyers.

title: Art Officials Deplore Nixon Comment
description: A statement from President Nixon, contained in transcript of a 1972 conversation released Monday, that his daughter Tricia Cox avoid museum and other art functions because they're Jews, they're left wing, evoked adverse comment yesterday from officials of arts institutions around the country.

title: Samuels and Carey in Vigorous Debate
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 6Howard J. Samuels and Representative Hugh L. Carey, opponents for the Democratic nomination for Governor, clashed vigorously here tonight on their respective qualifications for the post, on their political independence and on a few specific issues.

title: Harlem Dance Theater Scores London Triumph
description: LONDON, Aug. 6Arthur Mitchell is a man who has always been popular in London. But lie has never been so popular as he was last night, when his Dance Theatre of Harlem made its triumphant London bow at the Sadler's Wells Theater.

title: Gov. Dunn Criticizes Nixon
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 6 (AP)Gov. Winfield Dunn of Tennessee, chairman of the Republican Governors' Association, said today that he was extremely disappointed with the action of President Nixon in the Watergate investigation. In a statement issued by his office, Mr. Dunn said, Only the complete disclosure of all the facts will be sufficient to satisfy the American people that justice is being done to our country and its President.

title: Senate Panel Seeks to Resolve Indian Feud Over Arizona Land
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs reopened negotiations today between two feuding Indian tribes in Arizona lin an effort to settle a 92yearold land dispute.

title: JERSEY CITY CAMPVISITED BY MAYOR
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 6Operating almost under the imposing shadows of the World Trade Center towers and nearly under the nose of the Statue of Liberty, Camp Liberty, a day camp for 150 youngsters from the slums of Jersey City, had a special camper today.

title: Metered Blackjack
description: Owners of the city's taxicab fleets are back in their familiar position of using their reluctant drivers as a club to coerce the city into authorizing higher fares.

title: HARRY MARSCHALK, HEADED AD AGENCY
description: Harry C. Marschalk, a retired head of an advertising agency, died Monday at St. Joseph's Hospital, Stamford, Conn. He was 86 years old and lived in Darien, Conn.

title: 2 Killed in 2d FlyIn Crash
description: OSHKOSH, Wis., Aug. 6 (AP) Two persons were killed today in the second fatal plane crash in five days at the annual Experimental Aircraft Association flyin convention here. The victims were identified as Al Neunteufel, 43 years old, the pilot, and Karen Bos, 16, both of Addison, Ill. Officials said the plane had crashed shortly after takeoff from Wittman Field when a fourfoot section of the homemade plane ripped off.

title: Woman Protester Loses Fight for Meadows Home
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Aug. 6It was a little before noon today when Sheriff Joseph F. Job of Bergen County checked his watch and told the moving men: O.K., let's get this stuff out of here. I've got a meeting at 2 o'clock, and I can't hang around here all day.

title: Junta Out, Athens Cafe Satire Is In Again
description: ATHENS, Aug. 2  The sudden fall of Greece's military junta has brought an equally sudden return of political satire to the musical reviews that Athenians love.

title: Planners of Conventions Stage One of Their Own
description: The Province of British Columbia was offering an enormous beaver to some lucky doorprize winnerbut visitors to the mezzanine floor of the New York Hilton signed up for it anyway, each confident and hopeful that once again he would fail to win a contest.

title: Aaron Hits 2 Homers; Braves Win
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 6 (AP)Henry Aaron drove in four runs with two homers tonight as Phil Niekro, a righthander for the Atlanta Braves, beat the San Diego Padres, 52.

title: YIELDS IN BRITAIN LINKED TO PRICES
description: LONDON, Aug. 6The government moved today to protect pensioners and small savers from the effects of inflation by creating two new savings plans with dividends based on Britain's retail price index.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
Union and Owners Resume Talks for 5 Hours
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)Representatives of the striking players and of National Football League owners met with a Federal mediator for five hours today and agreed to resume bargaining tomorrow morning.

title: SpanishOrigin Persons Found Lagging in Purchasing Power
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Persons of Spanish origin in the United States have been losing ground to the rest of the population in terms of purchasing power, a Census Bureau survey showed today.

title: A Cloud Over Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The possibility possibility of PresidentNixon's resignation hung Iike an uncertain rain cloud over Washington todaya cloud that could burst at any moment but very well might not.

title: Kuh and Beame Letters On Inquiry on City Audits
description: Following are the texts of the letter from District Attorney Richard H. Kuh to Mayor Beame and the Mayor's reply:

title: Last of 7 Bodies Recovered In Collapsed Miami Building
description: MIAMI, Aug. 6 (UPI)Rescue workers finished recovering bodies from the collapsed Southeast headquarters of the Federal Drug Enforcement Administration today and proceeded with the task of salvaging records and evidence in vaults buried under tons of debris.

title: Results of Auction Delayed on U.S. 9% Notes
description: The small investor all bu drove the big institutions away from the Treasury's action o $2.25billion of 9 per cent, 33 month refunding notes yester day. Because of the massive demand, which dealers descrihed as unprecedented the results of the auction will not he announced until this morning. Normally, the Treasury reports auction results by 6 P.M. of the sale day.

title: A Garland of Books and Other Things to See
description: At first glance, Cappuccetto Giallo, may not look like the Little Red Riding Hood most American youngsters know, but cleverly wrapped up between the covers of Bruno Munari's Yellow Riding Cape is an updated version of the old story about a little girl and hazards on the way to grandmother's house. Mr. Munari's wolf is behind the wheel of a car on city streets, and other dangers abound, but our little heroine arrives safely.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: A NEW CONSTITUTION OFFERED IN ETHIOPIA
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 6 (AP)A 30member panel presented the draft of a new constitution to Premier Mikael Imru today, ending four months of work and bringing Ethiopia closer to constitutional monarchy.

title: Article 3  No Title
