description: The people at National Car Rental System and its agency, Richard K. Manoff, Ina., are happy with Don Rickles. So happy that, when their fall advertising campaign begins next month, they will use him as their spokesman more than ever.

title: Mansfield and Scott Pledge To Support Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) The Democratic and Republican) leaders of the Senate pledged today their continuing support of the nation's foreign policy regardless of President Nixon's troubles.

title: Suit Naming HomeStake Set For Hearing in Tulsa Aug. 27
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 7 (UPI)A hearing has been set for Aug. 27 in Federal District Court here on a class action suit alleging that the HomeStake Production Company and its former officers cheated investors out of more than $100million.

title: Dow Chemical Expands
description: The Dow Chemical Company said yesterday that its 70 per cent owned PetroquimicaDow, S.A., plans to double capacity of its lowdensity polyethylene plane at Concepcion, Chile, to 140,000 metric tons annually. The plant was expropriated by the Chilean Government in 1972 and was returned to Dow Chemical last January.

title: Senators Unable to Agree On Any Move Over Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7In an atmosphere of suspense fed by swirling rumors, the Senate leadership met, throughout the day today to discuss the fate of the Nixon Presidency.

title: Kissinger, Busy, Cancels State of World Message
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Nixon Administration has decided not to issue a State of the World message this year because of long delays in finishing a draft, State Department officials said today.

title: RUSH CHALLENGES ECONOMIC PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Kenneth Rush, President Nixon's economic counselor, expressed strong reservations today about two proposals for the economy put forward yesterday by Arthur F. Burns on behalf of the Federal Reserve Board, of which he is chairman.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday it had signed a contract valued in excess of $100million to supply nuclear fuel units for three 1,270megawatt generating units to the Arizona Nuclear Project. The project is owned by the Arizona Public Service Company, the El Paso Electric Company, the Public Service Company of New Mexico, the Tucson Gas and Electric Company, the Salt River Project and the Arizona Electric Power Corporation.

title: 10 Indicted in Alleged Bid to Discredit U.S. Evidence in LoanSharking Cases
description: NEWARK, Aug. 7A reputed mob leader, a former clerktypist for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, a wellknown criminal lawyer and a Bayonne police sergeant were indicted today along with six others on charges that they had used stolen F.B.I. files and bugged the lawyer's office in an attempt to discredit Government evidence against organizedcrime figures.

title: Eurodollar Borrowings Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  Liabilities of United States banks to their foreign branches fell $1.41billion to $3.27billion in the week ended July 31, the Federal Reserve reported today. This was $1.04billion higher than the level of Eurodollar borrowings in the same week a year ago.

title: Byrne Signs Bill To Help Industry To Grow in State
description: TRENTON, Aug. 7Governor Byrne signed into law today a bill establishing a State Economic Development Authority, which is designed to spur New Jersey's sagging economy by making longterm, lowinterest loans available for industrialexpansion.

title: Births
description: RAPPAPORTDr. & Mrs. Michael Rappaport (nee Laura Lippman) proudly announce the birth of Ryan Ethan in Los Angeles, Calif.

title: TREASURY NOTES DRAW FEW BUYERS
description: The Treasury continued to unroll its massive $4.6billion refunding operation yesterday by auctioning $1.75billion of 9 per cent, sixyear notes. However, the issue drew far fewer small investors than the $2.25billion of 9 per cent, 33month notes auctioned on Tuesday. While waiting on the Treasury to announce the results of, its latest sale this morning, dealers calculated that the average return on the new issue would be roughly 18.75 per cent, compared with 8.59 per cent on the Tuesday auction.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: Tacoma, Wash.  Sugar Ray Seales, 155 pounds, Tacoma, knocked out Dave Love, 156, San Diego, 12 rounds.

title: Boom Helps Norfolk, Va., to Delete Expletives About Its Past
description: NORFOLK, Va., Aug. 7Old salts have always dredged up an extra expletive or two when reminiscing about this midAtlantic port that overlooks the entrance to the Chesapeake Bay.

title: ITALY SEIZES THREE IN TRAINBLAST CASE
description: ROME, Aug. 7Three men were arrested today and two were being sought in connection with the bombing Sunday of a RomeMunich train in which 12 persons died and 48 were injured.

title: Paris to Review Its Mideast Arms Policy
description: PARIS, Aug. 7The French Government announced today that it would reconsider its Middle East armssale policy after President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said that Frenchbuilt Mirage fighterbombers sold to Libya had been operating in Egypt since the war against Israeli last October.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: REFRESH

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Stolen Picasso Found By F.B.I. Appraiser
description: A stolen Picasso drawing was recovered yesterday in the apartment of an East Side resident by an undercover agent who posed as an appraiser, according to the police.

title: JACOBSEN PLEADS GUILTY TO BRIBERY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Jake Jacobsen, a former aide to President Johnson who later became a lawyer for the nation's largest dairy farmer cooperative, pleaded guilty today to charges that he bribed former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally.

title: Dr. Chester Davidson, 80, Queens Surgeon, Is Dead
description: Dr. Chester Logan Davidson, who had been a surgeon in this city for many years until his retirement in 1966, died yesterday in North Carolina Memorial Hospital, in Chapel Hill. He was 80 years old and lived in Chapel Hill.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Jesse Jackson Hits Cub Management

title: House Votes Missile Site Planned for 6 Months' Use
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The House of Representatives voted $135million yesterday for the completion of a missile defense site that the Pentagon plans to place in mothballs six months after it becomes operative, according to a number of Congressmen and Administration officials.

title: House Backs Impeachment TV; Senate Panel Favors Same Step
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) The House approved today plans to permit live television and radio coverage of its scheduled impeachment proceedings, and the Senate Rules Committee voted to recommend the same action to the Senate.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
U.S. SEEKS REPORT BY CONSERVATIVES
description: Francis R. Valeo, secretary to the United States Senate, has directed the New York State Conservative party to file a financial report on a fund it collected in an attempt to help defeat Senator Jacob K. Javits and other candidates it considers liberal.

title: Investigators Find No Leads In Los Angeles Explosion
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Crime experts sifted barrels of debris today for a clue to the source of the blast that demolished a passenger lobby at Los Angeles International Airport yesterday, but a spokesman said there were no suspects, no leads.

title: Stock Prices Climb
description: Stock prices continued to climb yesterday amid widening conjecture that President Nikon would resign. The DowJones industrial average advanced 23.78 points. Meanwhile, the nation's leading economists have again lowered their hopes for the United States economy in 1974. Details on Page 47.

title: Rocket Toll in Phnom Penh At 75 in Month of Attacks
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Communistled insurgents fired two Chinesemade 107mm. rockets at Phnom Penh last night. One struck about 100 yards from the United States Ambassador's residence and the other about a half mile from President Lon Nol's residence.

title: Dance: Return of Diana
description: In program substitutions and cast changes that left unsuspecting ticketholders in delirious disbelief Tuesday night at the State Theater, American Ballet Theater presented Mikhail Baryshnikov and Natalya Makarova in La Bayadere, repeating the roles they had danced Monday. Fernando Bujones, originally scheduled to partner Miss Makarova in the ballet, appeared instead with Elanor D'Antuono in the season's first Diana and Acteon pas de deux, which was added to the program.

title: Eugene Ammons, Saxophonist Who Formed Group in '52, Dies
description: Eugene Jug Ammons, widely known for his distinctive style of playing the tenor saxophone, died Tuesday in a Chicago hospital. He was 49 years old and had been treated for pneumonia.

title: U.S. FEELS DISPUTE ON BERLIN IS OVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7High United States officials said today they believed that the controversy with the Soviet Union over East German interference with traffic on the access routes to Berlin was ended.

title: Ryan Loses NoHit Bid In 9th, Then Loses Game
description: Nolan Ryan, who can throw a baseball through the proverbial brick wall, lost his bid for the third nohit game of his sevenyear career when Dick Allen beat out an infield roller with one out in the ninth inning last night in White Sox Park.

title: Corruption Is as Commonplace as War in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 7A highschool teacher was explaining to a foreign friend how he manages to survive on a salary of about $15 a month. We have a couple of rich relatives in the family who help the rest of us, he said. They are Army officers.

title: Greek Cypriotes Doubt They Can Halt Turks' Drive
description: VASILIA, Cyprus, Aug. 7  Greek Cypriote soldiers streamed back in retreat today as Turkish armored columns advanced, under cover of artillery bombardment, into this northern coastal village about 12 miles west of Kyrenia.

title: Consumer Bill Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) Backers of legislation to create a consumer protection agency postponed it showdown Senate vote Tuesday, on the bill until Aug. 20.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: RIDGEFIELD PARK, Aug. 7If Karen Mandelkern can keep her husband, Andy, from overindulging at mealtime, he could become a major league catcher.

title: France Adopts Jail Reforms After Weeks of Disorders
description: PARIS, Aug. 7 (Reuters)After several, weeks of riots and other disorders in the country's jails, the French Government today adopted a series of prison reforms.

title: THE NEW YORK TIMES,
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)The British Petroleum Company, Ltd., said today it had arranged a $350million domestic United States bank credit as part of the financing of its share of the transAlaskan pipeline.

title: A City Full of Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Whatever can the man be thinking of? Why does he Insist on prolonging the agony? What does he want to do, hang on until Christmas?

title: Ted Kavanau Resigns Post Of WNEW News Director
description: Ted Kavanau resigned, yesterday as news director of WNEWTV amid reports of a dispute with Lawrence Fraiberg, vice president and general manager of the station.

title: 10 INDICTED IN BID TO TAR EVIDENCE
description: NEWARK, Aug. 7A repute mob leader, a former clerk typist for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, a wellknown criminal lawyer and a Bayonne police sergeant were indicted today along with six others on charges that they had used stolen F.B.I. files and bugged the lawyer's office in an attempt to discredit Government evidence against organizedcrime figures.

title: Bridge: Mathe Displays All His Skills When Boxed Into Tight Corner
description: The hundreds of players at the Summer Nationals here last month who were wellentertained by the show Bridge to Broadway heard one prophetic line.

title: Landmark Building Sold to Synagogue That Left Church
description: The synagogue purchased the 115yearbld landmark building from the United Federation of Teachers for $420,000 and will spend $300,000 for a historically accurate restoration under the supervision of James S. polshek, dean of Columbia University's School of Architecture.

title: Australian Wheat Rise For Export Questioned
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Throughout Asia, countries in need of grain have been increasingly looking to the vast continent of Australia as a possible source of supply. But they are likely to be disappointed.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Senators Unable to Agree On Any Move Over Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7In an atmosphere of suspense fed by swirling rumors, the Senate leadership met throughout the day today to discuss the fate of the Nixon Presidency.

title: POOR WILL GET PAID TO VISIT ELDERLY
description: Two experimental programs for the elderly in New York and Jersey City were announced yesterday by Robert F. Wagner, former Mayor of New York, and Mayor Paul T. Jordan of Jersey City.

title: Overthrow in Spain Is Goal Of a BasqueMarxist Group
description: PARIS, Aug. 7 (Reuters)A clandestine militant group pledged to bring down the Spanish Government was initiated here today.

title: MRS. ELLEN NEEDLES
description: Mrs. Ellen Gordon Needles, an interior decorator, died yesterday at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 63 years old and lived at 525 Park Avenue and in Saratoga Springs, N.Y.

title: EMMA FORDYCE M'RAE
description: Emma Fordyce MacRae, a painter who was Mrs. Homer Smith, died Tuesday at her home at 888 Park Avenue at the, age of 87. She maintained a studio here at 12 West 69th Street.

title: GLOOMY PICTURE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Three Republican leaders indicated today that President Nixon was now leaving open the possibility of resignation, and they said he had told them he would base his decision on the national interest.

title: New Gulf Oil Unit
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7 (UPI)The Gulf Oil Corporation announced the formation of a new subsidiary, the Global Energy Operations and Management Company, to provide energyrelated services on a contract basis to governments, governmentowned companies and others.

title: Many Mental Patients Simply Walk Out
description: More than 50 per cent of the mental patients admitted to Manhattan State Hospital and Bronx State Hospital during the year ended last June just walked out of the hospital without being cleared.

title: Now You Can Buy the Room
description: Packaging has become such a way of life that one would think there is nothing left to be subjected to it. But two wellknown interior designers seem to have thought of something new. They are packaging rooms.

title: Israelis Say Russian Arms Give Syria. Might to Strike
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 7Syria has received more than $2billion worth of modern weaponry from the Soviet Union in the last 10 months and is now capable of launching a fullscale war against Israel independently of Egypt, in the opinion of top Israeli leaders.

title: 60 More Are Put on Trial Secretly as Seoul Intensifies Political Crackdown
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 7In a major intensification of the recent series of political trials here, 60 more persons have been taken secretly before military courts in the last week.

title: NIXON DENIES TAPES FOR 2 INDIANS' TRIAL
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 7 (AP)President Nixon has refused to turn over Presidential tape recordings that defense attorneys in the Wounded Knee trial contend have a bearing on their case.

title: White House Says Calls Urge Nixon Not to Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)The White House said today that it had been flooded by calls from personssome of them in tearsurging that President Nixon not, resign.

title: JACOBSEN PLEADS GUILTY TO BRIBERY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Jake Jacobsen, a former aide to President Johnson who later became a lawyer for the nation's largest dairy farmer cooperative, pleaded guilty today to charges that he bribed former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally.

title: Dr. Marilyn Schotland 42, Pediatrics Professor, Dies
description: Dr. Marilyn Schotland, assistant professor of pediatrics at at Jefferson Medical College in Philadelphia, died last Wednesday at the Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania. She was 42 years old.

title: WEST SIDE DRIVE TO REOPEN A LINK
description: The Henry Hudson ParkwayWest Side Highway route will be open to southbound traffic all the way from the George Washington Bridge to 46th Street, starting at 6 A.M. Monday, Transportation Administrator Michael J. Lazar said last night.

title: Rinaldi Is Acquitted Of Perjury Charge Pressed by Radjari
description: State Supreme Court Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi was acquitted in Brooklyn yesterday of charges of perjury and obstruction of governmental administration.

title: Yanks Win, 43, Despite 14 Oriole Hits; Pirates' 14Hit Attack Routs Mets, 101
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7The New York Mets gave up the ghost tonight. Any similarity between the team of destiny they became last year and hoped to be this year seemed purely accidental after a 101 shellacking by the Pittsburgh Pirates, who rapped out 14 hits.

title: Excerpts From Ford Interview
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Following are excerpts from a transcript of an interview today by The New York Times with Vice President Ford:

title: World Football League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: FORD AND FRIENDS MEET FOR PRAYER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7While reports of his imminent succession to the Presidency swirled about the capital, Vice President Ford met in a Congressman's office just before noon today to pray with close friends, as he has most Wednesdays for three or four months.

title: Books of The Times
description: MR. NICHOLAS. By David Ely. 247 pages. G. P. Putnam's. $6.95.

title: Greek Junta Foe Relives Torture
description: PIRAEUS, Greece, Aug. 7Stella Tsirides weeps. She takes pills to calm her nerves but when she tries to sleep she remembers the day in February when she was summoned to military police headquarters and shown her husband Charalambos.

title: Newark Cabbies Jump Gun on Raises
description: NEWARK, Aug. 7Passengers who arrive at Newark International Airport after paying $28 or $29 to fly here from Boston or Washington are now finding themselves paying $16 or $17 for a 10mile taxicab ride into the Port Authority Bus Terminal in New York City.

title: State Correction Units Assailed From Within and From Without
description: About two months after the Attica prison rebellion of 1971, Malcolm Wilson, then Lieutenant Governor, listened for 45 minutes to plans of private companies for giving job training to inmates of the state's prisons, as well as to a proposal for creation of a businessmen's advisory council to the State Commission of Correction.

title: Lisbon Sets Talks on Isles
description: LISBON, Aug, 7 (Reuters)Portugal's Minister in charge of overseas territories, Antnio de Almeida Santos, flies to the Cape Verde Islands in the Atlantic tonight for talks on the islands' political future.

title: Ethiopia Considers A Charter Stripping Selassie of Power
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia would lose all the autocratic power he has held for nearly 45 years over the Government and armed forces under a new draft constitution being studied here, reliable sources said today.

title: White House Staff Aides Are Dismayed and Adrift
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 White House staff members, from secretaries to officials close to the center of power, admitted today being dismayed and adrift as Richard Nixon's Presidency apparently moved toward its conclusion.

title: Many Mental Patients Simply Walk Out
description: More than 50 per cent of the mental patients admitted to Manhattan State Hospital and Bronx State Hospital during the year ended last June just walked out of the hospital without being cleared.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A controversial regulation requiring bidders on city contracts to hire more minoritygroup workers in the building rtades, was declared invalid in State Supreme Court here yesterday. On July 25, in a separate case, the regulation had been upheld by Judge Morris E. Lasker in Federal District Cour.

title: Drought Robs an Iowa County Fair of Its Festive Mood
description: CLARINDA, Iowa, Aug. 7 It's one of the gloomier Page County fairs in memory. The children, with their 4H Club project ribbons, are excited and happy, as usual. But the old men sitting around in their bib overalls don't smile very much. Hey, play bingo, win a prize, shouts an amateur barker. Hurry up and play one game of bingo betore it starts raining.

title: ESB Declares Dividend
description: ESB, Inc., declared yesterday a regular quarterly cash dividend of 35 cents a share payable Sept. 27 to stockholders of record on Aug. 19. ESB noted that more than 90 per cent of its shares had been tendered to the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., but according to the Inco tender offer the dividend will be remitted to all ESB shareholders who tendered their shares.

title: The Wall Street Journal Joins Papers Urging Nixon to Resign
description: The Wall. Street Journal, which has expressed grave doubts about removing a President in an era of governinental instability thrpughout the. democratic world, said yesterday that the time had come for President Nixon to resign.

title: 2 Plead Guilty in Fraud. On F.H.A. Loan Insurance
description: Two employes of an Elizabeth mortgage company pleaded guilty today to a conspiracy charge stemming from an alleged fraudulent scheme to obtain nearly $1.1million in Federal housing insurance.

title: Poll in U.S. Shows Support of Detente
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 A sampling of opinion in regions across the country shows strong support for the Government's policy of seeking improved relations with the Soviet Union, although many Americans still distrust the Russians.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)The Interstate Commerce Commission approved today the formation of two companies to pool the boxcars and flatcars of most of the nation's railroads.

title: 5 Sticks of Dynamite Found in U.N. Meditation Room
description: Five sticks of dynamite were found yesterday in the Meditation Room at the United Nations, which is devoted to peace and where only thoughts should speak.

title: 10 Oil Nations Lift Monetary Reserves
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  The reserves of 10 oilproducing countries rose 16.12 per cent in June to $29.96billion following a gain of 15.7 per cent in May, according to statistics released today by the International Monetary fund.

title: Grumman Profits Post a Sharp Drop
Wigger Repeats As Rifle Champion
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 8 (UPI)Lones Wigger of Carter, Mont., won the 1974 national smallbore rifle four position championship today after trailing by 8 points going into the final round.

title: 24 Local News Agencies Closed by South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 8 (Reuters)South Vietnam has closed 24, local news agencies accused of operating illegally, a Government spokesman said today.

title: SPECULATION RIFE ON VICE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Potentially the most revealing and most important decision of Gerald R. Ford's Presidential debut  his choice of a successor in the Vice Presidency was a muchdiscussed mystery here today.

title: OPEN OPERATIONS, TAX PANEL URGED
description: To discourage abuses in propertyassessment reductions, a task force appointed by Mayor Beame recommended yesterday that the operations of the City Tax Commission be opened to full public scrutiny.

title: Interim City Center Chief
description: Martin J. Oppenheimer, legal counsel to the City Center of Music and Drama, was named yesterday as the center's acting operating chief and chairman of the executive committee to succeed Martin E. Segal, who will become a trustee.

title: Only Nixon Is Serene At Sad White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8On his 2,027th and penultimate day as President of the United States, with his staff and family unable to conceal their anguish, Richard M. Nixon went composedly through the schedule of a busy President.

title: The Irony History
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8In the long ironic history of America, events have kept unfolding contrary to the expectation of her greatest leaders and thinkers, but seldom has there been such an example of the irony and incongruity of political life as the case of Richard Milhous Nixon, who resigned the Presidency effective at noon tomorrow.

title: SUPREME COURT BACKS PROSECUTOR
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8A divided New Jersey Supreme Court today reversed two lowercourt rulings that had rejected a motion by the Passaic County Prosecutor to dismiss a complaint charging violation of state election laws.

title: A Normal Alert Status Is Set for U.S. Forces
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 8 Reuters)The Defense Department indicated today that American military forces around the world would remain on a normal alert status during the change in the Presidency.

title: NIXON TV AUDIENCE MAY SET A RECORD
description: Research experts at the networks predicted yesterday that the audience for President Nixon's primetime address would prove to be the largest television audience in history, totaling130 million people. Definitive rating statistics will not be available for several days.

title: White House Vigil: A Footnote to History
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8They were gathered in clusters at the White House fence today, as they did on Pearl Harbor night in 1941, and again in 1963 when the body of President Kennedy was brought home from Texas, and on a Saturday night last fall after the bloodless massacre in the Justice Department.

title: Detente and the Future
description: WASHINGTONGiven a choice between detente with the Soviet Union or a return to the eyeballtoeyeball confrontations of the frigid coldwar period, most Americans, I suspect, would choose a realistic easing of tensions between the supporters.

title: Sanok and Son, 21, Win 4Ball Golf
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J., Aug. 8Chet Sanok and 21yearold David Sanok became the first fatherson team to capture the New Jersey State Golf Association fourball matchplay championship foday defeating John Puskar and Dr. Dan Rosano of Rockaway River, 2 and 1, at the Braidburn Country Club.

title: Top Players Win Easily At Indy Net
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (AP)Terry Holladay, seeded No. 5, was a victim in one of the few upsets today, but most top players breezed through matches in the United States clay court tennis championships at the Indianapolis Racquet Club.

title: Former Aide Says He Quit White House Job Over Tapes
description: DALLAS, Aug. 8 (UPI)A former White House aide, Cecil Emerson, said he quit last, March because he was not allowed to examine tapes of White House conversations despite being an adviser to James D. St, Clair, President Nixon's defense lawyer.

title: After His Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Senator Mike Mansfield of Montana, the majority leader, has made the wise and constructive suggestion that impeachment proceedings should continue against President Nixon despite his resignation.

title: Clark Center Checking To Let Signs
description: The Clark Center for the Performing Arts is in a race with time. The center, which provides inexpensive classes in dance and theater arts, as well as a showcase for performances of works by new playwrights and choreographers, has been housed from its start in a building on Eighth Avenue and 51st Street, one of those to be sold by the Young Women's Christian Association and that must be vacated by the end of this month.

title: The 37th President Is First to Quit Post
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Richard Milhous Nixon, the 37th President of the United States, announced tonight that he had given up his long and arduous fight to remain in office and would resign, effective at noon tomorrow.

title: Women's Golf Final Today
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 8Mrs. Thomas J. Holy of Winged Foot defeated Mrs. Hoyt P. Steele of Stanwich, 5 and 3, and Mrs. James R. Hand of Sleepy Hollow won from Mrs. William M. Tingue of New Canaan, 1 up in 19 holes today and will meet in the final of the Women's WestchesterandFairfield Golf Association tournament tomorrow.

title: Trudeau Shuffles the Canadian Cabinet, Dismissing Five Ministers
description: OTTAWA, Aug, 8  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau shuffled his Cabinet today, introducing what he called a new policy of frequent ministerial changes to bring needed flexibility to his administration.

title: $2Million LoanSharking Ring Believed Broken With Aid of Bug
description: A loansharking operation with a $2million capitalization that District Attorneys Mario Merola described as thee heart of a usury ring focusing on smallbusiness men in the Bronx has reportedly been broken with the help of an electronic bugging device so sophisticated that the ring's efforts to find it failed.

title: Abroad, Officials and Citizens Call Outcome of the Crisis a Tribute to Democracy
description: The ending of the Nixon Presidency was widely viewed abroad yesterday as a praise worthy working of American democracy.

title: Contract Offer and New Deadline Avert a Taxi Strike
description: A work stoppage that would have crippled the operations of more than half the city's yellow medallion taxis was averted last night when the fleet owners, after making new contract proposal to drivers, agreed to a fourday extension of the old contract.

title: Red Smith
description: A man needs a strong stomach to read the papers these days, with Page One monopolized by a former Sunday school teacher who played football, not very well, for Whittier College and the sports section reflecting a growing ugliness between the National Football League's striking players and their unionbusting bosses. Still, not all the news is that unappetizing. On a good day one can read about two of the most exciting athletes to brighten the baseball scene in any seasonthe agreeably larcenous Louis Clark Brock from El Dorado, Ark., and Michael Grant Marshall of Adrian, Mich. Back in June when the St. Louis Cardinals were in New York, the gracefully aging Brock attended a party following the Mets' annual OldTimers gala. Seymour Siwoff, baseball's keeper of the rolls, who thinks in statistics, suggested that the burning question was whether Brock would steal 100 bases this year before Marshal pitched in his hundredth game.

title: Bridge: Cautious Isn't Prudent If It Costs Your Side Points?
description: Those players who never double the opponents into game, like commuters who never miss a train, lose in the long run by being overcautious. If you are willing to take calculated risks, and thereby suffer an occasional disaster, you will be ahead on pointsor timeon the long haul.

title: JAWORSKI ASSERTS NO DEAL WAS MADE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, said tonight after President Nixon's resignation speech that no deals had been either made or offered that would have given Mr. Nixon immunity from prosecution on any charges that might stem from the Watergate scandal.

title: Transfer of Power
description: Out of the despair of Watergate has come an inspiring new demonstration of the uniqueness and strength of the American democracy. A mammoth task of selfcleansing has been carried out under principles and procedures established by the Founding Fathers almost two centuries ago.

title: US. General in Saigon Assails Aid Cut
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 8  Maj. Gen. John E. Murray, the highestranking United States military officer in South Vietnam, today ongrily denounced recent Congressional cuts in military aid to Saigon, contending that shortages of ammunition had already caused increased casualties among South Vietnamese Government forces.

title: Stage: City, by Tokyo Kid Brothers
description: The innocence that suffused the Tokyo Kid Brothers' The Golden Bat (an Off Broadway hit four years ago) is an underlying presence in The City, the troupe's new musical playing for the next three weekends (Thursday through Sunday) at La Mama. But, clearly, this eager company of young performers wears badge of civilization.

title: PRICES OF SILVER SHOW A DECLINE
description: Gold prices abroad weakened as the dollar grew strong yesterday on news that President Nixon's resignation was imminent. In this country the price of silver, which often follows gold, dropped sharply, with all contracts down the daily 20centanounce limit.

title: Close Up View of Nixon Under Pressure Emerges From the Transcripts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8A lot of things damaged Richard Nixon's standing, but it was the tapes that delivered the mortal blows to his Presidency and that finally drove him from office in disgrace.

title: The Other Major News
description: Wholesale Prices Up

title: SOAKTHERICH TAX PROPOSED IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Aug. 8 (UPI)The Chancellor of the Exchequer; Denis Healey, outlined today two soaktherich tax proposals aimed at creating greater social and economic equality in Britain.

title: Cosmos 671 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8 (Reuters), The Soviet Union has launched the 671st in its series of Coscos satellites, the Communist party newspaper Pravda reported today.

title: DR. CURTIS H. SHELL
description: Dr. Curtis H. Shell, professor of art at Wellesley College since 1961, died Saturday in the NewtonWellesley Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived in Wellesley.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The proposal advanced by Harold Lamport, M.D. (letter July 30) is an interesting one because very few people appear to have speculated that the President would consider exchanging his office for immunity from future prosecution. How soon we forget. I am not a citizen of the United States and, because of that, perhaps I can afford to reject the sparing the nation the trauma argument that underlies Dr. Lamport's thesis.

title: Rosario Castellanos Dies; Mexican Envoy to Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Aug 8 (Reuters)  Rosario Castellanos, Mexico's Ambassador to Israel, died accidentally of an electric shock.

title: Royal Dutch/Shell Earnings Climb; Other Companies Report on Results
description: The Royal Dutch/Shell Group of Companies, in line with other petroleum companies, yesterday reported sharply higher rev; enues and earnings for the (three and six months ended June 30, reflecting higher prices.

title: DOLLAR REBOUNDS ALL OVER EUROPE
description: LONDON, Aug. 8The dollar strengthened all over Europe today in anticipation of President Nixon's resignation.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: About New York
description: Out on 86th Street between Fourth and Fifth Avenues in Bay Ridge, where they voted for Richard Nixon each time he sought national office and where they still know in their hearts that Barry Goldwater was right, there was anger yesterday, and a sense of betrayal, and a disappointed belief that they had been dealt double on the day that their President was to resign.

title: An Impeachment Ordeal's Climax
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The ordeal of impeachment ended tonight much as it had begun, in silent solemnity.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A. Gerdes Kuhbach was named executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey yesterday after serving as acting executive director since last August.

title: Books of The Times
description: DICTIONARY OF CONTEMPORARY MUSIC. John Vinton, editor. 834 pages. Illustrated. E.P. Dutton. $25.

title: Cyprus Leader Names a Cabinet as Effort to Define Truce Lines Goes On
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 8Glafkos Clerides, Acting President of Cyprus, today announced a new Cabinet containing no militant advocates of union of Cyprus with Greece.

title: Pravda Asks Cambodian Rulers To Step Aside for the Insurgents By MALCOLM W. BROWNE
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8The Soviet Communist party newspaper Pravda today in effect cailed on the Lon Nol Government in Cambodia to step aside in favor of the insurgent forces.

title: ROCKEFELLER DENIES GETTING FORD OFFER
description: SEAL HARBOR, Me., Aug. (AP)Nelson A. Rockefeller has not been offered the VicePresidency, a source close to the former New York Governor said today.

title: 6 Sewage Projects Approved for State; 8,000 to Get Jobs
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (AP)The state announced today that it had approved the financing of six sewage projects in the last four months that would handle 41 million gallons of sewage a day and provide 8,000 jobs.

title: Sets Down Loves, 2924, In Tennis
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Aug. 8 Stroking to a 10game lead before completion of the men's doubles, the fourth event on the program, the New York Sets treated 8,590 spectators, their largest crowd of the year, to a 2924 victory over the Detroit Loves in a World Team Tennis match at the Nassau Coliseum last night.

title: Senate Panel Urged To Speed Measures To Curb Corruption
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (AP) State Senator James H. Wallwork, Republican of Essex County, urged today that Senate committee release package of bills he has proposed for dealing with official corruption.

title: 10 Police Sergeants Held As Graft Club Members
description: Ten New York City police sergeants were arrested yesterday for allegedly participating in a club that collected more than $250,000 over more than a decade from legitimate businesses as well as from illegal rackets operations in Queens.

title: EGYPT SAID TO CALL RESERVISTS TO DUTY
description: CAIRO, Aug. 8 (Reuters)Egypt has called up some military reservists, according to diplomatic sources in Cairo, but the Government has not reported it and the extent of the move is not certain.

title: Gibson Visits 5 Centers In City Nutrition Project
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson today toured five of the 200 recreation, daycare, housing, community and church centers that are taking part in the Newark summernutrition programthe Mayor's fourth such tour.

title: Nixon Memoirs Estimated at $2Million The Screen
description: Scott Meredith, the literary agent, said yesterday that a close associate of President Nixon, evidently acting on the President's behalf, had asked him a month ago how much money Mr. Nixon could earn by writing his memoirs.

title: Presidentdesignate Ford
description: Gerald R. Ford, who said not too many years ago that he would ten times rather be Speaker of the House than Vice President, now undertakes to unite and lead the nation in the wake of the first Presidential resignation in United States history. The responsibility is heavy and throughout the nation there is a deep desire and determination to be supportive of the new President and to respond affirmatively to the leadership he offered in his brief and moving words immediately after Mr. Nixon had announced his intention to resign.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Lummus Company of Canada, Ltd., a wholly owned subsidiary of Combustion Engineering, Inc., has been awarded a $382million contract by Ontario Hydro, a provincial power agency in Toronto, for the design and construction of a second heavy water production plant near Kincardine, Ontario.

title: BRAZIL LISTS 1,000 DEAD OF MENINGITIS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 8More than 1,000 people have died from meningitis in Brazil this year, it was announced here today.

title: Reporter's Diary: A 3Month Chronicle of the Last Days of the Nixon Presidency
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Observing the disintegration of Richard Nixon's Presidency at close hand over the last few months has been like watching a terminal illness.

title: Sacrifice Is Praised; Kissinger to Remain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Ford praised President Nixon tonight for one of the greatest personal sacrifices for the country and one of the finest personal decisions on behalf of all of us as Americans.

title: People and Business
description: James Wood, who has been president and chief operating officer of the Grand Union Company since April, yesterday was given the additional responsibility of chief executive officer of the food chain, the ninth largest in the United States, Mr. Wood, who is 44, is deputy managing director of Cavenham, Ltd., the British food manufacturing and retailing group that acquired 51 per cent of Grand Union's stock last December in tender offer.

title: Thomas Jefferson: A Plea for Unity ...
description: DURING THE contest of opinion through which we have passed, the animation of discussions and of exertions has sometimes worn an aspect which might impose on strangers unused to think freely, and to speak and to write what they think; but this being now decided by the voice of the nation, announced according to the rules of the Constitution, all will of course arrange themselves under the will of the law, and unite in common efforts for the common good.

title: Baldur von Schirach, 67, Dies; Head of Hitler Youth 193340
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 8 (Reuters)Baldur von Schirach, the first leader of the Hitler Youth, who served 20 years in the Spandau Prison for his role in the deportation and execution of 50,000 Austrian Jews, died today, according to his family here. He was 67 years old.

title: The Nixon Resignation
description: The resignation of Richard M. Nixon, 37th President of the United States and the first to leave office under threat of impeachment, comes as a tragic climax to the sordid history of misuse of the Presidential office that has been unfolding before the eyes of a shocked American public for the last two years.

title: Police to Hear Lectures On MigrantVisit Rights
description: BRIDGETON, Aug. 8State policemen in South Jersey will soon be hearing lectures on a 1971 State Supreme Court ruling that permits representatives of the press and Federal, state and local migrant aid agencies to visit migrant labor camps On farms without permission of the farmer.

title: Meyer Tops Barker In Eastern Tennis
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Aug. 8  Ricky Meyer of Great Neck, a University of Pennsylvania player who is seeded first, defeated Bob Barker of Sands Point, L. I., the United States senior clay court champion, 61, 64, today and reached the semifinals of the Eastern clay court tournament at the Great Neck Tennis Center.

title: Transcript of President Nixon's Address to the Nation Announcing His Resignation
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's address last night as recorded by The New York Times:

title: 3 Indicted Companies Barred From Further State Contracts
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Three North Jersey companies indicted last week with Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel on charges of bidrigging conspiracy were barred from further state contracts.

title: Youth Gangs Here Are Found More Violent and Better Organized
description: State legislative investigators said yesterday that violent crimes committed by youth gangs were on the increase and that the gangs  some armed with automatic weapons  had become wellorganized groups who can terrorize any community when they decide tomobilize.

title: A.M.A. Says Poll Shows Health Bill Won't Succeed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UN) The American Medical Association said today that 85 per cent of the members of Congress polled recently by the group's lobbyists did not believe Congress would pass national health insurance legislation this year.

title: ALLEGHANY REPORTS PROFIT RISE IN HALF
description: The Alleghany Corporation reported yesterday for the first six months this year a net profit of $21.6million, or $2.63 a share, from $2.9million, or 33 cents a share, in the like period of 1973.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
11 GROUPS OPPOSE PLAN FOR CITY AIR
description: A coalition of 11 environmental groups urged yesterday that Federal authorities reject proposed changes in the transportation controls under a plan made public by Governor Wilson and Mayor Beame on July 26.

title: 4 Injured Greek Cypriotes Freed From Turkish Camp
description: ADANA, Turkey, Aug. 8 The Turkish armed forces today released four wounded Greek Cypriotes from a prisonerofwar camp in this southern Anatolian city.

title: BrazilChina Trade to Rise
description: BRASILIA, Aug. 8 (AP)Brazil said today she was confident that trade with China could be doubled to $130million annually or even more.

title: Zoning Case Called a Trial of City's Rationale
description: It has become almost commonplace for neighborhood activists to rally against proposed highrise apartment construction in their communities. Usually such opposition is limited to the immediate area of the proposed project.

title: N. J. Golf Finalists Are Ferro, Linney
description: ESSEX FELLS, N.J., Aug. 8 Cindy Ferro of Forest Hill and Kathy Linney of Plainfield won semifinal matches today to advance to the final in the 49th New Jersey womens amateur match play. golf championship at the Essex Fells Country Club.

title: Rise and Fall Appraisal of Nixon Career
description: The central question is how a man who won so much could have lost so much. How could a public figure who so well perceived the instincts of the majority of his countrymen have misused the powers and duties those same countrymen so eagerly ceded him?

title: A Tiny G.O.P. Bastion Feels Loss and Relief
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L.I., Aug. 8Six years after he put it on his car, Evans K. Griffing sadly stripped off his bold, redlettered bumper sticker today the one that said NIXON.

title: Calcutta Is Alarmed By Terrorist Revival
description: CALCUTTA, Aug. 5 Once again the police in Calcutta are armed and patrolling in groups of two and three. Once again the morning newspapers carry reports of explosives and detonators uncovered in slum districts. Once again state officials speak nervously about renewed spurts of terror.

title: Sadat Is Accused of Trying To Sow Discord in Libya
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 8 (UPI)A Libyan newspaper accused President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today of attempting to incite the Libyan people against their leaders and to sow discord within Libya's ruling Revolutionary Command Council.

title: MORE PEOPLE GOING TO MOVIE THEATERS
description: Movie  theater admissions have taken a spectacular spurt upward, reports Paul Roth, president of the National Association of Theater Owners, The Associated Press reports.

title: The Case Against Richard Nixon: A Catalogue of Charges and His Replies
description: During the three summers, and two winters of what clearly has been the biggest political scandal in the history of the United States, Richard M. Nixon was investigated more heavily and charged with wrongdoing more frequently than any of his 36 predecessors.

title: CITY SECURITIES SHIFTED TO BANK
description: Under the watchful eyes of a dozen policemen, millions of dollars of negotiable securities were transferred yesterday afternoon from a vault on the eighth floor of the Municipal Building to one or more banks in lower Manhattan.

title: Willamette to Add JohnsManville Timber Unit
description: Williamette Industries, Inc., reached an agreement yesterday day with the. JohnsManville Corporation to purchase its JohnsManville Timber Corporation, a subsidiary of about $34million in cash. The timber company own and operates about 60,000 acres of timberlands in the vicinity of Jarratt, Va. The transaction is expetted to be completed by Oct. 1.

title: POLITICAL SCENE SHARPLY ALTERED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8President Nixon's resignation drastically altered the American political landscape.

title: In 2 Years, Watergate Scandal Brought Down President Who Had Wide Mandate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 8  It was a tragedy in three acts.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state's Department of Insurance asked the Attorney General yesterday to appeal immediately a Superior Court decision dismissing a suit to have the financially troubled Gateway Insurance Company of Philadelphia declared insolvent. Judge Arthur K. Salvatore ruled Wednesday that the state could not bring an insolvency proceeding against an outofstate insurance company. Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran said a declaration of insolvency was necessary to protect Gateway policyholders and claimants against financial loss. If Gateway is declared insolvent, he said, an association of insurance companies doing business in the state will pay all approved claims. Gateway, which specializes in assignedrisk auto insurance, has 64,000 policyholders in New Jersey.

title: Greenspan Says He Would Stay As Council's Head if Ford Asks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Alan Greenspan said today he would stay on as chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers under the Presidency of Gerald R. Ford, if he is asked.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: WILLIAM HEINEMAN OF UNITED ARTISTS
description: William J. Heineman, vice president of United Artists Corporation from 1951 to 1967, who had been associated with the motionpicture industry for more than half a century, died here yesterday after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived in Yonkers.

title: The Other Major News
description: A new upward surge of farm prices joined a big jump in industrial prices to produce the year's largest monthly increase in the wholesale price index. The rise for July was 3.7 per cent, seasonally adjusted, and 3.9 per cent before adjustment. Page 45.

title: Soviet Asks U.N. to Consider Environmental Warfare Ban
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8The Soviet Union announced tonight that it had proposed an urgent discussion in the United Nations General Assembly on drafting an international convention to prohibit environmental modification for military purposes.

title: Kansans See News As Inevitable
description: HUTCHINSON, Kan., Aug. At the stanchly Republican Prairie Dunes Country Club onight in this overwhelmingly Republican city in Kansas' wheat country it was treated as a fait accompli.

title: Theater: Two Bright Spots of the London Season
description: LONDON  Two of the biggest hits of the current London drama season have both come from one organization, the Royal Shakespeare Company, and both starred the same actor, John Wood. These common factors apart; however, it would he difficult to imagine two plays more dissimilar than the old American melodrama, Sherlock Holmes, being reVived in London for the first time an nearly 70 years, and the dazzling cerebral fantasies of Tom Stoppard's latest play, Travesties. Sherlock Holmes was collaboration by the original author, Arthur Conan Doyle, and the American actorplaywright William Gillette. It a melodrama, but a wellcrafted piece, and the director, Frank Dunlop, taking working vacation from his own company, the Young Vic has Istagecl it with loving skill. The settings by Carl Tomb, much of the time swirling in authenticlooking London fog, are the purist's delight.

title: SPECULATION RIFE ON VICE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Potentially the most revealing and most important decision of Gerald R. Ford's Presidential debut  his choice of a successor in the Vice Presidency was a muchdiscussed mystery here today.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Classified pages distributed in metropolitan New York and adiacent territory.

title: PRICEINDEX JUMP IS YEARS HIGHEST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  A new upward surge of farm (prices combined with another big jump in prices of industrial goods to produce the year's largest increase in the wholesale prices index in July, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Hampton, at Grill, Offers SummingUp Of Decades of Jazz
description: Lionel Hampton, who turned the Benny Goodman Trio into Quartet by joining Mr, Goodman, Teddy Wilson and Gene Krupa 38 years ago this month, has seen the music world go round in innumerable circles since then, and he is part of another circle now. The other night at the Rainbow Grill, as Mr. Hampton was rocking his way through Hamp's BoogieWoogie, a piece he has been playing for more than 30 years, a young woman of the contemporary boogieing school who was hearing Mr. Hampton for the first time exclaimed happily, I didn't know he'd be hip!

title: ROBERT V. VAUGHN
description: Robert V. Vaughn, executive secretary and treasurer of the Federation of AmericanControlled Shipping and former vice president of Liberian Services, Ltd., died Wednesday of a heart attack at his home in Garden City, L.I. He was 47 years old.

title: Ford Sees Himself as an Internationalist and a Moderate on Domestic Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Months ago, as he underwent close Congressional scrutiny before becoming Vice President, Gerald R. Ford readily acknowledged that his views on both foreign and domestic policies were virtually identical to those of Richard M. Nixon.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NAVEL OBSERVATORY It is hard to know what is more unusual at a new restaurant, Genghiz Khan's Bicycle on the West Side, which features a real live belly dancerthe existence of a belly dancer in the heart of liberalism (and all that liberalism entails about the role of women) or the existence of a raucous crowd that seems to enjoy it all. At any rate, you can go see both the crowd and the dancer, as well as hear some music on the saz, ud, and dumbekthree Middle Eastern instruments that provide the accompaniment. The dancer's name, incidentally, is Christine Busuni. She's a native New Yorker though a professional at this sort of thing, and she can be seen nightly.

title: Yanks Go West, Pagan Goes to Farm
description: The New York Yankees farmed out Dave Pagan and his sore arm yesterday as they went Westwith Mel Stottlemyre and his sore shoulderfor six games against the California Angels and Oakland A's.

title: A Selection of Quotations Ranging Over the Public Life of Richard Nixon
description: Following is a selection of quotations of President Nixon drawn from various periods of his public life:

title: U.S. Horsemen Do Well
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 8 (UPI)Commandant Raimondo D'Inzeo, an Italian horseman, strengthened his position as leading rider in the Dublin Horse Show today when he won the first of the two international jumping events. Dennis Murphy of the United States won the second event, which was dominated by American riders.

title: JAVORSKI ASSERTS NO DEAL WAS MADE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, said tonight after President Nixon's resignation speech that no deals had been either made or offered that would have given Mr. Nixon immunity from prosecution on any charges that might stem from the Watergate scandal.

title: A Place Along the Hudson for lining (If You're the Patient Kind, That Is)
description: The Hudson River is famous for its majestic natural beauty and the hundreds of historical homes and points of interest along its banks, but there are few restaurants in the valley worthy of a detour. Packing a picnic hamper was the best insurance for eating well until recently, when the Culinary Institute of America opened its elegant Escoffier Room and Rabelais Bar on a reservation only basis.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WAYNE, Aug. 8William Paterson College has a short and undistinguished football tradition. In its only two varsity seasons, 1972 and 1973, it won a total of six games and lost 14 under a parttime coach and with no athletic scholarships.

title: MARKETS HERE GET DUALPRICING TEST
description: Responding to pressure from supermarkets and from some consumer interests, the city's Department of Consumer Affairs has decided to let supermarkets use dual pricing during a sixmonth test period.

title: The 37th President Is First to Quit Post
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Richard Milhous Nixon, the 37th President of the United States, announced tonight that he had given up his long and arduous fight to remain in office and would resign, effective at noon tomorrow.

title: Lisbon Aide Flies to Algeria; Final Guinea Talks Expected
description: LISBON, Aug. 8Foreign Minister Mario Soares arrived today in Algiers for what apmeared to be the final round of talks leading to the independence of Portuguese Guinea.

title: Devaluation and Controls Milestones for Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 The Nixon Presidency will stand out in the economic history of the United Statesindeed, in economic history generallyfor two decisions: the devaluation of the United States dollar against the other leading currencies and the first use of wage and price controls in peacetime.

title: Reluctant 10,350Lb. Hippo Family Packed for Trip
description: Three reluctant hippopotamuses put on an unexpected show for visitors at the Central Park Zoo yesterday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: August 9, 1974

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW SLIM RISE
description: Prices finished slightly higher on the American Stock Exchange yesterday in more active trading while the overthecounter market ended lower.

title: Judge Calls for Transfers For Integrating Lane High
description: Judge John R. Dooling terday ordered a new zoning pattern so that 600 minority students can be transferred out of Franklin K. Lane High School this fall and 570 white students brought in from across the borough line in Queens two years from now.

title: City Mixes Rapt Attention and Indifference
description: The President spoke to the nation last night, and the people of the city reactedoften with rapt attention, occasionally with ardor and sometimes with the barest show of interest.

title: Reactions Range From Elation and Relief to Despair
description: With emotions ranging from bitter elation and relief to despair, Americans responded yesterday to the news of President Nixon's resignation.

title: The Pop Life
description: In his prime, Joe Cocker was the great lovable eccentric of rock. Anyone who saw the movie of the Woodstock Festival will remember his raspingly sensitive whisky baritone and his strangely affecting contortions.

title: ThreePower Parley on Cyprus Resumes Effort to End Conflict
description: GENEVA, Aug. 8The Foreign Ministers of Greece, Turkey and Britain met here tonight in an effort to make the ceasefire on Cyprus effective and tackle the political problems underlying the continued fighting there.

title: CARL W. LARSON
description: Carl W. Larson, who retired as State Architect of New York in 1962, died Sunday in Vero Beach, Fla., where he lived. His age was 79.

title: HOUSE APPROVES CAMPAIGN REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) A campaign financing reform bill spurred by the excesses of the 1972 Presidential election, was approved by the House today, almost by acclamation.

title: THOUSANDS FLEE ANGOLA VIOLENCE
description: LUANDA, Angola, Aug. 8Thousands of blacks and whites have fled Luanda's outer suburbs, where 18 people have been killed and 122 wounded in three days of guerrilla clashes and other violence.

title: HOPE IS EXPRESSED BY CITY AND STATE
description: Eager to get Federal money from a miscellany of stalled legislature proposals, City Hall and Albany expressed cautious hope yesterday that Congress no longer preoccupied with impeachmentmight begin to move.

title: Union and National Airlines Press Talks to End Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Negotiations continued today in an effort to settle the 24day old strike by ground crewmen against National Airlines.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: And James Madison on Power and Law
description: The essence of Government is power; and power, lodged as it must be in human hands, will ever be liable to abuse. In monarchies, the interests and happiness of all may be sacrificed to the caprice and passions of a despot. In aristocracies, the rights and welfare of the many may be sacrificed to the pride and cupidity of the few. In republics, the great danger is, that the majority may not sufficiently respect the rights of the minority.

title: REALTY CONCERNS ARE CITED BY CM
description: The City Commission on Human Rights said yesterday that it had evidence showing that eight realestate organizations or owners illegally treated black and white homeseekers differently, including steering them to different neighborhoods.

title: ' Worker's Diary' Tells i of Finnish Couple
description: Taking as its subject matter a tissue-thin slice of life infected by bleakness, monotony and the sort of problems that do not so much shatter characters as nag them to death, "Worker's Diary" is a film that flirts with disaster.So it is a tribute to the skill of its director, Risto Jarva, that this Finnish film playing tonight and tomorrow at noon and midnight at the First Avenue Screening Room manages eventually to avoid the fate that usually awaits works that deal with drearinessboring the audience, too.But it is a narrow escape, and the less patient may weary of its two focal characters  the newlyweds, Ritva, a secretary in a state office, and Juhani, a welderlong before the introductions are over and their problems  his job, moving, her relatives, his memories, her pregnancy, his affair  crystallize.Set in a society not usually depicted in films seen here, "Worker's Diary" begins by making us conscious of what is foreign and ends by immersing us in the familiar. And the familiar smacks a little of soap opera, with an ending so coated with sugar that even Mr. Jarva seems impelled in the final frames to set his work in its proper place in the cosmos.It is a place, it would seem, just adequate for a craftsman's miniature.

title: U.S. Tells Town to End Hiring Bias or Lose Aid
description: The town of Montclair, N.J. has been advised by the Federal Office of Revenue Sharing to stop discrimination against minority people by its Police and Fire Departments in hiring and promotions or face the loss of up to $250,000 a year in revenuesharing funds.

title: People in Sports
description: The controversy stirred by padded attendance figures at home games of the Philadelphia Bell of the World Football League yesterday caused John B. Kelly Jr., the president of the team, to announce his resignation. The Bell, which had announced a W. F. L. record attendance of 64,719 for its game with the New York Stars, admitted this week that only 6,200 fans had paid. The club also disclosed that only 13,855 in an openinggame crowd of 55,534 had paid the admission price.

title: Residences for Women: Still Homey Isles of Safety in the City
description: Residences for young women. Aren't they passe, or Just too, too quaint? Who wants that kind of shelter in the city these days? A great many girls and young women, that's who. What's more, only a few of them want their dormitorylike existence to be coed.

title: Ford Promises That He and Kissinger Will Continue Nixon's Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Ford said tonight that he would continue without any hesitation or reservation the foreign policy of the Nixon Administration.

title: Rivkind in Net Final
description: HEWLETT, L. I.Dan Rivkind of New York, seeded first, and Paul Lynner of Carle Place, L. I., seeded second, reached the final of the Eastern senior clay court tennis tournament today at the Seawane Club. Rivkind defeated Ed Kujan of Armonk, N. Y., 62, 78, and Lynner beat Leonard Steiner of Harrison, N. Y., 62, 64.

title: Only Nixon Is Serene At Sad White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8On his 2,027th and penultimate day as President of the United States, with his staff and family unable to conceal their anguish, Richard M. Nixon went composedly through the schedule of a busy President.

title: 3 Networks to Cover White House Farewell
description: All three television networks plan special coverage of President Nixon's departure from the White House set for 9:30 A.M. today and the swearingin of Gerald R. Ford. scheduled for noon.

title: Malaysian Coalition to Run Unopposed in 47 Districts
description: KUALA LUMPAR, Malaysia, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The National Front coalition of Malaysia's Prime Minister, Abdul Razak, today won by default nearly onethird of the 154 Parliament seats at stake in the Aug 24 general elections.

title: Suspect Is Held in Attempt To Sell Bogus Treasury Bills
description: A 37yearold man was held here in lieu of $100,000 bail yesterday on charges of trying to sell $2million in counterfeit Treasury bills.

title: Dollar Up Abroad
description: The United States dollar closed broadly higher in world money markets yesterday while in Wall Street stock prices slumped unexpectedly to end a strong threeday rally in anticipation of President Nixon's resignation.

title: SENATE PANEL VOTES SUPERT ANKER PORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) A bill that would empower the Transportation Department to license construction of deepwater ports for supertankers was approved today by the Senate Commerce Committee.

title: Ocean County Inquiry Is Started Into Charges of Police Brutality
description: BRICKTOWN, Aug. 8 (UPI) The Ocean County Prosecutor's office is conducting an investigation into allegations of brutality by members of the Brick Township Police Department, it was disclosed today.

title: Nixon, Long a Master of Adversity, Was Overwhelmed by the Last of Many Crises
description: What particularly distinguished my career from that of other public figures, wrote Richard Milhous Nixon in 1961 with astonishing prescience, was that I had had the good (or bad) fortune to be in several crisis situations with dimensions far beyond personal consideration. A man with a propensity for crises, who seemed to be able to surmount each one while extracting a personal lesson from it, Mr. Nixon appeared to live a charmed political life in which adversity was only a temporary barrier on the road to personal triumph.

title: Comments Sought on Plan For NaturalGas Terminal
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)The state's Department of Environmental Protection today asked for comments about its environmentalimpact report for a proposed liquefiednaturalgas terminal at Raccoon Island in Gloucester County.

title: Graham Says Nixon Deserves Prayers and Expresses Sorrow
description: The Rev. Billy Graham, the evangelist who is a close personal friend of President Nixon, said last night that the President deserved the prayers even of those who feel betrayed and let down.

title: Nixon Nominates Meskill for Judgeship
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill was nominated to a lifetime term on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit today by President Nixon, a longawaited action that came on the eve of the President's resignation.

title: Group Asks a City Drug Aide to Resign
description: A Brooklyn comunity group that has been battling alleged abuses at a Fort Greene methaclone clinic has asked for the resignation of Jerome Hornblass, Commissioner of the city's Addiction Services Agency, charging that he had suppressed an unfavorable audit of the citysubsidized methadone program.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Cincinnati Reds, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 7:50 P.M.)

title: Mills Backs City on Revenue Sparing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Legislation that would take Federal revenuesharing money away from the states and divide their share among their cities instead was proposed today by Wilbur D. Mills, the chairman of, the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Ford's Economic Policy To Differ From Nixon's
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 People who have long known both Gerald R. Ford and Richard M. Nixon believe that Mr. Ford's posture will be subtly but significantly different from his predecessor's in the area that is of most concern to the nation today  economic policy.

title: Baseball Expansion Is Expected in 1976
description: Professional baseball took a long step yesterday toward increasing the major leagues from 24 teams to 28 when the National League unanimously adopted a resolution creating a committee to study expansion.

title: Priest Who Granted Garrow Absolution Denies He Confessed
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 8A priest who said he had visited with the convicted murderer, Robert Garrow, three times following his capture today denied that Mr. Garrow had confessed to him the murders or the location of the bodies.

title: U.S. ISSUE TO YIELD 8.63% ON AVERAGE
description: The Treasury completed its $4.6billion refunding operation yesterday with the auction of $400million of 8.5 per cent, 25year bonds.

title: A Sense of National Reconciliation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The capital took the news with remarkable serenity, almost as if it had lost a President but found itself. And President Nixon, in his noble farewell, contributed to this sense of national reconciliation. Washington is looking forward gladly now, having looked back for so long, and Mr. Nixon joined in forgettingalmost insisted on forgettingthe facts of the past.

title: A Selection of Comments Made by Ford on Various Issues and Individuals
description: Following is a selection of quotations of Gerald R. Ford drawn from various periods of his public life:

title: Dow, NL and Champion Set to Expand
description: Major capital expansion plans or projects were announced yesterday by the Dow Chemical Company, the Charpion international Corporation and NL Industries, mostly aimed at increasing production capacity.

title: Homer Defeats Mets, 43
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8 The New York Mets lost to the Pittsburgh Pirates for the third straight time here tonight. This time the score was 43, and defeat came suddenly in the ninth inning.

title: Strikers Called to Meeting
description: The player representatives of the 26 National Football League teams have been summoned to Washington for a meeting today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, AUGUST 9, 1974

title: Congressional Leaders Predict an Extended Honeymoon With the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Congressional leaders predicted tonight that there would be an extended honeymoon between Congress and the White House.

title: RICE OUTPUT FREED IN HOUSE PANEL VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The House Agriculture Committee approved today, by 19to16 vote, a controversial Administrationbacked bill to end Government controls on rice production for at least threeyear trial period.

title: DOW SLIDES 12.67 ON PROFIT TAKING
description: This week's sharp stock market rally, which was sparked by expectations of President Nixon's resignation, ended abruptly yesterday as prices finished mixed in steppedup trading.

title: POLITICAL SCENE SHARPLY ALTERED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8President Nixon's resignation drastically altered the American political landscape.

title: A Break With the Past: Nixon's Foreign, Economic and Domestic Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8.Richard M. Nixon said in 1968 that while he thought the United States could run itself domestically without a President, you need a President for foreign policy. That seemed to be his credo until the Watergate scandals led him to apologize publicly for not having paid enough attention to domestic politics and for having devoted too much time on foreign affairs.

title: KORFF SAYS NIXON AVOIDS STALEMATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) Rabbi Baruch M. Korff, one of Richard M. Nixon's chief defenders in recent weeks, said today the President was resigning to spare the nation months of anguished stalemate.

title: OXFORD POLLUTION IS HEARING TOPIC
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (AP)A Warren County company was ordered today to appear at hearing Aug. 22 on a state complaint that it had refused to comply with an order to stop polluting the air.

title: Watergate Guard Says No Position Is Too High
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 UP1)Frank Wills, the security guard who discovered the Watergate breakin, said today that no one was exempt from being honest and forthright.

title: Cyprus Land Mines Kill a Soundman for B.B.C.
description: LAPITHOS, Cyprus, Aug. 8A British television soundman was killed and five journalists were injured today when unmarked Turkish land mines exploded around them on the road to this village.

title: MAX KATZMAN
description: Max Katzman, who invented an electric vaporizer 50 years ago and founded the Kaz Manufacturing Company to produce it, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at 710 Park Avenue.

title: British Soldier Is Accused In Murder of an Irishman
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 8 (Reuters) British soldier was charged with murder today in the shooting of a 23yearold man, Patrick McElhone, near his farmhouse home at Pomeroy, County Tyrone, last night.

title: Sweeping Reforms in Regulation Of Securities Clear House Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 Legislation providing major reforms in securities market regulation was approved today by the House subcommittee on commerce and finance. The action sending the measure to the parent Interstate and Foreign Commerce Committee made final action on a reform bill at this session a distinct possibility.

title: Legal Questions Underlie the Debate Over Proposal of Immunity for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8In Congress and elsewhere in Washington today, there was growing debate over whether president Nixon should be given immunity from criminal prosecution upon his resignation.

title: BUT FEW EXPECT A MAJOR IMPACT
description: Businessmen, economists and narket researchers who take the pulse of consumer confidence believe that the change of Presidential leadership will give the economy a psychological uplift, but few are ready to assert that it will have a substantive impact.

title: 3 Ordained Women Told Here to Delay New Role as Priests
description: The Episcopal Bishop of New York, the Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., has directed the three women deacons in his diocese who were ordained as priests in an irregular ceremony in Philadelphia last month not, to try to function as priests untitlfurther notice.

title: 4 Gain in Girl's Golf
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 8 (AP)Nancy Lopez, a 17year old from Roswell, N. M., scored a fourunderpar round today to beat Lori Garhacz, 5 and 3, in a quarterfinal match of the United States Junior Girls golf tournament, Joining her in tomorrow's semifinals are Loren Howe of Colorado Springs, Julie Stanger of Phoenix and Elainee Hand of Douglas, Ga.

title: Politicians in Metropolitan Area See An End to Ordeal of G.O.P. and Nation
description: Republican and Democratic politicians in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut reacted to President Nixon's statement of resignation last night with wide agreement that it would remove a political albatross from Republican candidates, with relief that a national ordeal was ending and with calls for concentration on other national problems.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Rand Pair Shot Ahead In BestBall
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y. Aug. 8Winged Foot Golf Club still presented two magnificent courses today that tested the talents of the 84 amateur twosomes opening the 38th annual John G. Anderson Memorial bestball tournament. But the test was not quite as difficult as it was when Hale Irwin won the United States Open on the West Course here 53 days ago.

title: Texas Murderer Is Given 594 Years
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Aug. 8 (UPI)Exactly one year from the day that the police began unearthing 27 bodies of young men in unmarked graves, Elmer Wayne Henley was formally sentenced today to 594 years in prison for his part in the series of Houston murders.

title: NIXON VETOES BILL FOR AGENCY FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8President Nixon vetoed today $13.5billion in appropriations for Federal environmental, consumer protection and rural assistance progams. He called the bill a distinct threat to our fight against Inflation.

title: State Elections Post Filled
description: ALBANY, Aug. 8. (AP)George V. Palmer, former Schenectady County Demotoday as assistant executive director of the State Board of Elections at an annual salary of $30,000. The commissioners also appointed David E. Blabey of Slingerlands, assistant counsel to Governor Wilson, as special counsel to the board at $29,500 a year.

title: Kissinger Will Remain Secretary of State
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Ford announced tonight that Henry A. Kissinger would continue as Secretary of State in the new Administration.

title: Relax, Norell Fans, $3,900 Styling Lasts
description: In these uncertain times, Gustave Tassell's third collection for the house of Norell was wonderfully reassuring. The fall and winter designs shown to store buyers and the press this week seemed like a retrospective of the late Norman Norell's ideas from the 1960's on.

title: Advertising: New Zealand Views
description: Richard Mayson, a 32yearold member of the New Zealand Parliament and a former adman, retains a strong interest in advertising. So when he passed through New York yesterday, he took the opportunity to talk a bit about advertising in his country.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Business Loans Show a Rise; Fed Funds Rate Moves Down
description: With the Federal Reserve keeping the credit market on an even keel while the Treasury sold 9 per cent notes to help refinance $10.28billion of the national debt, little that was dramatic showed up in the central bank's weekly statistics made public yesterday afternoon.

title: Rise and Fall Appraisal of Nixon Career
description: The central question is how a man who won so much could have lost so much. How could a public figure who so well perceived the Instincts of the majority of his countrymen have misused the powers and duties those same countrymen so eagerly ceded him?

title: Ziegler's Final White House Briefing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Ronald L. Ziegler, President Nixon's press secretary for the last 5 years, held a final briefing fox White House reporters tonight, acknowledging the often abrasive nature of his relations with the press but saying he had a deep sense of respect for the nation's press.

title: Blues Still Available For Area's Fishermen
description: If the unusually warm weather that has embraced most of the East Coast the last few weeks is truly abating, one could expect to find a bit more action from striped bass, which traditionally are hard to find and catch in August.

title: Butterfingered Stars Come Through
description: Instead of writing a game plan this week, Babe Parilli should write a book. He could title it Six Crises.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Beauty Fills the Chinese Exhibition in Toronto
description: TORONTOA classic case of exhibitionitis has just broken out in Toronto, where The Chinese Exhibition is now an view (through Nov. 16) at the Royal Ontario Museurn. Exhibitionitis, though benign, is contagious.
