It manifests itself in a general state of euphoria, coupled with the attribution of magical powers to a visiting anthology of works of art quite distinct from the intrinsic quality of the objects.

title: Mrs. Ford Sees Dress Designer Instead of Her Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8At 3 P.M. today the Secret Service ordered a roadblock placed on Crown View Drive, a quiet suburban street in Alexandria, Va., where Vice President Ford lives.

title: F.T.C PLANS CURBS ON WORK SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission proposed today a set of regulations that it said were designed to eliminate profits by deceptive vocational and homestudy schools.

title: Rudi Bats in Half of A's 10 Runs in Rout
description: Joe Rudi, the unsung hero of the world champion Oakland A's and a loser in his salary arbitration case with Charlie Finley last winter, virtually beat the Texas Rangers by himself last night in Arlington Stadium.

title: U.S. Says State Lost 102,000 Residents in One Year
description: New York State lost 102,000 inhabitants from mid1972 to mid1973, one of only five states showing a decline in growth in that period, according to new Census Bureau estimates.

title: MORRIS GERMAIN
description: Morris Germain, photographer and teacher, who retired in 1967 as president of the Germain School of Photography here, died yesterday at the South Shore Nursing Home in Freeport, L.I. He was 83 years old and lived at 415 National Boulevard in Long Beach, L.I.

title: A Tiny G.O.P. Bastion Feels Loss and Relief
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L.I., Aug. 8Six years after he put it on his car, Evans K. Griffing sadly stripped off his bold, redlettered bumper sticker today the one that said NIXON.

title: Senate Votes to Upgrade Amtrak Passenger Service
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The Senate approved legislation today to upgrade Amtrak, the nation's rail passenger service, including the addition of basic Amtrak service to five states ignored when the system first began operating.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8With more plants closing for the model changeover, domestic auto production is expected drop to 70,448 cars this week, off 24.5 per cent from 93,365 last week.

title: Senate Votes to Improve Trade Ties With Rumania
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The eSnate voted today to grant mostfavorednation trade treatment to Rumania. The provision now goes to the House.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
District 1 School Board, 54, Votes Ouster of Fuentes
description: At a noisy meetig yesterday evening marked by shouting and scuffling, the Community School Board of District 1 on the Lower East Side passed resolution by a 5to4 vote calling for the ouster of Luis Fuentes, the district's superintendent.

title: Sacrifice Is Praised; Kissinger to Remain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Ford praised President Nixon tonight for one, of the greatest personal sacrifices for the country and one of the finest personal decisions on behalf of all of us as Americans.

title: Whitehead Resigns as Nixon TV Aide
description: Clay T. Whitehead, director of the White House Office of Telecommunications Policy since its formation four years ago, submitted to President Nixon Wednesday the letter of resignation he had announced as forthcoming last December.

title: Funds of Senators Found Far Greater Than Rivals' Money
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) The 28 incumbent Senators running for reelection this fall have already raised $8.6million in campaign contributions, Common Cause said yesterday.

title: KOREA CONVICTS 26 AT NEW TRIAL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 8 In an apparent attempt to speed the present series of political trials here, 26 more persons were convicted of subversion today and 19 others were placed on trial.

title: East Siders Fail to Save Prettiest Tree on Block
description: On the north side of 88th Street, 75 feet east of York Avenue, stood a plane tree that was the glory of the block.

title: Ban on Radioactive Material On Passenger Planes Sought
description: Atlanta, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Delta Air Lines said today that it had asked the Civil Aeronautics Board to ban transportation of radioactive materials on passenger aircraft except where essential to public health and welfare.

title: 20 on L. I. Are Arrested, Accused of Welfare Fraud
description: BAY SHORE, L.I., Aug. 8 (UPI)Detectives of the Suffolk County District Attorney's frauds bureau arrested 20 persons today on indictments charging them with illegally accepting a total of $150,000 in welfare payments over the last four years.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SUNNINGDALE, England, Aug. 8 (AP)Jan Ferraris, steering clear of the heather, shot a oneunderpar 71 today to take the firstround lead in the first European women's open golf tournament. Driving, straight along Sunningdale's narrow heatherlined fairways, Miss Ferraris, of the United States, took a onestroke lead in the $48,000 tournamentBritain's first big event for the women pros.

title: A Program of Broad Change at Home.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8President Nixon set out to reverse the tide of domestic programs, to divert the flow of power away from Washington and back to the states and localities.

title: Notes on People
description: A spokesman for the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn., confirmed yesterday that Associate Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr. of the Supreme Court has been at the clinic since Monday for treatment involving a nonmalignant enlargement of the prostate. The 66yearold justice underwent surgery Wednesday, and yesterday he was reported in satisfactory condition. He is expected to return to his home in Richmond, Va., in about two weeks.... In Madrid, one of the doctors attending Spanish Chief of State Francisco Franco denied rumors that General Franco had suffered a relapse while recovering from phlebitis. The general's aspect could not be better.... and he himself says he feels very well, the unidentified doctor was quoted as saying, in the newspaper Ya. General Franco was said to be able to take walks on the grounds of his El Pardo palace.

title: Boy Fatally Slashed by Target Of His Alleged Robbery Here
description: A 14yearold boy was slashed to death early yesterday morning by one of two men he and two teenaged companions are accused of having tried to rob.

title: 2 Mayors Named to Panel
description: Mayor Lee Alexander of Syracuse and Mayor Richard G. Hatcher of Gary, Ind,, have been named cochairmen of the United States Conference of Mayors' legislative action committee. The appointments were announced Wednesday at a meeting of the mayors' organization at Gracie Mansion, United Press International reported.

title: Ford a Traditionalist Who Believes in Home, Family, Hard Work and Patriotism
description: He has a granite jaw, regular features, and a demeanor that remains stern even in laughter: It is a model countenance for billboards and campaign literature. He believes in the homespun virtues of family loyalty, hard work and stubborn patriotism. No intellectual, he likes to think of himself as a devotee of sensible courses and determination rather than of originality and flair. He has admirers but no worshipful followers, critics but no real enemies.

title: POLICE AVOID FATE OF SLAIN OFFICER
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3 (AP) A year ago, Edwin Goulart was returning home from the funeral of a fellow motorcycle officer who had been shot while on patrol.

title: Harriman and Mrs. Lehman Come Out for Carey
description: Former Gov. W. Averill Harriman and Mrs. Herbert H. Lehman, widow of the United States Senator and Governor, endorsed Representative Hugh L. Carey for the Democratic nomination for Governor yesterday and were named cochairmen of his citizens committee.

title: Montclair Told to Stop Bias in Hiring Or Lose U.S. RevenueSharing Help
description: The town of Montclair has been advised by the Federal Office of Revenue sharing to stop discrimination against minority people by its Police and Fire Departments in hiring and promotions or face the loss of up to $250,000 a year in revenuesharing funds.

title: BERLINGER'S DEPUTY IS NAMED SUCCESSOR
description: ALBANY, Aug. 8 (UPI)Governor Wilson today named William F. Meyers, Deputy Welfare Inspector General, to succeed George F. Berlinger as Welfare Inspector General.

title: Severe Economic Problems Are Being Left by Nixon
description: Although it was the Watergate affair that proved to be President Nixon's undoing, the severe economic problems (spawned in large part by his domestic policies will be his lingering legacy to consumers land businessmen alike, according to some of the nation's prominent economists.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Impeachment Trial Urged By Nixon's 1950 Opponent
description: FAIRLEE, Vt., Aug. 8 (UPI)  Helen Gahagan Douglas, whose political career was cut short by Richard Nixon in 1950, said today that she was sorry the impeachment process had not proceeded to its logical conclusion in the Senate.

title: Big Favorite Wins Easily At Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 8  La Prevoyante, the Canadianbred who was named the filly of the year in 1972, once more showed her excellent form of a couple of years ago by winning her second straight race here today.

title: Cardinal Will Offer Mass for the Nation
description: Cardinal Cooke, Roman Catholic Archbishop of New York, will offer a special mass for the nation at St. Patrick's Cathedral today at noon.

title: Fish Silent On Concert By Morrow
description: One might have thought that Charlie Morrow picked a rather odd site for an avantgarde concert yesterday morning on a boat in the middle of Little Neck Bay in Queensand that the timing was rather odd, too a weekday morning just before a new President was to be inaugurated.

title: Marines, Soldiers Score in Shooting
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. (UPI)Teams from the Marine Corps and the Army ??eserve captured fourposiion team honors for metallicight an danysight shooting ??ere today during the 1974 National Smallbore Rifle Championships.

title: A GAS FIND IN ARCTIC IS REPORTED BY TASS
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9 (AP)Soviet geologists have discovered a gas deposit containing more than a trillion cubic meters on the shore of the Arctic Ocean in the polar circle, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported dtoya.

title: Vandalism Is Driving Out Sculpture Show in Park
description: PARAMUS, Aug. 9  The North Jersey Cultural Council is moving its SculptureinthePark exhibit from Van Saun Park here to the new campus of Bergen Community College, to safeguard the more than one hundred works from further theft and vandalism.

title: COFFEE PRICE CUT 3 CENTS IN WEST
description: The wholesale price of coffee sold to grocery stores was reduced 3 cents i pound yes erday by the Folgers coffee division of the Procter & Gam ble Company in its marketing area, west of the Mississippi. The 3cent reduction, attributed by a P.& G. spokesman to lower prices for green coffee, was met in the marketing area west of the Mississippi by the General Foods corporation for its regular ground Maxwell House and Yuban coffees.

title: JOSEPH RODRIGUEZ JR.
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 9Joseph Aloy Rodriguez Jr., former vice president of International General Time Corporatjon, died today at Stamford Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 45 Halpin Avenue. For the last year he was vice president of the Waltham, Mass., division of the Sylvania Corporation. He is survived by his widow, the former Thelma Felegy; two sons, three daughters and two grandchildren.

title: P.B.A. Chief Working Way Into Post
description: The making of a union leader is not accomplished simply by winning an election, or so Ken McFeeley, the new head of the 27,500member Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, has found.

title: Kay Agrees to Issue Shares to Bowater In Mercantile Sale
description: The Kay Corporation announced yesterday improved terms for the sale of its 71 per cent interest in Mercantile Industries, Inc., a finance and insurance company that has its headquarters in Chicago. On June 14, Kay said an agreement in principle had been reached with Bowater Holdings, Inc., for the sale of the Mercantile Industries interest for $17.87million and the proposed issuance to Bowater of $9.5million principal amount of 10year junior debentures at an interest rate of 10 cent.

title: The ExPresident as a Witness
description: AMAGANSETT, N.Y.  Richard M. Nixon's recent admission of complicity in the Watergate coverup make him a crucial witness in the forthcoming trial of those Watergate defendants who have not yet pleaded guilty.

title: Ballet: La Sylphide
description: The National Ballet of Canada's production of Bournonviile's La Sylphide, staged by Erik Bruhn and presented for the first time this season at the Metropolitan Opera House on Thursday night, is certainly one of the bestacted versions of the ballet.

title: Mary Beame Christens a Massive Tanker
description: A 225,000ton tanker, which Mayor Beame called the largest commercial vessel ever built in the United States, was (christened the Williamsburgh yesterday by Mrs. Mary Beame.

title: Aide to Selassie Arrested By Ethiopian Armed Forces
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  Lieut.Gen. Assefa Demissie, a personal aide of Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia, is under arrest, the armed forces announced over the country's radio today.

title: Goldin Questioned 5 Hours by Nadjari; Scoppetta Says Discrepancy Is Solved
description: Controller Harrison J. Goldin was questioned for more than five hours yesterday by the state's special prosecutor and emerged looking strained and subdued to say repeatedly that there had been a full and frank discussion.

title: Jets, Chargers Will Face Pickets' New Game Plan
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 9One week after successfully overcoming the unexpectedly noisy Denver pickets, the Jets' collection of rookies and secondstring veterans tomorrow night will encounter the San Diego pickets, who will be seeking a comeback.

title: Schlee Leads P.G.A. by Stroke at 135
description: CLEMMONS, N. C., Aug. 9  You see? asked John Schlee, a Gemini. When your signs are right anything can happen.

title: Bridge: Swiss Team Championship To Start Today in Flushing
description: The Swiss team championship of the Greater New York Bridge Association is scheduled at 1.30 P.M. and 7.30 P.M. today and at 1 P.M. and 7 P.M. tomorrow, with play at the Deborah Building, Northern Boulevard and Main Street, Hushing, Queens.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Conversation piece at breakfast

title: Qaddafi Reported to Drop Charges Against 4 Hijackers
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 9 (AP)The Libyan leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, has dismissed charges against four Palestinian guerrillas held in Libya since they hijacked and blew up a Japanese airliner last year, a proguerrilla Beirut newspaper reported today.

title: Many Across the Country Call Inflation Biggest Problem Facing New President
description: Once again, as they have so often in the last 11 years, Americans pondered yesterday the future of the country in the aftermath of national trauma.

title: Nixons to Be Protected For Rest of Their Lives
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Former President Richard M. Nixon and Mrs. Nixon will receive lifetime protection from the United States Secret Service.

title: G.M. to Raise Prices 9.5% On 1975 Cars and Trucks
description: DETROIT, Aug. 9The General Motors Corporation announced today that it would raise prices of 1975 model cars and trucks by an average of $480 or 9.5 per cent.

title: Con Ed Treats Alcoholism on Staff as Medical Problem
description: You can be fired for drinking at Con Edison, but it is not easy. You really have to want to be fired.

title: 4.NAMED TO HELP PORD TRANSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Immediately after he was sworn in today as the nation's 38th President, Gerald R. Ford took control of the Presidency and moved to give it a character and shape different from that of his predecessor, Richard M. Nixon.

title: HOME LOAN BANKS RAISE $1.8BILLION
description: The Federal Home Loan Banks borrowed $1.8billion yesterday through three shortterm bond issues, each of which carried interest rates above 9 per cent a year. Meantime, prices of fixedincome securities drifted lower again in extremely light trading that was marked by lengthening periods of inactivity as the day wore on.

title: Defense Fund Planned
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 9The head o fan antiimpeachment organization said today that he would turn his efforts to raising money for former President Richard M. Nixon's legal fees. George Dumas, who said he was torn up by Mr. Nixon's resignation, founded the President's Friends of America last year.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 9 (AP)Two drivers were hurt seriously today in a crash of stock racing cars during qualifying for Sunday's Talladega 500 stock car race. Taken to Memorial Hospital at nearby Anniston were Buddy Arrington, 36 years old, of Martinsville, Va., and Dean Dalton, 34, of Asheville, N.C.

title: Judge Backs Rule Voiding Man's Forced Commitment
description: SOMERVILLE, Aug. 9A Somerset County Court judge today denied a motion by county officials that he stay his earlier order nullifying the involuntary commitment of an elderly man to a mental institution on the ground that the usual commitment procedures violated all concepts of fair and due process of law.

title: SAMUELS REPORTS SPENDING MILLION
description: Howard J. Samuels reporter Yesterday that as of Aug. he had raised $1,088,409 and spent $1,085,605 in his campaign for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: Arab Oil Producers Pledge 5  Billion to Help Importing Nations Meet Costs
description: BEIRUT, LebanonArab oilproducing countries have pledged some $5billion in soft loans and other forms of assistance to countries that need help in paying for oil imports, according to petroleumindustry sources here.

title: A Plea to Bind Up Watergate Wounds
New Era of Justice In U. S. Seen by Hiss
description: PARIS, Aug. 9 (AP)Alger Hiss, who former President Richard M. Nixon helped send to prison in a sensational spy case almost 25 years ago, said today that the Nixon resignation may open a new era of justice in our country.

title: Mrs. Robbins And Glen Leet Wed in Vienna
description: Mildred Elowsky Robbins of New York, widow of Louis J. Robbins, a New York lawyer, was married yesterday morning to Glen Leet of Weston, Conn., president of the Save the Children Federation, at the City Hall in Vienna.

title: Brazil Hopes U.S. Attends To Trade Questions Now
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 9Brazilian Government officials expressed the hope today that with the Nixon crisis out of the way, the United States would be able to give full attention to trade and energy questions and the strengthening of the dollar, matters of deep concern here.

title: Special U. S. Election Urged By Communist Chief Here
description: Gus Hall, general secretary of the American Communist party, called yesterday here for an immediate Presidential election.

title: Books of The Times
description: LAUGHABLE LOVES. By Milan Kundera With an introduction by Philip Roth. Translated from the Czech by Suzanne Rappaport. 242 pages. Knopf. $6.95.

title: 2D PHILLIPS TRIAL PUT OFF TO MONDAY
description: William R. Phillips was adThe opening of the second murder trial of Police Officer journed yesterday to Monday by Justice Harold Birns, because of the absence of F. Lee Bailey, the defense lawyer of record.

title: Transcript of Address by New President
description: Following is a transcript of President Gerald R. Ford's Inaugural address yesterday in Washington, as recorded by The New York Times.

title: With Vacation at Peak, Russians Live It Up
description: NOVOROSSISK, U.S.S.R., Aug. 3With the coming of August, Soviet vacationers by the hundreds of thousands have massed along the stony shore of the Black Sea. This year they sporting the sleekest beach garb and fattest wallets yet seen along the Soviet Riviera.

title: My Uncle, the President
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Aug. 9 (UPI)Chris Ford, 9yearold nephew of the new president, was asked what he would call his uncle now. Mr. Uncle Jerry President, the youngster said.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 31

title: Jersey City Construction Men Give New President Support
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 8The ironworkers were having lunch in the Tube Bar on Journal Square so nobody inside heard President Ford's inaugural address on television.

title: Art: Seekind the Look of the City
description: The movies never miss with New York City. A novel like Butterfield 8, or like Breakfast at Tiffany's, gets the look of the city so exactly right that readers all over the world feel as if they had lived here all their lives. Memoirs can do the trick, too as in a.certain small classic by Hamilton Fish Armstrong. It's art that gets lost, somehow. I doubt if there is a picture painted in this century of which we can say, The whole city's there. Mark Tobey's Broadway, perhaps. One or two paintings by Georgia O'Keefe, almost. But the whole city? The city as we get it time and again in the movies? No, never. We get it, if at all, at a tangent: in the combine paintings of Robert Rauschenberg, espe cially.

title: Retail Sales in July Rose 4% to Record
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Retail sales were up in July after a small decline in June, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Nixon and Ford, With Similar Backgrounds, Exhibit Vividly Contrasting Styles
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Both are Republicans, both are conservatives. Both were born in 1913, came to maturity in the Depression, served in the Navy in World War II and journeyed to Washington to take their places in the House of Representatives.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: A KOREAN BISHOP FACES LONG TERM
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 9  Government prosecutors demanded today that a military court sentence a Roman Catholic Bishop and a 77yearold former President to 15 years in prison for allegedly taking part in a Communistbacked plot to overthrow the Government.

title: GERMANY EXPECTS ADVANCES IN G.N.P.
description: BONN, West Germany, Aug. 9 (Reuters)The West German Economics Ministry forecast today that the gross national product and, in particular, domestic demand will grow more strongly in the second half of this year than in the first six months when real G.N.P. is estimated to have risen between 1 and 1 per cent, compared with the first half of 1973.

title: VOTERS SUE NIXON TO GET $25MILLION
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 9 (UPI) Two hours after Richard M. Nixon left office today, he was named a defendant in a $25million damage suit seeking to void results of the 1972 Presidential election on grounds of fraud and corruption.

title: Red Norvo Returns To Play Vibraharp Ina Timeless Style
description: It is hard to believe that it is eight years since Red Norvo has been in town, padding gently across his vibraharp with his blueheaded mallets, peering out into the back reaches of the room as though he had expected to find the ultimate note hanging in space there, occasionally leaning back in amazed pleasure at the sounds he produces.

title: Strong Base Of Owners Is Eroding.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Reports today indicated that some. National Football League clubowners were working at crosspurposes with each other in the deadlocked negotiations with striking players.

title: Lawsuit to Revoke A Fornication Curb Nears Completion
description: NEWARK, Aug. 9Final testimony was heard today in Essex County Superior Court in suit by the New Jersey Civil Liberties Union seeking to prove there is a constitutional right to consentual premarital intercourse.

title: CAUTIOUS MARKET ASSESSES FORD
description: The stock market, contrary to hopes and expectations on Wall Street, greeted President Ford's first hours in office yesterday with sliding prices and slow activity.

title: Aide Doubtful That Ford Would Give Nixon Pardon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The new White House press secretary, J. F. terHorst, suggested today that President Ford was not likely to grant a pardon to former President Nixon. The press secretary was asked at a briefing this afternoon about the prospects of a pardon.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Con Edison to Study Hudson Fish

title: Notes on People
description: For the first time since he became acting chief of state in Spain, Prince Juan Carlos, designated successor to Generalissimo Francisco Franco, presided over a meeting of the Spanish cabinet yesterday. The prince called the special session so that the ministers could catch up on a work load that has been neglected since General Franco fell ill some weeks ago with phlebitis, a circulatory disorder. The ministers presented for the prince's approval about 70 decrees, a number of them dealing with economic problems, chief of which is a slump in tourism.

title: Peoples Gas Unit Planning 96Mile Pipeline to Gulf
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  The Natural Gas Pipeline Company of America, a subsidiary of the Peoples Gas Company, said today that it planned to build a 96mile gas pipeline to the Gulf of Mexico from the Texas coast.

title: NIXON TALK FAILS TO SET TV RECORD
description: The television audience for President Nixon's resignation address Thursday night was not the largest for a single television event, as network analysts had predided it would be. But if it was not a record audience, it was nevertheless an enormous one, especially for a summer evening, when television viewing is lower than at other times of year.

title: Hahn Homer Helps Mets Top Reds, 41
description: The New York Mets, who may not realize how badly off they really are, opened a sixgame home stand against the two best teams in baseball last night by upsetting the Cincinnati Reds, 41.

title: Thursday Fight
description: Los Angeles  Danny (Little Red) Lopez, 125 pounds, Alhambra, Calif., knocked out Masanao Toyoshima, 126, Tokyo, 3 rounds.

title: ARA Services Posts Records; Other Companies Issue Reports
White House Discloses NixonColson Tape Gap
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Seventeen minutes of a crucial telephone conversation on March 21, 1973, between President Nixon and his chief troubleshooter were never recorded, the White House disclosed today.

title: The Age of Nixon
description: BOSTON, Aug. 9In watching tragedy, the audience finds releasecatharsisfor its own fear and pain. So the Greek dramatists taught us. But to meet their definition of tragedy, the hero had to change during the drama, Like Oedipus, he came to understand the destiny imbedded in his character. He accepted reality, and so he expiated the wrongs of the past.

title: Male Teacher Accuses John Jay of Reverse Bias
description: A 33yearold assistant professor at John Jay College of Criminal Justice has brought suit in State Supreme Court charging the college with discriminating against him as a male by promoting four women ahead of him and ending his teaching contract.

title: JAPANESE OFFICIAL URGES TRADE ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, 9 (UPI) Japanese Ambassador Takeshi Yasukawa today urged that Congress pass trade legislation granting the President negotiating authority for the next round of trade talks.

title: ExPresident, On Coast, Vows to Strive for World Peace
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 9  Richard M. Nixon, his hardwon Presidency lost, came back today to the wonderful climate of California to live in a villa overlooking the Pacific, where he promised to work for world peace.

title: MARKETS HERE GET. DUALPRICING TEST
description: Responding to pressure from supermarkets and from some consumer interests, the city's Department of Consumer Affairs has decided to let supermarkets use dual pricing during a sixmonth test period.

title: Votes in Congress
Sports News Briefs
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 9 (AP)Two drivers were hurt seriously today in a crash of stock racing cars during qualifying for Sunday's Talladega 500 stock car race. Taken to Memorial Hospital at nearby Anniston were Buddy Arrington, 36 years old, of Martinsville, Va., and Dean Dalton, 34; of Asheville, N.C.

title: Jets, Chargers Will Face Pickets' New Game Plan
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 9One week after successfully overcoming the unexpectedly noisy Denver pickets, the Jets' collection of rookies and secondstring veterans tomorrow night will encounter the San Diego pickets, who will be seeking a comeback.

title: 2 CHARGES DROPPED FOR INDIAN LEADERS
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 9 (UPI)United States District Judge Fred Nichol dismissed today two more charges each against two American Indian Movement leaders, Dennis Banks and Russell Means, in connection with the 1973 occupation of Wounded Knee, S. D. the two defendants thus face only five of the original 10 counts. The judge dropped three other counts on Wednesday.

title: Concertwear Depends on Where
description: The girls in their summer dresses, their long flowered skirts and their slingback sandals, stepped out the other night to hear the music of Mozart at Lincoln Center.

title: 49,000 Workers at VW To Be put on PartTime
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Aug. 9 (UPI)Volkswagenwerk, A. G., suffering from low sales at home and abroad, announced today that it would put 49,000 of its 119,000 workers in West Getman plants on parttime shifts in the last week of August.

title: The Vice President
description: After the assurances of governmental continuity which his presence bestows and the hope of governmental decency which his character promises, President Ford's first great act of service in behalf of the American people will be his nomination of a new Vice President under the 25th Amendment.

title: Burns, Kirkland Capture Medal by 2 Shots on 136
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., Aug. 9George Burns continued to dominate Eastern amateur competition today, although the big 23yearold blond needed assistance from Dave Kirkland at the Winged Foot Golf Club.

title: Home Town Exults in Ford's Reflection of Its Virtues
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Aug. 9  Out the phrases rolled, crackling imperfectly from behind the 12inch screen of the television set amid the stacks of paper and the accounting machines in the offices of the Ford Paint and Varnish Company, a concern run by a brother of the new President of the United States.

title: President Ford
description: The simplicity with which Gerald R. Ford addressed the nation as he took the oath of office in the White House yesterday reflects the nature of this unpretentious man, who through an extraordinary and ironic chain circumstances has become the 38th President of the United States. It also suggests the straightforwardness and the humility which may be expected to characterize Mr. Ford's approach to the awesome responsibilities the great office he now will occupy for the next two and a half years.

title: U.S. Fines Cuban for fishing
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9 (UPI)A Federal judge today ordered the captain of a Cuban fishing boat to pay a $25,000 fine for illegally fishing in United States waters. District Court Judge James Noel gave the captain, Elias Sanchose Sorina, one week to determine how the fine would be paid. The Coast Guard boarded his boat on July 28, near East Matagorda Bay, southwest of Galveston, Tex. Captain Sorina denied that he in Galveston since their arrest. was fishing within the 12mile limit. He and his eightman crew have been held on their boat at the Coast Guard dock

title: 2 Mayors Named to Panel
description: Mayor Lee Alexander of Syracuse and Mayor Richard G. Hatcher of Gary, Ind., have been named cochairmen of the United States Conference of Mayors' legislative action committee. The appointments were announced Wednesday at a meeting of the mayors' organization at Gracie Mansion, United Press International reported.

title: Bartender Pleads Not Guilty In Failure to Report Body
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 9A 22yearold parttime bartender, Robert Sassone of Westbury, pleaded not guilty today to misdemeanor charge of failure to report a dead body under suspicious circumstances in connection with the death of Deborah Bock Streitfeld of Great Neck.

title: Martha Graham Recalls Years With Former Pupil, Betty Ford
description: A very great gift to us in America is the way Martha Graham describes her former dance student Elizabeth Ford, the new First Lady. To prominent members of the dance world, the fact that the White House is now occupied by someone who went through the discipline of their own training, has been met with great interest.

title: Kidnap Suspect Recaptured
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 9 (AP) A 33yearold kidnap suspect who escaped from the psyciatric ward at the Westchester County Penitentiary early today was captured about eight hours later, the police reported. The suspect, James W. Brown, who was charged with kidnapping a bookmaker in Mount Vernon earlier this year, escaped from the psychiatric unit of the penitentiary, where he had beeen placd after attempting suicide, about 3 A.M.

title: Bank Opens Iran Office
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9 (UPI)The First National Bank of Chicago announced today that it had opened a representative office in Tehran, Iran. It would serve customers in Iran and Afghanistan. Since 1970, the bank has participated in international bank syndicates which have provided some $1billion in medium and longterm credit to the Iranian Government for projects such as the AhwazRey pipeline in westcentral Iran and the Iranian Aluminum Company in Arak.

title: Contract Awards
description: The M. W. Kellogg Company, a unit of Pullman, Inc., announced yesterday it had been awarded contracts for more than $150million to design, engineer and construct an ammonia and urea plant and necessary support facilities to be built on the Musi River near Palembank, Indonesia. The contracts were awarded by P. T. Pupuk Sriwidjaja, Indonesia's Governmentowned petrochemical company.

title: Dean Refuses to Comment On the Nixon Resignation
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9 (UPI) John W. Dean 3d, who played a major role in the downfall of former President Richard M. Nixon, would not comment on Mr. Nixon's resignation.

title: U. S. Judge Orders Trouble Light Ban, Citing Deadly Peril
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) A Federal judge issued ?? temporary order today barring the manufacture, distribution and sale of a trouble light device that the Government says poses a deadly hazard to users.

title: China Sends Tree Seeds to Arboretum
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y.The newest imports from China are not faddish consumer products but nine packets of seeds that horticulturists here are hoping will give new life to some American trees.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Supreme Court announced yesterday that, effective Sept. 1, all proceedings in municipal courts in communities of less than 5,000 population will be preserved by sound recording, The order extends a twoyearold directive to all municipalities of more than 5,000 population and now includes all 567 communities in the state. The order also provides that all municipal court appeals will be kept on transcripts from the recorded proceedings. The cost of supplying and operating the sound equipment is to be borne by the municipalities.

title: The Opera: Composer's First Effort
description: ALBANY, Aug. 9One of the reasons that opera in America finds itself in a, depressed state today is that few opportunities exist for composers to learn this peculiar, hybrid art form. There are, that is, few equivalents to Off Off Broadway in the theater, where minor mistakes and even major miscalculations may be tolerated in the interest of the artists' growth.

title: Scholars Assay Meaning Of the Educated Person
description: ASPEN, Colo., Aug. 7 What does it mean to be an educated person today? The massive proliferation of knowledge and the doubt cast on established authority have made this difficult to answer. Traditional notions about classical and liberal education have become inadequate if not obsolete.

title: U.S. Changes Relieve Business Abroad
description: LONDON, Aug. 9  Relief spread through the European business and financial communities today in response to the resignation of President Nixon and the installation of Gerald R. Ford in the Presidency.

title: HENRY BJORKMAN, STOCKBROKER, DIES
description: Henry B. Bjorkman, a stockbroker whose avocation was making baseball bats and giving them to poor boys, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 141 East 88th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: Excerpts From Editorials on Nixon
description: Following are excerpts from, newspaper editorials in the United States on Richard M. Nixon's decision to resign the Presidency:

title: Mozambique Peace Talks Said to Have Broken Down
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Aug. 9Secret peace talks between the Mozambique Liberation Front and the Portuguese Government have broken down, military sources said here today.

title: 3d Accused Slayer Prof. Friedmann Pleads Guilty to Robbery in PleaBargain
description: Shortly after a State Supreme Court jury declared itself deadlocked last night on the fate of Steve Robinson, who was charged with the robbery and murder of Prof. Wolfgang Friedmann, Mr. Robinson pleaded guilty to robbing the professor.

title: Art: Seeking the Look of the City
description: The movies never miss with New York City. A novel like Butterfield 8, or like Breakfast at Tiffany's, gets the look of the city so exactly right that readers all over the world feel as if they had lived here all their lives. Memoirs can do the trick, too as in a certain small classic by Hamilton Fish Armstrong. It's art that gets lost, somehow. I doubt if there is a picture painted in this century of which we can say, The whole city's there. Mark Tobey's Broadway, perhaps. One or two paintings by Georgia O'Keefe, almost. But the whole city? The city as we get it time and again in the movies? No, never. We get it, if at all, at a tangent: in the combine paintings of Robert Rauschenberg, especially.

title: A Judge in Calcutta Bars U.S. Consuls From Spy Trial of 2
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 9  A Calcutta judge has barred United States consulate officials from attending the forthcoming trial of two Americans who have been held for 16 months on charges of espionage activities.

title: Surgery for Justice Powell
description: ROCHESTER, Minn., Aug. 9 (UPI)Associate Justice Lewis Powell Jr. of the Supreme Court underwent surgery Wednesday for a nonmalignant enlargement of the prostate, a spokesman for the Mayo Clinic said today. Justice Powell, who is 66 years old is expected to return to his home in Richmond about two weeks, the Spokesman said.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: State Is Asked to Freeze Rates On Phone Bills for the Elderly
description: NEWARK, Aug. 9An organization that says it has 250,000 members in New Jersey petitioned the state's Public Utilities Commission today to freeze rate increases on telephone bills for elderly persons and called for reductions of onehalf of any and all billings for residential telephone service for the elderly.

title: Connally Pleads Not Guilty to Bribery, Perjury and Conspiracy in the Milk Case
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9John B. Connally, Secretary of the Treasury for 16 months in the Nixon Administration, pleaded not guilty today to charges of accepting a bribe, committing perjury and conspiring to obstruct justice.

title: $2,203.60 Exacta At Spa
15% Cut in Demand For. Shipping Seen In Suez Reopening
description: PARIS, Aug. 9 (AP)A reopening of the Suez Canal, closed since the 1967 ArabIsraeli War, could lead to a reduction of 10 per cent in oil shipping and 5 per cent in drycargo shipping demand, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Pro Transactions
description: Pro Transactions

title: London Wax Museum Removes Nixon Figure
description: LONDON, Aug. 9 (UPI)Richard M, Nixon's figure was removed from the hall of world statesmen at Madame Tussaud's wax, museum today and was placed in storage.

title: Enjoins Continental
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The Continental Grain Company, the largest supplier of wheat to the Soviet Union in massive transactions two years ago, has been put under ceaseanddesist order for allegedly submitting incomplete and inaccurate information to the Government at that time, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: World Football League
Wheat and Corn Off
description: Wheat, corn and soybean futures prices declined sharply yesterday in trading on the chicago, Board of Trade.

title: Nixon Does Not Listen To Address by Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) The Presidential aircraft, Spirit of '76, was 13 miles southwest of Jefferson City, Mo., flying at 39,000 feet at three minutes past noon today when Gerald R. Ford was sworn in as the 38th President of the United States.

title: Buick Recalls Cars
description: FLINT, Mich., Aug. 9 (UPI)  The Buick division of the General Motors Corporation announced today a recall of more than 7,000 1974model station wagons because a rear brake pipe may be defective.

title: Market Place: Analyst Retains Bullish Outlook
description: All this week, the market surged and sagged as Richard M. Nixon weighed his decision to resign. With each hint that Mr. Nixon was about to leave the Presidency, stocks soared, only to fall back again.

title: Scientist Urges Congress to Bar Any Use of Pesticide 2,4,5T
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The scientist in charge of measuring the toxic effects of herbicides and insecticides for the Environmental Protection Agency testified today that 2,4,5T, an extensively used herbicide, was so poisonous to animal life that it snould be banned from all use.

title: Friedmann Case Ends
description: The third and last person charged with the 1972 murder of Wolfgang Friedmann, Columbia University law professor, pleaded guilty to robbery last night. The others had earlier pleaded guilty to robbery. As a result, none of those who have admitted robbing the professor will be convicted of [murdering him. Page 33.

title: Arabs Pledge Aid
description: Arab oilproducing countries, operating mostly through international agencies, have pledged $5billion in assistance to countries that need help in paying for petroleum imports as a result of escalating oil prices. Details on Page 44.

title: Judy Rankin Leads Golf By 2 Shots
description: SUNNINGDALE, England, Aug. 9 (UPI)Judy Rankin, a slim blonde from Midland, Texas, shot a 73 today for a oneoverpar 145 and a twostroke lead in the $54,480 Colgate European women's open golf tournament.

title: President and Kissinger Confer With the Envoys of 60 Nations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 President Ford undertook to convince foreign governments today that he would pursue the same foreign policy objectives that brought wide respect to Richard M. Nixon.

title: Nixon to Get $60,000 Annual Pension And Up to $96,000 for Office Expenses
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9President Nixon acquired considerable wealth while in the White House, but he left Washington with his fortune greatly diminished and his economic future in some doubt.

title: Sidney Sugarman, 69, Dead; Was Chief Judge of Court Here
description: Sidney Sugarman who retirer as Chief F?? leral Jr ??ge for the Southern District of New York in 1971 died yesterday in Golden Isles Hospital, Hallandale, Fla. He was 69 years old and lived in Hollywood, Fla.

title: CBS News Tells of Payola on Records
description: An hourlong CBS News documentary to be shown nationally tomorrow night confirms that officials and employes of a sister company, CBS Records, bought protection and drugs from organized crime figures.

title: ARSON AND VIOLENCE SPREAD OVER ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 9 (AP)A wave of arson and riot spread over Northern Ireland today, a violent observance of the third anniversary of jail without trial of guerrilla suspects.

title: Transcript of Nixon's Farewell Speech to Cabinet and Staff Members in the Capital
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's farewell speech to members of his Cabinet and White House staff in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: There's Far More to Abortion Than Finding the Best Price
description: Once a perilous, illegal and demeaning procedure, an abortion, while still having a deep psychological effect on many women, has become an operation where safety, legality and respectability have made immeasurable gains.

title: City to Appeal Invalidation Of MinorityHiring Rules
description: The city will appeal a State Supreme Court ruling that declared invalid the city's plan to get contractors to hire more minoritygroup members in the construction trades, according to Deputy Mayor Paul Gibson Jr.

title: Pop Music: Crosby, Stills
description: The first New York area concert in four years by Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young on Thursday at Roosevelt Stadium in Jersey City was upstaged by the larger political events of the night.

title: HAVANA BROADCAST CALLS NIXON ENEMY
description: MIAMI, Aug. 9 (AP)A Havana radio broadcast today reported the departure from office of President Nixon by saying: Now the turn has come for the Yankee President to quit, drowned in the dirty waters of Watergate.

title: U.S. Five Wins in Russia
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9 (UPI)A New York City all star high school basketball team defeated a Moscow team, 8078, tonight for its third victory in four games of a Soviet tour. The American coach, Howie Evans, complained that the Russians had used men up to 25 years of age, including three members of the national team that won the world basketball championship at Puerto Rico July 16.

title: Angels Beat Medich and Yankees, 71
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 9With a chance to gain on most of their Eastern Division rivals, who were losing to other Western Division teams, the New York Yankees lost to the California Angels tonight, 71, in the opener of a sixgame California trip.

title: The Fords' First Day as First Family
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9For the new First Family, today was a flood of mundane chores and extraordinary events.

title: Virginia Tech Head to Retire
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Aug. 9 (AP)Dr. T. Marshall Hahn Jr. announced today that he would retire as president of Virginia Tech as soon as a succesor could be chosen. Dr. Hahn has been prsident of the school, which has 17,000 students, since July 1, 1962.

title: Hawaii No Paradise for W. F. L. Strangers
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 9It's not the easiest thing for a team to call a city home when it hasn't been here long enough to be called a tourist.

title: Disaster and a Gloomy Gospel for a New President
description: For President Ford, the first 100 days will be no picnic. Economic miracles that the public seems to expect from the new chief executive on the problems of inflation, recession and unemployment will be difficult, if not impossible, to achieve.

title: LOEB, RHOADES SETS RISE ON SOME FEES
description: Public customers of Loeb, Rhoades & Co. will pay 5 per cent higher commissions on transactions valued between $2,000 and $300,000, effective Aug. 26, the brokerage firm reported yesterday. Commissions will not be raised on institutional transactions.

title: Saigon Reaction to U.S. Change Mixed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 9The South Vietnamese press greeted President Nixon's resignation today with a mixture of moods: relief, worry, introspection, sarcasm and a wistful admiration for the American system of democracy.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on amendment reducing appropriations for Department of Housing and Urban Development by $300million, which was rejected, 49 to 27, Aug. 5.

title: TEARS AT PARTING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Richard M. Nixon, his face wet with tears, bade an emotional farewell to the remnants of his broken Administration today, urging its members to be proud of their record in government and warning them against bitterness, selfpity and revenge.

title: Telephone Union Wins In Votes Here and Upstate
description: The Telephone Traffic Union, both upstate and downstate, has lefeated the Communications Workers of America in a repreentation election among traffic employes of the New York Telephone Company, officials of the National Labor Relations Board eported yesterday.

title: Sports Complex Site Suicide Left an Estate of $500,000
description: CLIFTON, Aug. 9  Marion Greenberg Parker, who committed suicide rather than leave her East Rutherford home of 30 years to make way for a sports complex, was buried today in Menorah Cemetery here.

title: U.A.W.G.M. Pact Agreed to
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 9 (UPI)The United Auto Workers and General Motors agreed last night on a new local contract covering about 3,800 striking workers at G.M.'s Doraville plant here, which was shut down by a strike last Monday. The workers are expected to return next Monday if the new agreement is approved by members of U.A.W. Local 10 at a meeting tomorrow.

title: Theater: Royal Shakespearean Twists
description: STRATFORD  ON  AVON, England, Aug. 8It would be simple to imagine Britain's Royal Shakespeare Company the pure custodian of the Shakespearean writ and canonsimple, but simplistic. The company is indeed the greatest interpreter of Shakespeare in and to the worldas it should beand in this it takes a quite different function from Britain's National Theater. (in a rather too neat nutshell, both British establishment companies concern themselves vitally, and possibly primarily, with the modern British playwright, but whereas the Royal Shakespeare Company still finds its prime, although far from exclusive, classic background in Shakespeare, Britain's National Theater takes the whole of classic theater as its oyster.) But more and more, it is offering us Shakespeare with a difference.

title: PAPERS AND TAPES ISSUES IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 9On the heels of Richard M. Nixon's resignation, some members of congress were urging impoundment of Presidential documents still in the White House. A few even demanded that the Watergate investigations be continued.

title: Meskill Hopes to Finish Term Before Judgeship
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 9  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill said today that he hoped to finish his fouryear term before becoming a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, in New York, but that he could not predict whether he would be able to do so.

title: Nixon's Picture Reappears In Republican Caucus Room
description: MADISON, Wis., Aug. 9 (AP) The picture of former President Richard M. Nixon was back on the wall of the Republican caucus room of the Wisconsin Senate today.

title: PARTIES SETTLE WATERGATE SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The Democratic National Committee and the Committee for the Reelection of the President agreed today in United States District Court here to settle their lawsuits that arose from the Watergate burglary.

title: FUENTES EXPECTS TO RETAIN HIS JOB
description: Luis Fuentes, superintendent of School District 1 on the Lower East Side, reported for work at his office yesterday, confident that he would keep his job despite a controversial resolution by the local board calling for his suspension.

title: News Summary and Index SATURDAY, AUGUST 10, 1974
description: The Presidency

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This is in reply to the Aug. 3 letter of George Dimitracopoulos, stating that the protection of the Turkish minority on Cyprus was an excuse to attack the Greek population of the island.

title: MRS. JOHN S. KNIGHT
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 9 (AP)Beryl Zoller Knight, wife of John S. Knight, editorial chairman of the Knight Newspapers, died yesterday at her home here. She was 81 years old.

title: INDIA SAID TO SEEK MORE SOVIET GRAIN
description: NEW DELHI, Aug, 9 (UPI)India is negotiating to buy an additional two million tons of wheat from the Soviet Union to help meet an expected sixmillionton grain shortage this year, a food ministry source said today.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: FREEHOLD, Aug. 9Seven years ago Ed Sabatini was selling heating oil in Clifton and never got nearer the harness racing sport than a seat in the grandstand.

title: Gains of Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Watergate has now joined Teapot Dome, Credit Mobilier and the Whisky Rill in the lexicon of political infamy. Yet, in millions of minds it also symbolizes the finest hour of American democracy. A President has been deposed, but the Republic endures. Its institutions have survived, and some are saying they have been strengthened as well. Even the Presidency, which Richard M. Nixon professed to be so anxious to protect, shows no signs of debility. The man in the White House is as powerful today as he was yesterday, although his name has changed from Nixon to Ford.

title: Radium Found on Turnpike
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J., Aug. 9 (AP)The state police are trying to trace the owner of a cylinder of radium that was found in a locked safe at a New Jersey Turnpike rest stop here. Authorities said the safe might have fallen from a vehicle or been abandoned by thieves sometime Wednesday morning. Two investigating officers were found to have been slightly contaminated by their exposure to the radium, but not in need of medical attention, the police said.

title: 4 Greeks Reported Killed Planting Mines Near Turkey
description: EDIRNE, Turkey, Aug. 9 (UPI)Four Greek soldiers died in an explosion during a mineplanting operation along the border between Greece and Turkey, witnesses said today.

title: Gains of Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Watergate has now joined Teapot Dome, Credit Mobilier and the Whisky Rill in the lexicon of political infamy. Yet, in millions of minds it also symbolizes the finest hour of American democracy. A President has been deposed, but the Republic endures. Its institutions have survived, and some are saying they have been strengthened as well. Even the Presidency, which Richard M. Nixon professed to be so anxious to protect, shows no signs of debility. The man in the White House is as powerful today as he was yesterday, although his name has changed.

title: People and Business
description: Bernard Klebanow, president of HCAMartin, Inc., has entered into an agreement in principle to sell his interest in the company, amounting to 900,000 shares of common stock for $15million in cash and notes. Julius Hermes, executive vice president of the company, a processor of nylon yarn for the carpet industry, will succeed Mr. Klebanow as president.

title: Computer Model of World Sought to Cope With Food Shortage
description: Few, if any, problems confronting modern man are more complex than that of assuring an adequate food supply to the peoples of the world in the decades to come.

title: St. Clair Out as Chief Counsel; Doubts Congress Immunity Step
description: WELLESELEY, Mass., Aug. (AP)James D. St. Clair said today that he was no longer Richard M. Nixon's chief Watergate attorney, and added that he did not believe Congress had the power to grant the former President immunity from prosecution.

title: Crowd of 6,792 Watches Lions Defeat Colts, 63
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 9 (AP) The Detroit Lions, threatening throughout the second half, scored on a 4yard run by Dave Wooley with six minutes remaining and beat the Baltimore Colts, 63, in National Football League preseason game tonight.

title: Mr. Nixon's American Language
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Bring us together and lawandorder were the first catch phrases of the Nixon men, and in the end they did bring us together in the cause of law and order, but not in the way the phrasemakers of 1968 had in mind.

title: Aide to Selassie Arrested By Ethiopian Armed Forces
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  Lieut. Gen. Assefa Demissie, a personal aide of Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia, is under arrest, the armed forces announced over the country's radio today.

title: Aide Doubtful That Ford Would Give Nixon Pardon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The new White House press secretary, J. F. terHorst, suggested today that President Ford was not likely to grant a pardon to farmer President Nixon. The press secretary was asked at a briefing this afternoon about the prospects of a pardon.

title: MiniDrydock Developed To Expedite Ship Repairs
description: In accordance with the old steamshipindustry axiom that ships make money only when they are running, the Maritime Administration is developing a new minidrydock to make hull repairs while a ship is unloading. The floating drydock is designed to seal off only a part  from 15 to 20 per centof the hull at a time. It can be used, the Federal ship agency said, while a vessel is docked at a pier for transfer.

title: COLLEGIANS AIDED BY HASIDIC RABBIS
description: LOS ANGELES  A fourstory stucco brick building, once a fraternity house, sits across the street from the sprawling U.C.L.A. campus, sheltered by a graceful rubber tree and rose bushes and manned by a corps of young Hasidic rabbis.

title: Schlesinger Notifies Forces of New Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger officially notified the armed forces today that they have a new Commander in Chief.

title: Ford Means Fregh Air to L.I. Town
description: BLUE POINT, L.I., Aug. 9Colt Gibner stood on the deck of his boat late this afternoon and took a deep breath.

title: Business Briefs
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 9 (AP)The National Energy Board recommended today that the $4abarrel charge on shipments of refinedoil products to the United States be lowered for September to make the products more marketable. A decision on the recommendation is expected next week.

title: Military Problems and a Frigid Atmosphere Snag the Cyprus Talks
description: GENEVA, Aug. 9With the Greeks wanting to draw a firm ceasefire line on Cyprus, the Turks demanding that the island be made a confederation of Greek and Turkish Cypriote states, and the British trying to keep the two sides speaking to each other, the threepower Cyprus peace talks here seem unlikely to reach fundamental agreement soon.

title: I'll Just Be Jerry
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 9 (UPI)Even though his World War II bunkmate is now President, William O. Timberlake, an insurance man, says he expects to remain on a firstname basis with Gerald R. Ford. Mr. Timberlake said today that he had once kidded his old friend about moving up on the political ladder. I'll just be Jerry and don't forget it, Mr. Timberlake quoted Mr. Ford as saying. They bunked together at the Glenview, Ill., Naval Air Base for several months in 1945.

title: In La Crosse, Wis., Mime's the Word
description: LA CROSSE, Wis., Aug. 7For the last three weeks, the motto of this tranquil, treelined city on the Mississippi River that boldly declares itself to be situated in God's country has been: Mime's the word.

title: STATE POLICE ARREST MARIJUANA SMOKERS
description: POMONA, Aug. 9 (UPI)At least 40 young men and women attending a rock music concert tonight were arrested outside the gates on charges of possessing marijuana or cocaine, the state police said.

title: State Reports Rise In Unemployment; Housing Starts Fall
description: TRENTON, Aug. 9 (AP)The state's Department of Labor and Industry reported today that, despite a spurt in summerseason jobs, the New Jersey economy continued to be troubled by high unemployment.

title: Connors, Nastase Gait At Indy Net
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 9 (AP)Jimmy Connors and Ilie Nastase advanced easily today, but the secondand thirdseeded women players were eliminated in the $130,000 United States clay court tennis championships.

title: GOING OUT
description: BY GERSHWIN A little revue of George Gershwin songs presented by a group called the Intense Family has been such a smashing success at the Universalist Church, 4 West 76th Street, that it has been extended indefinitely. The church itself is a popular West Side location for music and theater, community activities and rap sessions.

title: Ford Asserts He Will Name A Vice President in 10 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 President Ford told Congressional leaders today that he would nominate his successor in the VicePresidency within 10 days.

title: Harlem Man Stabbed
description: A 27yearold man was found stabbed to death yesterday in, his oneroom Harlem apartment, the police reported. They identified the victim as James Gadson of 16 Morningside Avenue and said he had been stabbed in the chest. The body was found at 5 F.M.

title: Connors, Nastase Gain At Indy Net
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 9 (AP)Jimmy Connors AND Ilie Nastase advanced easily today, but the second and thirdseeded women player were eliminated in the $130,000 United States clay cour tennis championships.

title: China Sends Tree Seeds to Arboretum
description: MILLBROOK, N.Y.The newest imports from China are not faddish consumer products but nine packets of seeds that horticulturists here are hoping will give new life to some American trees.

title: Back to the Issues
description: While the shroud of Watergate hung over the 1974 political campaign, it so obscured every other issue that voters could not realistically be expected to assess candidates by the normal yardsticks of individual merit. The results of byelections and primaries in many areas in recent months indicated that the misdeeds of Richard Nixon and his lieutenants sat heavily on the shoulders of Republican nominees not only for Congress but for state and local office as well.

title: Vietcong Shell Air Base; Hits on Villages Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Aug. 10 (AP)The Vietcong shelled the big Bien Hoa air base 15 miles northeast of Saigon before dawn today, according to the South Vietnamese military command.

title: Rusk Sees Great Tragedy
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 9 (UPI)Former Secretary of State Dean Rusk said today that the resignation of President Nixon was a great tragedy and a human tragedy for Mr. Nixon and his family. Reached by telephone in Caracas, Venezuela, where he is attending an international conference on sea law, Mr. Rusk urged Americans to get Watergate behind us quickly and promised support and understanding to Gerald Ford.

title: Taboo on Smoking In Elevators Here Is Signed Into Law
description: Mayor Beame signed into law yesterday legislation that bans smoking in passenger elevators and authorizes raising the noise level of automobile horns by 16 decibels.

title: Rockefeller Is Silent on Rumors He's in Line for VicePresidency
description: BANGOR, Me., Aug. 9Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York departed from prepared remarks at a Republican fund raising dinner tonight to praise President Ford as a man of integrity, dedication and abiding faith in America.

title: KerrMcGee Lifts Payout
description: The directors of the KerrMcGee Corporation announced yesterday an increase in the annual dividend rate to $1 share from 70 cents. A payout of 25 cents for the quarter endof 25 cents for the quarter endto stockholders of record Sept. 6.

title: Harlem Man Stabbed
description: A 27yearold man was found stabbed to death yesterday in his oneroom Harlem apartment, the police reported. They identified the victim as James Gadson of 16 Morningside Avenue and said he had been stabbed in the chest. The body was found at 5 P.M.

title: Ford Tells Athens Cyprus Needs Cool Heads
description: ATHENS, Saturday, Aug. 10 (Reuters)  President Ford, in one of his first acts, has urged cool heads and moderate behavior concerning Cyprus.

title: Ford, in Note To Waldheim, Said To Affirm U.N. Support
description: UNITED NATIONS, Aug. 9 (Reuters)President Ford, in one of his first acts after being sworn into office today, sent message to Secretary General Waldheim pledging his Administration's firm support of the United Nations, officials said.

title: The Former President
description: As he reenters private life, former President Nixon is fortunate to have the sustaining loyalty of a devoted family, and of those Americans who refuse to let the misdeeds which forced him out of office overshadow his positive accomplishments, particularly in the field of foreign policy.

title: PAPERS AND TAPES ISSUES IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9On the heels of Richard M. Nixon's resignation, some members of Congress were urging impoundment of Presidential documents still in the White House. A few even demanded that the Watergate investigations be continued.

title: Taxi Union Here Rejects Owners' PayRise Offer
description: The Taxi Drivers Union yesterday rejected a new contract offer of the city's fleet owners, which had projected increases of $3.75 to $4.60 a day for Divers and $10aweek pay Increases in each year of a breeyear pact for inside employes.

title: 9 Killed in U.N. Plane Downed in Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS, Aug. (Reuters)  A Canadian port plane on loan to the United Nations peacekeeping force was shot down by a missile over Syria today, according to reports reaching here.

title: Financial Measures Approved By Spanish to Stem Inflation
description: MADRID, Aug. 9 (Reuters) The Spanish Government approved tonight a package of financial measures designed to relieve inflationary pressure at home, according to a communique issued after a cabinet meeting.

title: U. of Michigan Carillon Salutes Alumnus Ford
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 9 (AP)University of Michigan carilloneur R. Hudson Ladd rang out the old and rang in the new as Richard M. Nixon stepped down from office and an alumnus, Gerald R. Ford, became President.

title: Soviet Says Resignation Does Not End Detente
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9Assured by The Kremlin that dtente would not collapse just because one American personality was gone, the Soviet people learned today of President Nixon's resignation and seemed to react with equanimity.

title: Gerald Eskenazi
description: This is the age of the raspberry. We are giving our officials the collective Bronx cheer and the point of our toe. A nation of fans has grown up with tapes arid they have come back to haunt those we put in power.

title: Leadership Shift Greeted Abroad With Hope That U.S. Policies Will Not Change
description: The change in United States leadership yesterday was greeted around the world with pressions of hope that AmeriCan policies would continue unchanged, and support for this hope was seen in the retention by President Ford of Henry A. Kissinger as Secretary of State.

title: Soviet Poem Lauds America and Detente
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9  As President Nixon left office, the Soviet Union tossed up an artistic bouquet today in honor of continued SovietAmerican dtente.

title: Forgive Nixon, Stassen Says
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 9 (AP) Harold Stassen, who sought to have Richard M. Nixon dropped as President Eisenhower's running mate in 1956, said today forgiveness should be extended to Mr. Nixon.

title: Way Devised to Store Large Speech Vocabularies in Computers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Three Bell Laboratories scientists believe they have made practical the storage of very large vocabularies of speech in computers.

title: Floods in Bangladesh and India Are Said to Kill 900
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 9With two mighty Himalayan rivers at flood stage for several weeks, much of India and nearly all of Bangladesh have been hit by severe floods described as the worst in 20 years.

title: Rail Frieght Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 The Association of American Railroads reported yesterday that freight traffice on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.5 billion tonmiles, 0.8 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 525,568 cars, 2.7 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 1.7 per cent below last year.

title: Vice President Holds Military Reins Briefly
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  For nearly two hours this morning the black box that links the Commander in Chief of the United States with his forces was in the hands of the Vice President.

title: President and Kissinger Confer With the Envoys of 60 Nations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 President Ford undertook to convince foreign governments today that he would pursue the same foreign policy objectives that brought wide respect to Richard M. Nixon.

title: OTC INDEXES UP; AMEX GAUGES OFF
description: Prices on the overthecounter market as measured by the NASDAQ indexes rose slightly yesterday while those on the American Stock Exchange dropped somewhat.

title: 4 NAMED TO HELP FORD'S TRANSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Immediately after he was sworn in today as the nation's 38th President, Gerald R. Ford took control of the Presidency and moved to give it a character and shape different from that of his predecessor, Richard M. Nixon.

title: G.M. to Raise Prices 9.5% On 1975 Cars and Trucks
description: DETROIT, Aug. 9The General Motors Corporation announced today that it would raise prices of 1975 model cars and trucks by an average of $480 or 9.5 per cent.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: ??NEW YORK'S ONLYINDOOR JEWISH MAUSOLEUM  Advt.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time

title: NL Industries Expanding West German Pigment Unit
description: NL Industries, Inc., a producer of paints and pigments and nonferrous materials, has announced a 20,000metrictonayear expansion at its Nordenham titanium pigment plant in West Germany.

title: Howie Pollet, Star Pitcher, Dies; Helped Cardinals in '46 Series
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9 (AP)Howie Pollet, a standout pitcher with the St. Louis Cardinals of 1946, which won the World Series, died Thursday. He was 53 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Like Bill Bradley nine years ago, Tom McMillen of the University of Maryland has decided to postpone a try at American professional basketball for two years to become a Rhodes Scholar at Oxford. But, again like Bradley, the 6foot11inch forward will maintain his court skills by playing on Sundays in the Italian League.

title: DISPUTES HEARD ON ENERGY NEEDS
description: DENVER, Aug. 9Spokesmen for the energy industry called for more energy development, freer access to public lands and higher prices, as a series of hearings opened here on the Federal Government's Project Independence blueprint for energy selfsufficiency. Environmentalists called for greater energy conservation.

title: TEARS AT PARTING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Richard M. Nixon, his face wet with tears, bade an emotional farewell to the remnants of his broken Administration today, urging its members to be proud of their record in government and warning them against bitterness, selfpity and revenge.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Congress Unanimously Passes a Pledge of Cooperation With the New President
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Without a murmur of dissent, the Democraticcontrolled Congress today sent President Ford its sincere best wishes, its assurances of firm cooperation and its fervent hopes for success in office.

title: Strong Base Of Owners Is Eroding.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP)  Reports today indicated that some. National Football League clubowners were working at crosspurposes with each other in the deadlocked negotiations with striking players.

title: Rate Rivalry Wounds Savings Industry
description: High interest sates once again are making the savings industry writhe.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: WINE TALK
description: A few remarks that might have been interpreted as being critical of wine retailers were published in this space recently. They were prompted by a letter from a woman who seemed to have been treated rather cavalierly by her local man.

title: Hightstown Retains a Rural Air Despite Growth
description: HIGHTSTOWN  There used to be a time, not long ago, when 4,000 to 5,000 migrant workers would be coming in here this time of the year to help the farmers pick their tomatoes and other vegetables, the woman in the drugstore commented. This was a big farm areaeggs and vegetables. But that's all in the past because of the changes that have taken place. In fact, I get the feeling that we've gone from rural right through to urban; we're not even in the suburban class.

title: Kathryn Stebbins Is Bride in Jersey
description: Kathryn Bates Stebbins, daughter of Naomi B. Faison of Summit and Avalon, N.J., and Robert P. Stebbins of Medford, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon, to Vernon Clark Johnson, son of Mr. and Mrs. William V. Johnson of Mountainside, N.J. and Point O'Woods, Fire Island, N.Y.

title: BROOKLYN WOMAN SLASHED TO DEATH
description: A 29yearold computer operator for the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center was raped, savagely beaten and slashed to death before dawn yesterday in a dark alleyway a half block from her apartment in a quiet residential secdon of Sheepshead Bay in Brooklyn.

title: New War College Head
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 10 (UPI)Vice Adm. Julien J. LeBourgeois took command of the United States Naval War College yesterday. He succeeded Vice Adm. Stansfield Turner, who takes command of the United States Second Fleet and the North Atlantic Treaty. Organization Striking Fleet Atlantic.

title: Hoover's 100th Birthday Honored by Home Town
description: WEST BRANCH, Iowa, Aug. 10Nearly 7,000 people came to this rural Iowa town today to honor the 100th anniversary of the birth of Herbert Clark Hoover, the nation's 31st President, and to become part of a turnofthecentury tableau that conjured up a simpler, more isolated, less mobile America.

title: East Germany Jails Man For Aiding Escapes to West
description: BERLIN, Aug. 10, (Reuters) East Germany announced today that another West German had been jailed forhealping East Germans flee the country. Friedrich Weissbarth, was send tenced to four and a half years for antistate human trafficking. Mr. Weissbarth was the 46th person reported in the last month to have been sentenced. Many of the verdicts are believed to be months old.

title: Aunt Jin Length Victor Despite a Bumpy Finish
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 10 (AP)Paul Cresci's Aunt Jin suivived a foul claim filed by Hot N Nasty's jockey and won the $54,750 Signature Stakes at Liberty Bell today.

title: Mostly Mozart Concert Focuses On Charming Pair of Sopranos
description: In terms of performance, the chief interest at the Mostly Mozart concert Friday night at Avery. Fisher Hall was the relationship between two soorangs.

title: Superstars Are Lining Up For 2d Race of Champions
description: A field of superstars is being lined up for The second International Race of Chardpions series, which presumes to decide the best driger in the world but at least does so with tongue in cheek. The idea, fostered, by Les Richter of Riverside (Calif.) Raceway and Roger Penske, was to take drivers from all segments of the sport, put them in identical cars, and see who's really best.

title: A Festival Unlike Any in the World
description: IF you're In Ireland the end of this month, you can hear a music festival unlike any in the world. There'll be thousands of vocal and instrumental musicians gathered from all parts of the republic at the Fleadh Cheoil (Flah Keeole is fairly close to the way it's pronounced) at Listowel, in Kerry, starting Saturday, Aug. 24. For three days the summer air will be drenched with traditional music.

title: Downtown, It's a Tenants' Market
description: When a prominent real estate lawyer asserted recently that Wall Street is a disaster area, he wasn't refering to the securities markets.

title: LEVITT CRITICIZES MILK INSPECTION
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt's office has urged the Department of Agriculture and Markets to tighten its milkcontrol program to insure uniform inspection ratings al plants and prompt reinspection if deficiencies are found.

title: The Nation/Continued
description: WASHINGTONA President fell from office last week, and though it was a thunderous fall, Watergatethe cause of it allwas still with us. Little had apparently changed at 1425 K Street N.W. where Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, and his staff were at work behind guarded doors on the ninth floor. They went to court and went on digging Into the scandal at the same time. And they have restored an old item of business to their list projects. The possible indictment of Richard M. Nixon, private citizen.

title: White Sox Top Indians As Wood Wins His 18th
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 10 (UPI)Dick Allen drove in four runs with a single and his 31st homer today and Wilbur Wood scattered seven hits for his 18th victory in leading the Chicago White Sox to a 51 victory over the Cleveland Indians.

title: A Missionary in Dallas Whose Time Has Come
description: It was on May 22, a Wednesday night, in Philadelphia, that Ron Newman, coach of the Dallas Tornado, asked to be given a little time when he was reminded that his Tornado had lost four News of their first five games.

title: Carpenters End Strike
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 (UPI)Some 40,000 carpenters in 11 southern. California counties will go back to work Monday after winning a contract that will raise their pay and fringe benefits to $108 a day by 1976. The settlement between the carpenters and members of the Associated General Contractors ended a sixweek strike.

title: Caballeros Seek 12th Title
description: HAWTHORNE  The 130member Hawthorne Caballeros, the worldchampion drum and bugle corps, are getting ready to fly to Miami next weekend, when they will be seeking their 12th United States title.

title: Raiders Top Falcons as 34,319 Watch
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 10 (AP)A pair of touchdowns by a rookie running back, Harold Hart, and the pinpoint passing of Ken Stabler led the Oakland Raiders to a 2816 National Football League preseason victory over the Atlanta Falcons at the University of California today.

title: BRAZIL LAWYERS FIGHT REPRESSION
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 10The Brazilian Bar Association, which will open a weeklong meeting here tomorrow on the theme of the lawyer and the rights of man, is expected to press the military Government to curb abuses of human rights.

title: Mozambique Rebel Chief Says Fight Is Not Racial
description: TETE, MozambiqueAt age 27 Raimundo Dalepa has almost 10 years of experience as an antiPortuguese guerrilla, the respect of the men he leads and of his enemies, and an uncertain future.

title: Mary Howard Wed To W.M. Carpenter
description: Mary Christine Howard, who graduated cum laude in June from Mount Holyoke College, was married yesterday afternoon to William Morse Carpenter, a magna cum laude graduate of Dartmouth College.
