description: PARTICIPANTS: Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, representing 60 fleets with 6,000 cabs; Local 3036, Taxi Drivers Union, representing 30,000 drivers. And, by reason of its control over taxi industry revenues, the City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

title: PAUL CHERINGTON, READ OF B.&M. R.R.
description: Paul W. Cherington, a popular professor at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration who took leave of absence in January, 1973, to assume the presidency of the bankrupt Boston & Maine Railroad, died Sunday at his home in Boston after long illness. He was. 56 years old.

title: Rights Unit Says U.S. Fails To Enforce Fair Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The United States Commission on Civil Rights today criticized the Federal Government's enforcement of fairhousing standards and made recommendations that it said would insure more vigorous enforcement.

title: Ford Says He's a Man of the People, Making Sure He Leaves Out No One
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12said he was the people's man, and he defined the people very broadly.

title: Bus Strike Snarls Los Angeles; Freeways Jammed With Cars
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 12Bus drivers and, mechanics in a fourcounty area here walked off their jobs this morning in a move that created heavy traffic congestion on the freeways and affected some 650,000 commuters.

title: Stocks Plunge in Britain; Trade Data. Due Today
description: LONDON, Aug. 12 (AP)The London stock market plunged to a 15year low today amid widening uncertainty about Britain's economy. Dealers reported a wave of selling by investors as the market continued an acrosstheboard slide. It has been dropping for weeks from one low to another.

title: The Proceeding's In the U.N. Today
Cosmos 672 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 12 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today the 672d in its series of Cosmos artificial earth satellites, the Tass press agency reported. Scientific equipment aboard the satellite for continuing space ex oration was said to be working normally.

title: 2d Bank Bankrupt In West Germany
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Aug. 12 (Reuters)The Federal banking authority of West Germany said today that a liquidator has been appointed for Bass & Herz Bankhaus, the second of this nation's private banks to go into bankruptcy proceedings in less than two months.

title: FORD IN WARNING ON U.S. DEFENSES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 President Ford warned other countries against trying to exploit the change in administration, asserting that the United States would stand by its commitments nnd would not weaken its defenses.

title: Connors Conquers Borg in Net Final
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 12 (AP)  Topseeded Jimmy Connors fought off a strong challenge by Bjorn Bprg of Sweden tonight to win the 1974 United States clay court tennis title, 5.7, 63, 64, and gain the $16,000 first prize.

title: How They Stand Today
description: Tuesday, August 13, 1974.

title: Turnpike Antinoise Plan Gets a Test
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, Aug. 12  The New Jersey Turnpike Authority demonstrated today how it intended to enforce recently enacted noiseabatement regulations along the 142mile tollroad system, particularly with regard to trucks.

title: Folks Make All the Music at Fox Hollow Festival
description: PETERSBURG, N. Y., Aug. 12 The ninth annual Fox Hollow Festival, which ended its fourday run yesterday, impiemented this event's reputation as the folk musicians' folk festival.

title: Texas End Is Killed
description: HOUSTON, Aug 12 (UPI) Parker Alford, a 22yearold tight end for the University of Texas, died in a twocar crash on a southwest Houston freeway today. Alford was the driver of one of the cars. The other driver was uninjured.

title: Harsh Questions
description: Consider two prospects: No. 1. The former President of the United States retires, into a status of revered obscurity, absorbed in memories inevitably more comfortable than was the reality; he emerges occasionally to do, some dignified public service, he writes his memoirs. The bitter enemies he made in public life keep the specter of him alive for their own partisan purposes, but personally they leave him alone. This would roughly correspond to the experience of the late Herbert Hoover, born 100 years ago last Saturday, the day that his latest successor to the oxPresidency first woke up a private citizen.

title: REFUNDING ISSUES TOTAL $1,2BILLION
description: The Government announced yesterday that two Federal agencies would offer more than $1.2billion in refunding issues this Thursday. One agency, the Banks for Cooperatives, will offer $514.6million of sixmonth bonds due next March 3. Part of the proceeds will be used to retire $367million of 7.15 per cent bonds Sept. 3 and the rest for lending operations.

title: A.B.A. Unit Backs Impartial Application Of Laws but Without Mentioning Nixon
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 12A committee of the American Bar Association approved unanimously tonight a resolution Palling for impartial application of the criminal laws to all potential defendants without fear or favor arising from the position of status of the accused.

title: Brooke Supported for Vice President
description: The appointment of Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts as Vice President was urged here yesterday by the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson, civilrights leader.

title: General Gets Medal
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Aug 12 (AP)Brig. Gen. Roscoe C. Cartwright, who will be the second black United States Army officer to retire with the rank of general, received the Distinguished Service Medal today after nearly 32 years of active duty.

title: Nixon Sends Telegram to Ford Congratulating Him for Speech
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 12 (AP)  Former President Richard M. Nixon watched President Ford's speech to Congress tonight and wired him congratulations on a splendid speech.

title: Senate Votes to Continue Oil Allocation Act 4 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI)The Senate voted itself today an extra, four months next year to devise fair fuel allocations and agreed to authorize a study on whether solar heating and cooling could be commercially feasible.

title: Mrs. Meir Says Sadat Ignored Bid to Meet
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 12, (Reuters)  Former Premier Golda Meir said today that a foreign head of state had tried to arrange, a meeting between her and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, but President Sadat did not reply to the invitation.

title: Notes on People
description: For months their friends and supporters In the West picketed Soviet embassies in behalf of the efforts of Valery Panov and Galina Ragozina to be allowed to leave Leningrad and settle in Israel. The Panovs finally won the exile they cherished, and yesterday they were doing some picketing of their own in front of the Soviet Embassy in London. They joined demonstrators protesting what they called the forthcoming farcical trumpedup trial of the dissident physicist, Victor Polsky, on a dangerousdriving charge in the Soviet Union.

title: Gwilym S. Brown, 46, Dies; A Sports Illustrated Editor
description: Gwilym S. Brown, an associate editor of Sports Illustrated magazine, died yesterday of a brain tumor at his home, 29 Prospect Place, CrotononHudson, N.Y. He was 46 years old.

title: 8 ARRESTED IN NASSAU ON GAMBLING CHARGE
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 12William Cahn, the Nassau County District Attorney, announced today the arrest of eight persons allegedly connected with what he described as a $12millionayear gamextending from Long Island to the Bronx.

title: Zaire: The Toughest Fight Is Just Getting There
description: The overseas operator wasn't happy about being disturbed. Where are you calling, sir? Zairethat's in Africa. Did you say Utica? No. Zaire. Africa. Oh, Zaire, replied the operator. You know, they don't pick up the phone in that country.

title: Threatener of Nixon Hangs Himself in Jail
description: MORRISTOWN, Aug. 12 (AP)  A 24yearold Hanover man who once threatened to kill the President has hanged himself in his Morris County Jail cell, authorities said.

title: Delay in CoverUp Trial Held Likely, Nixon's Legal Status Is Still in Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12A delay in the trial of the Watergate coverup case appeared increasingly likely today, in large part because of President Nixon's resignation last week.

title: Where City Hall Crowd Eats Lunch
description: The other day, Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh emerged from City Hall, looked about guardedly and, spotting no one who appeared ready to advance with pleas for jobs or contracts or whatever walked swiftly across Broadway to the Woolworth Building.

title: Christian Fouchet Dies at 63; Gaullist Served in the Cabinet
description: GENEVA, Aug. 12Christian Fouchet, former Cabinet member and ambassador, died last night in a hospital here of a heart attack. He was 63 years.

title: President Urges Others Not to Follow G.M. Lead
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12President Ford castigated the General Motors Corporation today, for its decision to raise the prices of its 1975 cars by an average of nearly 10 per cent.

title: Economic Priorities Shift to Independence in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 12 Brazil has started work on a $3.3billion program for the construction of 765 ships by 1979 as part of a general shift in this country's priorities to achieve greater economic independence.

title: Dooley Says Duran Bout May Be Off
description: A scheduled 10round fight on Monday at Madison Square Garden between Roberto Duran, the world lightweight champion, and Miguel Barreto of Puerto Rico may not take place, according to Edwin B. Dooley, the chairman of the New York State Athletic Commission.

title: Arson Is Blamed for Fire In Mrs. Nixon's Early Home
description: CERRITOS, Calif., Aug. 12 (UPI)A fire that broke out yesterday morning at the home Mrs. Richard M. Nixon grew up in was caused by arson, the authorities said today.

title: COURT BARS SEIZURE FOR STORAGE COSTS
description: A New York State statute that gave warehousemen the right to seize or sell goods in storage to pay for the cost of the storage was declared unconstitutional yesterday by Justice Frank J. Pino in State Supreme Court.

title: Escapes at Berlin Wall Dwindle Over 13 Years
description: BERLIN, Aug. 12 (AP)The Berlin Wall will be 13 years old tomorrow and it is more difficult to cross illegally than ever. Escapes to the West across the wall have trickled in recent years to a mere handful. The West Berlin Police say the wall has become almost escapeproof in the last several years.

title: DECISION AWAITED ON NEW V.A. CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 One of the first policy decisions under consideration by President Ford is the appointment of a new Administrator of Veterans Affairs, who heads the second largest agency in the Government and has the third largest budget.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Stephen Porter, well known for his successful staging of many, play revivals for the, A.P.A.Phoenix Company and the New Phoenix Repertory Company, has turned to opera. Mr. Porter will completely revise the New York City Opera's production of Don Giovanni. The original and highly controversial staging of the Mozart work was done by Frank Corsaro. The new version will be seen first on Oct. 4.

title: Olivieri Scores Rivals on Fund Report
description: Assemblyman Antonio G. Olivieri charged yesterday that his two rivals for the Democratic nomination for Lieutenant Governor had failed to comply with the disclosure requirements of the state's new election law.

title: Turkish Plan for Cyprus Disrupts Talks in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Aug. 12A Turkish proposal for a division of Cyprus into a number of separate communities under Greek Cypriote or Turkish Cypriote administration brought the Geneva truce talks to a standstill tonight.

title: Gov. Wilson Hails Ford
description: Governor Wilson praised President Ford's first address to Congress yesterday as reassuring and an eloquent, traightforward rededication of of our Government to the ideals and objectives of the American people and the American union.

title: Rock Concert Damage Estimated at $30,000
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 12 (AP)Hundreds of young hitchhikers lined the highways near the Charlotte Motor Speedway yesterday on their way home from a rock concert that attracted an estimated 200,000 persons.

title: Weekend Fight
description: FAIRMONT, W. Va. Duane Bobick, Bowlus, Minn., stopped Harold Carter, Cleveland, in 2 rounds, heavyweights.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Rights Unit gays U.S. Fails To Enforce Fair Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 12 The United States Commission on Civil Rights today criticized the Federal Government's enforcement of fairhousing standards and made recommendations that it said would insure more vigorous enforcement.

title: Send for The Old Pro
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12If Pres. dent Ford is serious about choosing the bestqualified man to serve as standby Presidentfor that is what a Vice President isthen he can only choose former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: JAMES LUDLOW, 57, TAUGHT DIPLOMACY
description: James Minor Ludlow, a State Department officer. for 32 years, died Thursday of cancer in Arlington, Va., where he lived. His age was 57.

title: ORDER ENFORCES FUENTES OUSTER
description: The majority faction of the District 1 Community School Board has obtained an injunction barring Luis Fuentes, the district's embattled superintendent, from entering his office today.

title: Tension in Cyprus Eases As Greek Pullout Goes On
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 12Tension in this divided island eased further today with the continued withdrawal of Greek Cypriote forces from Turkish enclaves they had been occupying and with expectations of a reciprocal gesture of goodwill from the Turkish side.

title: Harry and Tonto, Film Of Independence at 72
description: At the Wedding of the Generations in 1972when Allen Ginsberg and others decided that it was time to end youth chauvinism and performed a symbolic marriage between all the young and all the old in Miami Beachit was pleasing to hear the poet chanting the generation war is at an end while people of all ages danced and sang around his stepladder by the sea. There were quite a few conversations that focused on what the old and the very young have in commonin a society that deeply distrusts both.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Humanitas Prize Is Added to Awards for TV Writers
description: There is the Gavel Award from the American Bar Association for programs on justice and the law, the Alfred P. Sloan Award from the Automotive Safety Foundation for program efforts on behalf of highway safety and the Freedoms. Foundation Award for programs contributing to patriotism and a better understanding of the American way of life.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, AUGUST 13, 1974

title: $1.7BILLION MEASURE FOR HEALTH PASSED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) The House passed a bill, 359 to 12, today authorizing $1.7billion for health programs extended through the next two years.

title: Defense Will Start Its Case in the Rothko Trial
description: Mark Rothko's two children and State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz rested their case yesterday against the Marlborough Gallery, its head, Frank Lloyd, and the executors of the Mark Rothko Foundation, to which he willed his paintings.

title: Ford Builds More Compacts
description: MAHWAH, N. J., Aug. 12 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company began production today of its new luxury compact Granada and Monarch models at the Mahwah assembly plant, which had been producing standardsize Fords until July 12.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: LYNDHURST, Aug. 12Both American Legion baseball and John Hartigan have benefitted from his 30 years in the program. It lias been good to him and he has been good to the program.

title: 47 Killed in Upper Volta Air Crash
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper Volta, Aug. 12 (Reuters) Fortyseven people were reported killed today when an Air Mali airliner crashed near here.

title: Compensation Bill Passes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today broadening and liberalizing compensation for Federal employes who are injured or disabled on the job, The measure, previously passed by the House, now goes back there for action on Senate amendments.

title: NATO Is Viewed as Weakened by the War on Cyprus
description: GENEVA, Aug. 12  Little support can be found at the Cyprus peace talks here for the view expressed in Washington recently that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization emerged strengthened from the threat of war last month between two of its members, Greece and Turkey.

title: Kaffeeklatsch Loses Funds in Burglary Of City Clerk's Safe
description: In what appeared to the police to be an inside job, $887 was taken from the safe of City Clerk Herman Katz in the Munitipal Building, apparently, over the weekend.

title: BOTH SIDES PRESS FOR TAXI ACCORD
description: The city's taxifeet owners and their drivers pushed their efforts last bight to reach a contract agreement that would avert a threatened stoppage of fleet operations today.

title: Steel Output Rose 0.5% for the Week To 2,733,000 Tons
description: Steel production last week rose to 2,733,000 tons, an inerease of onehalf of 1 per cent ever the previous week, according to, the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: BOTH SIDES PRESS FOR TAXI ACCORD
description: The city's taxifleet owners and their drivers pressed negotiations early this morning in hopes of reaching, a contract agreement that would avert a threatened stoppage of fleet operations today.

title: Mother Backs Abortion; Child Is Denied Baptism
description: MARLBORO, Mass., Aug. 12 (AP) Roman Catholic priests at Immaculate Conception Church here have refused to baptize an infant because the boy's mother took a public position favoring abortion.

title: The Waistline? What Waistline? It's Chemise Time, Says Galanos
description: Troubled over what the chemise will look like when it hits American shores? Brood no more. Galanos has done itand nicely too, in delicacies such as striped satin or flowered crepe de chine. It looks every bit as flattering as it did a few weeks ago when Yves Saint Laurent launched it in Paris. Are we ingesting collusion? Pas de tout. Creating fashion may be a lonely business, but when a fresh idea comes along, it's likely, to strike in a few places simultaneously.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: BOSTON CONCERNS WARNED ON CARS
description: BOSTON, Aug. 12Federal environmental officials warned today that businesses here that fail to close a quarter of their employe parking spaces faced penalties including possible fines of up to $25,000 a day.

title: Of Nixon, Ford and the Presidency
description: To the Editor: As this should be a time for healing, further proceedings against Richard Nixon would be selfdefeating for all. But his removal from office does permit the people to assert an absolute right they were denied two years ago: a Presidential election.

title: SYRIA SHUFFLES MILITARY CHIEFS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug 12Syria's military command was shuffled today and Arab diplomatic sources said a Cabinet change was planned soon.

title: Union Head ReElected
description: DENVER, Aug. 12 (AP) Daniel E. Conway of Potomac, Md., was reelected over the weekend as international prsident of the Bakery and Confectionery Workers International Union of America.

title: A CopsRobbers Diamond Caper
description: On the pitcher's mound was a convicted mugger. The shortstop had done time for manslaughter. The catcher, squatting behind home plate, said he was a reformed burglar.

title: Mitsubishi Oil Negotiating For Credit at U.S. Banks
description: TOKYO, Aug. 12 (AP)The Mitsubishi Oil Company of Japan said today it was negoMating with United States banks to borrow $20million in the half year beginning Oct. 1 to help finance crude oil imporst.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A spokesman for New Jersey Bell announced that the company had reached agreement on local issues for threeyear contract with some 24,000 workers belonging to two unions. The settlement has nothing to do with the strike against the Wesern Elecric Company, which is in its eighth day.

title: ADDRESS TO NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12President Ford, appearing fore an enthusiastic joint sion of Congress only days after he took office, called tonight for bipartisan restraint in. Government spending to trol inflation.

title: Treasury Bills Rise At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12The rates of Treasury bills rose today as the Government borrowed $2.7billion on 91day and $2billion of 180day obligations.

title: Divorced Husband Liable for Wife's Welfare Aid
description: A Queens businessman who escaped having to pay alimony because his wife was adjudged the guilty party in their recent divorce must nevertheless reimburse the city's Department of Social Services for welfare payments to his former spouse, a Brooklyn State Supreme Court Justice has ruled.

title: INDIAN GRAIN FLOW TO CITIES FALTERS
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 12The Indian Government conceded today that the struggle to send wheat to the cities was faltering.

title: The Listing of a Defendant Is Corrected by D.A.'s Office
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office said yesterday that the city's Department of Correction had incorrectly listed a, defendant, accused of robbery and murder 35 nionths ago, as one of the five defendants who had spent the longest time in custody awaiting the disposition of their cases.

title: 8 Soviet Women Climbers Killed By Storm in Lenin Peak Ascent
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 12All eight members of a team of Soviet women mountain climbers died last week, as they unsuccessfully attempted, to traverse the 23,400foot Lenin Peak in the Soviet Pamirs.

title: PASSAGE IS SEEN OF U.S. TRADE BILL
description: GENEVA, Aug. 12International officials see new hope for early passage by the United States Senate of the trade bill, now that the impeachment issue has been resolved by the resignation of President Nixon and the Senate can again concentrate on legislative matters.

title: ABC to Show British Sketch About Nixon's Transcripts
description: A 10minute excerpt from a British television program, I Know What I Meant,, in which Nicol Williamson portrays Richard M. Nixon at his desk in the Oval Office, will be seen on Geraldo Rivera's Good Night America on ABCTV on Thursday,

title: WATERGATE AIDE TO JOIN LAW FIRM
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 Seymour Glanzer, one of three Assistant United States AtItorneys who handled the first 11 months of Watergate investigations, said today he was joining the Washington law firm of Dickstein, Shapiro & Morrin.

title: President Urges Others Not to Follow G.M. Lead
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12President Ford castigated the General Motors Corporation today for its decision to raise the prices of its 1975 cars by an average of nearly 10 per cent.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: To Restrain Turkey
description: Turkey's original intervention on Cyprus last month prevent the forced union of that island with Greece was at least understandable and probably legal under 1960 treaties. But there is no excuse whatever for Turkey's current fantastic military buildup and its deliberate policy of preeping annexation of territory in furtherance Ankara's longstanding aim of partitioning Cyprus.

title: BLOOMFIELD GETS YEAR'S EXTENSION
description: NEWARK, Aug. 5 (UPI)Bloomfield College was granted its request today to continue operations for another year, providing that its; courtappointed receiver is successful in obtaining a $500,000 loan.

title: RateRise Protest Taken To Public Service Chief
description: NEWARK, Aug. 12 (UPI) As 300 people marched outside, labor leaders took their protest of a proposed $257million rate increase sought by Public Service Electric & Gas Company directly into the utility's board room today.

title: Frederic Malek Resigns; Last of Haldeman Team
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 Frederic V. Malek, the last highlevel member of H. R. Haldeman's tough management team at the White House, is leaving the Government with the praise of President Ford and a highpaying job in private industry.

title: SUMMIT FAVORED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 President Ford, appearing before an enthusiastic joint session of Congress only three days after he took office, called tonight for bipartisan restraint in Government spending to control inflation.

title: Julie Eisenhower Rides Bike to the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI)Julie Nixon Eisenhower cycled onto the White House grounds today, wearing blue slacks with a blue and white jersey and looking unhappy.

title: REV. JOSEPH L. MELODY
description: The Rev. Joseph L. Melody, since 1973, pastor of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Yonkers, died Sunday in Yonkers General Hospital. His age was 60.

title: Hellman's Filly Wins At Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 12As soon as the $28,250 Adirondack was over and Laughing Bridge had posted a fivelength triumph, Al Scotti, the filly's trainer was asked, Where are you going with Laughing Bridge?

title: Funeral Set for Family of 8, Killed in Airplane Crash
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Aug. 12 (UPI)A funeral service will be held Thursday for a heart and blood specialist from Edison, his wife and six children, who were killed in an airplane crash in Minnesota Saturday night.

title: New Police Alert System Foils Store Thieves Within 25 Seconds
description: Tipped off by the Police Department's experimental holdupalert system, four detectives sped to a butcher shop in Harlem yesterday and arrested three alleged teenage robbers as they emerged from the store with $81.

title: A Millionaire's Million in Sculpture Airlifted by Copter on Way to Museum
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 12More tha a million dollars worth of famous, but rarely seen, bronze sculptures by such artists as Rodin and Henry Moore dangled through the treetops from a helicopter here today at the Joseph H. Hirshhorn estate as the millionaire art collector began the last steps in donating his private collecdon to the public.

title: Bar Patron's Stroll to Police Foils Leisurely Brooklyn Holdup
description: A leisurely holdup attempt of Brooklyn bar resulted in two arrests early yesterday after bar patron sauntered out during the twohour incident and notified the police of the Bay Ridge precinct that robbery was unfolding at Harper's Pub a few blocks away.

title: AMEX PRICES SUP IN SLOW TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market watched and waited yesterday for President Ford's economic message to the nation last night and allowed prices to ease in very slow dealings.

title: STOCK PRICES SLIP AS VOLUME LAGS
description: The stock market spent the day yesterday waiting to hear what President Ford had to say last night about the nation's effort to stop prices from rising so fast.

title: Books of The Times
description: A TEMPORARY LIFE, By David Storey. 249 pages. Dutton, $6,95, Though I'm not at all sure what I'm supposed to feel after reading A Temporary Life by David Storey, I like it. In some perplexity, I read it a second time, to see whether anything had eluded me, thinking that perhaps I had gotten so caught up in the central character that I had not paid sufficient attention to the author's overall design. Well, I'm no more enlightened, but I still like it.

title: ExHumphrey Aide Guilty in Milk Case
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 12The former press secretary to Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, pleaded guilty today to charges of aiding and abetting illegal corporate donations to political campaigns by milk producers.

title: BAILEY HOWARD, LED FIELD ENTERPRISES
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Aug 12 (UPI)Bailey K. Howard who retired in 1971 as chair man and chief executive officer of Field Enterprises, Inc., and president of its newspaper division, which publishes The Chiago SunTimes and The Chiago Daily News, died today at its home, apparently of heart attack. He was 59 year. old.

title: Gas and Oil Discovery
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 12 (Reuters)The Continental Oil Company said today that a subsidiary and, Pertamina, the Indonesian State Oil Company, discovered gas and oil in an offshore exploratory well in the China Sea about 130 miles west of Natuna Island. The company said further testing is needed to determine commercial significance; other partners in the group are units of the Getty Oil Company and the Standard Oil Company (Indiana.

title: Joseph Durso
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 12They were an unlikely bunch, but Mick, Slick and Cool Papa Bell stood in the sunshine of the Mohawk Valley this morningwith an umpire, of all peopleand walked serenely into baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Steelers, Browns and Bills Win
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 12 (AP)  Joe Gilliam ran for one touchdown and threw three third quarter touchtouchdown passes to key the Pittsburgh Steelers to a 5021 National Football, League Exhibition victory over the Chicago Bears tonight before a crowd of 42,325.

title: Tangle wood: Candles, Wine and Joplin
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 12Susan Scheraga was drinking again. Not from wine glasses, the way may do at Tanglewood, but from a plastic cup. She was drinking A. & P. orange juice (unsweetened), a la 1974. It was a very good year.

title: People and Business
description: Robert H. Johnson, who is 58, yesterday was named chairman of the Del E. Webb Corporation, succeeding the founder, Del E. Webb, who died July 4 at the age of 75. Mr. Johnson, a native of Arizona, has been president and chief executive officer of the building and development company, which has headquarters in Phoenix.

title: New Bus Service Startedand Halted
description: A 35cent rapid bus service was inaugurated yesterday by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority for riders between the Riverdale section of the Bronx and the World Trade Center, but it promptly ran into a legal roadblock that halted it, at least until Friday.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Ticket refunds will be accepted for the GiantsJets exhibition game Saturday afternoon at Yale Bowl in New Haven, game officials announced yesterday, despite the 14day cooling off period in the National Football League players strike. In order to qualify for a refund, tickets must be returned in person or by mail to Yale University by the close of business on Friday, Refund requests may be sent to Yale Athletic Association, Box 402A, Yale Station, New Haven, Conpecticut 06520, About 40,000 tickets already have, been sold for the game.

title: Turks' Action on U.N. Report Brings Armenian Protests
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 12 (AP)  More than 300 Armenians demonstrated outside the United Nations today against a Turkish proposal to delete any reference to 1915 massacre of Armenians by Turks from a United Nations report.

title: NATIONALIZING DUE FOR NORTH SEA SITES
description: LONDON, Aug. 12 (UPI)The Government announced today plans to nationalize land needed for building platforms for development of Britain's North Sea oil fields.

title: Contract Awards
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation announced yesterday that it had received orders for six more DC9, Series 40 jet aircraft from Toa Domestic Airlines of Japan. Previously, the Japanese airline had ordered eight of the jetliners. Although the aircraft builders did not put a figure on the new orders, industry sources said each plane was valued at $6million.

title: Market Place: Nay saying Rise In Commissions
description: Not so long ago, the partners of a mediumsized brokerage house asked the firm's salesmen how they would feel about an increase in commission rates.

title: Possible Doctor for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI)President Ford is expected to appoint Rear Adm. William K. Kukash, a Detroitborn internist, as his physician in the White House, officials said today. Admiral Lukash served as assistant to former President Richard M. Nixon's chief physician, Dr. Walter Tkach.

title: Camden Jury Continues Investigation of Police
description: CAMDEN, Aug. 12A Camden County grand jury that is investigating the Camden Police Department heard testimony today from City Attorney Martin McKernan.

title: JUDGE NAMED HEAD OF TAXSTUDY GROUP
description: ALBANY, Aug. 12Governor Wilson today appointed Francis Bergan of Albany, a retired Court of Appeals judge, as chairman of the commission that will study tax limits imposed on large cities by the state Constitution.

title: Harmonious Camp Expects Namath by Tomorrow
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 12 It was like old home week at Tower C on the Hofstra University campus today as 18 veterans, trickled into the New York Jets' training camp 41 days after the National Football League Players' Ai sociation strike began. With 11 veterans already in camps only 17 had not reported by nightfall, but they were expected shortly.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: INTO THE STATE The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater moves superbly on the stage, and this summer it has been moving as a troupe all across Europe. Tonight it begins a twoweek run at the New York State Theater, marking its first appearance there, and following that, it will be playing a week in the city's parks.

title: ARGENTINE POLICE SLAY 16 LEFTISTS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 12 (AP)  Provincial policemen killed 16 Marxist guerrillas today in a running battle in the mountains of Catamarca Province, police sources said. It was one of the worst setbacks in four years of terrorism for the guerrilla People's Revolutionary Army.

title: College Is Utilized for Adult Education
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Aug. 11Adult educated move onto a college campus in the last week, in an experiment that may have a promising future.

title: JOHN A. SPEAR
description: John Ashcroft Spear, a retired English teacher at Miss Porter's School in Farmington, Conn., died last Wednesday in Hartford Hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: Tender Is the Mind
description: If I were a new President I would first have the White House searched thoroughly for tape recorders. They would all be sent over to the Pentagon. I want these things surgically bombed by B52's, I would say, and I want you to give me the costs of the B52 fuel, crew salaries and bombs used in the mission.

title: LSD Raid Reported in London
description: LONDON, Aug. 12 (Reuters),  The police said today they had seized 40,000 LSD tablets at a house in north London last night in the biggest confiscation of the drug ever made in the capital. Three men were arrested in the raid, the police said.

title: Back to the Gridiron
description: The fate of the economy may not be determined on the professional football field, but millions of fans will share with that onetime star center at the University of Michigan, Gerald Ford, gratification at the twoweek truce Federal peacemakers have arranged in the National Football League strike.

title: Dodgers Lose to Mets, 31
description: Smack in the middle of a pennant race  somebody else'sthe Mets set back the Los Angeles Dodgers, 31, last night at Shea Stadium. It was the fourth of nine straight games the Mets are playing with the two top teams in the West Division of the National Leaguethe Dodgers and the Cincinnati Reds.

title: Advertising: Magazine Revived
description: Madison Avenue magazine, which was founded in 1958 and which suspended publication for the second time, last February, has come alive again under new ownership.

title: Triumphs Called Back
description: LEONIA, N.J., Aug. 12 (UPI) British Leyland Motors said today that it was recalling more than 44,600 Triumph TR 6 sports cars sold in the United States and Canada because of the possibility that fuel leaks could start a fire. A spokesman for the concern said that the problem involved possible loose connections and that it had been discovered in service reports.

title: Perpetually Dark MidOcean Floor Found Teeming With Fish and Other Organisms
description: ABOARD RESEARCH SHIP KNORR, at Sea, Aug. 9 Rarely, if ever, since exploration of the oceans began has there been such extensive observation of life on and near the deep sea floors in the submarine dives Project FAMOUS now drawing to an end.

title: Floating Notes Face Regulation by Fed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (Reuters)  The Senate Banking Committee approved a bill today that would give the Federal Reserve Board and other banking agencies authority to regulate securities issued by financial holding companies.

title: Transcript of President Ford's Address to Joint Session of Congress and the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12Following is the transcript of the address by President Ford as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Oil Spills Aid Rise of Clean  Up Company
description: GLENMONT, N. Y., Aug. 12  Oil spills are dangerous and costly to oil companies and the public but to three young men from Connecticut they have proved an opportunity to set up a new kind of business that is growing rapidlycleaning up spilled oil.

title: 2 Water Mains Burst, Disrupting Services
description: Two water mains burst here yesterday, tangling traffic, briefly disrupting IND subway service and flooding basements with torrents as deep as 30 feet.

title: G.E. AND SOVIET SET GAS TURBINE DEAL
description: The General Electric Company announced yesterday that it had received an order for 65 gas turbine compressors valued at $250million from the Soviet Union.

title: Airco to Expand 2 Plants
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Aug. 12 (AP)An $11million expansion plan was announced today for two plants of the Airco Speer Carbon Graphite division of Airco, Inc. The expansions, at the Niagara Falls and St. Marys, Pa., plants, will increase Airco Speer production by 20 per cent.

title: ASIAN BANK LOAM SHORT OF NEED
description: MANILA, Aug. 12 Sharply rising costs have overtaken several projects of the Asian Development Bank and required new investments amounting to $41.2million.

title: Jailed Secret Policemen Stage Brief Protest in Lisbon
description: LISBON, Aug. 12 (UPI) About 600 jailed former secre policemen seized a block o?? the Lisbon prison today but returned to their cells peacefulls after receiving permission to air their grievances with a member of the governing military junta.

title: WALLACE R. BRODE, CHEMIST, 74, DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 12Dr. Wallace R. Brode, an internationally known scientist and Government official, died Saturday of cancer at the George Washington University Hospital here. He was 74 years old.

title: Sen. Ribicoff Noncommittal On Meskill for Federal Judge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) Senator Abraham Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, said today that he would not take a position on the nomination of Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut to a Federal judgeship until after a full hearing by the Senate Judiciary Committee, Mr. Meskill has announced that he is retiring from the Governorship.

title: Independent Seeks Frelinghuysen Seat
description: PRINCETON, Aug. 12He hasn't sent out any news releases. He hasn't opened an official campaign headquarters or shaken hands at carnivals, fairs or other gatherings of peopie. His three opponents don't even acknowledge that he is a candidate. But there is a fourth candidate running in the Fifth Congressional District.

title: Calley Asking. Bond
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI) Former Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. is asking. Supreme Court Justce Lewis F. Powell Jr. to release him on bond while he seeks in civilian courts to overturn his conviction for his role in the My Lai slayings in South Vietnam in 1968. Mr. Calley has a habeas corpus action pending in United States District Court in Columbus, Ga.

title: Connors Conquers Borg in Net Final
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 12 (AP)  Topseeded Jimmy Connors fought off a strong challenge by Bjorn Borg of Sweden tonight to win the 1974 United States clay court tennis title, 57, 63, 64, and gain the $16,000 first prize.

title: A's Defeat Yanks, 32, On Error
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 12 A brilliant pitching duel between Pat Dobson, who is usually tough on the Oakland A's, and Catfish Hunter, who is usually tough on everybody, broke against the New York Yankees tonight as a wild throw by Craig, Nettles in the eighth inning gave Oakland the two runs it needed for a 52 victory.

title: 40 Soldiers in Cambodia Killed in Bombing Error
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 12 (UPI)  Forty Cambodian soldiers were killed when Government air force planes mistakenly bombed a unit of the Seventh Infantry Division six miles northwest of Phnom Penh, military sources disclosed today.

title: Wurlitzer to Shut Down OldInstrument Concern
description: Rembert Wurlitzer, Inc., often described as the world's leading dealer in fine old stringed instruments, will go out of business at the end of next month, the company's president and sole owner disclosed yesterday.

title: Some Democrats Viewed As Pleased but Dubious
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12In calling upon Congress tonight to become my working partner as well as my most constructive critic, President Ford appeared to signal an end to nearly nine years of what was widely viewed here as White House disdain for the legislative branch of government.

title: Zaire: The Toughest Fight Is Just Getting There
description: The overseas operator wasn't happy about being disturbed.

title: Surprise Over Crops
description: Agricultural economists and food industry spokesmen reacted with surprise yesterday over the latest gloomy crop predictions by the Agriculture Department, with most of them asserting that the situation was becoming very serious. Details on Page 41.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 14, 1974
description: Turkish invasion forces resumed fighting in Cyprus around midnight last night shortly after peace talks broke down in Geneva. Britain immediately called for an emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council in New York. The Turkish military ac tion resumed with an air attack on Nicosia, the capital. Bombs fell near theairport on the southern outskirts of the city. [1:8.]

title: 3Year Cab Pact Reached; Fleets Ask 25% Fare Rise
description: The city's taxifleet owners reached a tentative threeyear agreement with the Taxi Drivers Union early yesterday, four hours after the deadline for a contract termination, and immediately asked the City Taxi and Limousine Commission for a 25 per cent fare increase.

title: CONSUMER CHIEF POR ENERGY QUITS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 The head of the Office of Consumer Affairs of the Federal Energy Administration has resigned with a blistering attack on what he described as mismanagement at the agency and incredible failure to deal with consumer problems.

title: Rights Unit Increases Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (UPI)  John H. Powell Jr. chairman of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, said today that the commission's legal staff had been increased nearly fivefold in an effort to reduce backlog of 55,000 job discrimination cases a year. Mr. Powell said that the legal staff rose from 35 persons in 1972 to about 170 now and that the commission hoped to halve the 26 months it now averages to settle a job discrimination complaint.

title: CivilEmploye Union Chief Calls Byrne's Aides Inept
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13The head of New Jersey's secondlargest publicemploye union today charged that officials in the Byrne administration were inept vacillators, many of whom lack integrity and who have quarantined we Governor from knoeledge of what's really happening in New Jersey.

title: Beame Wins Praise Of Venders for End To Seizure of Carts
description: Ten streetcorner hotdog venders came to City Hall yesterday to thank Mayor Beame personally for interceding with the Police Department in their behalf.

title: Loans by Carey Brother Risk Election Violation
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey has borrowed so heavily from his brother to finance his gubernatorial campaign that he must repay at least $120,000 of the loans or risk violating the new state election law. The law limits loans and contributions by a candidate and his family.

title: South Africa Lifts Bank Rate
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 13 (Reuters)  South Africa raised its bank rate to 8 per cent from 7 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: BANCORP ON COAST ACCUSED BY S.E.C.
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 13, (AP)The Securities and Exchanobe Commission today accused Beverly Hills Bancorp and its real estate development subsidiary, Western Diversified Equities, of violating the registration, antifraud and reporting provisions of the federal securities law.

title: SIMON ANALYZES OIL EARNINGS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said today that oil company profits were not so high as they seemed but had been obscured by a smokescreen of hyperbole and demagogueryfrom both sides.Mr. Simon presented to the Senate Small Business Committee a new analysis of firstquarter profits for 19 major oil companies. The study concluded that the profits on continuing normal petroleum operations had risen 21 per cent from the comparable quarter of 1973in contrast to a 76 per cent rise in reported total profits of these companies.

title: Leis Are Victims Of a Small Court
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 13 (AP) The Hawaii Leis lost a tennis match today that they never played.

title: Hernandez Is Honored
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 13 (UPI)A San Diego Padres' infielder, Enzo Hernandez, who hit .450 in five games last week, was named today as National League player of the week for th period of Aug. 511.

title: Chaplaincy Ready, Quartermaster Isn't, As Woman Signs Up
description: The Rev. Alice M. Henderson received a pair of silver bars and a silver cross last month when commissioned as a captain in the Army Chaplain Crops, but has yet to receive an official uniform.

title: Sutton Backs Clark for Senator as a Rights Advocate
description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan endorsed Ramsey Clark for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator yesterday, saying that in terms of experience, compassion and integrity he was by miles the best qualified candidate.

title: Fund Rise in School Bill Called a Worry for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 President Ford offered both an olive branch and a warning when he told the joint session of Congress last night that lie would sign into law a bill on massive school aid. He said, he would sign it, despite reservations about some of its provisions.

title: Crash Kills 9 in Spain
description: SARAGOSSA, Spain, Aug. 13 (Reuters)  At least 9 people were killed and 20 injured when a bus and a fruit truck collided headon today near this city in northcentral Spain, the police reported. They said that most of the people on the bus were returning to Barcelona after holidays in western Spain.

title: LARCENY AND RAPE UP SHARPLY HERE
description: The police said yesterday that reports of larcenies and rapes increased sharply here in the first six months of this year while murder am robbery reports diminished slightly and auto thefts dropped dramatically.

title: Court Backs DebtPaying Plan For Paterson General Hospital
description: NEWARK, Aug. 13 (UPI)Paterson General Hospital, an institution in the Passaic County community for 103 years, has obtained court approval for a plan to pay off $1.1million in debts, it was disclosed today.

title: Trade Deficit of Britain Increased Slightly in July
description: LONDON, Aug. 23The Government reported today that Britains visible trade deficit increased slightly in July and was just short of a record level, mainly because of the nation's rising oil bill.

title: Guard at Watergate To Get S.C.L.C. Honor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 13 (UPI)  The Southern Christian Leadership Conference opened its 17th annual convention here today. It was the first time that the organization's annual gathering was held north of the MasonDixon Line.

title: Oganda President's ExWife Found Dead After Abortion
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 13 (UPI)The police said today that they had discovered the body of a former wife of President Idi Amin in the trunk of a car belonging to a doctor who died of poisoning yesterday.

title: I.T.T.to Sponsor Children's TV Show
description: Except for a period in 1967 when it made an attempt to acquire American Broadcasting Companies, Inc., the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation has had little involvement, on any level, with television in the United States.

title: People in Sports
description: Willis Reed, the New York Knicks' center whose career is in jeopardy because of a damaged knee, will undergo arthroscopy (a diagnostic probe) on Friday at Toronto General Hospital.

title: A Brooklyn Court Is Boycotted By Legal Aid Lawyers in Protest
description: Legal Aid Society lawyers protesting a judge's decision to hold one of the society's lawyers in contempt, failed to appear in Brooklyn Criminal Court yesterday.

title: Storey's The Farm, Opens Folger Season on Oct. 11
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13The 197475 season of the Folger Theater Group will open on Oct. 11  after previews Oct. 8, 9 and 10with the American premiere of The Farm, a new play by David Storey, British playwright.

title: Now Up, Up, And Awayyy...
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Legal Aid Lawyers Boycott Court

title: Baltazar Sets Pace For jockeys
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 13Chuck Baltazar dethroned Robyn Smith in the Pace with Sulkies that feaey Derby at Saratoga Raceway tonight. Keeping his sulky well in advance of all of his rivals in the onemile event, Baltazar steered a 5yearold horse named Young Bachelor to a decisive triumph.

title: Kennedy Concedes Aide Erred Under Campaign Law
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts, a leading Democratic sponsor of campaign finance reform was disclosed today to have become peripherally involved in an apparent violation of the 1972 Federal election spending law that he had supported in the Senate.

title: U.S. IS REPLACING ENVOY TO ATHENS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 13  The White House announced today that Henry J. Tasca would be replaced as Washington's Ambassador to Athens.

title: SOUTH KOREA JAILS MORE DISSENTERS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 13  A South Korean courtmartial announced today that 12 more students and a prison guard had been sentenced to prison for defying the Government of President Park Chung Hee.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: MRS. HENRY LEE
description: Marion McDermott Lee, writer for The Daily News, died yesterday in Stamford Hospital, Stamford, Conn. She was 66 years old and lived at 242 Ocean Drive West in Stamford.

title: Senate Backs a Bill To Exempt Lotteries From Tax on Bets
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 13 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today that would exempt staterun lotteries from the 10 per cent excise tax on wagers.

title: A BILLBOARD PLAN IN HOUSE SCORED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Legislation that a Department of Transportation official described as a disaster for highway beautification efforts and as a sellout to the billboard industry is expected to be reported out of the House Public Works Committee in the next few days.

title: Maddox Forced Into Runoff for Georgia Governor
description: ATLANTA, Wednesday, Aug. 14Lieut. Gov. Lester G. Maddox failed to achieve a majority in yesterday's Democratic primary for Governor and was forced into a runoff Sept. 3 against one of two moderates who were still locked in a close race early today.

title: 2 MISSING GIRLS REPORTED SEEN
description: The North Bergen police said they were checking the possibility that two teenage North Bergen girls missing since Friday had been spotted yesterday morning in a Union City luncheonette a few miles from home.

title: Shankland and Joyce Lead by Shot at 68
description: JERICHO, L. I., Aug. 13Craig Shankland, who said, I had been driving badly recently because I had been thinking badly, and Tom Joyce, who won the Westchester Professional Golfers' Association tournament last month, shared the firstround lead today in the 47th Metropolitan P.G.A. championship with fourunderpar 68's.

title: Youthful CowboysPerform at Rodeo
Prospects for Passage This Year Seen Better
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13With the active support of Preident Ford, the prospects that a national health insurance program will be enacted this year appear to have increased, although a few Congressional leaders said today that the outcome was still doubtful.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROTONDA, Fla., Aug. 13 (AP)Bob Seagren, the pole vaulter, clinched his third straight appearance in Superstars competition today by winning three of five qualievents and finishing second in a fourth event.

title: Contract Awards
description: Litwin, S. A., the French subsidiary of Amtel, Inc., of the United States, announced yesterday that it had been awarded a contract by the Soviet Union to build a $53million polystyrene plant in Omsk. The plant will be completed by the spring of 1978 and have an annual capacity of 1000,000 tons. It will be 80 per cent financed by longterm credits from French banks, with 20 per cent paid cash.

title: Baltazar Sets Pace For Jockeys
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 13Chuck Baltazar dethroned Robyn Smith in the Pace with Sulkies that feaey Derby at Saratoga Raceway tonight. Keeping his sulky well in advance of all of his rivals in the onemile event, Baltazar steered a 5yearold horse named Young Bachelor to a decisive triumph.

title: Sanok's 144 Paces Qualifiers in Jersey
description: WAYNE, N.J., Aug. 13Chet Sanok of Upper Montclair, who won his fourth state amateur championship this year, posted a 71, 73144 today to lead the seven New Jerseyans who qualified for the United States Amateur championship.

title: Salvino Captures Jersey Pin Meet
description: EDISON, N. J., Aug. 13 (AP)  Carmen Salvino of Chicago, wrapped up first place in the $50,000 New Jersey open bowling tournament tonight, defeating Don McCune of Munster, Ind., 208192, in the final match.

title: Dutch Police Sent Island In Antilles in Labor Strike
description: WILLEMSTAD, Curaao, Aug. 13 (UPI)A 35man police force and two Government officials of the Netherlands Antilles flew today from Curaao to the island of St. Martin, where the Dutch Government building was burned to the ground in suspected arson. The Dutch share the island with the French.

title: NAVY BID TO MAKE LOAN TO GRUMMAN BEATEN IN SEE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13The Senate rejected today the Navy's $100million loan agreement with the Grumman Aerospace Corporation to continue production of the F14 fighter plane.

title: COMMODITIES RISE ON CROP OUTLOOK
description: Most commodity futures jumped the daily limit as hold. era of short positions tried vainly in many instances to buy contracts to cover their positions. The impetus came directly from the Government's forecast of a sharply lower corn crop and a somewhat lower soybean production because of drought.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Kissinger and Senators Seek Accord on Soviet Jews
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Efforts to reach a compromise between Congress and the Executive branch on the tangled question of the emigration of Soviet Jews and passage of the trade bill have entered a decisive phase, with President Ford possibly ready to enter the discussions directly, Congressional aides said today.

title: S.L.A. Members Lose Plea
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 13 (AP)A judge has ruled that two members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army awaiting trial for the murder of Marcus Foster, the school superintendent, must serve time in solitary confinement for shouting obscenities at jail guards. Superior Court Judge Hugh Koford denied a motion by Russell Little and Joseph Remiro that they be released from the isolation tank.

title: Shipping Magnate's Death Termed Less Suspicious
description: The Medical Examiner's office said yesterday that it had become less suspicious about the stillunexplained death of Edgar F. Luckenbach Jr., the 49yearold New York shipping magnate whose body was found in an East Side apartment last Friday.

title: Traffic Slowed in Los Angeles With Bus Strike in Second Day
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 13  Traffic continued to move slowly throughout Los Angeles today as more than 400,000 bus commuters adjusted to the effects of a fourcounty transit strike.

title: Jamaica Asks Dominicans To Join Aluminum Project
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Aug. 13 (UPI)Jamaica has invited the Domicican Republic to join that cation, Trinidad and Tobago and Guyana in a $500million multi  government project to produce aluminum in Trindad and ultimately also in Guyana.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BALTIMORE (AL)Activated Jim Palmer, righthanded pitcher. Optioned Dave Johnson, righthanded relief pitcher, to Rochester of the International League.

title: Wall St. Quandary: Surviving in an Era of Inflation
description: Hey, Joey, what do you think? Jay H. Perry at Salomon Brothers asked Joseph S. DeMartino of the Dreyfus Sales Corporation in a telephone conversation early Friday, the day that Gerald R. Ford was to become President Ford.

title: In Pursuit of Privacy
description: President Ford's ringing affirmation of the individual's right to privacy and his flat declaration that there will be no illegal tappings, eavesdropping, buggings or breakins by my Administration were as welcome as they were direct and unequivocal. They signaled a sharp and necessary departure from the practices of the recent past which did so much to demean American democracy and injure its citizens.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Misuse of Mental Care Drugs Denied.

title: New Envoy to Seoul Designated by Ford In Time of Tension
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 President Ford announced today that he was nominating Richard L. Sneider, Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and Pacific Affairs, as Ambassador to South Korea, replacing Philip C. Habib.

title: 8 Climbers' Deaths Now Acknowledged By the Soviet Press
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 13The Soviet press today acknowledged that eight women climbers perished in a storm last week on Lenin Peak in the Pamirs.

title: Extension of Eximbank Is Approved by House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP)Legislation to extend the Export Control Act for two years without major change was passed by the House today after farm state representatives fought off proposals they said might curtail agricultural exports.

title: Ultimatum Endangers Duran Bout
description: Roberto Duran, the world lightweight champion, apparently left New York last night after being called home to Panama by his manager. But first, he stopped off in Brooklyn for a party.

title: Books of The Times
description: ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND FOOD SUPPLY. Edited by Philip L. White and Diane Robbins. 248 pages: Futura Publishing. $13.95.

title: REV. JOSEPH L. MELODY
description: The Rev. Joseph L. Melody, since 1973, pastor of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Yonkers, died Sunday in Yonkers General Hospital. His age was 60.

title: U.S. Settles Milk Trust Action Linked to Campaign Donations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 The Justice Department announced today that it had reached an agreement settling its antitrust suit against the Associated Milk Producers, Inc.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Decoy Traps a Rape Suspect In 3 Recent Cases in Brooklyn
description: A 24yearold Brooklyn man was arraigned on charges of rape in two cases in Criminal Court yesterday following an earlymorning arrest by a police team in which a woman officer acted as a decoy.

title: People in Sports
description: Willis Reed, the New York Knicks' center whose career is in jeopardy because of a damaged knee, will undergo arthroscopy (a diagnostic probe) on Friday at Toronto General Hospital.

title: WaitandSee Attitude Mixed With Relief
description: President Ford's speech to Congress Monday night was greeted yesterday almost universally by praise for his effort at conciliation and cooperation to fight inflation.

title: 5 OFFICERS ACCUSE ACADEMY HEADS
description: Five Air Force officers asked yesterday that the present and immediately preceding superintendents and commandants of cadets at the Air Force and Military Academies be courtmartialed for alleged violations of the Uniform Code of Military Justice.

title: U.S. Settles Milk Trust Action Linked to Campaign Donations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13The Justice Department announced today that it had reached an agreement settling its antitrust suit against the Associated Milk Producers, Inc.

title: TALKS AT STANDSTILL IN 2DAY A.&P. STRIKE
description: The strike by some 18,000 New York and, North Jersey meat cutters, cashiers and store clerks against A.&P. supermarkets enterd its second day yesterday with no negotiations scheduled and union officials predicting that the food chain's shelves would soon be empty.

title: Sagamore Leads In Midget Sailing
description: WESTPOAT, Co Aug. 13 The Sagainore Yacht Clilb crew of Oyster Bay, L.I., placed first and second off Cedar Point Y C today for a 1point lead after the first two flees in the final round of the midget sailing championship of Long Island Sonud.

title: Sagarnore Leads In Midget Sailing
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 13 The. Sagamore Yacht Club crew of Oyster Bay,. L.I., placed first and second off Cedar Point Y.C. today for a 1point lead after the first two races in the final round of the midget sailing championship of Long Island Sound.

title: Coral Belle Takes Trot At Yonkers
description: YONKERS, Aug. 13Coral Belle made her move at the top of the stretch, pulled away in the last 100 yards and won the $38,175 Speedy Rodney Trot, one of the New York Sire Stakes series, tonight at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Daylight Time

title: An Average Taxi Ride Would Cost 45c More
description: The cost of the average taxi ride would rise from $1.98 to $2.43 if the new fare increase is granted, a fleetindustry official said yester day.

title: Engineering Groups Expel 6 in Maryland Payoff Case
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (UPI)  Five engineers involved in kickback payoffs to former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew and the former Baltimore County Executive, Dale Anderson, were expelled today from the Maryland and National Societies of Professional Engineers.

title: Colts' Hendricks Sent to Packers
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 13 (AP) Ted Hendricks, an allprolinebacker signed to play next season in the World Football League, was traded by the Baltimore Colts today to the Green Bay Packers for Tom MacLeod, a starting linebacker as a rookie last season.

title: Pope Names 2 U.S. Bishops
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) Pope Paul VI, has named two new Roman Catholic bishops in the United States, the Apostolic Delegate's office announced today. The Most Rev. Joseph V. Sullivan, 55yearold auxiliary bishop of the Kansas CitySt. Joseph, Mo., diocese, will become bishop of Baton Rouge, La. And Msgr. Kenneth A. Angell, 44, chancellor of the Providence, R.I., diocese, will become auxiliary bishop of Providence.

title: About New York
description: At 7:30 one recent cloudy morning XWF, WM, CM, ChildFemale and 16 other people whose names were known were put into whitepine coffins, taken to Harts Island, onethird of a mile off Ate Bronx shore in Long Island Sound, and buried three deep in a bulldozed trench because nobody would say he knew them or wanted them.

title: A South Korean Battles to Save Her Doomed Son
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 13A middleaged woman sat clutching her hands, her frightened brown eyes darting at everything around her, not wanting to talk, for fear of the secret police yet unable to keep silent out of anxiety for her son, who has been sentenced to die.

title: 2 Senate Panels Cut Funds For Arms and Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Less than a day after President. Ford's charge to Congress to avoid unwarranted cuts, in national defense, two Senate committees have moved separately to reduce American military spending and foreign aid by almost $6billion.

title: Si Wins Migrant Worker's Release From Farm
description: WOODBURY, N.J., Aug. 13  Judge R. Edward Klaisz Jr. of Cumberland County Juvenile Court ordered today that a 16yearold Puerto Rican migrant worker be removed from the Rosario Sorbello & Sons farm and placed in the custody of his halfbrother in Vineland.

title: President Has No Plans Yet For Any Journeys Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (Reuters)President Ford is eager to renew his acquaintance with foreign leaders and, to express to them his wish for continued stability in foreign policy, but has no plans to travel overseas in the immediate future, J. F. terHorst, the White House press secretary, said today.

title: Ultimatum Endangers Duran Bout
description: Roberto Duran, the world lightweight champion, apparently left New York last night after being called home to Panama by his manager. But first, he stopped off in Brooklyn for a party.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Aug. 14, 1974 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: FORD SEES MEANY; ASKS UNIONS' HELP IN INFLATION FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 President Ford, seeking to get a grip on the nation's economy, turned today to the problems of wages and jobs, meeting separately with. George Meany, the labor leader, and with Peter J. Brennan, the Secretary of Labor.

title: 2 Senate Panels Cut Funds For Arms and. Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Less than a day after President Ford's charge to Congress to avoid unwarranted cuts in national defense, two Senate committees have moved separately to reduce American military spending and foreign aid by almost $6billion.

title: FUENTES PURSUES FIGHT FOR HIS JOB
description: Luis Fuentes, who was barred by a State Supreme Court justice on Monday from continuing as Superintendent of District 1 schools, yesterday carried his battle for reinstatement to Federal Court here.

title: Ill. State Names Schmakel
description: NORMAL, Ill., Aug. 13 (AP)Warren Schmakel, 52, years old, athletic director and former head football coach at Boston University, was named athletic director today at Illinois State University.

title: Close Aide to Haile Selassie surrenders to the Military
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 13 (Reuters)Emperor Haile Selassie's personal treasurer, Blatta Admassu Retta has surrendered to the armed forces, it was announced today.

title: Turkish Cypriote Village Feels Bitter and Cut Off
description: KNODHARA, Cyprus, Aug. 13This Turkish Cypriote village 19 miles northeast of Nicosia has been virtually cut off for three weeks by what its inhabitants consider the enemy.

title: JOSEPH BARNETT OF CANNON MILLS
description: Joseph W. Barnett, who retired in 4967 as president and vice chairman of Cannon Mills, Inc., died Monday of a heart attack at the United Hospital, Port Chester, N. Y. Ha was 72 years old and lived at Milton Harbor House, 720 Milton Road, Rye, N. Y.

title: Notes on People Gov. Mandel Takes New Wife in Baltimore
description: Half an hour after his divorce from his wife of 33 years, Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland yesterday married his longtime friend, Mrs. Jeanne Blakstone Dorsey. The wedding was performed by a rabbi in Baltimore, after a local judge had made final Mr. Mandel's divorce from Barbara Mandel and waived the twoday waiting period.

title: Motorcyclists Pressure Byrne on Parkway Ban
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13With a vroom and a roar, 200 motorcyclists from across the state converged on the capital today to demand that Governor Byrne sign a bill passed by the Legislature in midMay that would permit motorcyles to operate on the Garden State Parkway north of Ocean County.

title: PHOSPHATE MINE SET FOR NORTH CAROLINA
description: Plans for a $200million phosphate mining and manufacturing facility in Beaufort, N. C., were announced yesterday by the Agrico Chemical Company and the Kennecott Copper Corporation.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Staten Island Youths In Racial Disturbance
description: A fight between white and black youths led to a twohour disturbance in a Staten Island shopping center late last night, according to the police, who arrested a 19yearold on a charge of possessing a Molotov cocktail.

title: City Commission Skeptical About Taxi Industry Data
description: In the City Taxi and Limousine Commission offices at 67 Wall Street there are volumes of computer printouts, with statistics covering every one of the city's 12,516 medallion taxicabs:

title: Owners Warned By House
description: A thorough Inspection of pro football's antitrust status was threatened yesterday by 12 members of the House of Representatives if a fair contract compromise with the striking players' association is not reached or if the union is injured as a result of the 44day labor dispute.

title: Kings Sign Williams
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 13 (AP)  The Kansas CityOmaha Kings today signed Nate Williams, their No. 3 scorer, to a twoyear contract. Williams played forward and guard in 82 games for the National Basketball Association Kings last season, averaging 15.5 points a game and making 182 assists.

title: Ross Malone, Lawyer, Is Dead; President of the A.B.A. in 1958
description: Ross L. Malone, one of the youngest men to head the American Bar Association when he was elected president in 1958 at the age of 47, died yesterday in Roswell, N.M. He was 63 years old and lived in Roswell and at 303 East 57th Street.

title: DOW MAY ACQUIRE GENERAL CRUDE
description: The General Crude Oil Cornpany and the Dow Chemical Company announced yesterday the execution of an agreement to merge General Crude into Dow through a taxfree exchange of shares. The merger agreement is subject to approval by General Crude shareholders, the largest of which is Glenmede Trust Company of Philadelphia, which Is the trustee of the Pew Memorial Trust. The Pew Memorial Trust is the owner of 63 per cent of General Crude's common shares.

title: Brown Tops Nastase at Canada Net
description: TORONTO, Aug, 13 (AP)Bill Brown of Omaha, ranked 44th in the United States, upset Illie Nastase of Rumania, 61, 61, tonight in the opening round of the $130,000 Canadian open tennis championships.

title: Penny Measure Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (Reuter's)  The House Rules Committee has cleared for floor action a bill authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury to increase the amount of zinc in the penny if necessary to in sure an adequate supply if copper is no longer considered practicable.

title: Ryan Foresees 20StrikeOut Record Within Sight
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 13 (UPI)  Nolan Ryan, who went into the record books with 19 strikeouts last night, predicted today that mark could be broken at any time.

title: Crowd in Newark Protests Loss of Youth Corps Jobs
description: NEWARK, Aug. 13Between 250 and 300 poor youths and their parents converged on City Hall today to press for the re turn of their foreshoriened summer jobs and for back pay they contended was still owed them.

title: TALKS ON CYPRUS COLLAPSE
description: GENEVA, Wednesday, Aug. 14The Cyprus peace talks broke down here early this morning, creating the threat of a new outbreak of fighting between Greek Cypriote and Turkish troops on the Island.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Total business inventories continued to rise strongly in June, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: American Exchange Reports a Deficit
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday an operating loss of $805,000 for the second quarter and a firsthalf loss of $218,000. It lost $615,000 in the quarter a year ago and $722,000 in the first half.

title: Evers and ExWife Accused on Taxes
description: JACKSON, Miss. Aug. 13Mayor Charles Evers of Fayette, who took over the leadership of the civil rights movement in Mississippi after his brother Medgar was slain in 1963, was indicted today by a Federal grand jury here on charges of evading taxes on $159,000 in personal income over a threeyear period.

title: Wrong Prayer Wheels
description: The gunning down of a smalltime gangster in the basement of a Brooklyn house of worship should end, once and for all, the hypocrisy that allows religious institutions and the Police Department to look the other way at socalled charity gambling. Las Vegas Nites have no place in New Yorkespecially when the mob runs and receives the biggest cut of the charity from congregants.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROTONDA, Fla., Aug. 13 (AP)Bob Seagren, the pole vaulter, clinched his third straight appearance in Superstars competition today by winning three of five qualifying events and finishing second in a fourth event.

title: Blast Wrecks Patrol Cars
description: OXFORD, Miss., Aug. 13 (UPI)  Two city patrol cars were demolished today by an explosion in front of the Oxford police station. Police Chief Billy White said he could offer no explanation for the mysterious predawn blast. He said there had been no threatening phone calls or other troubles.

title: FRIENDS SAY FORD PLANS RACE IN 76
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Several of President Ford's closest political associates said today that he had already decided, tentatively at least, to seek a full Presidential term two years from now.

title: KISSINGER CONFERS WITH FAHMY AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy of Egypt discussed Middle East political issues with Secretary of State Kissinger again today as other Egyptian and United States officials considered ways to attract foreign investment to Egypt and to meet her requirements for grain.

title: The Bank on 42d Street
description: Calling it a dump the city would be better off without, our neighbor the Franklin Savings Bank plans demolish its substantial 1901 Yorke and Sawyer building at Eighth Avenue and 42nd Street with the avowed intention of making the block more attractive to speculator. The dump has sculptured bronze doors valued at $35,000 and fixtures that will go to the Brooklyn Museum, arched windows, vaulted ceilings and solid cutstone facades. It also has something increasingly rare in this and other cities: quality of structure and validity of style.

title: Sutton Backs Clark for Senator as a Rights Advocate
description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan endorsed Ramsey Clark for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator yesterday, saying that in terms of experience, compassion and integrity he was by miles the best qualified candidate.

title: Population Boom and Food Shortage:World Losing Fight for Vitalilalance
description: A world fragmented by differences in race, religion and social and economic conditions is at last taking cognizance of one of its most fundamental common problems: population.

title: Las Vegas Nites Face Study on Mob Influence
description: The office of the Brooklyn District Attorney, Eugene Gold, and the police are investigating possible infiltration by organized crime of gambling Las Vegas Nite games in Brooklyn churches and synagogues.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: JOEL H. HUFF
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 13 (AP) Joel H. Huff, assistant managing editor of The Atlanta Journal, died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 57 years old.

title: U.S. IS REPLACING ENVOY TO ATHENS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 13The White House announced today that Henry J. Tasca would be replaced as Washington's Ambassador to Athens.

title: Sanok's 144 Paces Qualifiers in Jersey
description: WAYNE, N.J., Aug. 13Chet Sanok of Upper Montclair, who won his fourth state amateur championship, this year, posted a 7173 144 today to lead the seven New Jerseyans who qualified for the United States Amateur championship.

title: Bar Meeting Fails to Act On Nixon Immunity Issue
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 13  An attempt to put the American Bar Association on record as opposing special legal treatment for former Presideht Richard M. Nixon failed today when the nation's largest organization of lawyers could not muster a quorum for a business meeting.

title: Dime Store Bargains Aren't New, but Now They Look Good, Too
description: A woman who has spent most of her life worrying about the ins and outs of fashion observed recently that it was now practically chic to be poor.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Decision Delayed on Closing of Tombs

title: Giants Check In but Gregory Holds Out
description: The New York Giants welcomed some of their biggest names into camp yesterday, but they won't see their defensive giant, Jack Gregory, until after the National Football League strike is settled, if then.

title: Relentless Rhythm Is Pulling Tucker Band Out of Doldrums
description: Over the last year, the Marshall Tucker Band has come out of the bottomofthebill shadows to gain a large, fiercely dedicated New York following, if Monday's Schaefer Music Festival concert in Central Park is any indication. It's not hard to see whyMr. Tucker's men are right for these times.

title: UNITED AIR PROFIT ROSE 21% IN JULY
description: United Air Lines, a wholly owned subsidiary of UAL, Inc., reported yesterday consoldiated net earnings of $13.9million in July, up 21 per cent from $11.5million in the same month a year ago.

title: People and Business Institutional Disclosure Backed
description: Legislation to require banks, insurance and trust companies, brokers, investment firms, charitable endowment funds and pension funds to make quarterly reports of their securities holdings and trades was supported yesterday by the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: AMEX RETREATS IN QUIET SESSION
description: President Ford's message to Congress provided no spark to trading on the American Stock Exchange or the overthecounter market yesterday as prices retreated along a broad front, in light trading.

title: GIBSON TO ASK FORD FOR A PLAN ON CITIES
description: NEWARK, Aug. 13 (UPI)Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson said today that he and 13 other Mayors planned to ask President Ford tomorrow not to forget the plight of the nation's cities.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 29

title: Ford Gets Recommendations for a Vice President
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 George Bush of Texas and Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York were the talk of the Capitol today as House and Senate Republicans submitted their VicePresidential recommendations for President Ford's consideration tomorrow.

title: Advertising: The Jumping Man
description: The Jumping Man, who danced his way into the hearts of millions of purchasers of men's socks with his antics all around a room, is coming back to life.
