title: U.S. Backs Turks in Cyprus But Warns Against a War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Thee State Department said today that the United States support ed Turkey's desire for a greater degree of autonomy for the Turkish community in Cyprus, but warned that any resort to direct military action by Turkey or Greece at this time would be regarded as unjustified.

title: 3Year Cab Pact Reached; Fleets Ask 25% Fare Rise
description: The city's taxifleet owners reached a tentative threeyear agreement with the Taxi Drivers Union early yesterday, four hours after the deadline for, a contract termination, and immediately asked the City Taxi and Limousine Commission for a 25 per cent fare increase.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: FORD NOW FACING VIETNAM DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13In their first official foreignpolicy briefings, Presidents Eisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson and Nixon were told that Indochina would be their most serious headache and that immediate decisions would be required.

title: Tropical Storm Off Trinidad
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Aug. 13 (UPI)Alma, the first tropical storm of the season was discovered with 55mileanhour winds east of Trinidad today, and a hurricane watch was posted in the outlying islands. At 3 P.M. the San Juan weather bureau centered the storm 450 miles east of Trinadad and 975 miles southeast of Puerto Rico.

title: Goldwater Is Opposed By Arizona Feminists
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Aug. 13 (UPI)  Feminists in his home state are demanding that Senator Barry Goldwater be eliminated from consideration for Vice President because he joked that a woman's place was doing the cooking, even a woman Vice President.

title: Up the Meter
description: The city's taxicab fleets have finally concluded new agreement with their unionized drivers; now they present the bill to New Yorkers in the form of demand for a 25 per cent boost in fares. The wisdom with which the city's Taxi and. Limousine Commission rules on that demand will represent a definitive test of its worth as a guardian of the public interest.

title: JOHN D. M'GRATH
description: John D. McGrath, a retired Westchester County realestate broker, died on Monday in Scarboro, Me. He was 87 years old and lived at 160 Greenridge Avenue in White Plains.

title: U.S. Mortgage Rate Up to Record 9.5%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP)  The Government announced today that it was raising the ceiling on federally insured home mortgages for the third time since May, this time increasing the maximum interest rate to a record 9.5 per cent.

title: NAVY BID TO MAKE LOAN TO GRUMMAN BEATEN IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13The Senate rejected today the Navy's $100million loan agreement with the Grumman Aerospace Corporation to continue production of the F14 fighter plane.

title: ULSTER BOOBY TRAP KILLS TWO SOLDIERS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 13  Two British soldiers were killed near the border with the Irish Republic today by a boobytrap hidden in a military observation post.

title: Conferees Agree on a Rise In G.I. Education Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 More than two million Vietnam veterans would receive a substantial increase in educational benefits under an agreement reached today by House and Senate conferees.

title: 61 Ecuador Stowaways Seized As Freighter Docks in Brooklyn
description: Sixtyone jobhunting Ecuadorians who had stowed away in refrigerated holds were taken into custody yesterday when the Prudential Lines' Santa Elena docked in Brooklyn from South Americathe largest number of stowaways that immigration and customs officials could ever remember on a, single ship in at least 30 years.

title: SIMON SEES HOPE ON GAS PRICE CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (UPI) Treasury Secretary William E. Simon said today the price of gasoline could soon drop six or seven cents a gallon, under certain conditions.

title: BIAS IN MONTCLAIR IS SAID TO PERSIST
description: MONTCLAIR, Aug. 13Operation Push in New Jersey charged today that this towns administration was continuing to discriminate against people of minority groups in the Police and Fire Departments despite an order by the State Civil Rights Division to end the bias.

title: Banks Trial Recessed
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 13 (UPI)The Wounded Knee trial was recessed today to allow a defendant, Dennis Banks to travel to Kenora, Ont., to prevent a potentially bloody confrontation between Canadian officials and Indians holding a park. Crown Attorney Paul Williams had asked that Mr. Banks be allowed to act as a mediator.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: THOROUGHBRED STALLIONRich Wine, No. 6110092, foaled 3/23/61 by Alcibldes 2nd out of Any Day by Citation. Proven can deliver. $2000 (516) 887.5885

title: Margaret McKellar Dies
description: Margaret McKellar, executive secretary of the Whitney Museum of American Art, died Monday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L.I. She was 62 years old and lived at 17 Roxbury Road in Garden City, L.I.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: THOROUGHBRED STALLIONRich win., No. 6110092, foaled 3/23/61 by Aicibides 2nd out of Any Day by Citation Proven can deliver. $2000 (516) 8875885

title: Russ Stewart, 65, Officer Of Field Enterprises, Dies
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Aug. 13 (AP)Russ Stewart, a retired vice president of Field Enterprises, Inc., of Chicago drowned yesterday while fishing near his home, here, He was 65 years old.

title: Chamberlain a WalkOn in Stokes Game
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 13Wilt Chamberlain and Dave DeBusschere, who between them spent 25 seasons in pro basketball as outstanding players with high salaries, are on the opposite side of the fence these days as part of management.

title: Stocks Continue Drop
description: The stock market continued to decline yesterday in response to more signs that the economy is slowing while prices are rising as fast as ever.

title: 4 Climbers Killed in Alps
description: ZERMATT, Switzerland, Aug. 13 (AP)  Two Austrian and two West German mountain climbers were killed in the Matterhorn region yesterday, the police reported today. The Austrians fell after they had ignored a guide's warning to avoid a dangerous route up the 14,701foot Matterhorn. The Germans fell while trying to scale 13,787foot Mt. Rimpfischhorn.

title: Thruway Death Toll Drops
description: ALBANY, Aug. 13 (UPI)Fatal accidents on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway dropped from 51 in the first six months of 1973 to 16 for the first half of this year, thruway Chairman R. Burdell Bixby reported today. The fatal, accident rate of 0.96 per 100 million miles traveled was the lowest since 1958, when the full year rate was 0.92, Mr. Bixby said.

title: Archdiocese Backs Priests In Refusal to Baptize Infant
description: BOSTON, Aug. 13 (AP)The action of the two Marlboro priests who refused to baptize an infant was defended yesterday by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston.

title: 2 OF 4 WHO ESCAPED PRISON ARE CAUGHT
description: COVE CITY, N.C., Aug, 13 (UPI)Two of the four convicts who crashed out of Federal prison in a garbage truck last week surrendered tonight after a brief gunfight with the police. A hunt continued for the other two. The four fugitives were believed to be the bandits who robbed the Cove City branch of the Bank of North Carolina earlier in the day.

title: Standard Time Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) The House Commerce Committee approved today a return ?? standard time for four months of the year. The measure, cleared for House action, would require moving clock's back an hour on the last Sunday of October and moving them forward an hour on the last Sunday in February.

title: Bridge:
description: Inexperienced players are often bewildered by the advice they are given in the area of opening leads. Never lead a singleton trump, they are told, or never underlead an ace against a suit contract.

title: Wilt Gets Ovation, Plays in Stokes Game
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 13Wilt Chamberlain and Dave DeBusschere, who between them spent 25 seasons in pro basketball as outstanding players with high salaries, are on the opposite side of the fence these days as part of management.

title: Net Up at Carnation, Procter & Gamble And Norton Simon
description: The Procter & Gamble Company, a leading manufacturer of soap, detergents, toiletries, food and paper products, posted record results for the fourth quarter and year ended June 0, the company announced yesterday.

title: Ford Gets Recommendations for a Vice President
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 George Bush of Texas and Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York were the talk of the Capitol today as House and Senate Republicans submitted their VicePresidential recommendations for President Ford's consideration tomorrow.

title: NEW GROUP SEEKS MASSTRANSIT AID
description: A businesslabor caucus that would be emulated in cities around the nation to descend on Washington in behalf of masstransit legislation was put on display yesterday at City Hall.

title: School Budget Finally Winn
description: PLAINVIEW, L.I., Aug. 13Voters in the PlainviewOld Bethpage School District tonight approved a school budget of $25,047,222 with a tax rate of $17.40. The vote was 3,110 to 2,721. It was the third attempt by the district to have school budget approved for next year. Two previously proposed school budgets were defeated.

title: Israelis Shell Palestinians in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 13Israeli gunboats shelled a Palestinian refugee camp on the coast of southern Lebanon today, reportedly killing one civilian and wounding five.

title: Wolfpack Quintet Wins
description: MANILA, Aug. 13 (AP)North Carolina State's basketball team, led by David Thompson's 47 points, swept a fourgame series in the Philippines with a 12493 victory tonight over a Filipino national team. The Wolfpack, the 197374 national college champion, will continue its sixnation swing through Asia in Taipei, Taiwan, tomonow.

title: State Acts to End Neglect In Mental Halfway Homes
description: No more proprietary homes for released mental patients will be licensed in New York City by the State Board Social Welfare as part of a crackdown that will include warnings and even the revocation of licenses of homes that fail to maintain programs for their residents. warnings and even the revocation of licenses of homes that fail to maintain programs for their residents.

title: Three Women Deacons Tell Why They Became Priests
description: When the Rev. Carter Heyward was distributing crommunion at Riverside Church last January as an Episcopal deacon, a young priest kneeling in front of her at the altar sipped the wine arid at the same time drew his fingernails across her band on the chalice, drawing Wood, I hope you burn in hell, he told her.

title: Population Boom and Food Shortage: World Losing Fight for Vital Balance
description: A world fragmented by differences in race, religion and social and economic conditions is at last taking cognizance of one of its most fundamental common problems: population.

title: Red Smith
description: The telephone rang in the football player's office and a feminine voice said: Ken Bowman, attorney at law. No, the voice said, Mr. Bowman was not at his desk, he was working out. It developed, however, that the veteran center was not in the Green Bay Packers' training camp in DePere, Wis., but was exercising by himself, as he and six other players on the negotiating committee had done in Washington before talks were suspended last weekend. They would take turns doing twohour hitches at the bargaining table, take off for a spot of physical culture and return to the interminable haggling. There was no point in Bowman's reporting to camp yesterday, for he would have to check out this evening and go back to Washingtonfor tomorrow's resumption of talks. The hetting in this corner is that the next round of discussions will be even less productive than those in the first 43 days of the strike. If the owners and their negotiators run true to form, they will assume that the battle was won when the players entered camp for a twoweek armistice and will deem it no longer necessary to give the appearance of bargaining in good faith. This attitude is reflected in a remark attributed to Wellington Mara of the New York Giants when the ceasefire was arranged:

title: A Fleet Driver's Night: Aiming for a $40 Meter
description: When Leslie H. Koerner pulled his bright yellow Dodge taxi away from the Belmore Cafeteria at 2 A.M. yesterday, the 30yearold fleet driver was hungry for fares.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: The Return of the Native
description: ATHENSI have written in the past that Constantine Caramanlis was Greece's best statesman since Pericles and worst politician since Alcibiades. What I meant was that he had run a firstclass Government from 1955 to 1963 but then had gone abroad in a huff when he lost power, instead of staying to lead the parliamentary opposition. The second part of my analysis has happily been proven wrong. Caramanlis won his way back to the top.

title: State Jury Is Investigating Brunswick Garbage Work
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13 (AP) The statewide grand jury that recently indicted New Jersey Secretary of State has subpoenaed records pertaining to garbage contracts for New Brunswick, East Brunswick and South Brunswick over the last nine years, sources close to the investigation said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The danger of new fighting between Turkish and Greek Cypriote forces on, the, island increased with the breakdown of peace talks. in Geneva. Britain's Foreign Secretary James' Callaghan blamed Turkish refusal of a 36hour recess to let Greek and Greek Cypriote delegates consult their governments: on the Turkish plan for autonomy in six separate cantons for Turkish Cypriotes. [1:8.]

title: Low Crop Predictions Surprise the Industry
description: Agricultural economists and food industry spokesmen reacted with surprise over the latest gloomy crop predictions by the Department of Agriculture, and most said the situation was becoming very serious.

title: Ford to See Long and Mills, Congressional Leaders on Health Insurance Bili
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13With th active support of Preident Ford, the prospects that a national health insurance program will be enacted this year appear to have increased, although a few Congressional leaders said today that the out come was still doubtful.

title: Sets Are Beaten By Triangles, 2522
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Aug. 13 The Pittsburgh Triangles, already assured of a playoff berth in the World Team Tennis playoffs, made a late surge at the Nassau Coliseum tonight before 7,319 spectators to beat the New York Sets, 2522.

title: Palmer Makes Comeback In 82 Oriole Triumph
description: His back was sore, his shoulder stiff and one of his fingers was slightly blistered, but Jim Palmer went out last night and pitched his first game since June 16, and the Baltimore Orioles are talking pennant again.

title: FORD SEES MEANY; ASKS UNIONS' HELP IN INFLATION FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13President Ford, seeking to get a grip on the nation's economy, turned today to the problems of wages and jobs, meeting separately with George Meany, the labor leader, and with Peter J. Brennan, the Secretary, of Labor.

title: The Healing Art
description: President Ford is proving a tonic for a nation weary of deceit and arrogance in high place. His televised appearance before a joint session of Congress carried forward the refreshing sense he gave at his swearingin of a leader open not only in manner but in receptivity to new ideas for tackling the nation's problems and for banishing the spirit of Big Brother from government.

title: Turkish Planes Resume Hostilities With Dawn Air Attack on Nicosia
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Wednesday, Aug. 14Turkish forces resumed hostilities early this morning with an air attack on Nicosia following the collapse of the Geneva peace talks.

title: Concert
description: Lukas Foss made a reputation as an expert performer of Mozart's piano concertos. And, as Monday night's Mostly Mozart program at Avery Fisher Hall made clear, he retains his affinity for the composer.

title: Albert Parker, 87, Director And Actors' Representative
description: Albert Parker, a Hollywood director and for many years an actors' representative in England, died Saturday at his home in London. His age was 87.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BAYONNE, Aug. 13This city of 75,000 inhabitants, known chiefly as a center for the oilrefining industry of the eastern United States, has taken on an aura of international festivity.

title: Vice Presidential Duties
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13In his first few days in office, President Ford has touched off an explosion of common sense in Washington. He's not waiting for the Congress to cut the Presidency down to size. He's lopping off the grandeur and keeping the dignity, and turning the old Nixon enemies list into a company of friends.

title: Brown Tops Nastase at Canada Net
description: TORONTO, Aug. 13 (AP)Bill Brown of Ohaha, ranked 44th in the United States, upset, Illie Nastase of Rumania, 61, 61, tonight in the opening round of the $130,000 Canadian open tennis championships.

title: CHURCH MEETING IN JAKARTA OFF
description: BERLIN, Aug. 13The World Council of Churches, faced with protests by Indonesian Moslem leaders, has decided against going ahead with plans to hold its fifth general assembly in the Indonesian, capital next year.

title: Conferees Agree on a Rise In G.I. Education Benefits
description: WASHINGTON Aug. More than two million Vietnam veterans would receive substantial increase in educational benefits under art agree ment reached today by House and Senate conferees.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: UPTOWN JAZZ In the general migration of jazz to the upper West Side, a movement that's gathered momentum in the last few years, a tiny place called Stryker's Pub, at 103 West 86th Street (8748754), has stood out with distinction. Only a year ago, Stryker's had music exclusively on weekends. Now there's jazz Wednesday through Sunday, and a good sized crowd enmost night.

title: Vigorous Playing Buoys Waterfront Moby Dick
description: The South Street TheateronthePier's weekend production of Moby Dick is far and away the best achievement of this enterprising crew, now in its fourth summer. Compressed into 90 minutes, with the massive bulk and metaphysical depths of the whaling classic at least suggested by imaginative staging and vigorous playing, this is superb minidrama, eerily at home on the old waterfront. Reservations can be made at 3494310.

title: CIGARETTES' SALES UP BY 4% FOR YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 13 (AP)  The Federal Trade Commission reported today cigarette sales in 1973 increased 4 per cent over the previous year, the largest rise in 10 years. More significantly, it said, the sale of lowtar cigarettes rose 40 per cent in the same period.

title: XRay Telescope Is Lofted To Study the. Crab Nebula
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug, 13 (AP)  Scientists working in Canada launched an Xray telescope with a giant balloon today to study the Crab Nebula, one of the most colorful stellar outbursts.

title: Portugal Bays Personnel In GuineaBissau May Stay
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 13The Portuguese representative at the United Nations said today that the 20,000 Portuguese troops still in GuineaBissau included doctors and troops of engineers building roads, while wives of younger officers were serving as teachers.

title: Stage: Alfred the Great
description: BOSTON, Aug. 13Israel Horovitz is a puzzling American dramatist. His work has varied from that naturalistic essay in violence The Indian Wants the Bronx, to such surreal fantasies as Rats. Generally he has seemed most comfortable in shorter pieces  preferring, perhaps, the quick sketch to the deeper portrait.

title: Yank Errors Help A's Win On Coast, 61
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 13 The champion Oakland Athletics, who have many strings to their bow, used their running weapon tonight to defeat the New York Yankees, 61, behind Ken Holtzman's sevenhit pitching.

title: Medalist Advances in Seattle Golf
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 13 (AP)Debbie Massey, the medalist, and threetime winner, Anne Sander, passed their firstround tests today in the 74th United States women's amateur golf championship.

title: Stalled Strike Shocks Tannen of Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 13 When Steve Tannen heard about the players' association decision to send the strikers into their training camps, his feelings were  to say the least  incredulous.

title: White House Utility Parley Is Put Off
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 A White House conference called to encourage state utility commissions to give swift rate increases to power companies was postponed today, in part because officials felt that the conference would appear to conflict with President Ford's fight against inflation.

title: Equity Stress View Unlike Nixonomics
description: How will President Ford do as an economic policy maker compared with President Nixon? He won't do worse, said one top Washington official shortly before Mr. Ford delivered his address at the joint session of Congress this week. And it is already clear that Mr. Ford does not intend to be bound by the set of economic policiesor policy advisershe inherited from his predecessor.

title: Mrs. Ford Tours the White House and Likes It as It Is
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13As any new homeowner will, Betty Ford carefully checked the closet space, the color: schemes and, after nearly two hours, said: I'm thrilled at the thought of moving in. It is in excellent condition.

title: CYPRUS FIGHTING RESUMES AS PEACE TALKS COLLAPSE; U.N. CALLED INTO SESSION
description: Fighting resumed in Cyprus at about midnight last night shortly after peace talks broke down in Geneva. Britian immediately called for an emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council in New York.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: To the Editor: Your July 31 editorial Clean Air? Hot Air regrettably continues The Times' endeavor to equate cleaner air with increased financial burdens on motorists.

title: Edward Gucleman, 67, Banker And ExCommerce Aide, Dead
description: Edward Gudeman, an investment banker who was Under Secretary of Commerce in the Administration of President Kennedy, died Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived in Sarasota, Fla.

title: State Law Will Offer Disabled a Better Future
description: The couple who strolled into an Upper East side bar one night recently were respectably dressed and had money in their pockets, but the bartender, they say, refused to let them sit at the bar because he thought it would be bad for business. The couple were blind.

title: A 3,200YearOld City Is Uncovered in Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 13 (AP)American archeologists have uncovered the ruins of a 3,200yearold city, Hisban, Jordanian officials announced today.

title: Soap Box Derby Nears
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 13 (AP) Entrants in the grand prix of gravity racing, the AllAmerican Soap Box Derby, arrive here tomorrow to prepare for the 37th annual downhill speed race. The derby is trying to recover from the scandal that surrounded the discovery of an electromagnetic device in the nose of the winning car last year. The driver, James Gronen of Boulder, Colo., was disqualified.

title: Prices of Bonds Drift Lower In Session of Light Trading
description: The credit markets gave President Ford's call for a determined fight on inflation lukewarm reception yesterday. Prices tended to drift lower on fixed  income securities in light dealings.

title: Ford Pledge on Inflation Widely Praised Abroad
description: President Ford's pledge to continue the foreign policies of the Nixon Administration and to fight inflation as Public Ehemy No. 1 drew many expressions of satisfaction around the world yesterday.

title: Ill. State Names Schmakel
description: NORMAL, Ill., Aug. 13 (AP)Warren Schmakel, 52, years old, athletic director and former head football coach at Boston University, was named athletic director today at Illinois State University.

title: Amnesty for Nixon: Views For and Against
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13No amnesty for Nixon. The bumper stickers have already started to appear, blue letters on a white background, theirs message harsh and unequivocal. Lawyers and politicians and ordinary citizens alike are speaking out with a similar message. The pressure is understandable, for there are good arguments in favor of prosecuting Richard M. Nixon.

title: State Acts to End Neglect In Mental Hallway Homes
description: No more proprietary homes for released mental patients will be licensed in New York City by the State Board Social Welfare as part of a crackdown that will include

title: Fund Rise in School Bill Called a Worry for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 13President Ford offered both an olive branch and a warning when he told the joint session of Congress last night that he would sign into law a bill on massive school.

title: 61 Ecuador Stowaways Seized As Freighter Docks in Brooklyn
description: Sixtyone jobhunting Ecuadorans who had stowed away in refrigerated holds were taken into custody yesterday when, the Prudential Lines' Santa Elena docked in Brooklyn from South Americathe largest number of stowaways that immigration and customs officials could ever remember on a single ship in at least 30 years.

title: House Votes 3 Bills On Appropriations; Cuts $444Million
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) The House passed today in quick succession appropriations totaling $13.35  billion for five Government departments and score of lesser agencies.

title: Mets Beat Dodgers on 4Hitter By Matlack, Grote Homer, 30
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers are bringing out the best in the Mets. That's a feat this season, because the skills of the defending national, League champions have been lying rather dormant.

title: Mrs. Ford, After Tour, Calls White House Nice
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13As any new homeowner will, Betty Ford carefully checked the closet space, the color schemes and, after nearly two hours, said: I'm thrilled at the thought of moving in. It is in excellent condition.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Thousands of Subway Riders Flee Safely From Fire in Rush Hour
description: Thousands of subway riders were briefly trapped beneath Eighth Avenue during the rush hour yesterday morning after a fire forced two IND trains to a halt between the 42d and 34th Street stations.

title: Film Studios Try New Route to Public
description: Quietly, without any undue publicity, Hollywood's major studios, influenced by the surprise success of maverick producers, are examining new ways of getting their films to the public. In a related move, they are also making demographic studies of moviegoers.

title: RUTH H. FISHER
description: Ruth Harrison Fisher, for many years a member of the dance team of Harrison & Fisher, with her husband, Alex Fisher, died apparently of a coronary attack, at her home, 158 West 58th Street, on Monday. She was about 60 years old.

title: PLAYBOY, PENTHOUSE BACK IN PHARMACY
description: Playboy and Penthouse magazines are back on the shelves of the Medical Center Pharmacy in Livingston after a 19 month absence as a result of an aboutface lilting by the State Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Samuel Barber's operatic version of Shakespeare's Antony and Cleopatra, comrnissioned and produced for the opening night of the Metropolitan Opera's new home at Lincoln Center on Sept. 16, 1966, will be revived for the first time by the Juilliard American Opera Center next winter. Its initial staging by Franco Zeffirelli was highly controversial and was said to have contributed to the poor reception the opera received.

title: Navy Cost Expert Scores Trident Submarine Contract; Aspin Seeks Inquiry
description: The Navy's action last month in signing a $285.4million contract for the first of its Trident missile submarines was taken despite protests from its outspoken director of procurement control, Gordon W. Rule, that the price was phony and that. Pentagon directives were being flouted.

title: Mrs. Sander Advances in Seattle Golf
description: SEATTLE, Wash., Aug. 14 (UPI)Anne Quest Sander, a threetime winner, relied on her putter today for another easy victory, while Carol Semple, the defending champion, was pushed to the final hole before gaining the thirdround final of the United States women's amateur, golf championships.

title: The WoadWatchers
description: WASHINGTONIn Cottondale, Ala., I. Willis Russell, professor emeritus of the University of Alabama, sifts through newspapers and magazines looking for new words, or new uses of old words. He is the dean of Americe's wordwatchers.

title: Dr. Bert Loewenberg Is Dead;Sarah Lawrence Historian, 69
description: Dr. Bert James Loewenberg, a wellknown Darwin scholar and a member of the Sarah Lawrence College history faculty from 1942 to his retirement in 1971, died Tuesday at his home in Orange, Conn. His. age was 69.

title: SEOUL PRESIDENT ESCAPES ASSASSIN
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thursday, Aug. 15An unknown assailant tried to assassinate President Park Chung Hee of South Korea this morning as he delivered a national day address. The President was not hurt.

title: Gimbel Brothers Doubles Earnings; Others Report
ONEDAY BOYCOTT BY LAWYERS ENDS
description: Legal Aid Society lawyers returned to work in Brooklyn Criminal Court yesterday after a daylong boycott.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Chancellor Ernest L. Boyer of the State University announced in Albany that the university would send 10 studentssix women and four mento study for a semester at the State Institute of Foreign Languages in Moscow. As part of the exchange program, 10 Russian students are scheduled to arrive next week for study at the State University of Albany. The American students will leave Sept. 11 for Moscow.

title: Golden Gate Traffic Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO (UPI) Traffic on the Golden Gate Bridge has decreased in the last fiscal year for the first time since World War II. The bridge general manager, Dale W. Luehring, said that the 32,824,780 vehicles that crossed the span in the year ended June 30 was a 5.19 per cent decrease from the previous year, and was about the same as traffic in 1970. He said that the decrease was due to a combination of the energy crisis and the bridge district's mass transit activities.

title: London Gold Price Up $5.75 an Ounce; Stocks Off Sharply
description: LONDON, Aug. 14The renewed fighting on Cyprus and continuing anxieties over world economic trends brought speculative buying of gold on the London bullion market today, while the stock market plummeted to another 19year low.

title: Indefinite Delay in Trial Is Requested by Haldeman
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI) Contending that the public has been so poisoned against him that no jury would find him not guilty of Watergate crimes, H. R. Haldeman asked today that the coverup trial in which he is a defendant be delayed indefinitely.

title: Primary Residency Rule Is Struck Down by Court
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 14 (AP)State Supreme Court Justice Leonard Rubenfeld has ruled unconstitutional a provision of the state election law on residency requirements for voting in primary elections.

title: Major Declines in Oil Prices Doubted
description: There are signs of weakness in oil product prices around the world but energy experts doubt that these declines which have been small so far will grow to major reductions in petroleum costs. These are the ingredients in a confused situation:

title: People and Business Greenspan Picks Women to Operate Firm
description: While he will be toiling with the nation's economy as chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers, Alan Greenspan has decided to leave his own economic consulting firm, TownsendGreenspan & Co., in the hands of an executive committee of three women. The three are M. Kathryn Eickhoff, vice president and treasurer, Bess Kaplan, a vice president, andLucille Wu, also a vice president. All are seasoned hands with the consulting firm. A former fulltime associate, Judith Mackey, has also agreed to return to the firm in consulting capacity.

title: Contract Awards
description: The LTV Aerospace Corporation has received a $45.7million contract from the United States Navy for procurement of A7 attack aircraft.

title: ATTORNEY GENERAL
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams was endorsed for this nomination by the New York State Young. Democrats. It said he had the most effective programs for scrutinizing the telephone, electric and gas monopolies and protecting other consumer interests.

title: Marine Midland Will Raise Stake in ParisBased Bank
description: PARIS, Aug. 14 (Reuters)The Marine Midland Bank, New York, has been authorized by the Federal Reserve Board to raise, participation in the capitl of the Parisbased merchant bank InterunionBanque, S. A. to 45 per cent from 19.4 per cent, InterunionBanque said today.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: IMPEACHMENT UNIT DRAFTS ITS REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 For more than two years, President Nixon engaged in deliberate, repeated and continued deception of the American people about the Watergate case, according to the draft of the House Judiciary Committee's final report on impeachment.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Giants' Training Is Refreshed By the Grunts of Experience
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Aug. 14  There were these developments today as the New York Giants training camp took on new life in its 36th day of operation:

title: BATTLE AT NICOSIA
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Thursday, Aug. 15Turkish forces, which began a heavy air and ground attack early yesterday, appeared today to be on their way toward seizing control of much of northern Cyprus.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BASKING RIDGE, Aug. 14Consistency and competitiveness are the trademarks of Bill Scarlett's success in tennis.

title: Ford's Aides Say He Seeks Decentralization of Power
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 14  President Ford wants the power of the White House dispersed. He wants it to be more widely shared with Government agencies and departments and with Congress. That is the impression gained today from conversations with several of the President's closest advisers, including members of the team that is studying the problems of transition ifrom one Administration to another.

title: PRICE RISES SET BY UNIROYAL TIRE
description: The Uniroyal Tire Company, a division of Uniroyal, Inc., announced yesterday price increases on tires and tubes ranging from 2.5 to 10 percent. The new prices go into effect today. New passenger tire prices for the replacement market include an average of 9.6 per cent for size E and smaller, while some ?? of larger tires will rise 2.5 to 5 per cent, the company said in Detroit. All passenger tubes swill be increased 10 per cent.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Scudder Fund Formed
description: The formation Of Scudder Managed Reserves, a cash management fund emphasizing certificates of deposit, was announced here yesterday by Scudder, Stevens and Clark, an investment counseling firm with more than $5billion ?? vestments under management.

title: GASOLINE OUTPUT IS ALLEGEDLY CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI) Representative James J. Howard, Democrat of New Jersey, charged today that the nation's major oil companies had cut back gasoline production to maintain gasoline prices.

title: Dickering Marks Bergen Mall Antiques Fair
description: PARAMUS, Aug. 14 It's difficult to tell who is doing the better part of the buying at the antiques fair in the Bergen Mall, which opened here yesterday.

title: HAROLD G. BROWN
description: Harold G. Brown, a retired New York stockbroker, died yesterday in Princeton (N.J.) Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived near Lambertville, N. J.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 15, 1974

title: 0.2% RISE IS NOTED IN MARKET BASKET
description: Led by a sharp increase in the price of meat, food prices rose 0.2 per cent last week, according to the Department of Consumer of Affairs.

title: LowYield Nuclear Device Exploded in Nevada Desert
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (Reuters) The United States exploded a nuclear device in the Nevada desert today, its third announced weaponsrelated test this year, the Atomic Energy Commission said.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP)The Atomic Energy Commission has recommended that restrictions on the enrichment of foreign uranium for use in domestic American nuclear power plants be relaxed starting in 1977.

title: Baer Says Witness Backs His Account Of Beating on Farm
description: TRENTON, Aug. 14 (AP) Assemblyman Anthony M. Baer siad today that he had produced eyewitness testimony supporting his complaint of being assulted while inspecting South Jersey farm last month.

title: U.S. Urges a CeaseFire And Resumption of Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14The United States, after failing in several days of diplomacy to persuade Turkey not to renew hostilities on Cyprus, called today for an immediate ceasefire and resump. tion of peace talks.

title: Islands for Sale
description: The few unspoiled coastal barrier islands still left off South Carolina are in danger of going from wild, windblown marshland and beach, teeming with marine and bird life, to elaborate resort colonies, complete with mansions and golf courses. Of the 25 major islands, only four are still free of development or the threat of it.

title: SHOP TALK
description: When it comes to artistry and craftsmanship, anyone who wants to see the difference between articles made in Hong Kong and those created in mainland China can wander through Asian House, a handsome, balconied new furniture store on Seventh Avenue at 56th Street.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Despite increased price conformity in many areas of consumer buying, haggling (or bargaining, to be polite) ?? not dead, and even an ad??ertised sale price can be just a starting point for some plain talk between buyer and seller.

title: Kate O'Brien, Irish Playwright, Author of Many Novels, ls Dead
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (AP)Kate O'Brien, the Irish novelist and playwright, died yesterday in a hospital near her home in Faversham, Kent. She was 76 years old.

title: Coast. Caller Terms Blast Revenge for Two Shootings
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 14An anonymous caller, apparently the one who earlier took responsibility for the bomb blast last week at Los Angeles International Airport, telephoned local newspaper last night and said that the bomb had been revenge for the fatal shooting of two Mexican nationals by the police three years ago.

title: NADJARI'S INQUIRY CLEARS SCOPPETTA
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, said yesterday that no improper or criminal act had been committed by the city's Investigation Commissioner, Nicholas Scoppetta, in the controversy over two belated entries in the ledgers of the City Controller.

title: WHEAT FUTURES LOSE EARLY GAINS
description: Leftover buying orders from Tuesday pushed prices of wheat, soybeans and corn up their daily limits at the opening of trading yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Then prices of wheat and soybeans dropped quite sharply in a rush of selling, but corn stayed up the limit.

title: Oscar Nelson Jr. Weds Lucinda Porter
description: Lucinda Christian Porter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Porter of Syracuse, Skaneateles, N.Y., and Snow Hill, Md., was married at noon yesterday to Oscar Nelson Jr. of Lewisburg, W. Va.

title: Argentina Pushing Extensive Search For Marxist Band
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14 (UPI) Argentine Army units pursued Marxist guerrillas into the mountains near Tucumn Province today in a drive to wipe out a highly organized band.

title: Garcia,' a Film Portrait of Pessimism
description: From the deceptive tr??? quility of the first sho??? when ducks and swans gl??? Pas??? a very young pregnant woman who sits humming ??? the water's edge in a white dress-???to the frenzy wh??? erupts when her outra??? father (a Mexican aristocrat) offers a million dollars for the head of the man who ???pregnated her, Sam Peck???pah's "Bring Me the Head ??? Alfredo Garcia" begins ???liantly, especially because ??? the pacing. Knowing ??? when to speed the action ??? or slow it down, Mr. Peck???pah grabs our total attention. Then the movie disintegrates rapidly. "Garcia" opened ???terday at Cinerama, and ??? East 59th Street Twin 2 and the RKO 86th Street Twin 2 theaters.???ly, you fear for ??? hunted man-???above all because this is a Peckinpah picture. But it's quickly explained that Garcia is already ???-???of drunken drivi??? which seems about as ??? as dying of vic???. Without Garcia as ??? victim, the plot has almost ???where to go. Theref??? ???dom episodes are slung ??? the narrative, includ??? one of the silliest near-r??? scenes I've ever seen. The wo??? ??? supposed to welcome ???e, and the acting ??? ???h a phony lyricism: the ???ailant fo???s with her hair, ???ich inspires her to kiss ???. But even this gratuitous ???bage can't prevent the ???vie from dragging."Garcia" focuses on Ben???, (Warren Oates), an American obsessed with locating Garcia's corpse and pocketing the loot. He lurches through Mexico with a testy though super-submissive girlfriend (Isela Vega, a study in wood), who dissolves into sodden, doggy gratitude when he says he loves her.Bennie guns down anyone who gets in the way; often, ???seems to kill out of sheer ??? temper. Among the repetitive shoot-outs, there's one fine moment which re??? Mr. Peckinpah's best ??? after a large family ??? been wiped out at a roadside, one old man survives, his hands meekly raised while the murderers turn on one another and ignore the pa??? figure that's waiting to ???-???or die.Corpses are roughly treated throughout this movie: Bennie ??? a couple of shots into a ??? stiff "because it feels ??? goddam good!" Meanwhile ??? seems like a spoo??? on ???. After Garcia's grave is robbed, his severed head becomes the leading character in the picture. Bennie chats to it, pours booze on it, and it even gets a shower. When the thing is eventually brought to the christening of Garcia's newborn child, the camera dwells on the baby's head: a close-up that's repeated just in case you missed the point.The movie isn't as bloody as some of Mr. Peckinpah's others. Instead, it's profoundly pessimistic -??? because of the empasis on obscene acts committed merely for money. Bennie is momentarily made to rebel against the many deaths. But we can't believe him, since he had to kill all those people simply to flesh out this movie.Warren Oates is blustery, sometimes frantic, and Isela Vega gives the most awkward performance by an actress since Kerima played the primitive in "An Outcast of the Islands." Gig Young, Kris Kristofferson and Helmut Dantine are wasted in roles that give them little chance to act. But the movie's main problem is that the protagonist -??? the dead head -??? is a bore.

title: ROSELLA KUSHELL
description: Rosella W. Kushell, who had been a registered nurse in this city for more than 30 years, died yesterday at BeekmanDowntown Hospital. She was 80 years old and lived at 6940 108th Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: At Museo del Barrio, a Mission and a Sense of Fun
description: The Museo del Barrio at 1945 Third. Avenue, between 107th and 108th Streets, is not exactly besieged by visitors, from either midtown or downtown, but it is a place that I recommend to any openminded person. It was st p a year or two ago in what was formerly a kindergarten and now looks as if it might be a supermarket of a lively but rather secretive sort. It is painted outside in a brisk, jazzy, formalized sort of way that contrasts with the look of most other houses on that section of Third Avenue, and you can spot it from two blocks away as a place that is somehow exceptional.

title: What's The Story, Jerry?
description: The process of finding out little things about him began right away. On the morning of the day Gerald R. Ford was sworn into office, we were told in one of the first reports, the Presidentsosoontobe rose early, opened the front doer in his bathrobe to pick up the newspaper and then went back to cook breakfast for himself and one of his sons.

title: White House Says Tapes Are Nixon's Own Property
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14.The tape recordings that former President Nixon made of thousands of hours of conversations with aides, associates and advisers are his personal property and will be returned to his control, a White House spokesman said today.

title: SOYBEAN FARMERS SEE SIGNS OF HOPE
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 14When they left their parched soybean fields last week and headed south for a convention, Middle Western farmers had further refined the mutter, the grimace and the despairing head scratch in the artistry of gloom.

title: Royals, Irked by Smug A' s, Take It Out on Tigers
description: Jack McKeon, manager of the Kansas City Royals, was Miffed when he learned that the Oakland A's had begun accepting ticket, orders for the American League playoffs.

title: Nixon Said to Have Barred Any Bargains for Immunity
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 14 (AP)Before he resigned as President last week, Richard M. Nixon ordered his aides not to seek art, deals preventing his future prosecution, The Baltimore Sun said today.

title: NEW ESTIMATE PUT ON ROTHKO'S ART
description: Peter Selz, professor of art history at the University of California at Berkeley and former director of the university's art museum, testified yesterday in Surrogate's Court that the 100 paintings by Mark Rothko bought by the Marlborough Gallery for $1.8million were worth $4,038,000 when purchased in May, 1970.

title: Murray Chass
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 14.The black Cadillac limousine, rented at $14 an hour, pulled up in front of Tower on the Hofstra University campus, and professional football's highest paid player emerged from the rear seat. It was 1:15 P.M. and Joe Namath was ending his 44day strike for a better collective bargaining agreement for the workers of the National Football League. Unloading his belongings from the car's spacious trunk, Nainath carried a green equipment bag and some clothes into the New York Jets' training camp dormitory while Jimmy Walsh, his lawyer, toted a garment bag and a white equipment bag and the chauffeur (who declined to give his name because I don't want some people to know I'm driving this limousine) hauled a carton and a television set.

title: Not Very Big Earthquak Felt in Los Angeles County
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 14 (UPI) An earthquake that swayed tall buidings jolted parts of Los Angeles County today but apparently caused no damage.

title: BATTLE AT NICOSIA
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Thursday, Aug. 15Turkish forces, which began a heavy air and ground attack early yesterday, appeared, today to be on their way toward seizing control of much of northern Cyprus.

title: Galbreath Syndicates Star Colt
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 14The Sanford Stakes, associated with upset outcomes of varying degrees in its long history, produced another surprising result in its 61st running today. Sigmund Sommer's Ramahorn won the the race by a nose at a return of $35 for $2.

title: Sofia Reviews Spy's Appeal
description: VIENNA, Aug. 14 (Reuters) Bulgaria said today that the Supreme Court in Sofia was still considering the case of Heinrich Spetter, a Bulgarian economist and former United Nations employe whose appeal against a death sentence was reported yesterday to have been rejected.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The Winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: U.S. JESUITS' PARLEY ASSAILS SEOUL TRIALS
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 14The American Jesuit Missions Conference Way protested the arrest and conviction of the Most Rev. DanielChi Hak Soun and other South Korean churchmen, students and political leaders.

title: Judge Acquits 2 Charged In Wounded Knee Seizure
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Aug. 14 (UPI)Judge Warren K. Urbom of Federal District Court found two men not guilty today of charges stemming from the 72day Indian occupation of Wounded Knee, S.D.

title: CIBA IN AN ACCORD TO BUY FIBERITE
description: The CibaGeigy Corporation, a major pharmaceutical and specialty chemicals manufacturer, said yesterday that it had entered into an agreement to Purchase more than 90 per cent of the stock of the Fiberite Corporation at $41.08641 a share. Fiberite, which has its headquarters in Winona, Minn., manufactures plastic molding materials and laminates. There is a total of 900,541 shares of Fiberite outstanding, with the major Portion in the hands of one family, believed to be that of Budolph W. Miller, Fiberite's chairman.

title: Harlem Group Threatens Boycott Over City U. Job
description: A coalition representing minoritygroup workers in the Harlem area said yesterday that unless half the force employed in the construction of facilities on the north campus of City College was nonwhite, the job would not be permitted to begin.

title: A PostMortem on Geneva Talks
description: GENEVA, Aug. 14  The prospect of failure in the Cyprus peace talks became apparent to the British delegation on Monday when it became clear, as one source said, that the Turks were presenting an ultimatum and not negotiating.

title: Ford Devotes the Day to International Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 President Ford turned his attention largely to international affairs today for the first time since taking office on Friday.

title: CLUE DISCOVERED IN SYPHILIS FIGHT
description: A surprising discovery about the nature of the bacterium that causes syphilis has raised scientists' hopes that they can grow this organism for the first time in the laboratory and ultimately develop a vaccine against the potentially fatal veneral disease.

title: Congress Acts Quickly in Effort to Meet Ford's Request for CostofLiving Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14Congress moved swiftly today to act on President Ford's request for a new cost of living task force to keep watch over private wage and price behavior but without authority for mandatory controls.

title: Stars Rout Storm, 3816, For 4th Stratight Triumph
description: In the shadows of the Triborough Bridge, the New York Stars swept to their fourth straight World Football League victory last night.

title: ATHENS PROTESTS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 14  Greece withdrew her armed forces. from the North Atlantic Treaty: Organization today, blaming her allies for not having prevented Turkey's new military advance's in Cyprus.

title: $2,376 for Wounded Woman
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 14 (UPI) A Hyattsville, Md., woman who was wounded by a bullet in the attack on Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama in 1972 has been awarded $2,376 in damaged by the Maryland Criminal Injuries Compensation Board. She is Dora Thompson, 36 years old, a Wallace campaign worker.

title: For Haven in Riverdale, a Great Gardener
description: He is chlorophyll's child. He has a green thumb, a green palm, a green forearm and green biceps. Edwin L. Weisl Jr., the city's Commissioner of Parks and Recreation, calls him one of the great gardeners of the city.

title: New Chief of W.T.Grant Found in Company Ranks
description: The W. T. Grant Company, the troubled retail giant that has been looking for a new chairman, president and chief executive for more than a month inside and outside its ranks found one yesterday in one of its affiliates.

title: BLOOM CONDUCTS OUTDOOR CONCERT
description: Outdoor programs seldom come as imaginatively planned as that led by Arthur Bloom in Washington Square Park or Tuesday night. He used an ensemble of brass and percussion players, not too different from the small bands to be found performing in village squares. The music was of considerable sophistication, of course, being chosen from American works composed between 1943 (Copland's Fanfare for the Common Man) and 1968 (Virgil Thomson's Ode to the Wonders of Nature).

title: British Soccer
description: SCOTTISH LEAGUE CUP

title: Bridge: What Is Strength of a Raise To Game or Short of Game?
description: Experts have divided opinions about one notuncommon situation in bidding: if it becomes clear at a low level that game must be reached, is a raise to game weaker or stronger than a raise short of game?

title: LEBANESE REPORT ISRAELI SHELLING
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, Aug. 14 (Reuters)Israeli troops shelled areas of southern Lebanon today, residents said, two days after Palestinian guerrillas reortedly withdrew from the area.

title: Americans Take Sixth In Row, 390
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 14 (AP)Willie Smith dashed 81 yards on a punt return and Alfred Jenkins teamed with George Mira on a record 95yard scoring pass tonight to help Birmingham to a 390 World Football League victory over Hawaii.

title: Glenn McHugh, ExOfficer Of Equitable Life, Is Dead
description: Glenn McHugh, vice president of city mortgage operations for the Equitable Life Assurance Society in New York when he retired in 1960, died on Aug. 6 in Tipperary, Ireland, where he had, been vacationing with his wife.

title: PayTV Unit Defends Right to Carry Yankee Games
description: Home Box Office, Inc. the paytelevision service that will be offered on the Manhattan Cable System this fall, yesterday defended its right to carry occasional games of the New York Yankees as consistent With the spirit and intent of the Federal Communications Commission's paycable policies.

title: IMPEACHMENT UNIT DRAFTS ITS REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 For more than two years, President Nixon engaged in deliberate, repeated and continued deception of the American people about the Watergate case, according to the draft of the House Judiciary Commit tee's final report on impeachment.

title: SAMUEL KAMSLY
description: Samuel Kamsly, a diamond merchant, died Tuesday Of cancer at New York Hospital. Mr. Kamsly, president of Samuel Kamsly, Inc., at 608 Fifth Avenue, was 76 years old and lived at 240 Central Park South.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Iran Loan Offered Grumman for F14
description: Iran has offered to lend money to the Grumman Corporation to enable it to continue production of the controversial F14 fighter plane, Representative Otis G. Pike of Long Island disclosed yesterday. Iran has 80 F14's on order.

title: Trade Deficit in France Up
description: PARIS, Aug. 14 (AP)France suffered a $600million foreign trade deficit in July, up sharply from an $80million deficit in June, the Foreign Trade Ministry reported today. A spokesman explained that French oil imports were reduced during June when some refineries, were closed for technical reasons.

title: Ford Is Expected to Name Roudebush as Head of V.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI) White House officials said today that President Ford would probably announce next week the appointment of Richard. L. Roudebush as head of the Veterans Administration.

title: Music: Stimulating Mix
description: The performances Tuesday evening at the Mostly Mozart concert in Avery Fisher Hall were solid, decently effective statements of a stimulating mix of chamber and solopiano pieces by Mozart, Haydn and Schubert. Apart from the ultimate unsuitability of Fisher Hall to intimate music of any kind it was a concert that presented the Music fairly.

title: F.D.A. VITAMIN CURBS SCORED BY PROXMIRE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin accused the Food and Drug Administration today of trying to assume too much power with proposed controls over vitamins.

title: Mexico Joins the Ranks Of SelfSufficient in Oil
description: MEXICO, CITY, Aug. 13Mexico has achieved self??fficiency in oil for the first time in a decade as a result of last winters energy crisis, when the Government decided to increase fuel prices and step up domestic production.

title: CARE Launches an Appeal For Aid in African Drought
description: CARE, the international relief and development agency, began a nationwide appeal yesterday for contributions to aid the droughtstricken African subSaharan belt.

title: Hushen Reported Slated As Press Aide to Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)President Ford reportedly plans to recruit the public information director of the Justice Department, John W. Hushen, as the top assistant to his press secretary, J. F. terHorst. Mr. Hushen turned aside questions by reporters today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The 1975 Virginia Slims women's tennis circuit has increased its total purse to $900,000 and reduced its schedule to 10 tournaments. The players will have to compete in a minimum of seven of the 10 in order to qualify for the championship final, which will be worth $150,000.

title: Excerpts From the Draft of House Judiciary Panel's Final Report on Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14Following are excerpts from the draft of the final report by the House Judiciary Committee that contains facts supporting Articles I, II and III of impeachment of former President Nixon:

title: Out Came a Mouse
description: Well, the great flap over the city's vanished funds seems to be over. Special State Prosecutor Nadjari has completed his investigation and has concluded that City Investigation Commissioner Scoppetta committed no improper or illegal act while investigating the $5.4million discrepancy on the books of the Controller's office.

title: Bill Signed to Allow Owning Gold in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (Reuters)  President Ford signed a bill today allowing American citizens to buy and sell gold after Dec. 31 for the first time in 40 years.

title: Venezuela Lends $500Million at 8% To the World Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)  The World Bank announced today that it had borrowed $500million in Venezuela at 8 per cent interest, the largest single borrowing operation ever undertaken by the development institution.

title: Safire Book Hearing Sets Precedent in Arbitration
description: A precedent in private commercial arbitration was set yesterday when a three  man panel, hearing a dispute between William Safire, author and columnist, and his former publisher, William Morrow & Co., opened the hearings at 340 West 51st Street to the press.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 15, 1974

title: A Compromise Preserves City's Sanctuary in the Bronx
description: Ever so discreetly, a struggle is coming to an end over the fate of 28 of the city's most placid acres, where no sound louder than a Hudson River foghorn disturbs pheasants nesting beneath hemlocks.

title: London Suggests Turkey Planned to Resume War Before Peace Talks Collapsed
description: LONDON, Aug. 14The Brit ish Government suggested today that Turkey had planned to resume war on Cyprus even before the peace talks in Geneva collapsed early this morning.

title: Ford Telephones Nixon His Thanks for Message
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug, 14 (UPI)  President Ford telephoned former President Richard M. Nixon last night to thank him for a message of congratulations on Mr. Ford's address to Congress.

title: SALE TO PUERTO RICO BARRED BY COMPANY
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Aug. 14 (UPI)Transamerican Trailer Transport, Inc., announced today, it would not sell its Puerto Rican operations to the Government. The decision could end Government plans to establish a public merchant marine next month.

title: Coast Beach, Once Nixon's Alone, Now Open to Public
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 14Former President Richard M. Nixon has been taking drives every day this week to a heavily guarded and deserted beach at the Camp Pendleton marine base 13 miles south of his San Clemente estate, while the general public is being welcomed back to the beach that, at times, he alone had been permitted to use.

title: TURKISH PREMIER IS BLAMING GREECE
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 14Premier Bulent Ecevit said today that Turkey's military action on Cyprus was a continuation of the one halted on July 30 after the signing of the Geneva agreement.

title: U.S. Urges s CeaseFire And Resumption of Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14The United States, after failing in several, days of diplomacy to pertuade Turkey not to renew hostilities on Cyprus, called today for an immediate ceasefire and resumption of peace talks. diate ceasefire and resumption of peace talks.

title: Carbide Factory to Grow
description: The Union Carbide Corporation announced yesterday multimilliondollar expansion of its molecular sieve absorbent factory at Mobile, Ala. It is the second expansion of the plant within a year. Molecular sieves, used mainly by the petrochemical, natural gas and petroleum refining industries,. are porous crystalline materials that remove moisture and other inipurities from liquids and gases and also separate materials of different molecular size.

title: 4 BISHOPS DEFEND ORDAINING WOMEN
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 14  Four Episcopalian Bishops who participated in the ordination of 11 women into the priesthood of their church three weeks ago in Philadelphia explained and defended their actions before the House of Bishops here today.

title: Imperatives for Cyprus
description: With the breakdown of peace talks in Geneva, Turkey's accelerated military drive on Cyprus and Greece's withdrawal of its forces from NATO, the full dimensions of the crisis in the Mediterranean have come abruptly into focus. The imminent dangers are of allout war between Turkey and Greece and of collapse of NATO's southern flank, with ominous consequences for the entire eastern Mediterranean and the volatile Middle East.

title: U.S. MOVE TO CURB SPENDING IMPERILS AID FOR PARE HERE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 New York City's hope of saving the 35cent transit fare was doubly jolted today as Transportation Secretary Claude S. Brinegar urged Congress to make localities assume greater responsibility for financing transit operations and Republican Congressmen fought to cut a $20billion masstransit bill in half.

title: NATO Calls on Athens to Reconsider
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 214  The North Atlantic: Treaty Organization called on Greece today to reconsider as soon as possible her decision to withdraw her armed forces front the 15nation Western defense alliance.

title: I.T. T. INCREASES DIVIDEND AND NET
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday record sales and earnings for the second quarter and first half. The company also announced an increased quarterly dividend of 38 cents a share payable Oct. 1 to stockholders of record Aug. 23. A year ago the dividend was raised to 35 cents from 31 cents a share.

title: Carmines Sings His and Other Songs
description: When Al Carmines, the composer and author of a long list of successful Off Broadway musicals who is also a minister of the Judson Memorial Church, gives his occasional concerts or makes his even more occasional nightclub appearances, his programs are usually drawn from the wealth of varied, provocative and witty material he has written for his shows. His programs this week at Reno Sweeney, however, depend almost as much on his memories of songs of the nineteentwenties and thirties, which have provided style and inspiration for many of the devices he uses in his own songs, as they, do on his creations.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Alleged Colombo Associate Shot in Brooklyn
description: A man who wandered into a Sheepshead Bay courtyard bleeding from a stomach wound late Tuesday night, ?? stoop sitters for help and ?? begged them not to call ?? police may be the latest ?? of a Mafia war, the police and other law enforcement sources said yesterday.

title: Brazil Meningitis Worse
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Aug. 14 (Reuters)A meningitis epidemic afflicting So Paulo, Brazil's largest city, has worsened over the last few days, health authorities revealed today. The disease has killed more than 400 people since July 1, according to official statistics.

title: Immigration to Israel Declines Sharply as a Result of October War in the Mideast
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 14Immigration to Israel dropped by a striking 33 per cent in the first six months of 1974, epparently as a result of the economic dislocation and political uncertainty caused by the October war.

title: 2 GEORGIA RACES REQUIRE RUNOFFS
description: ATLANTA, Au. 14  Lieut. Cov. Lester G. Maddox and Mayor, Ronnie Thompson of Macon led the Democratic and Republican primaries for the governorship yesterday, setting the stage for a confrontation in November between two flamboyant, conservative politicians  if both men survive runoff elections on Sept. 3.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterdays was:

title: Conner Takes Over Mariner's Helm
description: NEWOORT, R. I., Aug. 14 Ted Turner was replaced as skipper of Mariner today as the four United States yachts braced for the start tomorrow of the final trials to select the yacht that will defend the America's Cup next month.

title: Notes on People
description: On the occasion of turnlng 24 yesterday, Princess Anne was honored by her mother, Queen Elizabeth II, for her bravery and calmness in the face of adversity. The Queen appointed Anne a Dame Grand Cross of the Royal Victorian Order, and made the Princess's husband, Capt, Mark Phillips, a commander of the seine order. Appointed a member of the order was Rowena Brassey, the Princess's lady in waiting. All this was a reward growing out of the attempted kidnapping of Princess Anne near Buckingham Palace last March. Captain Phillips and Miss Brassey were with the Princess the time.

title: Longshoremen to Vote
description: The International Longshoremen's Assoroiation, announced yesterday the scheduling of contract ratification votes for next Wednesday in deepsea ports from Maine to Virginia, tha Associated; Press reported.

title: No Amer. Soccer Playoff
description: QUARTERFINAL ROUND

title: JOHN J. GOEPFERT
description: John J. Goepfert, who retired in 1971 as controller of the Schering Corporation, the pharmaceutical company, died Monday at St. Mary's Hospital in Orange, N. J. He was 68 years old and lived at 747 Berkley Avenue in Orange.

title: Dog Fighting: Illegal, Brutal, Growing
description: CHICAGO  Pat Podzianowski is a construction worker by trade, a burly, ponderous man about 40 years old, with a great stomach. His bare upper body, across the chest and back and over the arms, is covered with tattoos.

title: Percy Shelves Campaign For White House in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14After a year of intensive effort, Senator Charles H. Percy has shelved his campaign for the 1976 Republican nomination for President.

title: Ford's Aides Say He Seeks Decentralization of Power
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14  President Ford wants the power of the White House dispersed. He wants it to be more widely shared with Government agencies and departments and with Congress. That is the impression gained today from conversations with several of the President's closest advisers, including members of the team that is studying the problems of transition from one Administration to another.

title: EDMUNDO DE LASSALLE
description: Dr. Edmundo de Lassalle of 635 Park Avenue, vice president of the International Fund for Monuments, an adjunct of the United Nations, died in London on Aug. 1. He was 57 years old.

title: Tuesday's Fight
description: New Bedford, Mass.  Paul Poirier, Brockton, Mass., outpointed Jim Henry, Montreal, 10 rounds; weights unavailable.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Ambassador Departs
description: With the replacement of Ambassador Henry J. Tasca in Athens, United States relations with the new civilian Government of Greece can develop on a far surer footing than was possible as long as he was in that post.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest percentage gains on the New York Stock. Exchange yesterday.

title: 2 D.A. CANDIDATES CLASH IN DEBATE
description: Richard H. Kuh, the Manhattan District Attorney, and Robert M. Morgenthau, who wants the job, clashed in an impromptu debate yesterday on the rubblestrewn site of the old Broadway Central Hotel.

title: Kuh Sets Up Limits On Plea Bargaining In Heinous Cases
description: District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan issued a Jongawaited directive to his 200 assistants yesterday that prohibits plea bargaining in cases involving particularly egregious, heinous or notorious criminal conduct and places tight restrictions on its use in other cases.

title: Saratoga Jockeys
5 Drug Programs Here Studied For Fraud in New Crackdown
description: Records of three drug rehabilitation programs and two schoolbased prevention centers have been referred to government authorities for the investigation of possible fraudulent activities, sources within the city's Addiction Services Agency have disclosed.

title: City's Revised CleanAir Plan Found Lacking by Federal Aides
description: In their first comment on the city's, new plan to meet cleanair standards, Federal officials said yesterday that the plan had  as one of them put it a lot of good concepts, but that it was deficient in not detailing how these concepts would be realized or where the needed money would Come from.

title: LISBON POLICE FIRE ON RALLY, KILLING 1
description: LISBON, Portugal, Thursday, Aug; 15 (Reuters)  Policemen opened fire on demonstrators attending a banned rally in support of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola here last night.

title: Kuh Sets Up Limits On Plea bargaining In Heinous Cases
description: District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan issued a longawaited directive to his 200 assistants yesterday that prohibits plea bargaining in cases involving particularly egregious, heinous or notorious criminal conduct and places tight restrictions on its use in other cases.

title: CITY TAXI PANEL TO MEET ON FARE
description: The City Taxi and Limousine Commission is scheduled to meet today to begin consideration of a request by taxifleet owners for a 25 per cent fare increase to cover higher operating and labor costs.

title: Books of The Times
description: David Livingstone was one of those men that only a powerful faith can produce. He traversed some 30,000 miles in Africa, much of it on foot. At one, time, while crossing an immense swamp, he and his party had to build mud piles, like graves, to sleep on each night. On another occasion, with his shoulder in the jaws of a lion, Livingstone was cool enough to turn his head to relieve, the weight of the animal, whose paw was on the back of his head, and to make some interesting observations on the anesthetic effect of shock. When his teeth inevitably decayed due to the poverty of his diet, he pulled them by tying them to a stump and striking the string with a stick. Often staggering with fever, he never failed to record accurate and detailed notes on the plant, animal, bird insect life around him.

title: Lord Mayor Arnulf Klett Of Stuttgart, Is Dead at 69
description: STUTTGART, West Germany,, Aug. 14. (AP)  Lord Mayor Arnulf Klett, whose 29year term this city was West Germany's longest, died of a heart attack today. He was 69 years old.

title: Verbal Jabs End Duran Bout
description: An errorfilled boxing comedy in which, no one got hurt but everyone was embarrassed ended yesterday when the State Athletic Commission formally called off next Monday's bout involving the world lightweight champion, Roberto Duran.

title: Ackley Says Cutting Budget Won't Control Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14The new Senate Budget Committee, at its first public hearing today, heard a noted liberal economist rebut the arguments of the Nixon and Ford Administrations that budget reduction was the key to controlling inflation.

title: Byrne and Legislators Tour Farmland by Bus
description: GLASSBORO, Aug, 14Governor Byrne and about 40 legis ators, many of, them accompanied by their wives and children, toured South Jersey today to study the problems of the area's farms.

title: People in Sports
description: A panel of track officials in Kenya yesterday cleared Ben Jipcho of charges of professionalism that he had admitted to in a Sports Illustrated article three months ago. Jipcho, considered the world's most versatile distance runner, had said he accepted hundreds of dollars worth of gifts after running in Europe during the summer of 1973 when he was an amateur.

title: Market Place: Decline Shown In Margin Debt
description: Customer margin accounts were in slightly better shape at the end of July a month earlier, but a continued weak market threatens to trigger numerous margin calls, which in turn could depress stock prices below their present low levels.

title: 2 Missing Jersey Girls Found Dead In Montvale, Victims of Sexual Attack
description: PARAMUS, Aug. 14The nude bodies of two teenage girls, missing from their North Bergen homes since last Friday, were found this morning in a small wooded area of Montvale. Both girls had been sexuelly assaulted and apparsntly strangled approximately 36 to 40 hours buiore being found, the police said.

title: TwoDivision Cane Pace First for Race in 20 Years
description: YONKERS, Aug. 14The draw for post positions for the Cane Pace at Yonkers Raceway Saturday night was held today and when the entry box was emptied, 14 horses were entered and officials began to worry.

title: Aug. 110 Car Sales Climb; 1975 Price Rises a Factor
description: DETROIT, Aug. 14  United States auto makers reported today record sales of 207,624 new cars in early August, with the gain attributed in part to buyers who were seeking to avoid large price increases scheduled for 1975 models.

title: The Sediment After Watergate's Tide Recedes
description: MILWAUKEEIt is too early for a total assessment of Watergate's longrange impact on the Presidency. But, there is a strong possibility that as Richard M. Nikon's successors pig the pieces back together again they will find a few holes have been blasted through the walls that have isolated Presidents from political reality.

title: Wright Leads by Four Strokes
description: JERICHO, L.I., Aug. 14The 18 greens at the Meadow Brook Club average 10,000 square feet of putting surface each, according to George Heron, the greenskeeper. The first green of the 527yard, par5 hole is the biggest with more than 15,000 square feet.

title: 58 Ecuador Stowaways Returned Home in a Jet
description: Fiftyeight Ecuadorians who stowed away to the United States in search of jobs and a better future went home yesterday, in the cabin of a jet airliner instead of the dank holds of a cargo ship, and eating sirloin steak instead of green bananas.

title: White House Move Delayed
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Aug. 14 (AP)Betty Ford has delayed her packing for the move to the White House because of preparations she must make for a state dinner Friday night for King Hussein of Jordan, a White House spokesman said today. But the Fords still hope to move in on Monday at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue from Alexandria, Va.

title: Jury's Verdict Is Guilty In a 1972 Harlem Slaying
description: A State Supreme Court jury of 10 men and two women has found a 29yearold man guilty on one count of murder in the slaying of a 20yearold Harlem man almost two years ago.

title: Chronology of Recent Events in Cyprus Crisis
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (Reuters)Following is a brief chronology of recent events leading to the renewal of fighting on Cyprus today:

title: White House Says Tapes Are Nixon's Own Property
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 The tape recordings that former President Nixon made of thousands of hours of conversations with aides, associates and advisers are his personal property and will be returned to his control, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Personal Finance: Money in Old Age
description: Many of the older people who rushed to buy the high interestbearing Treasury securities last week probably are worried not only about the cost of living today but also about how long their capital will last if they have to use some of it.

title: Report Asks Jersey City Never to Reopen Its Jail
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 14  A report issued today by the Hudson County chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union and students from Jersey City State College urged the city administration never to reopen the municipal jail.

title: Fiat Raises Prices 11%
description: TURIN, Italy, Aug. 14 (AP)Fiat, the giant Italian auto maker, announced today an average increase of 11 per cent in the price of its models. It was the third increase this year, with Orices rising by about 40 per cent in eight months. The increase will become effective on Monday.

title: Several PortauPrince Delights, but First the Rum
description: RUM PUNCH

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The proposal that President Nixon be given immunity from criminal prosecution shows that Congressional leaders are still unwilling to apply what one had thought were fundamental American principlesthat no man is above the law, and that all men are equal before the law.

title: What Election Reform?
description: New York's new election campaign reform law has taken remarkably little time to prove itself remarkably ineffective. Thanks to shameful delay in Albany, the primary campaign was already so far along when the law was enacted that much of its value for this year's election was dissipated to begin withand that was no accident.

title: Now That Liberated Fashion Has Won, Do Fall Skirt Lengths Really Matter?
description: Thee wearers of long skirts this summer may be the vanguard of an army of kneecovering fashion enthusiasts next fall. At least they feel like revolutionaries when friends offer unsolicited advice (That skirt would be much better if you put up the hem three inches) and strangers stare at the bolder ones approaching in elevators, the subways or the street.

title: Court Upholds Indictment In Riverside Bribe Case
description: TRENTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)The Appelate Division of Superior Court today upheld a fivecount indictment charging four Riverside men with conspiracy to bribe two public officials in an attempt to influence their behavior in office.

title: For Haven in Riverdale, a hardener
description: He is chlorophyll's child. Be, has a green thumb, a green palm, a green forearm and green biceps. Edwin L. Weisl Jr., the city's Commissioner of Parks and Recreation, calls him one of the great gardeners of the city.

title: JOB ACTION SLOWS WORK ON SCHOOL
description: Fourteen new schools and some classrooms in more than 100 existing schools will not be ready when school begins on Sept. 9 because of job actions by electrical workers, the president of the Board of Education said yesterday.

title: Bar Convention Discusses Need For Renaissance in Public Life
