description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller, the 66yearold former Governor of New York, was nominated by President Ford today to be the 41st Vice President of the United States.

title: Work Starts at Hunts Point in October On LongPlanned Fulton Fish Market
description: Ground will be broken in October for the longplanned modernistic $16million Fulton Fish Market project within the Hunts Point food center in the Bronx, with completion aimed for July, 1976.

title: Mariner, Valiant Put Out of Cup Trials
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 20The ax fell on Mariner and Valiant here today as both yachts lost decisively on the race course and were eliminated from future competition in the America's Cup final selection trials. This leaves two, Courageous and Intrepid, in contention for the role as defender of the 123yearold trophy in the Cup series starting Sept. 10.

title: Slain Girl's Friend Threatens Suicide Over Interrogation
description: FAIRVIEW, Aug. 20 (UPI)A 16yearold former boyfriend of one of two girls found raped and murdered in Montvale last week reportedly threatened to kill himself today when the police attempted to question him.

title: Shirley Temple to Be Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI)  President Ford nominated Shirley Temple Black today to be Ambassador to Ghana. A resident of Woodside, Calif., she has represented the United States at the United Nations and in other shortterm diplomatic assignments.

title: G.I. Protests Ouster Atop 200Foot Tower
description: McGUIRE AM FORCE BASE, Aug. 20 (AP)A soldier who was being discharged because he allegedly failed to state when enlisting that he had been forced to leave the Marine Corps climbed a 200foot water tower here today and stayed there for five hours.

title: City and Odyssey House Clash Over Drug Program's Policies
description: Investigators of the city's Addiction Services Agency have charged irregularities in the financial and admission practices of Odyssey House, one of the largest drug rehabilitation programs here, and say that the program has violated its funding contract with the city.

title: GALLERY BACKED AT ROTHKO TRIAL
description: The Marlborough Gallery, which bought 100 paintings by Mark Rothko and received 700 others on consignment, was the best equipped to handle the estate of the late abstract expressionist, ?? principal defense witness testified yesterday in Surrogate's Court.

title: Europe, Having Sown Inflation, Reaps Farmers' Wrath
description: PARIS, Aug. 20Many of the Common Market's farmers are on the rampage again, burning crops, blocking roads and pelting manure to protest the failure of their incomes to keep pace with the cost of living. The farmers are 10 million strong and bursting with anger.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 41

title: Interim White Plains Mayor Installed
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 20Richard Maas, a 55yearold Democrat who is a partner in an investment firm, has never been elected to public office before, but the esteem in which he is held here and his reputation for political moderation have put him in the Mayor's chair for four months, starting today.

title: Child Is Baptized In Church Clash
description: MARLBOROUGH, Mass., Aug. 20A Jesuit priest from New York baptized 3monthsold Nathaniel Ryan Morreale on the front steps of Immaculate Conception Church here today after the church's priests had refused to perform the sacrament because of the views of the mother on abortion.

title: Pennsy's Trustees Back Court Finding On Reorganization
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad in a 100page brief filed with a special threejudge court in Washington yesterday supported a Federal District Court finding that the Penn Central should not be reorganized under the Rail Reorganization Act of 1973 because, they believe, provisions of that act requiring the trustees to mandatorily convey the rail road's properties to a successor carrier are not fair.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: WESTERN UNION HITS A.T.&T. HOOKUP BAN
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company asked the Federal Communications Commission yesterday to reject the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's proposed restrictions that would forbid an A.T.&T. customer from hooking certain lines of Bell System equipment into Western Union's domestic satellite facility.

title: Foreign Role Is Seen for Rockefeller
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Senate Republican leader, Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania, said today that he hoped Nelson A. Rockefeller, if confirmed as Vice President, would take an active role in foreign affairs, helping out his old associate, Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Queens Youth Is Charged With Policeman's Slaying
description: A 19yearold youth was charged yesterday with the murder of Pollee Officer Thomas V. Pegues on a busy street corner in South Jamaica, Queens. The youth, whom the police identified as John Gordon of 13715 157th Street, Springfield Gardens, Queens, had been a passenger in a car that 27yearold Officer Pegues and his partner had stopped for a routine license and registration check at about 10:30 Monday night.

title: SOME DISSENTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Nelson A. Rockefeller's nomination to be Vice President was widely applauded today by all but a few Democrats and Republicans in Congress. But ahead lies an intensive scrutiny of his family's vast international fortune.

title: A Sampling of Statements by Rockefeller on a Variety of Subjects
description: Following is a selection of statements of Nelson A. Rockefeller, drawn from his speeches, writings and interviews in recent years, on various subjects:

title: Oil Concerns Pay $ 103Million In Overcharges After U.S. Audit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Federal Energy Administration reported today its auditing of oilcompany operations had resulted in 10 oil companies repaying a total of some $103.7million in alleged overcharges. The F.E.A. had alleged $194.4million in overcharges.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 21, 1974

title: Film Fete to Be French Collection
description: Cineastes, attention! The 12th New York Film Festival, which opens at Lincoln Center on Sept. 27, will have beaucoup de films from France. It's not that festival organizers have a thing about French movies. It's simply that the French themselves have a certain je ne sais quoi about les flicks.

title: MINES' SHUTDOWN LINKED TO DEATHS
description: Arnold Miller, president of the United Mine Workers of America, said yesterday that the current weeklong nationwide shutdown of bituminous coal mines by his union had been called as a memorial to men killed and injured in the mines, not to support striking workers at two mines in Harlan, Ky.

title: EXILES ARE COOL TO AMNESTY MOVE
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 20  In Canada, which has become home to most of the young men who left the United States to avoid serving in the Vietnam war, little enthusiasm was expressed today for President Ford's conciliatory move toward a kind' of amnesty.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Ground will be broken in October for the longplanned moderistic $16million Fulton Fish Market project in Hunts Point in the Bronx, with completion set for July, 1976Mayor Beame announced the, new schedule, during a visit to the old market on the East River just north of Fulton Street.

title: Advertising: New J.W.T. Team
description: We're hungry and aggressive, We've got ourselves pretty lean over the years. Now we're going to start rolling again.

title: Canadian With U.N. Force On Cyprus Seriously Hurt
description: EPISKOPI, Cyprus, Aug. 20 (Reuters)A Canadian soldier in the United Nations force here was stabbed in the stomach and seriously hurt late tonight while investigating a report of looting along the Green Line separating Turkish Cypriote and Greek Cypriote communities.

title: Financing Bank to Lend $1 5Billion to Utilities
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuters)The Federal Financing Bank will lend up to $1.5billion to rural electrification and telephone systems, under an agreement signed today with the Rural Electrification Administration of the Department Of Agriculture.

title: S.E.C. HEARING SET ON BROKERS' FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Securities and Exchange Commission today scheduled public hearings for Sept. 24 on the request of the New York Stock Exchange for a further increase in nonmember fixed commission rates on orders valued between $2,000 and $300,000. Rates, beyond that range are set competitively.

title: 21 Hurt in Multiple Collision Near Grass Fire in Texas
description: SEALY, Tex., Aug. 20 (UPI)Twentyone persons were injured today when two tractortrailer trucks, a bus and 15 cars collided in dense smoke from a grass fire along Interstate 10 near here.

title: MEXICAN WORKERS DEMAND 35% RAISE
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 18Mexico's labor movement is threatening a nationwide strike unless the Government and private employers agree to grant: a 35 per cent emergency wage increase to compensate for inflation.

title: Saxbe Seeks Report This Week on Legal Precedents for Amnesty
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Attorney General William B. Saxbe, after conferring with Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger at the White House today, ordered a Justice Department study group to have something in hand by the end of the week on President Ford's plan for leniency for draft evaders and deserters.

title: Cyprus Arrest Warrants Issued for Three in Slaying of U.S. Envoy
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 20Warrants were issued today for the arrest of three persons involved in the killing yesterday of the United States Ambassador, Rodger P. Davies, during an antiAmerican demonstration at the Embassy building.

title: PRICES UP FOR IRON, SUGAR AND SOLVENT
description: Price increases announced yesterday covered sugar, solvents and iron ore and amounted to 14 per cent in some cases.

title: People in Sports
description: The Montreal Canadiens learned yesterday they would keep their link with glory when Henri Richard changed his mind about retiring and agreed to play for a 20th season. The 38yearold Richard is the club's captain and the only active National Hockey League performer to play 20 years with the same club, Last season he became the ninth player to reach the 1,000. point plateau. The 5foot7inch center has amassed 1,033 points (355 goals and 678 assists) in 1,240 games.

title: Woodbridge Residents Fear Gas Tanks on S.I.
description: WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP, Aug. 20  Residents of this group of 10 tidy municipalities strung along the Arthur Kill across the narrow strip of water from Staten Island feel like natives living on the edge of a potentially live volcano.

title: '74 Collegiate Golf Team Is Introduced at Dinner
description: Somewhere in this country there must be a computercontrolled machine that cranks out young golf prodigies, most of them slim and with long blond hair. They start playing as soon as they climb out of the crib, and they have names like Johnny Miller, Ben Crenshaw, Lanny Wadkins, John Mahaffey, Hale Irwin and Tom Kite. They compete in collegiate golf, and some really, study. Eventually they turn pro and win tournaments.

title: Bomb Found in Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 20 (AP)A 15pound bomb was dismantled in central Jerusalem today and some Arabs were detained for questioning, the police said.

title: GENE GEDMAN
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (UPI)Gene Gedman, a former halfback with the Detroit Lions football team, died yesterday after a heart attack. He was 42 years old.

title: Ford Backs Move to Bar Rhodesian Chrome Import
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 The White House announced today that the Ford Administration favored the repeal of an amendment that permitted the United Stales to import Rhodesian chrome in violation of United Nations sanctions.

title: BALL SEES SOVIET GAINING IN GREECE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  American relations with Athens have been so severely damaged by the crisis in Cyprus that the United States may not be able to prevent substantial Soviet influence in Greece, according to former Under Secretary of State George W. Ball.

title: A Turn in G.O.P. Tide
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20President Ford's nomination of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President completes a reversal of national political tides of potentially historic proportions. Ten days ago, politicians were asking whether the Republican party could survive; today, they were asking how the Democrats were going to mount a challenge in 1976.

title: Selection of Rockefeller Puts New Life in Market
description: The stock market broke its eight session losing streak yesterday and posted a slight advance in heavier trading.

title: Bridge: When Alcohol Is Flowing Redoubling Can Be Stoopid
description: If both sides are bidding to a high level with freakish hands, it is nearly always unwise to redouble when doubled. Just be satisfied to buy the contract, Redoubling does not make sense when you are due to fail, and if you are about to make your contract you may scare the opponents into persevering in their own suit.

title: EXAIDE CRITICIZES U.S. ENERGY OFFICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Lee Richardson, who resigned as head of the Federal Energy Administration's Office of Consumer Affairs on Aug. 8, squared off today against his old boss over charges by the former consumer chief that he had been allowed no voice in policy decisions.

title: HARRY BURKE DEAD; REPORTER IN NEWARK
description: BELMAR, N.J., Aug. 20 (AP) Harry Burke of Belmar, a top reporter for more than 40 years on The Newark News, died of cancer last night. He was 62 years old.

title: KUH OFFICE STUDIES LUCKENBACH DEATH
description: The office of District Attorney Richard H. Kuh confirmed yesterday that it had entered the investigation into the death of a New York shipping executive, Edgar F. Luckenbach Jr., whose body was found under mysterious circumstances on Aug. 9 in an apartment at 109 East 73d Street occupied by two women.

title: Demographic Realities
description: Considering the taboos which only a few years ago prevented many governments from even considering the serious issues raised by unchecked population growth, the turnout of delegations from 130 nations at the United Nations World Population Conference in Bucharest this week represents a dramatic and heartening awakening. It is already evident, however, that too many of the participants have not yet begun to come to grips with what a keynoter described as the demographic realities.

title: President and Rockefeller Remarks by
description: Following is a transcript of Piesident Ford's statement broadcast from the Oval Office in Washington yesterday presenting Nelson A. Rochefeller to members of Congress as his nominee for Vice President and Mr. Rockefeller's remarks, followed by the nominee's news conference in the White House Press Room, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: ALFRED M. GEORGER
description: Alfred M. Georger, treasurer of the Metropolitan Opera Association from 1950 to 1953, died yesterday in Bridgeport, (Conn.) Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: Moriarty Is Sued After Quitting Cast Of Find Way Home
description: Rick Hobard, the producer of Find Your Way Home, sought an injunction in State Supreme Court yesterday to prevent his star, the Tony Awardwinner, Michael Moriarty, from leaving the Broadway play.

title: Rockefeller Neighbors In Maine Are Pleased
description: MOUNT DESERT ISLAND, Me., Aug. 20Residents of this island were elated today when they learned their summer neighbor, former Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York, had been nominated by President Ford to be the Vice President.

title: JobCutoff Protesters Invade Newark City Hall
description: NEWARK, Aug. 20More than 200 shouting adults and teenagers invaded City Hall this afternoon, angrily demanding that officials resolve the problems surrounding the premature closing of a summer youthjob program.

title: ShortSchoolDay Dispute in Williamsburg Settled
description: A controversy over short sessions at an elementtary school in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn was resolved yesterday by a compromise Worked out between parents and officials of Community School District 14.

title: Expert Says Word Has 27 Days' Food
description: BUCHAREST Aug. 20  An inattentive and factious session on population was told today that the world had reserves of food for only 27 days at the moment, a level considered too low to insure against sudden calamity.

title: Twins' Failure to Cover Plate Helps Yanks' Dobson Win, 21
description: The unguarded home plate in baseball is like the untended net in hockey, or the unprotected chicken yard anywheretoo good to believe, too inviting to ignore. And last night in Shea Stadium, the Minnesota Twins left the plate unguarded for a few instants in the third inning, and the New York Yankees took them up on it.

title: Child Is Baptized In Church Clash
description: MARLBOROUGH, Mass., Aug. 20A Jesuit priest from New York baptized 3monthsold Nathaniel Ryan Morreale on the front steps of Immaculate Conception Church here today after the church's priests had refused to perform the sacrament because of the views of the mother on abortion.

title: People and Business
description: They are playing musical chairs these days in the executive suites of Pan American World Airways and American Airlines. Last week, Wesley G. Kaldahl resigned as senior vice president, for airline planning and scheduling, at Pan Am. His old friends there acknowledged that it was not entirely unexpected. Within recent months Mr. Kaldahl hadn't hidden his frustration with the various decisions made by several departments over which he had no control.

title: Hello, Dolly. on Stage, Canneloni on Menu
description: Question: Where can you go and spend an entire eve, ning including dinner, a live show and maybe dancing afterwards for less than $15 a person and get the parking thrown in free?

title: PROTECTION ON DATA SOUGHT BY CONCERNS
description: WASHINGTON,. Aug. 20 (AP) Eight corporations moved today to protect their right to challenge later a controversial informationgathering program being conducted by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: White House Is Reviewing Nixon's Choice of Meskill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  The White House is reviewing former President Richard M. Nixon's nomination of Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut for a vacancy on the United States Court of Appeals, but a spokesman said a recall of the nomination was unlikely.

title: People in Sports
description: The Montreal Canadiens learned yesterday they would keep their link with glory when Henri Richard changed his mind about retiring and agreed to play for a 20th season. The 38yearold Richard is the club's captain and the only active National Hockey League performer to play 20 years with the same club. Last season he became the ninth player to reach the 1,000 point plateau. The 5foot7inch center has amassed 1,033 points (355 goals and 678 assists) in 1,240 games.

title: Leary Parole Bid Delayed
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 20 (AP)  California parole officials have delayed for one month a decision to parole Timothy Leary, a prison spokesman said today: Mr. Leary is serving a sixmonths to 15year sentence. He was convicted of marijuana possession and escaped from the state prison at San Luis Obispo in 1970.

title: Saving City Jobs
description: Of all New York City's mountainous problems, the most pressing remains jobs. Federal statistics showing that the city lost 41,000 more jobs in the last twelve months point up the importance of the initiative Mayor Beame is taking to develop 175 acres of now desolate land on the BrooklynQueens border as a complex embracing industry, housing and recreational facilities.

title: Allied Phone Lifts Dividend
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 20 (UPI) Directors of the Allied Telephone Company have raised its quarterly dividend to 9 cents from 8 cents, with payits quarterly dividend to cents from 8 cents, with payment scheduled for Sept. 30 to holders of record Sept. 13.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Nearly the entire slate of the incumbent president of Operating Engineers Local 825, George Frawley, won in the local's general elections Monday in Newark. Mr. Frawley, an organizer of last month's march on the State House of construction workers demanding more jobs, took 20 per cent of the 6,000 votes cast. About 8,500 members were eligible to vote. Seventyone candidates were vying for 13 offices. Also elected were Robert J. Illario, vice president; Henry Legowski, recording and corresponding secretary; James J. Schmidt, financial secretary; William Coburn, treasurer; Thomas Rove, Frederick J. Macco and Patsy Florio, trustees, and Patrick Campbell, Douglas W. Patterson and John Reardon, auditors. The only loser on Mr. Frawley's slate was William G. O'Connell, who lost the race for guard by 25 votes to Guido Gatti.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Aug. 20Sarah Bolster, a fulltime mother, possesses a full athletic schedule, as well as a nationally ranked masters swimmer, founder and director of the annual East Coast masters invitation swim meet and the competitive promoter for the Princeton Aquatic Association. The 45yearold Mrs. Bolster, who never swam in a race before 1972, often engages in twoaday workouts at Princeton University's Dillon Pool, covering between 4,000 and 5500 meters in each session.

title: Deere Net Off 8.1% As Sales Set Record
Mariner, Valiant Put Out of Cup Trials
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 20The ax fell on Mariner and Valiant here today as both yachts lost decisively on the race course and were eliminated from future competition in the America's Cup final selection trials. This leaves two, Courageous and Intrepid, in contention for the role as defender of the 123yearold trophy in the Cup series starting Sept. 10.

title: U.S. GIVES $500,000 FOR AID TO CYPRUS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  Secretary of State Kissinger authorized a $500,000 cash grant today to be used by the Red Cross for aid on Cyprus.

title: JAY CERF, 51, DIES; LED CONSULTANTS
description: Dr. Jay H. Cerf, president of Consultants International of Cambridge and a former Commerce Department official, died last Thursday while vacationing in Vermont. He was 51 years old and lived in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Lincoln Center Opens Free Outdoor Festival
description: Bouquets of colored balloons floated high over Lincoin Center yesterday after Mayor Beame cut them free and launched a twoweek program of free theater, dance and musical events called Lincoln Center OutofDoors.

title: C.A.B. Chief Sends Check To Jet Maker for Junket
description: Robert D. Timm, the chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, has sent a check for several hundred dollars to Harry J. Gray, the chairman of the United Aircraft Corporation, to erase any cloud over the weekend trip to Bermuda that Mr. Timm and his wife took last month as Mr. Gray's guests.

title: INVESTORS FUNDING ASKS TIME ON DEBT
description: The Investors Funding Corporation, a realestate concern that said it owed a group of banks some $71million, disclosed yesterday that it had asked for more time to meet $6million due Oct. 1.

title: Rockefeller Residence In Capital Is Uncertain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 Where Nelson A. Rockefeller and his family will live if he is confirmed as Vice President was unclear today.

title: Not Another Aegean Storm!
description: ANKARA, TurkeyTurkish Premier Ecevit, hoping to calm the stormy political waters of the Aegean, assured me again that he is eager to hold a bilateral summit with his Greek opposite number, Constantine Caramanlis, in order to settle any and all problems and pave the way to renewed friendship.

title: MARY L. GAMBRELL OF HUNTER IS DEAD
description: Dr. Mary Latimer Gambrell, president emeritus of Hunter College of the City University of New York, died Monday night at her home, 70 East 96th Street, after a long illness. She was 76 years old.

title: MOSCOW PRESSED BY FORD ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Secretary of State Kissinger said tonight that President Ford, as one of his first acts of office, had called upon Soviet leaders to join the United States in an intensified effort to negotiate an effective and equitable limitation of strategic arms.

title: NEWS INDEX
G.O.P. State Senator Wins Wyoming Vote for House
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Aug. 20 (AP)  State Senator Thomas Stroock breezed to an easy primary election victory over two opponents today to win the Republican nomination for Wyoming's only seat in the House of Representatives.

title: POLICE EQUIPMENT ON VIEW IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 20An international exhibition of police equipment is attracting some brisk official curiosity in Moscow, even though the Soviet Union maintains that it has no crime problem.

title: Market Place: Newmont Top's Old Foote Offer
description: About a year and a half ago, when Newmont Mining offered to merge with Foote Mineral on the basis of $9.50 of debentures for each Foote share, management rejected the offer as inequitable. Many Foote shareholders were disappointedespecially when they watched the company's shares drop to 4 in mid1973.

title: Leaders in State Parties Praise Choice of Rockefeller
description: The choice of former Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller as the new Vice President drew praise from politicians of both major parties in the state yesterday, along with an estimate from Democrats involved in the gubernatorial campaign that Governor Wilson would benefit at the polls in November.

title: HUNDREDS ON IRT TRAPPED BY FIRE
description: A fire in an IRT subway tunnel under the East River in the evening rush hour yesterday trapped four Seventh Avenue trains in smoky darkness between the Wall Street Station and Brooklyn's Clark Street Station, forcing the removal of hundreds of riders through emergency exits.

title: NEWMONT SEEKING SHARES OF FOOTE
description: The Newmont Mining Corporation announced a tender offer yesterday for all of the common shares of the Foote Mineral Company that it does not already own and all of Foote's convertible preferred stock. Newmont now owns 656,337 common shares of Foote Mineral, or about 33 per cent of the total outstanding.

title: GERM TEST PLANNED BY U.S. AND RUSSIANS
description: DOWNEY, Calif., Aug. 20 (UPI)  United Soviet scientists are preparing joint experiments for next year's rendevous of spaceships in orbit, including one to see what happens when Russian germs meet American germs in space.

title: New Men, New Mood
description: PARIS, Aug. 20The names Ford and Rockefeller have always been symbols of America here and elsewhere in the world, but now they are seen in a new political context, and a critical period of adjustment is opening up both in Europe and America.

title: WILLIAM B. SHATTUCK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 20Beverly Shattuck, a retired Central Intelligence Agency administrator, died Sunday at Suburban Hospital in Bethesda, Md. He was 67 years old.

title: Westchester Dealer Sees Civil War Over Milk
description: ALBANY, Aug. 20A detailed picture of what he called a civil war in the milk industry in Westchester County was, drawn here today by an independent dealer who is facing the loss of his license to operate.

title: U.S. Calls on Population Parley To Agree on World Growth Curb
description: BUCHAREST, Aug. 20 The United States called today for concerted effort to curb global population growth, with a goal of averting billions of births in the next 75 years.

title: OPTIMISM VOICED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller, the 66yearold former Governor of New York, was nominated by President Ford today to be the 41st Vice President of the United States.

title: JUDICIAL SYSTEM IN CITY ASSAILED
description: In a confidential document, State Supreme Court Justice James J. Leff has sharply criticized workavoiding judges, judges who attend political dinners, retired appellate judges who take on appellate work and the general operation and administration of the court system in the city.

title: Connors Advances at Jersey Net
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 20  The Wimbledon champion, Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., and Alex Metreveli of the Soviet Union, the first and secondseeded players, respectively, survived firstround matches today in the $50,000 MediQuik open tournament at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: U.S. FIRM TO FILM SPECIAL IN CUBA
description: Bob Banner Associates, a television production company in Beverly Hills, Calif., has received permission from the Cuban Government to film portions of a television special about Ernest Hemingway, in Cuba.

title: MOTHER AND GIRL ARE SLAIN UPTOWN
description: A 28yearold woman and her 9yearold daughter were found stabbed to death yesterday morning in separate bedrooms of their apartment in Harlem River Houses at 151st Street and Seventh Avenue.

title: U.S. Calls On Business To Counter Alcoholism
description: A luncheon news conference to discuss what business can do about identifying and treating alcoholism was held yesterday at 21, the nation's foremost exspeakeasy and the pinnacle of expense account imbibing.

title: World Football League
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: WITNESS'S MOTIVE IS ISSUE IN COURT
description: TRENTON, Aug. 20 (AP)A state appeals court today ruled that a defendant had the right to challenge the motive of a fellow defendant who testified against him.

title: Escapee Seized in Newark
description: NEWARK, Aug. 20 (AP)Edward Carter, the last of five prisoners who escaped from Salem County Jail on July 7, was captured here today by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents.

title: Ilona Massey, Film Temptress, TV and Radio Actress, 62, Dies
description: Ilona Massey, who overcame an impoverished childhood in Hungary to achieve stardom in Hollywood as a blond temptress, died yesterday at the Naval Hospital in Bethesda, Md., after a threemonth illness. She was 62 years old.

title: CHURCH TO EXAMINE CHARGES BY ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 20The Greek Catholic Church has decided to investigate accusations of arms smuggling raised by Israel against the Greek Catholic Archbishop of East Jerusalem, the most Rev. Hilarion Capucci.

title: HOUSE UNIT CLEARS A HEALTHBILL PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) A sharply divided House Ways and Means Committee tentatively approved a key financing feature of a cempromise health insurance bill today after narrowly rejecting two rival ideas.

title: Burroughs Expanding Plant
description: DETROIT, Aug. 20 (UPI)  The Burroughs Corporation said today it would expand its Rancho Bernarde manufacturing plant at San Diego, with construction to be finished next June. It produces semiconductor devices.

title: SOME DISSENTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Nelson A. Rockefeller's nomination to be Vice President was widely applauded today by all but a few Democrats and Republicans in Congress. But ahead lies an intensive scrutiny of his family's vast international fortune.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: One of the Government's favorite benchmarks for measuring consumer prices, the roast beef dinner, rose in June to a record of $8.25, or 3 cents above the previous month, and 55 cents higher than in December, 1973. At the same time, according to figures of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the wages of factory workers have not kept pace with rate of food p rice rises, so the working time needed to buy a roast beef dinner at home for a family of four (including appetizer, vegetables, salad, dessert, beverages, and bread and butter) rose to one hour 51 minutes, an increase of four minutes over December, 1973.

title: Mrs. Rockefeller: Shy in Spotlight
description: People who know Happy Rockefeller found nothing surprising in her absence yesterday from the White House ceremony at which President Ford nominated her husband as Vice President of the United States.

title: FORD SEES NO LID ON PAY AND PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20President Ford said today after a meeting with the Congressional leadership, It is clear there will be no Federal mandatory wage and price con trols.

title: Draft Resisters in Sweden Say They're Unimpressed
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 20 American deserters and draftdodgers living in Sweden said today they were unimpressed with President Ford's pledge to grant them conditional amnesty.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 20 (AP)Taiwan, which took the Little League World Series last year with three consecutive nohitters, opened defense of its title today by defeating New Haven, 16.0, on a onehitter by Lin WenHsiung, Lin a righthander, overpowered the Connecticut batters with an overhand fastball, striking out 13 and walking three. New Haven's only hit was a fourthinning double down the rightfield line by the pitchershortstop, Lorenzo Vincent. Vincent started the game for New Haven and took the loss. He was chased in the second inning after Lin homered, the first of four home runs by Taiwan. The island is seeking its fourth consecutive victory in the Little League World Series, which runs through

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HENRIAD A twoday spree of ethnic celebration gets under way at noon today on the Lower East Side with a parade of musicians, entertainers and politiciansall of it marking the opening of the seventh annual Henry Street Festival, a popular summer standby for the city's streets.

title: Astros Set Back Mets, 62
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 20The news from the Southwest continues to be bad for the Mats. The New York team is finding hits difficult to produce. Tonight, the Mets were held to only three in bowing to the Houston Astros, 62. They now have lost four straight games.

title: Growers Awarded Damages Against A&P for 32.7Million
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 20A Federal Judge signed a $32.7million judgment on Tuesday, officially giving seven California and Colorado livestock growers damages against A&P Stores for alleged beef price fixing.

title: Effort to Stop Shanker Fails in A.F.T.
description: TORONTO, Aug. 20One o?? the final obstacles in Alber?? Shanker's ascent to the presidency of the American Federation of Teachers was knocked ?? today when the organization voted to allow its president to hold other union offices simultaneously with the presidency.

title: A Ford Paradox: Washington Joy vs. New York Gloom
description: Since Gerald R. Ford succeeded Richard M. Nixon as President on Aug. 9, a remarkable phenomenon has developed.

title: SUSPECT ARRESTED IN COAST BOMBINGS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20 (AP)  A 31yearold Yugoslavian man has been arrested in the alphabet bombings, the Federal Bureau of Investigation announced tonight.

title: Police Recruit Hurt Here In Attackon Way to Work
description: A police recruit was injured slightly yesterday morning as he fought off two men in Queens who tried to mug him at gunpoint while he was on his way to the Police Academy.

title: Stars' Sauer Is Sidelined Against Texans Tonight
description: George Sauer Jr., the New York Stars' leading receiver, won't be in the lineup tonight when the club attempts to extend its World Football League victory string to five games against the Houston Texans at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: Dollar Sold Overseas
description: Speculators were selling dollars in European markets today, but the effort to lock in profits following the American currency's recent rises failed to halt that rise completely. Page 51.

title: Friends Estimate the Rockefeller Fortune at Between $300Million and $500Million
description: Nelson Rockefeller declined yesterday to answer reportes' questions about his wealth, saying he woulld discuss that matter with Congress. But close friends estimated that his fortunemuch of it in trusts for himself and his heirsmay have reached $500million or more in recent years.

title: Daughter Dies of Wounds In Little Silver Shootings
description: RED BANK, Aug. 20 (UPI)Four days after she was allegedly shot in the head by her father, 13yearold Holly Mottershead died today at Riverview Hospital.

title: MOSCOW PRESSED BY FORD ON ARE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Secretary of State Kissinger said tonight that President Ford, as one of his first acts of office, had called upon Soviet leaders to join the United States in an intensified effort to negotiate an effective and equitable limitation of strategic arms.

title: Papandreou Opposes Athens Protests'
description: KASTRI, Greece, Aug. 20Andreas Papandreou, one of the leading figures of the Greek left, does not intend to organize large public demonstrations here, because he fears they could bring back military rule.

title: ETHIOPIA'S PRESS DISPLAYS CANDOR
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 20The Ethiopian press is telling its readers almost daily now that they are a small minority because more than 95 per cent of the population of 27 million are illiterate.

title: Bond Prices On in Dull Trading; New Issues Are Well Received
description: Prices drifted lower yesterday in lackluster trading in the corporate, municipal and Government bond markets.

title: Jersey Girl, 13, Dies Of Gunshot Wounds
description: RED BANK, N. J., Aug. 20 (UPI)Four days after she was allegedly shot in the head by her father, 13yearold Holly Mottershead died today at Riverview Hospital.

title: House Formally Concludes Inquiry Into Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 20 Without a trace of fanfare or drama and without a word of debate, the impeachment inquiry by the House of Representatives formally ended today.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Choice Wins Vote
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 20Fakhruddin All Ahmed, former Food Minister and a nominee of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, was elected President of India today.

title: Mayor Suspends Utica Police Chief In Policy Dispute
description: UTICA, N.Y., Aug. 20 (AP)Mayor Edward A. Hanna suspended Police Chief Benny Rotundo today after a disturbance that resulted in the arrests of four youths. The four were subsequently ordered reby the Mayor.

title: Appeals Court Acts to Speed Decision On Request to Delay the CoverUp Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, moving rapidly today to resolve the controversy over the starting date of the Watergate coverup trial, ordered all parties to the case to file by noon tomorrow their views on whether or not the trial should be postponed.

title: Mideast Momentum
description: The credibility of peaceful intent is what really matters as Arabs and Israelis maneuver around each other in preparation for a new phase of Middle East peacemaking or warmaking. The moment one side or the other becomes convinced that its adversary has abandoned the path of political compromise, in favor of giving the military option another try, will be the moment of danger for all the diplomatic progress piled up since last October. On this premise it is less important which specific new diplomatic goal is pursued than it is simply to keep the wheels of diplomacy moving, to keep accumulating evidence of goodwill and peaceful intent.

title: S.E.C. HEARING SET ON BROKERS' FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Securities and Exchange Commission today scheduled public hearings for Sept. 24 on the request of the New York Stock Exchange for a further increase in nonmember fixed commission rates on orders valued between $2,000, and $300,000. Rates beyond that range are set competitively.

title: Afghanistan Sentences 12
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan. Aug. 20 (AP) An Afghan military tribunal sentenced one person to death and 11 to jail terms of up to 15 years for trying to overthrow President Mohammad Daud's Government in Afghanistan, Radio Kabul reported today. Since President Daud came to power in a coup in July, 1973, the Government has announced only one countercoup attempt, in October. At that time, 22 persons were imprisoned or executed.

title: A Turn in G.O.P. Tide
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20President Ford's nomination of Nelson A, Rockefeller as Vice President completes a reversal of national political tides of potentially historic proportions. Ten days ago, politicians were asking whether the Republican party could survive; today, they were asking haw the Democrats were going to mount a challenge in 1976.

title: Pennsy's Trustees Back Court Finding On Reorganization
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad in a 100page brief filed with a special threejudge court in Washington yesterday supported a Federal District Court finding that the. Penn Central should not be reorganized under the Rail Reorganization Act of 1973 because, they believe, provisions of that act requiring the trustees to mandatorily convey the rail road's properties to a successor carrier are not fair.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SECRET GLASS. By Beryl Bainbridge. 152 pages. George Braziller. $5.95.

title: Rockefeller Questioning On Prison Policy Urged
description: BOSTON, Aug. 20 (UPI)A leading authority on penology who has been highly critical of the way Nelson Rockefeller handled the Attica prison riot when he was Governor said today that Congress should ask him some hard questions about his position on prison reform.

title: One Man Killed, 2 Hurt In Cleaning an Oil Tank
description: CAMDEN, Aug. 20 (UPI)One worker was killed today and two others were injured, one critically, when they were overcome by fumes while cleaning the inside of a fuel oil tank in Camden.

title: Selling by Speculators Slows, But Fails to Halt, Dollar's Rise
description: LONDON, Aug. 20 (UPI)speculators sold dollars today, seeking to lock in a quick profit, but while the sales slowed the steady climb of the American currency, they did not halt it.

title: Union Views PlayerCut As Owners' Retaliation
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 20 (AP)Ed Garvey, executive director of the National Football League Players Association, said today that team owners were apparently committed to breaking the Union.

title: 19 Candidates Lose Liberal Party Line
description: All 19 Democratic and Republican aspirants who received Liberal' party endorsement in Manhattan for the November elections will he barred from the Liberal line on the ballot because the party failed to file documents authorizing their candidacy, officials of the city's Board of Elections disclosed yesterday.

title: Panama Plans Cuba Ties
description: PANAMA CITY, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Panama has decided to resume diplomatic relations with Cuba, the Government radio station reported here today. It gave no date for the resumption. Panama and all other members of the Organization of American States except Mexico broke off relations with Cuba in 1964.

title: A Bronx Physician Seized as Impostor; Had 164 House Calls
description: In this age of vanishing medical house calls, a Bronx man was arrested yesterday on charges of being all too willing to make them. District Attorney Mario Merola charged him with impersonating a physician.

title: BODY OF A WOMAN FOUND IN VILLAGE
description: The nude body of an unklentified blond, blueeyed woman about 25 years old was found on a Greenwich Village apartmenthouse roof yesterday.

title: Police Seek Robber Who Bluffed A Bank Officer Out of $157,000
description: Two dozen city detectives and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation teamed up yesterday hi an effort to track down the steelnerved holdup man who strolled out of a Yorkville bank Monday night with $157,000.

title: TUNA INDUSTRY SUED IN ANTITRUST CASE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 2 (Ap)  The Western Fishboal Owners Association and foul tunaboat owners filed suit in Federal court today accusing five major tunafish canners of violating antitrust laws.

title: Events From the Personal Life And the Career of Rockefeller
description: In 1908, the year that Nelson A. Rockefeller was born as a grandson of the nation's first billionaire, he inherited huge wealth and privilege, and a problem in political imagery.

title: RASH OF SELLING HITS GRAIN PITS
description: Nervous grain traders, feeding on each other's fears of an export curb on farm produce most of yesterday, finally broke and liquidated holdings of soybeans, corn, oats and some wheat in the last hour.

title: A Bronx Physician Seized as Impostor; Had 164 House Calls
description: In this age of vanishing, medical house calls, a Bronx man was arrested yesterday on charges of being all too willing to make them. District Attorney Mario Merola charged him with impersonating a physician.

title: Oil Concerns Pay $103Million In Overcharges After U.S. Audit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Federal Energy Administration reported today its auditing of oilcompany operations had resulted in 10 oil companies repaying a total of some $103.7million in alleged overcharges. The F.E.A. had alleged $194.4million in overcharges.

title: Half Million Left Homeless In Floods, Burma, Reports
description: RANGOON, Burma, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Widespread flooding of the Irrawaddy River has left more than half a million persons homeless, offical reports received here said today.

title: Financing Bank to Lend $1.5Billion to Utilities
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuters)The Federal Financing Bank will lend up to $1.5billion to rural electrification and telephone systems, under an agreement signed today with the Rural Electrification Administration of the Department of Agriculture.

title: Police Recruit Hurt Here In Attack on Way to Work
description: A police recruit was injured slightly yesterday morning as he fought off two men in Queens who tried to mug him at gunpoint while he was on his way to the Police Academy.

title: Giants' ExDoctor Tied to Bookies Ina Conspiracy
description: Two bookmakers were indicted yesterday in connection with a $26millionayear sports gambling operation that focused on professional footbdii and involved the orthopedic surgeon of the New York Giants.

title: Truman Portrait Hung In White House by Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI)  President Ford crossed party lines today as he personally put up in the Cabinet. Room a portrait of one of his favorite Presidents, Harry S. Truman.

title: Perry Treated Unroyally As Indians Are Beaten, 20
description: According to Jorge Orta of the Chicago White Sox, Gaylord Perry is not pitching the Way he was earlier in the season. He seems to be throwing a little different, Orta said recently after the White Sox had defeated the Cleveland ace. The ball isn't moving as much as it used to.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: 2 HIGH OFFICIALS RESIGN IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 20The South Korean Government announced today that President Park Chung Hee had accepted the resignation of his longtime confidant and bodyguard, Pak Chong Gyu, who took responsibility in the assassination attempt against the President last Thursday.

title: The Rockefeller Choice
description: The nomination of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President assures the nation that, in an emergency, there will be available in that post a man of Presidential quality. After careful deliberation President Ford has chosen his party's most experienced state executive, a man wellversed in economic and foreign affairs and the domestic side of the Federal Government. It is a responsible and encouraging nomination.

title: Sales of Mutual Funds Exceed Redemptions for Third Month
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Heavy investment in mutual funds offering Government securities and other moneymarket instruments raised mutual funds overall to the third straight month in which customers bought more shares than they cashed in the industry reported today.

title: Book on Robert Moses a 7Year Job
description: Although Robert A. Caro's The Power Broker: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York his been the talk of New York's architecture and planning community in recent weeks, the author himself is unknown to most of these people. They have been asking one another who he is, and wondering what his other writings are.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: MOVE DUE SEPT. 19 ON EQUITY FUNDING EQUITY FUNDING
description: ANGELES, Aug. 20 (AP) A, judge will decide on Sept. 19 whether to accept a plan to settle legal arguments over liquidating the Equity Funding Life Insurance Company.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: FORD SEES NO LID ON PAY AND PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20President Ford said today after a meeting with the Congressional leadership, It is clear there will be no Federal mandatory wage and price controls.

title: Talmadge: No Bars Due on Crop Exports
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Expected tight crops this year demand dose monitoring of exportsbut no export control measures at this time, Heiman E. Talmadge, chairman of the Senate Agriculture Committee said today.

title: SIGNING DUE TODAY ON SCHOOLAID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 20 (AP) A White House spokesman said today that President Ford would sign a $25billion aidtoeducation bill tomorrow, It was approved last month after one of the bitterest controversies of the present Congress.

title: Republic Steel Payout 40c
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 20 (AP) Republic Steel Company directors declared a quarterly dividend today of 40 cents a share on common stock, an increase of 10 cents, the company announced, The 30cent, dividend had been in effect since June, 1973. The new dividend is payable Sept. 20 to stockholders of record Aug. 30.

title: Manufacturing Building, Largest in City, Is Sold
description: Harry B. Helmsley, a major realestate owner who has dealt mainly with residential and office buildings, bought the largest manufacturing building in the city at a foreclosure sale yesterday.

title: European Leaders Basking in Sun, Not the Limelight
description: LONDON, Aug. 20Prime Minister Harold. Wilson of Britain is on an island, Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany is on a lake, President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France is on the Riviera. In short, Europe's leaders are on vacation.

title: Bond Prices Off in Dull Trading; New Issues Are Well Received
description: Prices drifted lower yesterday in lackluster trading in the corporate, municipal and Government bond markets.

title: Marjorie Bienstock, ExHead Of SpenceChapin, Dies at 61
description: Marjorie Cahne Bienstock, a former president of SpenceChapin Adoption Service, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital. Her age was 61.

title: Iacocca Sees Price Rise In Cars Exceeding $500
description: DETROIT, Aug. 20  Lee A. Iacocca, president of the Ford Motor Company said today that the $500 price increase generally expected on 1975 model cars is not the end of the rises probable for the new autos.

title: Noroton Y.C. Leads Final in Sailing
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 20The Norton, Conn., Yacht Club the Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound, represented by William S. Cox, led St. Petersburg Y.C. of the Florida Sailing Association, represented by Edwin Sherman, two races to none, the final round of the North American Interclub match race championship for the Prince of Wales Trophy. The first two races of the bestof  seven  race series were sailed on Long Island Sound off American Yacht Club today.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE.
description: ACROSS

title: Tennessee Candidate Dies
description: MANCHESTER, Tenn., Aug. 30 (AP)Mort Lloyd, 43year. old Democratic nominee for Congress from the Third District, was killed today when his light plane crashed near here, sheriff David Brasell of Franklin County said.

title: VENEZUELAN LAW ON OIL PUBLISHED
description: CARACAS, Aug. 20 (AP)Venezuela today published her longawaited preliminary draft law on the nationalization of the nation's oil industry, the world's thirdlargest oilexporting operation and the major supplier of United States imports.

title: Don't Get Caught Doesn't And Scores Upset at Spa
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 20Don't Get Caught took her name literally in the $20,000 Mayor's Purse, the sixfurlong race for fillies that featured the racing card today.

title: Committee on Critical Choices Intends an Orderly Conclusion
description: The executive director of Nelson A. Rockefeller's Commitsion on Critical Choices for Americans offered assurances yesterday that despite Mr. Rockefeller's call to Washington, work on the massive project here would proceed some sort of orderly conclusion.

title: Contract Awards
description: The International Systems and Controls Corporation said yesterday its wholly owned subsidiary, Black, Sivalls & Bryson, Inc., had received a $25million award from MachinImport, the Soviet Agency responsible for imports of machinery and process equipment. The contract covets 84 pressure vessels used to treat gas to meet pipeline specifications.

title: Ryan Fans 19 Tigers, But Loses, 10, in 11th
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug, 20 (UPI)Bill Freehan's runscoring single in the 11th inning spoiled another senational 19strikeout performance by Nolan Ryan tonight and gave the Detroit Tigers a 10 victory over the California Angels.

title: Byrne Leads Flotilla to Tocks Dam Site; Trip Fails to Sway Him From Opposition
description: TOCKS ISLAND, Aug. 20Governor Byrne led a flotilla of 50 canoes, kayaks and power boats filled with newsmen, politicians, conservationists and Army engineers early today on a watersplashing 10mile inspection tour of the proposed Tocks Island dam site.

title: 6 OF VETERANS UNIT ARRAIGNED IN QUEENS
description: Six members of a group called Vietnam Veterans Against the War/Winter Soldier Organization were arraigned in Queens Criminal Court yesterday on charges of seconddegree assault against security police officers at Shea Stadium and released for a hearing on Sept. 8.

title: Rockefeller Seen in Tune With Ford on Vital Issues
description: Judging by his recent record, Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President would be in tune with President Ford on such key issues as dtente, defense spending and the economy.

title: AMEX STOCKS DIP; OTC AREA MIXED
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange finished lower yesterday for the eighth consecutive session. Prices on the overthecounter market were mixed.

title: A.E.E. Study Finds Hazards of Reactors Very Slight
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 The Atomic Energy Commission released today a study of nuclear power plant safety indicating that the chance of mass destruction from an atomic reactor accident was as unlikely as that of a meteor striking an urban area once in a million years.

title: Monday's Fights
description: New York (At Felt Forum)Davey Vasquez, New York, outpointed Andres Torres, Puerto Rico, 10 rounds, bantamweights; Frankie Benitez, Puerto Rico, outpointed Richie Harris, New York, 8, bantamweights.

title: 2 Youths Held in Theft Of Policemen Bicycles
description: Two youths were arrested last night and charged with stealing: the bicycles of two police officers at gunpoint on anticrime patrol in Central Park last Sunday.

title: House Supports Measure To Guard. Pension Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Thee House of Representatives approved today major bill aimed at protecting the pension rights of an estimated 30 million American workers in private industry.

title: Lisbon Gets Pope's Views
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 20 (AP)  Pope Paul VI told the new Portuguese Ambassador to, the Vatican today that he was following with great interest Portugal's new policy toward her African territories and that he hoped it would lead to accords offering secure conditions of justice, peace and progress. The Am. bassador, Jos: Thomas Cabral, is the first envoy of the new Portuguese Government to the Vatican.

title: Queens Youth Is Charged With Policeman's Slaying
description: A 19yearold youth was charged yesterday with the murder of Police Officer Thomas V. Pegues on a busy street corner in South Jamaica, Queens. The youth, whom the police identified as John Gordon of 13715 157th Street, Springfield Gardens, Queens, had been a passenger in a car that 27yearold Officer Pegues and his partner had stopped for a routine license and registration check at about 10:30 Monday night.

title: HUNDREDS ON IRT TRAPPED BY FIRE
description: A fire in an IRT subway tunnel under the East River in the evening rush hour yesterday trapped four. Seventh Avenue trains in smoky darkness between the Wall Street Station and Brooklyn's Clark Street Station, forcing the removal of hundreds of riders through emergency exits.

title: Crocker Reduces Issue Of Notes by $35Million
description: The Crocker National Corporation, San Francisco, yesterday announced that it was reducing the size of its proposed issue of floating rate notes due 1944 from $75million to $40million.

title: Jury to Investigate Betting on Dogfights In the Chicago Area
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21 (Reuters) A county grand jury will open an investigation here tomorrow into allegations that gamblers in the Chicago area are betting on fights between dogs trained to kill.

title: A.T. & T. to Raise Quarterly Dividend to
description: Directors of the American Telephone & Telegraph Company, the world's largest corporation and the most broadly owned American enterprise, voted an eightcent increase in the quarterly dividend to 85 cents a share yesterday.

title: Bus Driver Mysteriously Gets $131,000 to Ransom Nephew
description: A city bus driver raised $131,000 in just a few hours last weekend to ransom his 20yearold nephew from a band of professional kidnappers, according to detectives investigating the case.

title: Neil Amdur
description: To most professional athletes, their team physician is a combination of Dr. Spock and Dr. Feelgood. He mends bruised bones and also babies proud, sensitive souls that cry out for advice and understanding. Most players want and need coaches' approval, especially when they are injured and can't perform, Dave Meggyesy, the former linebacker of the St. Louis Cardinals, observed in Out of Their League, an indictment of the dehumanization in football. It really tears them up when the coach won't even speak to them.

title: Buford Pusser, Sheriff Depicted In Walking Tall Film, Is Dead
description: Buford Pusser, whose exploits as a crusading sheriff in McNairy County, Tennessee, were related in the hit movie Walking Tall, was killed in a traffic accident early yesterday, only hours after he had agreed to star in a sequel to the movie that made him famous.

title: Bembridge Golf Victor
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland, Aug. 21 (UPI)Maurice Bembridge, a British Ryder Cup member, carded a fourunderpar 66 today for a 136 to win the 36hole Benson and Hedges individual golf championship by a stroke from Bob Charles of New Zealand.

title: 15.26 Decline on Dow Covers Wide Spectrum of Prominent Issues
description: The stock market, apparently unable to digest more than one session of prosperity, resumed its recent losing pattern yesterday, as prices dropped sharply in slower trading.

title: Deadline for Auto Insurance
description: TRENTON, Aug. 21 (AP)The state said today that New Jersey motroists insured by the insolvent Gateway Insurance Company of Philadelphia had until Sept. 20 to purchase coverage from another company. The company insures mostly assigned risk drivers in New Jersey. A coalition of insurance companies doing business in the state will assume responsibility for paying claims brought by Gateway policyholders.

title: Ford and Kissinger in Tribute to Slain Cyprus Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger led the mourners at Andrews Air Force Base outside Washington today as the body of Ambassador Rodger P. Davies, who was slain in Cyprus on Monday, was returned.

title: Constantine Is Open To Ceremonial Role As Greek Monarch
description: LONDON, Aug. 21  King Constantine, virtually the only Greek unable to return home since the downfall of the Athens junta, is prepared to accept severe restrictions on the authority of the monarch in exchange for an opportunity to return to his country.

title: Affiliate Artists Strive to Bridge Gap to Audience
description: WASHINGTON  Although the health of the arts at times appears to be precarious at bestwitness the recent deMise of the National Ballet here and the Dallas Symphony  there is encouraging news to be found in a flourishing, grassroots effort to bridge the gap between artist and audience.

title: Detective Indicted In Shakedown Case By Jury in Bergen
description: HACKENSACK, Aug. 21 (AP) A Jersey City detective has been indicted here on charge of attempting to shake down an Englewood physician for $20,000.

title: Woman Freed on Contempt
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 21 (UPI)A woman who refused to testify before a Federal grand jury investigating the group known as the Symbionese Liberation Army has been ordered released from jail. U. S. Distrid Judge Alfonzo Zirpoli released Cynthia Garvey on her own recognizance yesterday after Justice William O. Douglas ordered the release. She has been held in contempt.

title: People and Business
description: Former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally, once vigorously sought by corporations as a director, has quietly resigned from the boards of two Texas banks. Mr. Connally pleaded not guilty earlier this month to charges of accepting a bribe, committing perjury and conspiring to obstruct justice in a milk money scandal.

title: HARRY C. YOXALL
description: Harry C. Yoxall, director of the old Alfred Corning Clark Neighborhood House at 283 Rivington Street, on the Lower East Side, died Tuesday in the [Coral Gables Convalescent Home, Miami. He was 99 years old.

title: Restoration of Lowell
description: LOWELL, Mass., Aug. 21 (AP)A $9.1million grant to help restore Lowell has been promised by Gov. Francis W. Sargent. The restoration would be part of the proposed Lowell Heritage State Park.

title: Rockefeller Is Expected To Spur Inflation Drive
description: SEAL HARBOR, Me., Aug. 21  Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller will very likely head President Ford's Domestic Affairs Council and play a key role in the Administration's antiinflation efforts, informed sources said today.

title: PYRAMID SELLING BARRED BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission issued a ruling today that would ban outright a system of selling called pyramid marketing.

title: Rockefeller Is Expected To Spur Inflation Drive
description: SEAL HARBOR, Me., Aug. 21  Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller will very likely head President Ford's Domestic Affairs Council and play a key role in the Administration's antiinflation efforts, informed sources said today.

title: Readers in Soviet Informed Of Rockefeller's Nomination
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 21The official Government newspaper Izvestia, reporting yesterday's nomination of Nelson A. Rockefeller to be Vice President, informed Soviet readers tonight that Americans considered the post a stepping stone to the White House.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: I.M.C. AND LEAMAN HALT TRANSFER PLAN
description: The International Minerals & Chemical Corporation and Chemical Leaman Tank Lines, Inc. said yesterday that they have withdrawn their applications from the Interstate Commerce Commission for the transfer of Chemical Leaman's operating rights to an I.M.C. subsidiary. The application was filed in connection with Chemical Leaman's proposed merger into the subsidiary.

title: BLOC CHIEFS SHUN FETE IN RUMANIA
description: BUCHAREST, Aug. 21 Aleksei N. Kosygin and Willi Stoph, Premiers of the Soviet Union and East Germany, arrived here today to participate in the 30th anniversary of Rumania's liberation from Axis rule during World War II.

title: Constantine Is Open To Ceremonial Role As Greek Monarch
description: LONDON, Aug. 21  King Constantine, virtually the only Greek unable to return home since the downfall of the Athens junta, is prepared to accept severe restrictions on the authority of the monarch in exchange for an opportunity to return to his country.

title: Samples of His Restaurant's Dishes
description: LOBSTER COOKED ON SEAWEED

title: Wallace Waterfall Dead at 74; Secretary of Physics Institute
description: Wallace Waterfall, secretary emeritus of the American Institute of Physics, died yesterday of cancer in the Brandywine Nursing Home in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. He was 74 years old and lived at 6 Merestone Terrace, Bronxville, N.Y.

title: LIVELY AIR MARKS STOMPERS' JAZZ
description: One of the continuing New York oasis for those who like the kind of freewheeling traditional jazz that could once be heard at Eddie Condon's and Nick's is the Mondaynight sessions by the Grove Street Stompers at Arthur's, 57 Grove Street, just off Sheridan Square, The Stompers, a sixpiece band of avocational jazz musicians led by Bill Dunham, a pianist who by day is a Wall Street broker, are now in their 12th year of their onceaweek appearances at Arthur's.

title: People in Sports
description: The Washington Bullets joined yesterday the growing pro basketball trend of signing top talent to longterm contracts. The NationBasketball Association team gave Phil Chenier, the rising backcourt star, a sevenyear contract. Bob Ferry, the Bullets' general manager, railed the contract, a lucrative one that befits a player of Phil's caliber. He is one of the top guards in all of basketball, if not the greatest one. Reports were that the contract was worth $2million.

title: Nader Hopes to See Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI)Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, never welcomed at the White House during either the Nixon or Johnson administrations, wants an appointment to see President Ford. Ford should initiate a new era where it is not considered a breach of protocol to meet with citizens, Mr. Nader said today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PETER PRINCIPLE For a person who has spent most of his 30odd years becoming acquainted with the corrosive realities of drugs, poverty and crime, Peter Copani is not doing poorly these days. He has more productions of his plays done by street theater companies around town than Neil Simon usually has on Broadway. All his work bears a quality of vibrant ghetto life that, in the view of many established critics, gives it a fierce blend of energy and substance.

title: Pro Transactions
EXWESTGATE AIDES ACT TO BAR EVIDENCE
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 21 (UPI)Three motions to suppress evidence were filed in United States District Court yesterday on behalf of C. Arnholt Smith and Philip A. Taft, both former executives of the financially troubled WestgateCalifornia Corporation.

title: Spain Tells U.N. She Will Hold Referendum in Sahara Colony
description: MADRID, Aug. 21 (UPI) Spain announced today that she would hold a referendum in her northwest African colony of Spanish Sahara next year to allow the people there to determine their political future.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: An Ode to Trees
description: Occasionally, a truly superb book is written on subject that appeared to be thoroughly embraced by previous publications, and such is Hugh Johnson's The International Book of Trees.

title: Namath Set For Return To Pocket
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 21. Joe Namath and his escort have a date in St. Louis Friday night.

title: LUCKENBACH DEATH REMAINS A MYSTERY
description: The police investigating the death of Edgar F. Luckenbach Jr., a shipping executive, said yesterday that they had not been able to account for his movements in the hours before his death on Aug. 9.

title: Nearby Yachting
description: (Final round of fourofsevenrace series) Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound, Noroton (Coon.) Y.C., William S. Cox, defeated Florida Sailing Association, St. Petersburg Y.C., Edwin Sherman, 4 races to 0.

title: WYOMING OIL BROKER GETS G.O.P. HOUSE BID
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Aug. 21 (UPI)Thomas Stroock, a Yale graduate who moved to Wyoming in 1948, won the Republican nomination for the House by tasily defeating two political unknowns yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Rauf Denktash, the Turkish Cypriote leader, said he was prepared to form a provisional independent Turkish state in Cyprus if the Greeks refuse to negotiate a peace settlement. Warning of further Turkish military intervention if Greeks harass Turkish Cypriote villages, he indicated that the refugee problem could be solved by an exChange of populations moving 60,000 Turkish Cypriotes into the Turkishheld area. [1:5.]

title: Food Costs OH Slightly as Index Climbs 0.8%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 The steep rise in consumer prices nioderated, at least temporarily, in July, the Labor Department reported today.

title: East German Swimmers Snap 2 World Records
description: VIENNA, Aug. 21 (UPI)Ulrike Tauber and Rosemarie Kother, two East German teenagers, set world records today at the European swimming championships. The records were the sixth by the East German team, which leaves next Tuesday for Concord, Calif., and a dual meet with the United States.

title: American Airlines Files Bid
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) American Airlines has announced that it has field an application with the Civil Aeronautics Board for nonstop authority between Boston and Toronto. Nonstop authority between the two cities became of fective last May when a bila eral agreement was signed b the United States and Canad.

title: MASSTRANSIT BILL HELD INADEQUATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Senator Harrison A. Williams today criticized as inadequate the new $11billion, sixyear a masstransportation bill passed by the House of Representafives, saying it called on cities to put up matching funds they simply do not have.

title: TEXAS INMATE KILLED AS JAIL REVOLT ENDS
description: AMARILLO, Tex, Aug, 21 (UPI)Armed deputies blasted their way into the Potter County jail today and freed a jailer held hostage for 36 hours by five knifewielding inmates. The leader of the revolt was killed and three other persons were wounded in the assault.

title: Chicago Paper Said to Plan To Discontinue Publication
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21 (AP)Chicago Today, the nation's fifth largest afternoon daily newspaper, will cease publication on Sept. 13, a local television station reported today.

title: Phone Restoration Tonight Expected in 42d St. Area
description: All telephones in the area around 42d Street and Third Avenue that werek nocked out of service by last Saturday's heavy rain will be restored to service by tonight, a spokesman for the New York Telephone Company said yesterday.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Webster Listed in Good Condition

title: Expenses in City Area Up 0.5% in Month
description: A dramatic lesson in how the rising cost of city and state government is inflating living costs for residents here was given yesterday by the Consumer Price Index for New York and northern New Jersey.

title: KENYA BARS ODINGA IN FALL ELECTIONS
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 21 (AP)The Government today banned Oginga Odinga, the former leader of the country's outlawed Opposition party, the Kenya People's Union, from running for a seat in Perliament in the October general elections.

title: F.D.A. Links Rise in Deaths to Birth Device
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration reported today a sharp increase in the number of deaths and uterine infections among women who used the intrauterine contraceptive device known as the Dalkon Shield.

title: CLIFFORD J. LAUBE, NEWSMAN, POET
description: Clifford J. Laube, a poet and newspaperman who was Brooklyn and suburban editor during his 24year career on The New York Times, died yesterday of cancer in Callicoon, N. Y. Mr. Laub, who Was 82 years old, had divided his time in recent years between his homes at 10706 103d Avenue in Richmond Hill, Queens, and in Jeffersonville, N. Y.

title: SHOP TALK
description: With most stores showing fall clothes, as if the maple leaves were going to turn red and gold before the week is out, it's not easy to find summer things above the category of leftovers. Yet everyone knows there is a lot of hot weather to come.

title: Notes on People
description: The Army reported yesterday that Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, Army Chief of Staff, was being treated in Walter Reed Army Medical Center for blood clot and that he is in serious condition.

title: Fuel Oil Plan Scored
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Representative Robert H. Steele, Republican of Connecticut, who is a nominee for Governor, says a Federal Energy Administration proposal on residual fuel oil could add $200million to New England electricity bills next year. The plan would exempt residual fuel oil used in electricity generating plants from mandatory allocation regulations.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Zoning Plan Developed to Preserve Clinton Area
description: The City Planning Commission has developed a proposal for a special zoning district on the West Side embodying what John E. Zuccotti, the commission chairman, describes as revolutionary zoning concepts to preserve the Clinton neighborhood, which has been threatened with largescale development.

title: Spanish Bank to Open Here
description: Banco Urquijo sa Madrid said yesterday it had been granted a license to operate an office in New York. It will be the first Spanish banking operation in the United States it said.

title: Courageous Gets Victory, But Is Yet to Gain Spoils
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug 21Although Courageous beat Intrepid today for the second straight time, by 1 minute 31 seconds in light, shifting winds, the New York Yacht Club's dilemma continued about which yacht to select to defend the America's Cup.

title: VOTE PANEL HEARS PATERSON MAYOR
description: MORRISTOWN, Aug. 21 Mayor Lawrence Kramer of Paterson testified today at State Election Law Enforcement Commission hearing that he transferred $9,050 of his own campaign funds to the treasuries of two City Council candidates. But he denied that the funds were then used to further his mayoral campaign preceding the May 14 municipal election.

title: TV: Cavett and Williams
description: After Dick Cavett's long, fascinating exchange with Katharine Hepburn, his 90minute dialogue with Tennessee Williams, starting tonight at 11:30 over ABCTV, seems tamely unrevealing. The background of New Orleans could hardly be more picturesque.

title: TWODAM PROJECT OPPOSED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21By a vote of 21 to 15, the House Interior Committee approved today a bill designed to prevent the American Electric Power System from building a $430million hydroelectric project on the New River in western Virginia and North Carolina.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: G.M. Agrees to Roll Back 1975 Price Rise to 8.5%
description: DETROIT, Aug. 21The General Motors Corporation said today that because of pressure from President Ford it is lowering its previously announced 9.5 per cent price increases on 1975 models to 8.5 percent. This move means that the cost of G.M. cars and trucks with average equipment will be increased by $426, or $54 less than the planned rise of $480.

title: Nurse's Illness to Force TB Test for 1,300 la ants
description: Almost all the 1,300 babies born in Yonkers since midDecember may have been exposed to tuberculosis, and Westchester County health officials have begun notifying parents to bring their infants in for tests.

title: PERSONAL INCOME CLIMBED IN JULY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Personal income and new orders for durable goods both ders for durable goods rose strongly in July, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Syrian Arrives to See Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Foreign Minister Abdel Halim Khaddam of Syria arrived today for talks with Secretary of State Kissinger that American officials hope will clarify Syria's intentions, viewed ominously in Israel and with some disquiet here.

title: Cosmos Rehire Bradley
description: The New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League rehired yesterday Coach Gordon Bradley for the fifth straight season. Bradley is the only coach the Cosmos have had since they joined the N.A.S.L. in 1971.

title: PearlyWhite Teeth and Pretty Hair Don't Guarantee A Happy Life, Despite What Some Texas Mothers Say
description: WASHINGTONIn the small Texas town I grew up in, a girl was firmly taught that if she had clean hair, pretty teeth, and had been a cheerleader, she would have a good life.

title: Fare Defenders Look Homeward
description: City officials who have been looking to Washington for a significant contribution to preserve the 35cent fare beyond Jan. 1 began looking closer to home yesterday.

title: Stars Rout Texans by 4310
Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: SENATE BILL RAISES G.I. BENEFITS BY 23%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Senate passed and returned to the House today a compromise bill that would give veterans attending school under the G.I. bill a 23 per cent increase in monthly benefits.

title: ... and Improving the Bad
description: The Federal Government's move to enforce compliance with its air quality standards in Boston raises hope that the Environmental Protection Agency intends to be more like its old self where the upgrading of urban air is concerned. As far as the automobile goes, city dwellers can take comfort from the warning by Mr. Quarles that the E.P.A. will not shrink from strong action to achieve the purpose of the Clean Air Act of 1970.

title: RULE ON BANK AID PROPOSED BY FED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 The Federal Reserve Board proposed today a new regulation that would permit a higher interest rate on discount window borrowings by banks that need exceptionally large assistance over a prolonged period of time.

title: Thief in Paris Loots SafeDeposit Boxes of $2Million
description: PARIS, Aug. 21Last month a man rented a safedeposit box at a branch of the Rothschild Bank here, and in subsequent days paid three visits to the vault carrying a large suitcase. Today the police estimated that he had managed to remove as much as $2million worth of valuables from safedeposit boxes in the vault by using duplicate keys stolen from the bank.

title: Guerrilla Guns and Bombs Disrupt a Town in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Palestinian guerrillas demonstrated in the port of Saida, in southern Lebanon, this morning to protest the killing of a comrade by polidemen yesterday in a roadblock clash outside the town.

title: Coast Bar Suspends Krogh for 9 Months
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Egil Krogh Jr., the former White House aide who was convicted of authorizing the breakin at the offices of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist, was suspended today from practicing law in Washington State.

title: Police Believe Suspect in Coast Bombing Acted Alone
