title: Design
description: It was a shack with peeling paint and such an appalling buildup of dirt and decay that the asking price was $13,500 in 1968, but artist Lou Fink and his wife Florence could see beyond the neglect to the possibilities. They bought it, and the cost of transforming it into a charming cottage was less than $10,000. How did they do it? By tackling every inch of the work themselves. The decrepit little house in Sag Harbor, L. I., was only 22 feet wide and 50 long, and it contained a warren of tiny rooms with every wall papered in a different pattern and every floor buried under layers of linoleum. The roof leaked, the plumbing was archaic and the wiring dangerous. There were doors everywhere, five in the bedroom alone, Mrs. Fink said. Every time Lou walked out of the house, he had a door under his arm. Wherever possible, they removed walls as well as doors. Taking down the wall between the living and dining rooms created a spacious openplan living area. A new eatin kitchen, a small study and bath complete the ground floor. Two bedrooms and a second bathroom are upstairs. Builders claimed that a steel beam would have to be installed to shore up the second story when the livingroom wall was removed, but Mr. Fink devised a postandbeam method to hold it up at a fraction of the cost. Their ingenuity extended to the furnishings. A builtin banquette in the living room uses the space more efficiently than a sofa. A wallhung cabinet provides storage and also serves as a buffet. Mr. Fink built and installed the kitchen cabinets. I'm really a frustrated architect, he says. I loved the challenge of solving the problems. The result of their labors is as lightfilled and open in feeling inside as a modern house. while the outside is a faithful restoration. wall between the living and dining rooms created a spacious openplan living area. A new eatin kitchen, a small study and bath complete the ground floor. Two bedrooms and a second bathroom are upstairs. Builders claimed that a steel beam would have to be installed to shore up the second story when the livingroom wall was removed, but Mr. Fink devised a postandbeam method to hold it up at a fraction of the cost. Their ingenuity extended to the furnishings. A builtin banquette in the living room uses the space more efficiently than a sofa. A wallhung cabinet provides storage and also serves as a buffet. Mr. Fink built and installed the kitchen cabinets. I'm really a frustrated architect, he says. I loved the challenge of solving the problems. The result of their labors is as lightfilled and open in feeling inside as a modern house. while the outside is a faithful restoration.

title: Cuban Work in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Aug. 24 (UPI)The unemployment rate of Cuban immigrants living in Puerto Rico is zero, compared with an overall island average of more than 12 per cent. The figures came from a study made by a local agency for the Federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, which found that Puerto Rican businesses discriminated against Puerto Ricans in hiring. The study found that employers preferred to hire United States mainlanders and Cubans.

title: You can go home again
description: Last winter when I saw my first episode of Upstairs, Downstairs, I knewabsolutely and irrevocablywhat I always suspected: I was born in the wrong time. While there were times I found it difficult to identify with Elizabeth (Why must she fly in the face of convention like that ? Wasn't her wedding to Laurence, after all, beautiful beyond belief?), I have had no trouble in imagining myself Lady Marjorie, sharing with her, as I do, impeccable taste and an interest, verging on passion cin devoting myself to looking pretty.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time
description: MAXIM GORKI (Wall St., Cruises), Cruise to Nowhere; sails 9 P.M. from W. 44th St.

title: Judith T. Sim, Bank Executive Have Nuptials
description: Judith Terry Sim, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. H. Craig Sim of Garden City, L.I., was married yesterday afternoon to John Manfred Sartorius Jr., son of Mr. Sartorius of Tenafly, N.J., and Quogue, L.I., and the late Frances Cauchois Sartorius.

title: Kosygin Returns to Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 24 (Reuters) Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin returned here today from Bucharest after having attended celebrations of the 30th anniversary of Rumania's antifascist insurrection in World War II.

title: Busy Weekends Ahead For Dog Events in Area
description: For the next two weekends, metropolitan fanciers have a busy schedule. Six shows are listed over the next nine days, and all a relatively short distance from the city. Newton, Rockland and New Brunswick take place in that order over the Labor Day weekend, and Tuxedo, Somerset Hills and Westchester follow, starting Sept. 6.

title: Reds Turn Back Expos With 2 Runs in 9th, 64
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 24 (AP)  Runscoring singles by Tony Perez and. Cesar Geronimo in the ninth inning today gave the Cincinnati Reds a 64 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: Determined King Scores As 301 Shot
description: CHICAGO, Aug, 24 (UPI) Determined King, a 301 outsider, made up five lengths in the final sixteenth of a mile today to win the $132,000 American Derby for 3yearolds at Arlington Park, upsetting favored Holding Pattern.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Soviet Says NATO Backs Turks' Invasion of Cyprus
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 24The Soviet Union, in a new attempt to link the North Atlantic Treaty Organization directly to the hostilities in Cyprus, implied today that the Western alliance had ordered the Turkish invasion of the island after failing to gain control through the earlier Greekled coup.

title: Mommy goes to college
description: Catherine Appel lives on Crow Hil Road in Mount Kisco, N.Y., only a few winding country miles from a Loehmann's branch, and yet she rarely stops to look at the designer bargains there.

title: Miss Upton Bride of Mark Fulford
description: Katherine Miller Upton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederic Kendall Upton of Concord, N. H., was married yesterday afternoon to Mark Lansing Fulford, son of Mr. and Mrs, Hunter Lansing Fulford of Baltimore, The Rev. David Hamilton peforrned the the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Concord.

title: Italian Industrialist Accused Of Aiding Rightist Plotters
description: PADUA, Italy, Aug. 24 (AP) Andrea Mario Piaggio, one of Italy's wealthiest men, was arrested today on charges of having financed subversive rightwing activity.

title: Moroccan Proposes Oct. 24 As Date for Arab Parley
description: CAIRO, Aug. 24 (Reuters)King Hassan II of Morocco hasproposed Oct. 24 as the new date for a postponed Arab summit conference in Rabat.

title: Exotic Plants in Terrarium Were the Life of the Party
description: There were two kinds of bottles at an East Side party the other night. One kind contained wine. The other kind contained plants, which was what the party was all about.

title: REV. THOMAS AUSTIN
description: The Rev. Brother Thomas Austin, former Piovincial of the Marist Brothers and the first American to become an assistant general of the Catholic order, died Aug. 14 in Kobe, Japan. He was 77 years old and had been in Japan for the last 12 years, including 10 as Provincial Visitor.

title: ATHENS CAUTIOUS ON MOSCOW PLAN FOR CYPRUS TALK
description: ATHENS, Aug. 24  Greek officials sought today to clarify, and soften, the sudden statement of Foreign Minister George Mavros early this morning that Athens would accept a Soviet proposal for an international conference on the Cyprus issue.

title: Tax Cuts Suggested To Aid Environment
description: MINEOLAA recommendation that Nassau County give tax deductions to owners of environmentally valuable and unusual openspace land to keep it undeveloped was among the proposals in an analysis of the county's land, air and water resources released last week by County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: New NOW Unit leeks to Aid Prisoners
description: CLINTON TOWNSHIP There is a new chapter here of the National Organization for Women (NOW), but the problems it is dealing with are far removed from, and much more complex than, those confronted by other chapters.

title: Quad Stars Are Upset By N.Y.A.C.
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Aug. 24 The New York Athletic Club quad upset an allstar national team today on Lake Carnegie to win the right to represent the United States in the world rowing championships at Lucerne, Switzerland, Sept. 4 to 8.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Ken Polke, who went from No. 1 quarterback to No. 4 with the Miami Dolphins when the veterans returned, says: Sure I expected it to happen. But it's a real shocker to have busted your butt for a month and a half playing most of the time and thenin space of a few hoursbe on the fourth team.

title: Mayday! Pleasure Boats On Increase in the Sound
description: EATONS NECK  Mayday! the boatman's call for help, is increasingly being sent on shiptoshore radios to the United States Coast Guard Station here as a result of the sharp rise in pleasureboating.

title: Racing Odd Couple: Hunt and a Tigress
description: James Hunt, who drives for the one team in grand prix racing that does not allow sponsors, wears an advertising emblem on his racing uniform Sex: The Breakfast of Champions.

title: The Pick Of Modern American Music
description: Where did the list come from? It evolved from a search by the yearold International Contemporary Music Exchange (ICME) for a highly selective list of works that it would feel justified in promoting through music centers here and in Europe. It was done this way: The organization's director, Igor Buketoff, asked 40 people10 composers, 10 conductors, 10 critics and 10 leading media peopleto name 10 prospective jurors, who were familiar with contemporary American music and objective about compositional styles. The nine with the most recommendations became the jurors. They did not act as a body, but prepared their selections individually.

title: Letter from Laos
description: VIENTIANE. The Vietnamese grow rice. The Khmer watch rice growing. The Lao listen to rice growing. Somewhere in this jolly colonial slander, fashioned by some anonymous French wit, lies a grain of truth that helps explain why the Kingdom of Laos is at peace while its Indochinese neighbors, Vietnam and Cambodia, remain at war. To their eternal credit, the warring Lao partiesthe Americanfunded Vientiane Government and the North Vietnamesenourished Pathet Laonever were very warlike: Their instinct on the battlefield was for compromise, not carnage. It was not unknown for Lao commanders to meet, compare their respective forces and declare the preponderant side the winner. Now that the ceasefire is a year and a half old, aversion to bloodshed runs even stronger. Hitching a ride on a motorized sampan down the Mekong River, two Vientiane soldiers volunteered that they had just fled a surprise Pathet Lao attack on their outpost (a rare ceasefire violation). Asked why they had bolted, one soldier, finding the question unintelligent, responded: Why, one man was killed!

title: Kissinger Completes Parley With Syrian; Silence on Results
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (Reuters)The Syrian Foreign Minister, Abdel Nalim Khaddam, today concluded a series of talks on the Middle East in a onehour meeting with Secretary of State Kissinger at the White House.

title: Israeli Poll Shows a Drop In Popularity for Kissinger
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 24 (SIB)Secretary of State Kissinger's popularity with Israelis has dropped 15.5 per cent since June, a publicopinion poll disclosed this week.

title: Army Rejected Bid For Justice Inquiry Into an Ad Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) The Army has acknowledged that it rejected investigators' recommendations for a Justice Department inquiry into evidence of possible criminal misconduct by senior Pentagon oflicials in awarding a $40million advertising contract.

title: Indiana Klan Chief Advises Members To Get Shotguns
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 24  William M. Chaney, grand drag. on of the Indiana Ku Klux Klan, has urged Klan members to arm every household with shotguns as a result of two shooting incidents in Kokomo, Ind., in the last month.

title: FARM EXPERTS SEE A U.S. OPPORTUNITY TO LESSEN HUNGER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24The United States has substantial reserves of agricultural resources that could help feed the world's hungry if there were sufficient economic incentives and significant changes in traditional Federal farm policy, a number of leading agricultural experts agree.

title: C. C. Felton 3d Marries Sallie Knowlton
description: Sallie Elliott Knowlton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Elliott B. Knowlton of Holden, Mass., was married yesterday noon (to Cornelius Conway Felton 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Felton Jr. of Pride's Crossing, Mass.

title: House Allowance Raised
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) House members will get more stationery and stamps, effective immediately, under new allowances set by the House Administration Committee. The stationery allowance was raised last January to $5,250 a member. The committee's newest action, which under new procedures does not have to be ratified by the House, raises this to $6,500 a Congressman. A second order increased the stamps allowance from $910 to $1,140 per Congressman.

title: Votes in Congress Last Week's Tally for Metropolitan Area
description: Senate

title: Battle Hymn of Republic
description: ISTANBULLenin once wrote, The standing army, everywhere and in ill countries is intended for use not so much against the external as the internal enemy. While this assertion is no more true of Turkey than it is of the Soviet Union the military in this nation have an ancient tradition of interfering in political affairs.

title: Judy, Rogers Wed to Scott Surrey
description: Judy Lynn Rogers and Scott Stanley Surrey, who received master's degrees in social sciences from Boston University in May, were married yesterday afternoon. The Rev. John B. Knight, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony in the barn at Blythebrook Farm in Millis, Mass.

title: Nakamura Leads by 3
description: FUKUOKA, Japan, Aug. 24 (AP)Toru Nakamura carded a twounderpar 70 today and took a threestroke lead over Jumbo Ozaki going into tomorrow's final round of the KBC golf tournament. Graham Marsh of Australia was second.

title: Bonomi Wins Cowes Race
description: COWES, Isle of Wight, Aug. 24 (AP)Carlo Bonomi of Italy, the world champion, won the international power boat race today with Dry Martini in the English Channel. Bonomi covered the 240mile course at an average speed of 66.90 miles per hour, a record for the event.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: These are progress reports based on Times inquiries into unfinished news events.

title: ExBoxer, Shot, Dies
description: BOSTON, Aug. 24 (AP)Tommy Tibbs, a New England lightweight boxing champion in the early 1960's, died today at Boston City Hospital from gunshot wounds he suffered last night in an argument in a Roxbury cafe. He was 40 years old.

title: Archery Title to Miss Butz
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Aug. 24 (UPI)Ann Butz of Corning, N.Y., took her fifth consecutive national title in the 12th annual Professional Archers Association championships today. Frank Gandy of Bartow, Fla., won the men's title in a playoff with Steve Robinson of Richwood, Ohio.

title: Falkenberg Enters The Hall of Fame
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 24 (AP)Four former stars were inducted into the National Lawn Tennis Hall of Fame at the Newport Casino today.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Whatever was in William Wilson's mind when he wrote DETOUR (Berkley/Putnam's, $5.95), it cannot be denied that he has come up with a shocker. Most likely the novel is a parable of manof his innate goodness mixed with his innate deviltry. Both goodness and deviltry exist equally. This coexistence leads to the damnedest things. Wilson has set up a situation in which a group of people in a small Western town, isolated from the world, face a major problem. They go about meeting it, in a way that will suggest the famous Shirley Julson story, The Lottery. And Kafka too plays a part in Wilsurreal world.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation has leased approximately 47,000 square feet of office space at No. 5 World Trade Center for 25 years at an aggregate rent of about $10million.

title: Defense Agency Cut Imperils South Jersey Clothing Industry
description: EGG HARBORThousands of jobs in the men's clothing industry, long a bulwark of the South Jersey economy, are at stake under the dual impact of a sharp cutback in Defense Department contracts and a slackening in the demand for civilian attire.

title: Underage Taking to Drink
description: NEWARK  Reflecting what is apparently a national trend, police officials in many North Jersey communities report a huge increase In complaints involving drinking by boys and girls under the age of 18.

title: The World
description: Turkey is now sitting back in confidence over the Cyprus issue, waiting for negotiations with Greece that can end only in general confirmation of what Turkey has accomplished by arms, and beginning to count the benefits of conquest. One thing was immediately clear on Cyprus: The Turkish minority would now live much better and the Greek majority considerably worse.

title: An Impressive but Propandistic Show of Chinese Art
description: TORONTO EIGHT years ago, when news of the Cultural Revolution in China began to reach the West, there was considerable apprehension concerning the fate of China's art treesures. Rumor suggested that in their excessive iconoclastic zeal the Red Guard were desecrating temples and toppling statues. Even the security of the museums was in doubt. Senior archaeologists, we heard, were being persecuted, and all archaeological activity on the mainland had ceased.

title: 9 Hospitals Join to Fight Breast Cancer
description: Nine Brooklyn hospitals have been enlisted by the Downstate Medical Center in a coordinated effort to detect and treat breast cancer.

title: Today's Sections
description: *Included in all copies distributed in New York City and the suburban area.

title: Marianne A. Woudhuysen Wed In Rye to Kenneth James Penn
description: Marianne Agnes Woudhuysen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andries D. Woudhuysen of Rye, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Kenneth James Penn. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard James Penn of Southampton, England.

title: Tunis Challenge the. Role Of U.N. Force on Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 24On the eve of Secretary General Waldheim's visit to Cyprus, the role of the United Nations peacekeeping force on the island is being challenged by the Turks and Turkish Cypriotes and praised by the Greek Cypriotes.

title: Directions to Ridgewood C.C.
description: From New York City and Long IslandGeorge Washington Bridge to Route 4 to Route 17. North to Midland Avenue (Glen Rock Exit). Halfmile to club entrance.

title: Title Soccer Game Today Is Showcase for TV Pact
description: How far soccer will get the green pastures of television will depend a great deal on this afternoon, when the North. American League's championship game will be televised live by the Columbia Broadcasting Systern (Channel 2 in New York) at 3:30 o'clock.

title: Is Liquidity Of Business In Jeopardy?
description: Not since the Penn Central collapsed in mid1970, have the clouds hung so heavy and dark over Wall Street.

title: Home Buyers All Over U.S. Feel the. Economy's Crunch
description: With the price of both new and older homes rising, increasing numbers of middleincome Americans are being priced out of the singlefamily housing market, according to a nationwide sampling of real estate brokers, home builders and bankers.

title: Kunstler and Lane Freed After Night in Prison
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 24 (AP)Two lawyers, William M. Kunstler and Mark Lane, were released from jail today after a long meeting between another lawyer for two American Indian Movement leaders and Judge Fred Nichol of United States District Court.

title: Definitions for Today's Theater
description: ISHOULD like to propose two categories that would define the theater institutions currently operating in the United States. This definition will not be based on geographical, economic or structural principles but is inspired rather by artistic goals and practicesa yardstick that seems to me eminently more interesting than where a theater is located or what constitutes its chief source of funds. The categories. I propose are seminal theater and consumer theater. Before defining these terms, however, let me explain why I find the current distinctions somewhat inadequate, in view of recent developments in the American theater.

title: RUNDLE RESIGNS CITY PRISON POST
description: Dr. Frank L. Rundle has resigned as director of psychiatry for the city's Prison Health Services because, he said, the program is being scrapped.

title: Recordings
description: HAYDN, spent most of his creative life, from 1761 to 1809, employed by the Hungarian noble family of Esterhazy. He wasn't entirely happy about the situationthe musical facilities were excellent but Esterhazy castle lay well outside the European mainstream and only in his later years, after two fabulously successful trips to London, did Haydn receive the kind of international acclaim that was due him.

title: Historic Buildings to Be Restored for Bicentennial
description: TRENTONThe state's Bicentennial Celebration Commission has selected eight historic buildings for matching grants so as to insure their restoration or development in time for the nation's 200th birthday observance in 1976.

title: Headliners
description: Los Angeles police have a suspect in the Aug. 6 bombing of Los Angeles International Airport. He is Muharem Kurbegovic, a Yugoslav alien who came here seven years ago. His citizenship papers have been held up due to a previous arrest for an unspecified sex offense. For the time being, officials are satisfied that Mr. Kurbegovic acted alone in the airport bombing, which killed three persons an injured 35. The suspect, it is reported, is going into trances and refusing to talk. But, police said, enough bombmaking paraphernalia was found in Mr. Kurbegovic's apartment to fill a small pickup truck.

title: Rocket Man Is Honored By Russians
description: KALUGA, U.S.S.R., Aug. 21 When the Soyuz team of Soviet cosmonauts returns to earth from its rendezvous next July with the Apollo crew of American astronauts, one of the first formal stops will almost certainly be this pleasant city.

title: Miss Epstein Bride of Paul Rigney
description: Barbara Lee Epstein and Paul Michael Rigney, graduates of the Untversity of Massachusetts, were married yester day noon by State Supreme. Court Justice Morrie Slifkin, who performed the ceremony at the Tappan Hill, a restaurant in Tarrytown, N. Y.

title: The ResignationCapstone to Nixon's TV Career
description: IN the boondocks, where my disdain is temporarily stationed and doing calisthenics in preparation for the fall season, we took Mr. Nixon's abdication neat. Children were made to stay up, dinners were rushed and dessert was skipped in order that families might gather around their TV sets at 9 o'clock on August 8. Regrettably, most of us weren't as pious as most of the network commentators. In the privacy of our own homes, we were not obliged to be on our best behavior. I was among refugees from various wars that the President had won and the rest of us had lost, and no one felt like jumping over the net to congratulate him for a game try. In fact, someone at 9:18 turned the sound down and played Taps on a bugle.

title: Jockey Killed in Race
description: PRESCOTT, Ariz., Aug. 24 (AP)Kent Roberts, a 44yearold jockey, was killed today when his horse smashed into the rail during the sixth race at Prescott Downs.

title: Home is the Heights
description: What I really need, says Karla Kuskin, is a psychiatrist who cleans. That's understandable. And it would be nice if that compulsive shrink would sew and shop, too.

title: Patricia Beatty Married
description: Patricia Angela Beatty, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. Burton Paul Beatty of Ridgefield, Conn., was married yesterday morning to Daniel John Chapple, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Chapple of New York and Breezy Point, L. I. The ceremony was performed in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Ridgefield by the Rev. James Hamilton of Helena, Mont.

title: Souvanna Phouma Off To France to Recover
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sunday, Aug. 25 (AP)Premier Souvanna Phouma left here today aboard a French hospital jet for France, to recover from hls heart attack last month.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE SENATE PASSED and sent to the President the pension reform bill to protect the pension rights of 30 million Americans... Corporate profits before taxes rose by $11.7billion In the secondquarter to an annual rate of $150.4billion after a $16billion rise in the first quarter. ... The Commerce Department's revised secondquarter G.N.P. indicates a decline of 0.8 per cent instead of 1.2 per cent as originally reported. The Consumer Price Index rose 0.8 per cent in July, the second smallest rise this year.

title: PRESIDENT SIGNS BILL SETTING UP WAGEPRICE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24President Ford signed into law today a bill establishing a special agency to monitor wages and prices.

title: What I hate about clothes...
description: Before the consumer revolution and the women's movement had made their marks, everything in the world of fashion was lovely or terrific or fantabulous.

title: Child Being Adopted May Have His Say
description: TRENTONTwo bills having a vital effect on children will be among the measures facing the State Assembly when it returns for its fall session next month. Both measures already have been passed by the State Senate, where they were introduced by Senator Alexander J. Menza, Democrat of Union County.

title: Dancing her way up
description: Ronda Sampson was 15 and her sister Roslyn was 13 when Arthur Mitchell of the Dance Theatre of Harlem, the allblack ballet company, spotted them in a master class he was giving in Atlanta. He was so impressed that he offered them scholarships to the Dance Theatre of Harlem School.

title: Braves' Walk in 10th Beats Mets, 43
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 24 The Mets proved again tonight that they are becoming unaccustomed to protecting leads  especially early ones. In their third game of a series with the Braves before a crowd of 34,000 at Atlanta Stadium, the New Yorkers lost, 43, allowing a tworun, firstinning advantage to disappear in two innings, tied the game in the ninth, and then, lost it in the 10th by walking in the winning run.

title: Caryl E. Speir Bride in Jersey Of R.W. Byrnes
description: Caryl Elizabeth Speir, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Dean Speir of Madison, N.J., was married last evening to Randall William Byrnes, son of Mrs. Sybil G. Byrnes of Weston, Mass., and William L. Byrnes of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and Naples, Fla.

title: Elizabeth C. Hanifin Married To Thomas Joseph Reagan Jr.
description: In Gesu Roman Catholic Church in University Heights, Ohio, yesterday morning, Elizabeth Chauvenet Hanifin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John William Hanifin of Hunting Valley, Ohio, was married to Thomas Joseph Reagan Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Reagan of Savannah, Ga. The Rev. Glenn Williams performed the ceremony.

title: Geologist to Marry Barbara Ann Bibb
description: Barbara Ann Bibb, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas G. Bibb of Troy, N.Y., plans to be married Oct. 12 to Thomas Willoughby Brazeau, a geologist in the operations department of the Superintendence Company of New York. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Willoughby F. Brazeau of Garden City, L.I.

title: TWO BLOCS DIVIDE POPULATION TALKS
description: BUCHAREST, Aug. 24  The divergence in opinions on whether population growth is an asset or a grave problem was underlined anew here this week as the World Population Conference began work on a plan of action.

title: Atlantic Air Fares to Rise By 10% More Next Nov. 1
description: GENEVA, Aug. 24The International Air Transport Association announced today new price package that would increase passenger fares on scheduled North Atlantic flights by an average of 10 per cent starting Nov. 1.

title: Furman Fills a Post
description: GREENVILLE, S. C. (AP)Furman University has appointed Art Black as sports information director, succeeding Charles Dayton, who has taken a similar post at Wake Forest.

title: Cover that shows more than it hides
description: The subject of dress has been largely neglected by serious students of art history and the history of ideas. The field has been left to those who practice a kind of historical fashionjournalism, superficially observing the fluctuations of past modes in the light of modern psychology and sociology. For theatrical designers there are many books containing processions of historical costume examples, usually redrawn in one single illustrative style from unidentified originals, but most of these works display the sequence of past fashions as a selfcontained, curiosity unconnected with other cultural facts. Costume plays and movies have consequently taught many people that clothes from the remote past all look rather alike, the same way old masters may all seem to look alike.

title: Garment center lexicon
description: I think the woman has been panted to death and will want sweaters. (Women's Wear Daily, April 3, 1974.)

title: The Standby Equipment Doesn't Have to Rust
description: WASHINGTONBefore his fall from grace, former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew reflected during an interview on the strange nature of his job.

title: 2 SLAIN IN TEXAS, 2 HOSTAGES TAKEN
description: ROTAN, Tex., Aug. 24 (AP)A West Texas rancher on the death list of an escaped Colorado convict was shot and killed in front of his his home today, and the authorities alleged that the same assailants later killed a woman and took two hostages.

title: U.S. Amateur Golf Starts At Ridgewood Tomorrow
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.J., Aug. 24 (UPI)With two of the top players eliminated in qualifying, the 200 survivors begin a weeklong grind of match play Monday for the United States Amateur golf championship.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  One of the very first decisions on economic policy that President Ford is facing is whether to embrace a largescale program of public service employment, to come into play as the nation's unemployment rate mounts.

title: George III: A King Among Art Collectors
description: IF you don't like someone, the thing to do is too pull down the biggest statue of him that you can find and chop it into little pieces. He'll get the message.

title: Miss Faupel Bride of Dr. E. G. Keating
description: Caroline Megan Faupel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard B. Faupel of Short Hills, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon, to Dr. E. Gregory Keating, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Keating of Clearwater Beach, Fla.

title: Kissinger
description: The love affair between the American public and their Secretary of State reached its apogee in the summer of 1974, when a Harris Poll found Henry Kissinger the nation's most admired man. Perhaps Kissinger was right two years ago when he told an Italian interviewer the main reason for his growing popularity stems from the fact that I've always acted alone and Americans admire the cowboy leading the caravan alone astride his horse, the cowboy entering a village or city alone on his horse ... aiming at the right spot at the right time. There is little in this biography, which concentrates on the years of the Nixon Administration, to challenge his assessment. Kissinger, by two noted C.B.S. correspondents, is the most detailed study yet of American diplomacy in the post coldwar era: it is worshipful, gravely flawed and indispensable. Moreover, it contains a dirty little secret that many people would prefer to ignore after the denouement of the sordid scandal of Watergate.

title: Food: Cheesecake Is His Specialty
description: MAPLEWOOD  Cheesecake is the singular specialty of Hy Schaefer, whose oneman bakery at 1893 Springfield Avenue is aptly named Fly's Cheese Cake.

title: Linn Ahlers Fiancee Of Lieut. Paul Manley
description: Linn Keese Ahlers, an art major at the University of Arizona, and Lieut. Paul Robert Manley, U.S.A.F., will be married in October.

title: Excerpts From Interview With Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany
description: BONN, Aug. 24Following are excerpts from an interview conducted in English with Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany by The New York Times:

title: Zaretzki Is Battling to Retain Senate Seat
description: In one of the classic bouts of modern Manhattan politics, Joseph Zaretzki, the proud 73yearold minority leader of the State Senate Democrats, is attempting to fend off a harddriving primary challenge from Assemblyman Franz S. Leichter, one of the fiery founders of the Reform movement.

title: Cecilia Lanahan Becomes Bride Of Patrick Kehn
description: Cecilia Scott Lanahan and Patrick Earl Kehn were married in Trappe, Md., at noon yesterday. The bride is a daughter of Samuel J. Lanahan of Washington and Mrs. C. Grove Smith of Washington and Montgomery, Ala., and a granddaughter of the late F. Scott Fitzgerald, the novelist, and the late Zelda Fitzgerald. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. James McNamara of Syracuse and the late Patrick Kehn.

title: ShakersA Mere HandfulAre Alive and well in Maine
description: SABBATHDAY LAKE Shaker village near New Gloucester, Me., reveals itself first to visitors as a 19thcentury bell tower emerging over knoll. Then the Dwelling House, a manychimneyed brick building surrounded by a brood of white clapboard houses, rises by the roadside. Impressions of a simple, orderly religious way of life, entombed in silenceinipressions that are suddenly shattered.

title: At Home With Dorothy Stickney
description: STANTONWeekends in New Jersey made it possible for me to continue playing in Life With Father for five straight years, Dorothy Stickney reminisced the other day while relaxing at her charming country home in this rural Hunterdon County community.

title: Why Did They Turn Duddy Kravitz Into a Charmer?
description: TORONTO To describe The Apprenticeship of Duddy Kravitz as the most successful Canadian movie ever made is a nation's private joke. It is the truth, but the truth doesn't tell you quite enough. There hasn't been all that much competition for the crown, and the Canadian film industry remains in??o limited a stage of developmentlike, I suspect, the black cinema in the United Statesthat each new film of any merit gets its turn. With only a handful of films jostling for the crown, a newcomer can be worked through the competition quite quickly.

title: Unanimous Verdict
description: The unanimous declaration by the House Judiciary Committee that Richard Nixon would have been impeached, had he not chosen to resign, definitively seals the historic record. That straightforward judgment essential to a fun understanding of the circumstances and the constitutional procedures that led to Mr. Nixon's downfall. The bipartisan affirmation that he had committed offenses that warranted his removal from office serves to foreclose any future misunderstanding that might flow from the former President's parting explanation that only the loss of a strong enough political base forced his departure. The House added emphasis to the finality of its action by voting 412 to 3 to accept the report and commend the committee for its work.

title: BRIDGE OFFICERS FIGHT FOR IMAGE
description: The quickest way to rile one of the 600 uniformed men who collect the tolls at the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority's seven bridges and two tunnels is to call him a toll collector.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 24 (AP)Lin WenHsiung, pitched a twohitter and hit two home runs today in leading Kao Hsiung of Taiwan, to a 121 victory over Red Bluff, Calif. and the Little League World Series championship. It was the fourth straight year that a Taiwan team has won the tournament and the fifth time in six years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the euphoria over the restoration of civilian rule in Greece, it is important to recall how wrong our policy has been toward that country since 1967. For if we forget, the Greeks will not.

title: Aiming for '68 Masters
At Last, Just Politics
description: In almost everything he did, from chatting with Black Congressmen to naming Nelson Rockefeller as the man he wants as his Vice President, Gerald R. Ford last week returned the Presidency to what it normally is, a place of political as well as governmental leadership. And he seemed to be acting on the premise that what, he determined to be best for Government would be the best he could do for the Republican party.

title: Greek Reply to Britain: No Cyprus Talks Now
description: LONDON, Aug. 24 (Reuters)Greece has told Britain that she is not ready for further Cyprus peace talks with the parties directly involved in the dispute, a Foreign Office spokesman said here today.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: A PostMortem, Since It Could Happen Again
description: Bad Richard Nixon is out of the White House. Good Gerald Ford is in. The Republic rocks along, returned to something like normality.

title: SUIT ACCUSES U.S. IN POISONING CASE
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Aug 24Hearings are scheduled to open Monday in a $3.9million suit against the Federal Government filed on behalf of an Alamogordo, N.M.; family that was stricken with mercury poisoning five years ago.

title: Safety Role Is Seen For License Plates
description: PRINCETON  A scientific approach to the mundane license plate is being explored here, the aim being to develop an electronic system to improve highway safety and automatic traffic services.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: The Adventures of God in His Search for the Black Girl
description: By Brigid Brophy. 224 pp. Boston: AtlanticLittle, Brown. $7.95.

title: Diana Crosby Bride Of Kelly G. Lindsay
description: Diana Crosby and Kelly G. Lindsay were married yesterday afternoon in South Londonderry, Vt., by the Rev. Robert Abarno of the South Londonderry Baptist Church.

title: The Duke and Duchess of Windsor, 1967. The Woman He Loved By Ralph G. Martin. Illustrated. 543 pp. New York: Simon & Schuster. $9.95.
description: Queen Mary called it a pretty kettle of fish, and she was right. Here was her handsome oldest son, Edward, the popular bachelor King of England, determined to marry an American woman who was about to be divorced for the second time. And if he didn't get his way? Why, he'd up and abdicate, that's what. Unthinkable? Not in fairy talesor the straitlace Britain of 1936 when the love story of the century, as it became known, had its beginnings.

title: Cup Sailing Is Halted by Heavy Fog
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 24Fog from Block Island rolled into the America's Cup courses today and caused abandonment of two races, one between Courageous and Intrepid and the other, two miles to the southwest, between Southern Cross and France. The races will be started over tomorrow.

title: In Dance, Male Lib Means Less Masculinity
description: THE late Jose Limon, in an article he contributed to Selma Jeanne Cohen's book The Modern Dance: Seven Statements of Belief, wrote that he had always thought that dancing was something for girls to do until he saw Harald Kreutzberg perform. He then realized that a man could, with dignity and a towering majesty, dance.

title: CANDIDATES FILE SPENDING REPORT
description: ALBANY, Aug. 23This ?? form program will substantiall bolster voter confidence in th?? electoral process, Govern?? Wilson said on May 30, whe?? he signed a bill that amende the state's muchcriticized ele?? tion law.

title: Bridge Traffic Decreases
description: NEW CASTLE, Del., Aug, 24 (AP)  Traffic over the Delaware Memorial Twin Bridges decreased by 7.2 per cent in July, compared with the same month last year, and revenue declined by 4.8 per cent, the Delaware River and Bay Authority reported Thursday.

title: U.S. Girls Triumph
description: SAINTGEAVAIS, France, Aug. 24 (UPI)  Americans swept the first two places today in the women's final of the skating grand prix. Canadians finished third and fourth. Barbara Smith, 15, of Los Angeles, edged Priscilla Hill, 12, of Lexington, Mass., for first place.

title: Junior Jumping to Be Held In the U.S. for First Time
description: The annual junior international jumping competition, long a fixture in Canada, has been expanded to include an event in the United States this year.

title: Correction
description: In The Week in Review of Aug. 18, the map on page 9 related to world population was mislabeled. The label should have been Birth Rates instead of Fertility Rates, and the key for shadings on the map should have read, Annual Live Births per 1,000 Population.

title: Polish Rider Wins Bicycle Title
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 24 (UPI)  Janusz Kowalski and Ryszard Szurkowski of Poland won first and second places in the amateur road race today in the world cycling championships. Michel Kuhn of Switzerland was third.

title: Miss Vigeland Wed to R.S. Ashton
description: Kristina Hooker Vigeland, until recently an admissions assistant at the Dalton School here, and Robert Stewart Ashton, who will begin graduate studies next month at the Amos Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College, were married yesterday afternoon.

title: East Side fashion squirrel
description: Lili Townsend is a brandname lady, attested to by the Social Register and Dun & Bradstreet. Her string of addresses is as silky as old family pearlsLocust Valley, Palm Beach, Southampton, Manhattan's Upper East Side. When her Chapin School classmates trooped off to college, Lili scoffed. I didn't want to waste the time. I was going to be a woman of the world.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: APREVAILING theme in much of the political and economic commentary of recent days has been the view that the next three months will offer President Ford the best opportunity to get some constructive new programs under way in the economic area while the era of goodwill toward his Administration persists throughout the nation.

title: The Purpose of Intercollegiate Sports: Help the Individual Pursue Excellence
description: The recent New York Times series on abuses in college athletic recruiting has opened the door to questions of greater magnitude:

title: SIHANOUK IN PLEA TO FORD TO BRING CAMBODIAN PEACE
description: BUCHAREST, Aug. 24 Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the nominal leader of the insurgent forces in Cambodia, asserted today that President Ford was free to bring about peace in Cambodia quickly because he was not bound by the former President's obligations.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Television/Radio
description: MOST people might not consider it crucial to their lives, but earlier this week an event occurred which is of quasicosmic significance in the world of teenaged music lovers  and in the rock radio business that feeds hungrily upon that world. What happened was this: Cousin Brucie switched stations.

title: Memorials for Children of Change
description: It is a fundamental impulse of modern taste to transform the material survivals of history into esthetic objects. No longer are we content to classify these materials according to their social or religious or economic functions alone. The esthetic factor must be duly acknowledged as a shaping force. Even where little or no evidence of a conscious artistic intention can be adduced, we are now determined to identify an implicit esthetic imperative. Anything less seems a denial of something categorical in our experience.

title: Science Fiction Movies Are Catching on in a Weary America
description: NO LESS a citadel of science than the Hayden Planetarium recently presented a series of science fiction films in its great dome. That is, of course, a surprising fact because the Planetarium is normally thought to be reserved for serious galactic affairs.

title: House Allowance Raised
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) House members will get more stationery and stamps, effective immediately, under new allowances set by the House Administration Committee. The stationery allowance was raised last January to $5,250 a member. The committee's newest action, which under new procedures does not have to be ratified by the House, raises this to $6,500 a Congressman. A second order increased the stamps allowance from $910 to $1,140 per Congressman.

title: Political Turnaround...
description: In the two weeks since President Ford took the oath of office, the country's political prospectsto say nothing of its moralehave undergone a dramatic transformation. The profound relief at having Watergate vanish as a minutebyminute concern, lifting a leaden weight from the spirit of the nation, was easy enough to anticipate. Less predictable was the sharpness of the change in political climate, a change sufficient to exhilarate a Republican party that was in despair and to throw off balance a Democratic party that had been preparing for a major triumph in November.

title: And Suffolk Growing In Nassau And Suffolk
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Communications Commission said list week that applications to operate cable television had increased in Nassau and Suffolk Counties, particularly in. Suffolk.

title: Six Skippers Undefeated In Manhasset Bay Sailing
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 24Six skippers remained undefeated after the third race today in the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club's 42d annual Race Week.

title: Can't Regret Scores
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Aug. 24 (AP)Steve Rowan rode the 7yearold Can't Regret to a head victory in the featured race at Finger Lakes track today. Blue Funk was second.

title: J.C. Hartenstein And Sally Swan Married in Ohio
description: Sally Galarneau Swan and James C. Hartenstein were Married yesterday afternoon in the Swasey Chapel at Denison University in Granville, Ohio, by the. Rev. A. Gary Angleberger, minister of the First Presbyterian Church in Granville.

title: Two Men Are Shot in Kentucky In Incident Laid to Mine Strike
description: A striking coal miner was in critical condition last night in Harlan County, Ky., after being struck in the head by a shotgun blast. It was the latest violent incident in Harlan County, long a scene of labor unrest.

title: Nixon Freeway Project Suspended in California
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 24Construction on the Richard M. Nixon Freeway, a route so designated by the California Legislature, was begun in 1967, but now work has been suspended on the project and many people apparently don't even know the road's name.

title: U. S. AIDES STUDY ISSUE OF AHNESTY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24The Justice Department prob ably will tell President Fore that the best way to gran leniency to draft evaders is to use his power to withhold pros ecution rather than his powen to grant pardons.

title: J. Hans Stumm, Miss Wohlforth Marry in Jersey
description: In St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Demarest, N.J., yesterday afternoon, Priscilla Wohlforth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Wohlforth 2d, was married to J. Hans Stumm, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Stumm of Aurora, Ill.

title: BUSINESSS ROUNDUP
description: Despite all the excitement that accompanied the first sale of floatingrate notes a month ago, the demand for these new credit instruments seems to have faltered.

title: Hunting Will Start Sept. 1 For Small Game on L.I.
description: ALBANYThe state department of Environmental Conservation has announced that the smallgame hunting season on Long Island will open on Sept. 1.

title: Hunter Honors To Maple Leaf:
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 24Spur of the Moment, owned by the Maple Leaf Farms of Malvern, Pa., won two of the five classes and took a thirdplace ribbon in another test to win the green working hunter championship today at the concluding session of the twoday Fairfield County Hunt Club Horse Show.

title: How to Make a Popping Bug With Plastic Tubing, Electric Drill and Feathers
description: Under proper conditions, certain game fish cannot resist a flyrod popping bug.

title: Faster Social Security Aid Asked by Ribicoff and Pell
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (UPI) Two Democratic Senators have proposed legislation to assure speedy replacement of lost or stolen Social Security checks and to speed appeals procedures on disability insurance and supplemental income, for the elderly.

title: European Transport on the Cheap
description: THEY aren't the best accommodations. Your seat is the metal floor of a van or bus, and after an hour of travel the wornout oriental rugs between you and the floor offer little consolation when the bus hits a bump. If it's an overnight journey, your same morsel of sitting space is also your bed. The bus may sleep 10 with comfort or 14 with difficulty; 16 is a major logistical exercise.

title: Editors' Choice
description: General

title: Paris Weighs Aid to Greek Armaments Industry
description: PARIS, Aug. 24  France, which has been giving strong diplomatic support to Greece during the Cyprus crisis, is considering helping the Greeks set up their own armaments industry, according to French Government sources.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Job Movement And Football/Roman Fights /Ali's Fight
description: Richard Kazokas's article (paper of Aug. 18) questioning what to tell his son about the N.F.L. players' strike reaches the bottom line of the American way of life and business (and sports is certainly a business).

title: Start with a clean face
Stamps
description: THE United States is endeavoring to use a postage stamp as one way to instill in Americans a concern for the, need to conserve energy, but at the moment it appears likely to have about as much impact as the 55mileanhour speed limit has on most motorists along the nation's highways.

title: Mrs. Carver, Kazmierski Tied at 141
description: GOLDEN, Colo., Aug. 24 (AP)JoAnne Career and Joyce Kazmierski shot threeunderpar 69's today to move into a tie for the lead in the $35,000 National Jewish Hospital tournament on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour.

title: Marion Raynor Farnham, U. School NurseTeacher
description: Marion Reynor Farnham, for more than 18 years a school nurseteacher at the Munsey Park School in Manhasset, L. I., died Monday at her home in Glen Cove, L. I. Her age was 63.

title: Music
description: FOR the last few seasons, the New York City Opera has been opening at the end of August, and 1974.75 is no exception. On Wednesday at 7, P.M. the curtain at the New York State Theater will rise to a Lucia di Lammermoor with Beverly Sills and Jose Carreras. Aug. 28! Before Labor Day! The height of vacation time!

title: India Installs Ahmed, a Moslem, as 5th President
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 24Fakhruddin All Ahmed, a wealthy mildmannered Moslem, was made India's fifth. President today and termed his nation's problems colossal.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: THE Brustein's stern warning in Broadway and the Nonprofit Theater A Misalliance [Aug. 4] to the nonprofit theater community to beware of entangling Broadway alliances is that presentation on Broadway of a play originated in a nonprofit theater is by definition corrupting. Is this really true? Was the Long Wharf Theater derailed from its artistic course by the presentation on Broadway of The Changing Room? Has Arena Stage sold out as a consequence of The Great White Hope and Raisin? Is Joe Papp looking only for hits after That Championship Season and Two Gentlemen of Verona? I don't think so.

title: Ocean Shells Gain Favor With Rowers
description: Rowers, who like to use their legs as well as their arms, are going down to the sea in a new breed of craft called the Alden ocean shell.

title: Giant Defense a Plus in Defeat
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 24The Pittsburgh Steelers finally may have found their championship quarterback, but his name isn't Terry Bradshaw or Terry Hanratty.

title: Oh, so SoHo! WearDated clothes at these good stores:
description: TOPAZ

title: Fatalities Are Rare But Fires Are Much Less So
description: The men who manage New York City's 231mile subway system, one of the busiest public transportation networks in the world, have boasted year after year that it is the safest in the world. No other form of transportation, they have said, moves so many people, almost four million riders each weekday, so safely.

title: World News Briefs
description: TUNIS, Aug, 24The Tunis ian high court today found 175 students and intellectuals guilty of charges of subversive activities. They were sentenced to six months to 10 years prison.

title: Numismatics Bicentennial Coins Make Debut
description: BILE all but a relative handful of Americans will have to be satisfied. with looking at photographs (as at right) until next summer, the thousands of collectors who attended the recent American Numismatic Association convention in Florida have already seen the real thingthe first strikings of the 17761976 Bicentennial commemorative coins.

title: Federal Housing Funds Sliced
description: WASHINGTON  The nation's first omnibus housing and development act since 1968, which President Ford signed into law on Thursday, calls for a major tailing off of Federal grants for urban renewal and community development in many North Jersey communities.

title: The Cyprus Realities
description: It is understandable that out of resentment against the United States and Britain, Greece's new Government should accept a Soviet proposal for convening an unwieldy international conference to deal with the Cyprus tragedy. But Premier Caramanlis and Foreign Minister Mavros surely know that nothing constructive can come from such a propaganda exercise.

title: Catherine Ronan Wed to Paul Rochmes
description: Catherine Murray Ronan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas P. Ronan of Rye, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection in Rye to Paul H. Rochmes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis L. Rochmes of Bethesda, Md. The Rev. Robert Poveromo performed the ceremony.

description: A man who should know says it is no secret that this has been less than a banner year for the state's 900 newcar dealers.

description: Anne Steckel, H. W. Low 3d Marry on Coast

title: College, at Early Opening, Stresses Parents' Role
description: GRINNELL, Iowa, Aug. 24About 400 college students did here yesterday what many thousands more will do in about a monthstart the fall term.

title: Seventh Avenue
description: Four years ago Seventh Avenue took a gamble and lowered hemlines. Women stayed away in droves, forcing several couture houses and small manufacturers into bankruptcy and the apparel industry into a tailspin. So guess what Seventh Avenue is doing this year? Its taking a gamble and lowering hemlines.

title: The Pepitone Problem in Japan: Maybe the Problem Is Pepitone
description: The recent article written by Sae Pepitone (paper of May 19) about Japanese baseball demands a reply. His account of his brief stay in Japan is of little, if any, truth.

title: CITY ADDICTS MASK TESTS FOR DRUGS
description: Three of every four addicts in the city's detoxification program may be taking an herbal root called goldenseal to prevent detection pf drug use, according to a top official in the city Health Department.

description: DETROITLee A. Iacocca, bluntspeaking president of the Ford Motor Company, wheeled around in his chair, pulled the cigar from his mouth and, said:

title: Connors, Metreveli Gain Final
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 24Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., will face Alex Metreveli of the Soviet Union in the final of the $50,000 MediQuick open grass tennis tournament at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club tomorrow at 1 P.M.

title: The Trolley Car, Doomed by Auto, Makes Comeback
description: PORTLAND, Ore.Clang, clang, dingding bell and all, the trolley car has begun to make a comeback in American cities.

title: Marvin Gaye Tours After 5 Years
description: Marvin Gaye's appearance at the Nassau Colisuem Friday nightpart of his first tour in five years  was by and large a disappointment. But what that really means is that the records he has made since his last public performance have been of such quality that they set up expectations that he didn't fulfill in person.

title: Carolyn Quinby Scudder Bride In Jersey of Peter Mason Miller
description: Carolyn Quinby Scudder, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard B. Scudder of Navesink, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Mason Miller, son of John Campbell Miller of Chester Springs, Pa., and Mary Miller of Vero Beach, Fla.

title: New & Novel
description: A Strange God

title: Pair of $4.20 Favorites Win Spa's Split Hopeful
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 24A pair of hopefuls emerged from the Hopeful Stakes today, for the simple reason that the race wat run in two divisions, with each section producing a decisive and popular winner.

title: In London, John Gielgud Plays a Suicidal William Shakespeare
description: LONDON THE most important question in the British theater at the moment, arguably, is posed by the queues at the box office of the Royal Court Theater. Are they there primarily to see Edward Bond's new play Bingo? Or have they come to see its star, Sir John Gielgud, cap his career which has included playing every major part Shakespeare wrote by now playing the role of Shakespeare himself'?

title: Ann Underhill Married to John Belknap
description: Ann Dudley Underhill, daughter of Edward Underhill of Charleston, W. Va., and the late Mrs. Underhill, was married in Hillsdale, N.Y., yesterday afternoon to John Corbould Belknap. The Rev. William Weigle performed the Episcopal ceremony at Greenhills, home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Belknap, parents of the bridegroom.

title: The Greatest Number Served Before the Feminist Movement
description: WASHINGTONIronically, the highwater mark for women in Congress was reached in 1962, when two women sat in the Senate and 18 in the House of Representatives. That was several years before the feminist movement began.

title: SOMALIAN THREAT SEEN IN ETHIOPIA
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 24The armed forces profess to be worried over what they describe as heavy Soviet involvement in neighboring Somalia, and are pressing the United States for more military aid.

title: Sugar Cane Workers Get Increases in Three States
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (UPI)Minimum wages for suFar cane workers in Louisiana, lorida and Texas have been raised by from about 12 per cent to 22 per cent for the 1974 season, the Agriculture Department has announced.

title: A Love Song in Prints to New York, N.Y.
description: FOR an exhibition called New York, New York, the Associated American Artists Gallery has assembled 219 fine prints reflecting 219 of the thousands upon tens of thousands of aspects that compose the shifting entity of this strange, wonderful, terrible and beautiful city. John Marin shatters its buildings and bridges in his expression of its energy; Lyonel Feininger transposes that same energy and those same forms into a serene crystalline geometry. Richard Haas describes the Potter Building molding by molding and curlicue by curlicue, while Nancy Gray reduces the Empire State Building to blots of white puncturing a black field. There are vistas of the city's canyons dating back to the days when canyons was still a poetic image, not yet a bromide (Samuel Chamberlain, Childe Hassam) and intimate explorations of those private cells that most New Yorkers have to call home (Edward East Side Interior.)

title: Coffee Exporters Hang Together
description: It took an alleged mistake by an obscure functionary in the tiny Central American republic of El Salvador last week to remind the world's coffee exporters that they will have a most difficult time trying to raise prices.

title: Westie Gets Top Award At Ravenna
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Aug. 24  A pert West Highland white terrier, Ch. Braidholme White Tornado of Binate, came out of the East today to lead a field of 2,922 at the 33d Ravenna Kennel Club fixture at the Sun Beau Valley Ranch today.

title: Look at Rocky's Money
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24Hi ya, fella. Nice to see you.

title: Israeli Fair Opens At Monmouth Y
description: DEAL PARKA highlight of the Monmouth Y.M.Y.W.H.A.'s annual Israeli Fair, which opened last night, is a fine arts show. Proceeds from the fair aid various Y projects.

title: TRANSIT OFFICIALS VIEW IRT FIRE SITE
description: Transit officials, led by David L. Yunich, chairman of the metropolitan Transportation Authority, yesterday inspected the site of Tuesday's subway fire under the East River that led to passenger panic and medical treatment for 157 persons.

title: Europe 30 Years After
description: PARIS, Aug. 24On the thirtieth anniversary of the liberation of Paris, Europe has many problems, but it is alive and vibrant. It is liberated in the West, divided in the middle and occupied by the Russians in the East, but it is not alone and it is not afraid.

title: 7 Suffolk Towns Protest County Relief TakeOver
description: EAST HAMPTON  Concerned about what they consider a threat to local rule and a potential tax strain on their residents, seven of Suffolk's 10 towns have formally protested the county's recently announced takeover of home relief administration.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WEST ORANGEFor the fashionconscious woman whose tastes may be, somewhat richer than her budget will allow, Bernsteins Designer Clothes At Discount Prices may be an answer.

title: Fewer Americans Visit Europe This Summer
description: PARIS, Aug. 24  Fewer Americans are visiting, Europe this summer, and those who do are keeping a tight grip on their marks and francs, a survey by bureaus of The New York Times shows.

title: Cardiologist Weds Candace Somerall
description: Candace Somerall, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Bentley Somerall of New York, was married last evening to Dr. Harvey S. Sherber, a cardiologist on the faculty of the Georgetown University Medical School in Washington. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Allan Sherber of New Rochelle, N. Y., are the bridegroom's parents.

title: Evelyn Treat Cutler Is Bride Of Francis Abbot Goodhue 3d
description: Evelyn Treat Cutler and Francis Abbot Goodhue 3d were married yesterday in St. Gabriel's Episcopal Church in Marion, Mass., by the Rev. Ernest W. Cockrell.

title: BRIDGE OFFICERS FIGHT FOR IMAGE
description: The quickest way to rile one of the 600 uniformed men who collect the tolls at the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority's seven bridges and two tunnels is to call him a tol?? collector.

title: Mets' Records
Chavez Out of Hospital
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug. 24 (UPI) The leader of the United Farm Workers, Cecar Chavez, was released from a hospital yesterday after treatment for exhaustion and a recurrent back ailment. His physician, Dr. Jerome Lackner, said that the back condition had improved, but there was still some pain. He said that he had ordered Mr. Chavez to return home and stay in bed for some time.

title: Woman Named to Post
description: DENTON, Tex., Aug. 24 (AP)Dr. Joan Gondola has been named the first director of women's intercollegiate athletics at North Texas State University. The budget for women's intercollegiate sports also was increased by $10,000 to $28,000.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The New York Bank for Savings' residential building at 15th Street and Eighth Avenue must certainly be a candidate for the shoddiestlooking apartment house constructed in the city this year. It is all the more shameful because a bank owns it and paid for it.

title: Coalition Challenges Mozambique Liberation Front
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Aug. 24 (Reuters)A new political party emerged in Mozambique today in an apparent challenge to the supremacy of the Mozambique Liberation Front.

title: Subpoena Not Served On Nixon; U.S. Marshal Will Not Say Why
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 24 (AP) The United States marshal has refused to say why a subpoena seeking former President Richard M. Nixon's testimony in a Watergate coverup trial has not been served, even as a second subpoena is reported on the way.

title: Once More, Decisions To Be Made On Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON  In the first official briefings given to incoming Presidents Eisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson and Nixon, they were told that Indochina would be their most pressing problem and that immediate decisions would be required of them to prevent a Communist victory there. Now it is President Ford's turn.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Move pots of mums into flower borders where spots of color are needed.... Feed and seed bare spots in the lawn... After corn silk browns, put coneshape paper cups over the ears to keep birds from pecking at the kernals.... Check squash, and beans frequently for crop.

title: Sugar Cane Workers Get Increases in Three States
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (UPI)Minimum wages for sugar cane workers in Louisiana, Florida and Texas have been raised by from about 12 per cent to 22 per cent for the 1974 season, the Agriculture Department has announced.

title: Follmer Fastest In CanAm Trials
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., Aug. 24 (AP)George Follmer bettered the time of his Shadow teammate, Jackie Oliver, in the final hour of qualifying today to win the pole for tomorrow's CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup sports car race at Road America.

title: How Arabs Turn Oil Into Armaments
description: WASHINGTONDeep in the Gothic recess of the old Executive Office Building, a high Administration official was reflecting one day last week on overseas investments by the oilproducing countries.

title: Spectator Fleet at America's Cup Trials Off Newport Provides Largest, Most Colorful Boat Show of Year
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug 24 At the America's Cup trial races out at sea this past week there were three events taking place. Two were competitive among the 12Meter racing sloops, Courageous against Intrepid to decide eventually the defender of this prestigious trophy and Southern Cross against France to determine the challenger. The third event was a boat show, a magnificent boat show.

title: Iran and Kuwait to Give Sri Lanka $100Million Aid
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Aug. 24Sri Lanka will receive nearly $100million in aid from Iran and Kuwait by 1975, reliable sources said here this week.

title: Officers, to the RearMarch!
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.A recent poll showed that the military's reputation has turned the corner. The public's respect for the profession is again on the rise. This is good, news for the uniformed services. But it would be better news if the message filtered through to the civilian hierarchy in the Pentagon, which operates with a Singular lack of understanding of military values and sensibilities.

title: Nonstop volunteer
description: Jane Bullard's brotherinlaw swears that She'll wear out, not rust out. Most people exposed to Mrs. Bullard's coiledspring energy find it hard to conceive of her ever slowing down. One gets the impression that she runs, not walks, although she scoffs at the notion.

title: Page Martin To Be Bride
description: Page Martin, a senior at Virginia Commonwealth University, and G. Wyche Ford, a senior at the University of Virginia, plan to be married May 31.

title: Building Funds Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) The House Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds has approved $124.3million to construct or alter Federal buildings in 11 states. The bill inchides $2.2million for a Federal building in Pittsfield, Mass.

title: Carl Gebauer Weds Miss Alexandre
description: Mary Ann Alexandre and Carl Robert Gebauer, teachers of English in the Massapequa, L. I., school district, were married at noon yesterday in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Churoh, Manhasset, L. I., by the Rev. Richard Hoerning.

title: Puerto Rico Plans Rise in Phone Rates; Opponents Protest
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Aug. 24 Within a month of completing the purchase of the Puerto Rico Telephone Company, the government announced what it called a 32 per cent rate increase that political opponents insist is considerably more.

title: Drive On to Get Gracie Mansion In U.S. HistoricPlace Register
description: Mayor Beame squinted in the sunlight at Gracie Mansion's northern facade and porch with its fancy white railings and elaborate doorway.

title: Law Journal Bars A Satirical Article
description: TRENTONThe editorial board of The Journal, a quarterly published by the State Bar Association, has rejected a politically sensitive article that sought to satirize the State Senate's approval of highly controversial measure pertaining to collective bargaining with public employes.

title: Some Reflections on Theatrical Primitivism
description: SUPPOSING that drama must start all over again, where should it start? If our young experimental groups have insisted upon one thing more than another, it is that there's, no point in picking up where the lamed professional theater left off, sighing and leaking its life away. The root of the form itself must be renewed, and to do that all embryo actors and actresses, as well as directors and playwrights, must deliberately go primitive, scrap all that we have considered as sophisticated and, as a rule in bare feet, carve theater afresh out of nothingness.

title: Interoffice Memo: Have We Ever Got a fall Lineup for You!
description: To: All Network Vice Presidents From: Deputy Vice President, Creativity Division

title: Now It's American Fashions for Paris
description: With the support of the Commerce Department, a representative group of American apparel manufacturers for the first time will take their wares to Paris for the PretAPorter show in October.

title: Martin Triumphs In Powerboating
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 24 (AP)Billy Martin of Clark, N.J., set a course record of 78.5 miles an hour to win the Hennessy California Cup powerboat race at Marina Del Rey today.

title: Scientists Say Aleutian Artifacts Prove Migration From Siberia
description: STORRS, Conn., Aug. 24 (AP) A joint United StatesSoviet discovery of 9,000yearold Aleutian artifacts has led scientists to believe that the items are the first direct evidence that North America's original inhabitants came from Siberia.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayPocono modified stock car championship race at Pocono International Raceway, Long Pond, Pa., 2 P.M.

title: Epilogue A Glance Back at Some Major Stories
description: It has been more than six months since Patricia Hearst, the daughter of the San Francisco newspaper publisher, was taken from her Berkeley apartment by a small band of quixotic revolutionaries called the Symbionese Liberation Army.

title: Clandenita Victor
description: SALEM, N.H., Aug. 24 (AP) Clandenita came on in the stretch to win the $15,000 Lilac Stakes by a length and a half today at Rockingham Park. The favorite covered the six furlongs in 1:10 1/5.

title: Meri Polstein Fiancee Of John Grumbacher
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph N. Polstein of East Rockaway, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Men Polstein to John Richard Grumbacher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Grumbacher of Hagerstown, Md.

title: Office Building Rising on Queens Boulevard
description: The Arlen Realty & Development Corporation has begun construction of an 11story office building in the Rego Park section of Queens.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: ART

title: G.O.P. Bastion Accepts Loss of Nixon
description: SMITH CENTER, Kan., Aug. 29They haven't taken down Richard M. Nixon's picture yet at the modern, onestory brick post office on Court Street here. It still hangs in its place of honor on the wall outside Postmaster George Howard's door.

title: Six Women Who..
description: Lili Townsend lives on New York's elegant East Side with her husband and her teenage son. Born to elegance, she has in the past tew years given up family heirloom furniture and livein help for a simpler life of orderin food, holidays in the Hamptons, modern furniture and paintings. Her clothes fit that new lite and her quite perfect size six figure. She squirrels away her old designer numbers each year, adds what she loves out of seasonal fashioin, and does wear jeans. (See page 54.)

title: U.S. Tennis Open Starts Wednesday
description: It was only a few years ago when Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert were in grade school, that the tennis tournament at Forest Hills, Queens, was for amateurs only. It was called the Nationals and its officials wracked their brains over how to attract customers.

title: Yankees Take 4th ins Row, 31
description: The New York Yankees, strengthening their track position heading into the homestretch, won their fourth straight game yesterday when Pat Dobson and Cecil Upshaw pitched them to a 31 victory over the California Angels.

title: Virginia Wren Wed To John Downey
description: Virginia Claire Wren, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Shoemaker Wren of North Tarrytown, N. Y., became the bride at noon yesterday of John Murray Downey Jr. of Ravena, N. Y. He is the son of Mrs. Downey of North Tarrytown, and the late Mr. Downey.

title: Toro ! Toro ! Toro
description: El Chicote, nicknamed The Aviator because he spends so much time in the air, is a cowardly bullfighter. He comes to a bad end, as he. deserves. Esmeralda Fabada, runaway gypsy girl, who turns a few tricks to make money to buy bullfighting slippers, and sneaks nightly into breeding ranches where naked under the moonlight she makes passes (with a cape) at the bulls, is very brave. She comes to a good end, as she deserves. Paco Machismo, the famous torero, el numero uno, wealthy, masterful and vegetarian, is also brave. He is, in fact, the good end to which Esmeralda comes during the explosive climax of this bravissimo novel.

title: Pentagon Kept Tight Rein In Last Days of Nixon Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger and the Joint Chiefs of Staff kept unusually close control over lines of command, in the last days of the Nixon Administration to insure that no unauthorized orders were given to military units by the White House.

title: How New Measure Will Affect 26 Cities
description: WASHINGTONAlthough the new omnibus housing bill authorizes funding under the block grant program for three years, separate appropriation bills will be needed before the money is actually granted. The Department of Housing and Urban Development is also instructed to come back before the end of the threeyear period with recommended funding levels for an additional three years. On this basis, the department has already prepared a tentative funding program over the sixyear period, Here is how it would apply to 26 New Jersey communities:

title: Bridge
description: How many trumps the combined hands should have is a simple question for the beginner: eight or more, he will say, echoing the general advice given him by his textbook. The expert knows that reality is much more complex.

title: Chess: Hort (Briefly) Grabs Lead In 9th Round of the Open
description: Just as he had done earlier, Vlastimil Hort once again took a clear lead in the ninth round, of the United States Open Championship by defeating Craig Chellstorp.

title: Appliance Bargains Are on the Wane
description: One of the last great bargains for the American consumer may soon go the way of the 35cent gallon of gasoline.

title: Diana L. De Fabis Wed to M. J. Arnold
description: Diana Lynn De Fabis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest De Fabis of Indianapolis, was married yesterday afternoon to Michael John Arnold, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard A. Arnold of Farmingdale, L.I.

title: Larson Takes Title In Water Ski Jump
description: PINE MOUNTAIN, Ga., Aug. 24 (AP)Brant Larson of Madison, Wis., wail the Men's I Division jumping event today in the national water ski championships with a 137foot leap. Ken. Whits, of Honolulu finished second, only a foot short.

title: Home Repair Clinic
description: Questions from readers about home repair problems should be addressed to: Home Improvement Department, The New York Times, Times Square, New York, N.Y. 10036. Only those questions of general interest will be answered in this column:

title: State Intensifying Drive on Oil Spills
description: TRENTONThe state is intensifying its prevention and cleanup programs for oil spills, its action stemming from the plans of refineries to expand and the possibility of offshore drilling in the foreseable future.

title: Lucy Clark Bride Of Alfred Popkess
description: Lucy Clark, a wildlife biologist, and Alfred Westbrook Popkess, a lawyer in Syracuse, were married yesterday afternoon in Utica, N. Y. at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harold Thomas Clark.

title: Politicians in Iceland Fail To Form Coalition Cabinet
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 24 (Reuters)Efforts to form a new government ended without final agreement today and the country's economic crisis deepened.

title: What's Doing in VANCOUVER
description: SO SCHON IST KANADABritish Columbia is a huge province, but provincial is no longer a word that applies to its largest city, Vancouver, whose metropolitan area contains half of British Columbia's 2,252,000 people. Since World War II, and especially in the last 15 years, Vancouver has become quite cosmopolitan. On the Germanlanguage radio broadcasts the leading hit is a countrywestern version of a nostalgic song, Mein Schlesierland, whose new words begin: So schn ist KanadaCanada is beautiful. The singer urges his girlfriend to head with him to Canada, where there is space and freedom. A threeblock section of downtown Robson Street from Howe to Bute Streets is now known as Robsonstrasse, so oriented is it to recent European immigrants, particularly Germans and Italians. The immigrants, however, are not the only ones who enjoy the coffee and pastries in Robsonstrasse's cafes or the superb corned beef on rye with dill pickle served in the, delicatessen on the corner of Robsonstrasse and Burrard Streitso do nativeborn Vancouverites andtourists.

title: Notes: The Battle Of the Icepack
description: DOES OES a cameratoting tourist have as much right to wander among the great herds of Arctic seals on Canada's frozen Gulf of St. Lawrence as a hunter with a club? Hanns Ebensten, an American tour operator who believes they do, has won a sixmonth battle on this issue against both the hunters and the government of the Province of Quebec, and as a result he will resume his Seals on the excursions March.
