title: 1,300 Enumerators Wander in Fields To Gather Data for U.S. Crop Reports
description: WAVERLY, Neb., Aug, 24  Sometimes people wonder about Adolph J. Nemec. When they see him park by the roadside and walk into a cornfield, as he does almost daily, it raises all sorts of questions about what he is doing.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On Lead Shot
description: A ban on the use of lead shot for waterfowl hunting in the Atlantic Flyway, beginning with the 1976 hunting season, has been proposed by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service.

title: A Sailor, 21, Completes Solo Voyage to England
description: Two months after he set out alone to sail from Rhode Island to the British Isles, 21yearold Robert Gainer landed safely at Falmouth, England, yesterday and promptly telephoned his anxious parents in Hillsdale, N. J., with tales of adventure at sea.

title: Iceland Party Picks Supporter of NATO To Be Next Premier
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 26 (AP)  Geir Hallgrimsson, a staunch supporter of Iceland's participation in the North Atlantic Treaty. Organization was nominated today by the Parliamentary group in his Independece party as Iceland's new Premier.

title: CALIFORNIA TO GET NEW LAW GRANT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 26The National Endowment for the Humanities has announced that it will grant $740,000 to the State Bar of California to support an elementary and secondary school project called Law in a Free Society.

title: Johnson Honored on Birthday
description: STONEWALL, Tex., Aug. 26 (AP)  friends of Lyndon B. Johnson gathered yesterday at the LBJ ranch to celebrate Mr. Johnson's birthday. The former President, who died last year, would have been 66 tomorrow. More than 100 friends of his attended a reception on the front lawn of the ranch house.

title: DR. EARL M. SHERMAN
description: Dr. Earl M. Sherman, a dentist and associate member of the board of the Hebrew Home for the Aged in Riverdale, the Bronx, died Sunday in Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospitals. He was 71 years old and lived at 300 West 108th Street.

title: Chess: Hort and Benko Share Title As Open Closes With a Bang
description: Vlastimil Hort, a Czech grandmaster, and Pal Benko, a United States grandmaster, stormed their way into a tie for the United States Open championship with equal 102 scores.

title: 2 BRITISH PARTIES SEEK SOOT VOTES
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Aug. 24  The Scottish National party, now holding a record seven seats in the House of Commons, is coming under increasing pressure from the major parties, intent on recapturing lost electoral ground.

title: 3 Convicts Are Sighted in Texas As Hundreds of Police Close In
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tex., Aug. 26About 200 officers ringed a fivesquaremile area of rugged ranch country today in an attempt to trap three escaped convicts and end their fourday rampage of violence.

title: Late Bengal Surge Beats Lions, 2714
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 26 (AP) Bernard Jackson, a defensive back, raced 52 yards with a recovered fumble, sparking a lastquarter surge that gave the Cincinnati Bengals a 2714 National Football League exhibition. victory over the Detroit Lions tonight.

title: COAL MINES OPEN FOLLOWING PROTESTS
description: The nation's coal fields went back to normal operations yesterday after a weeklong shutdown that saw production cut by about 70 per cent, industry spokesmen told The Associated Press.

title: FRANCIS B. FORBES
description: Francis Bonner Forbes, a retired civil engineer, who had been an, active member of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church since 1898 and an elder emeritus, died Saturday in Doctors Hospital. He was 91 years old and lived at 1160 Fifth Avenue.

title: U.S. Health Insurance
description: WASHINGTON; Aug. 26National health insurance doesn't seem to have an enemy in town.

title: Two Missing Jersey Girls Sought Here
description: Anguished parents, their fears intensified by New York City's jungle image and by the memory of the stillunsolved murders of two teenage New Jersey girls this month, augmented the police yesterday in the search for two 12yearold cousins ho ran off Saturday from Ridgefield Park, N. J., to Manhattan.

title: Borg Routs Okker for Pro Title
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 26 (AP)Bjorn Borg, the 18yearold Swede, won the $100,000 United States pro tennis tournament by trouncing Tom Okker of the Netherlands, 76, 61, 61, tonight at the Longwood Cricket Club.

title: Youth Is Killed as He Walks In On Brooklyn Gas Station Holdup
description: A 16yearold Brooklyn youth who had just won permission from his parents to stay out later at night was shot to death at 1 A.M. Monday, the police said when he walked into a Bay Ridge service station in the midst of a holdup.

title: Solo Voyage to England Completed by Sailor, 21
description: Robert Gainer, the 21yearold sailor who set out two months ago from Rhode Island in a 22foot sailboat to cross the Atlantic Ocean alone, reached land safely at Falmouth, England, yesterday, shortly after 1:30 P.M., New York time.

title: Tremary Bills Soar At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The yields on Treasury, bills soared today as the Government auctioned $2.8billion of 91day bills and $2billion of 180day bills at its regular weekly sale.

title: Technical Gain in Afternoon Cuts Losses
description: The stock market finished in accelerated trading yesterday after a technical recovery in the afternoon erased many of the earlier losses.

title: Mr. Ford Goes to Church
description: A little noted but welcome change initiated by President Ford is his break with his predecessor's practice of holding church services in the White House. Earlier Presidents did hold occasional religious service's as special events, but it was Richard Nixon who institutionalized the practice.

title: Southern Cross Outsails France for 30 Cup Lead
description: NEWPORT, R. I. Aug. 26 Moving through choppy water with the steadiness of a sharkfin, Southern Cross savaged bluehulled France today and took a 30 lead in their fouroutofsevenrace yachting series for the role of America's Cup challenger.

title: President Selects 5 Goals For 2Day Inflation Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 President Ford's summit conference on inflation will be held here Sept. 27 and 28 and will be preceded by a series of preliminary meetings between the Administration and leaders of individual sectors of the nation's economy.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: PLANT SCIENTISTS START CHINA VISIT
description: Leading scientific architects of the green revolution in agriculture are among a delegation of 10 plant researchers and two other Americans that is entering China at Canton today for a twicepostponed, fourweek visit.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Atlantic City (Steal Pler), deduct 26 min, from Sandy Hook time.

title: Hilda R. Williamson Dies; Active In Charities Here
description: Hilda Raymond Williamson, who had long been active in philanthropic causes, died Saturday at her summer home in Gloucester, Mass. She was 95 years old and lived at 1220 Park Avenue.

title: BailOut Loan Rate For Banks Criticized
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (UPI)Senator William Proxmire said today the Federal Reserve had not gone far enough in increasing the interest rates it intended to charge for bailout loans to banks threatened with failure.

title: Indonesia Ordering Cuts In Production of Timber
description: JAKARTA, Aug. 26 (AP)The Indonesian Government, in an effort to check declining prices of timber, has ordered timber companies to reduce production 15 per cent, the Department of Agriculture announced here today.

title: Zeckendorf Offers Smaller Plan For Fort Lee Washington Plaza
description: FORT LEE, Aug. 26William Zeckendorf Jr. presented a scaleddown version of the controversial George Washington Plaza project to the Borough Planning Board tonight.

title: Allure of Poetic Settings Marks Iran Arts Festival
description: SHIRAZ, Iran, Aug. 26The garden shrine of a 14thcentury Persian poet, a courtyard in the medieval bazaar and the towering ruins of Persepolis formed the impressive openair backdrop of the eighth Iran Festival of Arts, lied in Shiraz and Persepolis from Aug. 15 to 23.

title: PENNEY DECIDES TO REMAIN HERE
description: After considering moving its 4,600employe headquarters staff out of New York City, the J. C. Penney Company, the country's second largest retail. ing chain, has decided not only to remain but also to expand its staff here and it has leased 450,000 square feet of new space in 1633 Broadway at 50th Street.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Arabian American Oil Company acknowledged yesterday that it had to reduce oil production to less than 8 million barrels a day from a target of 8.5 million barrels for August because of disrupted freighter loadings a result of bad weather.

title: Advertising: Checking Research
description: An indepth program for a toptobottom check of the validity of advertising research has been established by the nonprofit Advertising Research Foundation.

title: TV: CBS Studies Kansas Settlers In 34th Star
description: The American Parade, a series of 13 programs being presented by CBSTV in conjunction with the 1976 bicentennial, gains some necessary solidity tonight with The 34th Star, an hourlong drama about a pioneer family and the settling of Kansas. Robert Markowitz has produced and directed the program on Kansas locations with exceptional care for period detail. And except for one scenea wedding that comes out looking like one of those ebullient crowd commercials for bottled beer William Wagner's direclion of photography is excellent.

title: The Cult of Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26It is. A.M., Tuesday morning, July 15, 1958. White House Press Secretary James Hagerty is making a dramatic announcement at his morning briefing. At this very moment, U.S. Marines are landing in Lebanon. President Eisenhower will address the nation tonight on the crisis in the Middle East.

title: New Procedures Snarl Elections Board Routine
description: First came a new state law to permit absentee voting in primaries. Then came the massive and complex state election reform law, requiring all candidates to make detailed financial disclosures on eight separate occasions. Then a Federal Court decision requiring a bilingual election process.

title: PIERRE LOUIS FALAIZE
description: PARIS, Aug. 26 (UPI)Pierre Louis Falaize, Monano's Minister to France, died here yesterday at the age of 69.

title: Five Colleges Get N.C.A.A. Penalty
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 26 (AP)  Southern Methodist and Florida State were among five schools reprimanded today by the National Collegiate Athletic Association's committee on infractions for irregularities in their athletic programs. Also cited by the committee were McNeese State, Western Kentucky and Cornell.

title: SELASSIE'S WEALTH REPORTEDLY SEIZED
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug, 26 (UPI)Emperor Haile Selassie has apparently been stripped of nearly all his wealth inside Ethiopia.

title: Gregory on the Way
description: Jack Gregory of the New York Giants Is planning to come to camp in a couple of days and talk with Coach Bill Arnsparger about his salary differences with the team, the club announced yesterday.

title: Michigan Skipper Leads
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Aug. 26 (UPDSusan Corbett of Pontiac, Mich., was the leader today after two races in the Adams Cup women's sailing championship at Lake Murray. Tied for second place with 11 points were Laurie Wilcox of Seattle and Tyke Gibley of Wickford, R.I. Carolyn Newcomb of Balboa, Calif., was in fourth place.

title: REV. JOSEPH J. LAFFAN
description: The Rev. Joseph J. Laffan, pastor of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church, 177 Kent Street, Brooklyn, from 1971 until his retirement two months ago, died Aug. 16 on a visit to Limerick City, Ireland. His age was 67.

title: Turkish Newsman Dies
description: ADANA, Turkey, Aug. 26 (UPI)Adem Yavuz, a 29yearold Turkish journalist shot while being captured by the Greek cypriote National Guard on Cyprus 12 days ago, died today in a hospital here.

title: Lindbergh Dies of Cancer in Hawaii at the Age of 72
description: KIPAHULU, Maui, Hawaii, Aug. 26Charles A. Lindbergh, the first man to fly the Atlantic solo nonstop, died this morning at his simple seaside home here. He was 72 years old.

title: Women's Equality Day Marked Here By Bus Tour and Rally at Federal Hall
description: A touring political bandwagonbus, carrying women candidates and officeholders as well as musicians, and an Equal Rights Amendment rally on the steps of Federal Hall National Memorial were the major features of Women's Equality Day here yesterday, replacing the feminist marches of a few years ago.

title: SOVIET LAUNCHES 2 ON SPACECRAFT
description: MOSCOW, Tuesday, Aug. 27The Soviet Union has launched a new twoman spacecraft into orbit around the earth, the official press agency Tass announced early today.

title: Gregory Knockout Victor
description: Eddie Gregory, a 22yearold, 161pounder from Brooklyn and a twotime Golden Gloves welterweight champion scored a four round knockout over Eugene (Cyclone) Hart last night at the Felt Forum.

title: Portuguese Guinea Wins Independence
description: ALGIERS, Aug. 26Portugal today began the dissolution of her colonial empire in Africa with the signing of an agreement granting independence to Portuguese Guinea on Sept. 10.

title: Andrew Van Dyke, Rector Of Old Jersey Church, Dies
description: The Rev. Andrew Van Dyke, who was rector of Christ Episcopal Church in Middletown, N.J., when it celebrated its 250th anniversary in 1952, died Thursday in St. Luke's Hospital, New Bedford, Mass. He was 64 years old and had been living in South Dartmouth, Mass.

title: Storm Gathering Over Malone's Case
description: At the University of Maryland there was anger, at Marquette compassion and at St. John's and Notre Dame understanding.

title: Conquering Lion at Bay
description: At a time of life when most statesmen find it difficult to alter course, Emperor Haile Selassie sensed the winds of change sweeping over Africa and Asia in the wake of empire and swung Ethiopia dramatically into mainstream. He played a key part in the creation of the Organization of African Unity in his own capital in 1963 and insisted on building its headquarters there along with that of the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa.

title: Southern Cross Outsails France for 30 Cup Lead
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 26 Moving through choppy water with the steadiness of a sharkfin, Southern Cross savaged bluehulled Prance today and took a 30 lead in their fouroutofseven race yachting series for the role of America's Cup challenger.

title: New Jersey Sports Cheerfull Students
description: WEST MILFORD, Aug. 26Early in August, the Diocese of Paterson's Catholic Youth Organization summer camp here was more active than usual.

title: Coast Bus Strike in 3d Week
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 26 (AP) The bus strike in the Southern California Rapid Transit District entered its third week today. Representatives for management were to meet today with striking bus drivers and with striking mechanics on Wednesday. No progress has been reported in the negotiations. Major issues include wages and working hours. The strike affects the major bus Ime serving the counties of Los Angeles, Orange, San Bernardino and Riverside.

title: Record of 9.9% Set on Issues at Auction
description: The Government paid a record 9.930 per cent interest to borrow money for 180 days at its regular weekly auction of Treasury bills yesterday. The average rate on the companion 91day issue was 9.908 per cent, also a record. A week ago, the average rate on the 91day bills was 8.846 per cent, and that on the longer issue was 8.899 per cent.

title: State Lotteries Under Study In Regard to Gaming Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (UPI) Justice Department lawyers are studying the question whether to recommend a crackdown on state lotteries as violators of Federal gambling laws, an official said today.

title: Two Electric Utilities Go Abroad for Coal
description: Two American electric companies have been importing small portion of their coal supply this year, in what the industry terms another move by electric utilities to obtain the coal they need any way they can.

title: Island Trust
description: The islands off the Atlantic Coast, from Maine to Georgia, are the most fragile of the nation's scenic and recreational treasuresand the most imminently threatened by the pressures bf uncontrolled real estate speculation and development. The process of destruction has gone on so rapidly and so intensely in recent years that only urgent action at the national level will be able to save what, is left of this priceless natural heritage.

title: A.E.C. Won't Ease Safety At Nuclear Power Plants
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commission said today it was not planningto relax safety regulations for nuclear power plants on the basis of a recent study that showed that the risks from power reactor accident wete very low.

title: CANDIDATES LACK FUNDS IN FLORIDA
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Aug. 23  A statewide shortage of campaign funds has driven Florida's candidates for Senator and Governor away from television electioneering and back to such oldtime standbys as fish fries, shopping center tours and handshaking at factory gates.

title: 17 LANDS EXPECTED TO USE I.M.F. OIL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (Reu ters)The International Monetary Fund is expected to publish a list of 17 countries that will be the first to draw funds from the facility the agency set up to help finance the oilrelated deficits of member nations, monetary sources said here today.

title: FEMINISTS OPEN OWN CREDIT UNION
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 26Symbolically breaking the economic chains that tie us down with a boltcutter, the Connecticut Feminist Federal Credit Union opened its doors here today.

title: Koss Securities Considered By S.E.C. for Suspension
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today initiation of administrative proceedings that could lead to suspension of the Koss Securities Corporation of Brooklyn.

title: Shoppers Finding Prices Of School Clothing Higher
description: The woman shopper had a pair of boy's denim jeans in one hand, a $10 bill in the other, and a young son trailing behind her as she approached the cash register. The cashier looked at the price tag and figured the tax.

title: Ethiopia's Military Seeks Talks in Eritrean Crisis
description: ASMARA, Ethiopia, Aug. 25 The military movement that rules Ethiopia is opening an official investigation into the chronic unrest in Eritrea, the country's northernmost province, and says it wants to estabfish a dialogue with the rebels fighting for independence.

title: Quaker Oats Net Up
Shoppers Finding Prices Of School Clothing Higher
description: The woman shopper had a pair of boy's denim jeans in one hand, a $10 bill in the other, and a young, son trailing behind her as she approached the cash register. The cashier looked at the price tag and figured the tax.

title: MARY BRADY REIL
description: Mary Brady Reil, an assistant principal at Joseph B. Cavallaro Junior High School, 8787 24th Avenue, Brooklyn, died yesterday in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood, N. J., after a short illness. She was 56 years old and lived at 128 Regency. Park, Ramsey, N. J.

title: State Funds Draw High Bank Interest Under Bid Policy
description: TRENTON, Aug. 26 (AP)The state announced today that it would deposit $10million with 27 banks under a new policy requiring bidding by financial institutions for state deposits.

title: Labor Day Death Walk Over Great Falls Slated
description: PATERSON, Aug. 25 (AP)  French aerialist Philippe Petit, who reecntly walked a tightrope between the tops of the World Trade Center twin towers in New York, agreed today to perform a similar stunt over the Great Falls here on Labor Day, Mayor Lawrence F. Kramer said.

title: Gain 76 Triumph Medich Chased in 3Run Sixth
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 26The high hopes the New York Yankees had harbored about closing in quickly on the leading Boston Red Sox in the American League East race received a jolt tonight. They were beaten by the Twins, 76, despite an auspicious start.

title: OLD CROSS STOLEN AT ST, JOHN DIVINE
description: A 17thcentury gold reliquary cross presented to the Episcopal Diocese of New York nearly 50 years ago by the Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem has been stolen from the high altar of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine on Morningside Heights.

title: Oil Leads Rise to Import Peak
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The oilhungry United States paid more for imported goods in July than in any other month on record, sending the nation into its thirddeepest monthly trade deficit ever, the Government reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In summarily rejecting a proposed downwardsliding scale for taxation of capital gains, your recent editorial, Tax Unreform Bill, seems to proceed from the assumption that the interests of wealthy shareholders are somehow opposed to those of the majority. However, testimony given before the House Ways and Means Committee strongly supports the view that this reform would serve the best interests of all Americans.

title: The Rockefeller Homes: Comfortable, Understated Elegance
description: Well, there goes Nelson A. Rockefeller's rush to finish his Japanese house. At least for the time being. If Mr. Rockefeller becomes Vice President, and there is every evidence that he will, he isn't going to have the time to worry over the details of furnishing this latest of his multiple households.

title: New Nation at a Glance
description: GEOGRAPHYPortuguese Guinea, the smallest, poorest and least hospitable of Portugal's African territories, is wedged between. Senegal and Guinea near the tip of Africa's western bulge. It is wet end hot, and its 13,948 square milesabout twice the size of New Jerseyconsist largely of lowlying savannah, swamps, rain forests and mangrovecovered coastal wetlands.

title: Braves Keep Winning but Not Gaining
description: The Atlanta Braves are on a treadmillthey keep winning, but they are not getting any place in the National League's Western Division.

title: G.M.'s Price Increases Range Up to $1,316
description: DETROIT, Aug. 26The General Motors Corporation disclosed today that it was raising prices of some of its 1975 models hundreds of dollars more than the average $426 increase it announced last week for its new cars and trucks.

title: All the Way With T.A.
description: Although some straphangers are finding it difficult to reach Brooklyn safely in the city's subways these days, State Controller Arthur Levitt has turned up evidence that it is possible to go a long way with the Transit Authorityprovided you are one of its top officers.

title: Greeks Report Gunfire At Border With Turkey
description: ALEXANDROUPOLIS, Greece, Aug. 26 (Reuters)Turkish troops fired machinegun bursts against Greek position's across the GreekTurkish border in Thrace at noon today, according to local press reports here.

title: People and Business
description: F. Donald Hart, president of the American Gas Association, asserted yesterday that, to achieve substantial progress toward energy independence, this nation must urgently develop supplemental sources of gas to meet our growing energy demands.

title: Racquets Capture Team Tennis Title
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 26 (AP)Andrew Pattison's 60 victory in the men's singles led the Denver Racquets to a 2824 Victory over the Philadelphia Freedoms and the World Team Tennis championship tonight. Denver took the series, 2 to 0.

title: Open Schools Pose a Problem for Open Polls on Primary Day
description: The Board of Education has rejected a request by the Board of Elections to close the city's schools  many of which are used as polling placeson primary election day, Sept. 10.

title: Jets Place Thompson, W.F.L. Jumper on Waivers
description: The Jets put Steve Thompson, a sixthyear defensive tackle, on waivers yesterday and if no team in the National Football League picks him up by the deadline this afternoon he could become the property of the World Football League's Portland Storm a year early.

title: BUTZ SEES NO NEED FOR PANIC ON FOOD THIS YEAOR NEXT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The United States will have plenty of beef in the coming year despite disappointing fall crops of livestockfeed grains, but lower supplies of pork and broiler chickens will be available, a panel of administrators led by. Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Ford Greets Little League Champions

title: Son of Slain Muslim Minister Carries on His Work in Newark
description: NEWARK, Aug. 26It has been almost a year since the Muslim minister James Shabazz was shot to death as he entered his home here at 341 13th Avenue, but the work of his group continues, according to his son and successor, James Shabazz Jr.

title: G.M. Workers at Ohio Plant To Vote on Contract Today
description: DETROIT, Aug. 26 (AP)Rankandfile workers at General Motors' Lordstown, Ohio, assembly complex will vote on a new local contract tomorrow to end a sevenweekold strike there.

title: Bridge:
description: The candidates for international honors seem to get younger every year. The players in the International Team Trials to be played later this week in Washington are particularly young group, with only one player over and few over 40.

title: Screen
description: Although we now live with melodrama on a weekly basis, it's still immensely refreshing on film, Fritz Lang's Testament of Dr. Mabuse, the sequel to his Doktor Mabuse of 1922, yields a sensational torrent of images that almost make the early nineteenseventies seem. tame.

title: Mobil Says Offer to Buy Stock Of Marcor Will Not Be Renewed
description: The Mobil Corporation reported yesterday that its offer to purchase common and convertible preferred shares of Marcor, Inc., had been oversubscribed by a wide margin. As a result, the giant oil company said that the tender offer, which expired last, Friday, would not be renewed.

title: Bridgeport Women Win
description: BUCK HILL FALLS, Pa., Aug. 26  April Backhurst and Barbara Weaver of Bridgeport, Conn., won the doubles title in the eastern division tourney of the American Women's Lawn Bowling Association over the weekend at the Buck Hill Inn and Golf Club. Sheila Buttar, Mattie Duncan, Ruth Neumair and Marie Gorman of the Sunrise Bowling Club, L. I., captured the fourwoman team event.

title: Revenue Sharing Target Of New General Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTONFor nearly two years, one of the smallest Federal bureaucracies in Washington has been quietly mailing out checksreaching a total of $14.3billionto thousands of units of state and local government.

title: State Welfare Rolls Off QuarterMillion From Peak in 1972
description: The number of New Yorkers on welfare has been cut by almost a quarter of a million since its high point in early 1972, Governor Wilson's office said yesterday.

title: Swimmers Picked for Coast Meet
description: CONCORD, Calif., Aug. 26 (UPI)This weekend's cornpetition between swimming teams from East Germany and the United States is billed as a dual meet, but it probably will turn out to be a world recordbreaking get together.

title: Grand Jury Links Politics And Garfield Police Force
description: HACKENSACK, Aug. 26 (UPI)A Bergen County grand jury has returhed a presentment charging that the Garfield Police Department was dominated by political motivations during the nineteensixties and early nineteenseventies.

title: Turks Say They Could Halt Any Guerrillas on Cyprus
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 26Turkish military commanders ire not seriously concerned about Greek Cypriote guerrilla lotion and they are confident that Turkey can match any creek buildup of modern jets and tanks.

title: How to Lose an Ally
description: Secretary of State Kissinger still seems oblivious to the dimensions of the disaster sustained by United States foreign policy in the Cyprus tragedy and insensitive to the hurt of people who feel let down by Washington.

title: PILOT OF COPTER FILES GUILTY PLEA
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Aug. 26 (AP)A young Army private pleaded guilty today to charges stemming from a helicopter flight that ended on the White House lawn.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Daylight Time

title: Revenue Sharing Target Of New General Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTONFor nearly two years, one of the smallest Federal bureaucracies in Washington has been quietly mailing out checksreaching a total of $14.3billionto thousands of units of state and local government.

title: The Evil of Work
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26I read in the papers recently that there are 500 million marginal people on the earth. These are people the world can't use. There is no economic need for themno jobs, not enough natural resources, not enough arable land, not enough food, Socially and economically, they are useless, if not worse, since they cause political upheaval, high taxes and slums.

title: TIMES NAMES FISKE EDUCATION EDITOR
description: The appointment of Edward B. Fiske as education editor of The New York Times was announced yesterday by A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor.

title: WOOLWORTH NET DECLINES BY 16%
description: A substantial rise in interest costs reduced, earnings of the F. W. Woolworth Company in the quarter and six months ended June 30 despite record sales, the company reported yesterday.

title: SADAT LINKS '73 WAR TO EGYPT'S ECONOMY
description: CAIRO; Tuesday, Aug. 27 (AP)  President Anwar elSadat said yesterday that he went to war against Israel last October to save Egypt from bankruptcy.

title: Bridge: International Contenders Get Younger All the Time
description: The candidates for international, honors seem to get younger every year. The players in the International Team Trials to be played later this week in Washington are a particularly young group, with only one player over 50 and few over 40.

title: Fire Suspect Gets Help
description: The man charged with setting the fire that killed 24 persons at Gulliver's nightclub in Port Chester and who was reported to have made two suicide attempts in the last two weeks, is undergoing psychiatric counseling in the court jail at Grasslands. Peter Leonard, a 22yearold highschool droptried to slash his wrists, Wand then set fire to his cell, authorities said.

title: Nixon Personality Held Flawed By Jesuit Aide in White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (UPI) Describing former President Richard M. Nixon as a thoroyghbred with a flawed personality, the Rev. John J. McLaughlin, a former Presidential speechwriter, said today that he had a new feeling of excitement and peace with President Ford in the White House.

title: Ford Cutting Output of Pinto Subcompacts
description: DETROIT, Aug. 26The Ford Motor Company, with a threemonth supply of unsold Pintos, is cutting back production of the subcompact car but says it is still confident that the smallcar segment of the market will account for about half of this year's sales.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Motorist Association. Assails G.M.'s Pricing
description: The General Motors Corporation has bowed to President Ford's request to reconsider its price increase, but the corporate response has been found wanting by the National Automobile Association.

title: WALDHEIM MEETS CYPRUS LEADERS; ARRANGES TALKS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 26Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations and the heads of the Greek and Turkish Cypriote administrations conferred here today and said afterward they had achieved some progress toward an eventual solution of the crisis on the island.

title: Welfare Commissioner Resigns in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 26Westchester County's Social Services Commissioner, Leonard Berman, resigned today, citing inflamatory publicity in the recent indictment of his wife for alleged welfare fraund.

title: NEW PLAZA PLAN GIVEN IN FORT LEE
description: FORT LEE, Aug. 26William Zeckendorf Jr. presented scaleddown version of the controversial George Washington Plaza project to the Borough Planning Board tonight.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Mugged; 2 Youths Held Inimediately,
description: A 54yearold Brooklyn man was shot and beaten by two robbers on a street corner in Brownsville last night and seconds later, two detectives who spotted the assault captured the alleged assailants.

title: HARRY NEWBURN, 68, HEADED UNIVERSITIES
description: MESA, Ariz., Aug. 26 (AP)Dr. Harry K. Newburn, former president of several universities died Sunday night. He was 68 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: BankAmerica Changes Name of GAC Finance
description: The BankAmerica Corporation announced yesterday that it would change the name of GAC Finance, Inc., a finance company acquired in January, to the FinanceAmerica Corporation.

title: Grain Prices Fall; Currency. Futures To Start Trading
description: Futures prices of farm commodities tumbled on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday during a widespread liquidation spree, mostly of a profit taking nature.

title: Fro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Shore Patrol Wins Jersey Race
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 26 (UPI)Shore Patrol outsped a field of nine New Jerseybreds today to win the $22,700 Longport Handicap, openingday feature of the Atlantic City Meeting.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SEVENPERCENT SOLUTION. By Nicholas Meyer. 253 pages. Dutton. $6,95.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: MYTHIC PROPORTIONS The Brooklyn Everyman Company was founded in 1968 and has grown since then into two separate theatrical troupes that present free shows in that borough's streets, using talented young people from the neighborhoods. These days, the two groups are presenting two musical plays that translate legendary stories into modern settings.

title: M'CARTHY HEADS NEW MOVEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26A political movement is being organized to put forward an independent Presidential candidate in 1976.

title: CBS BUYS NBC SERIES AND BECOMES A RIVAL
description: In an unusual action that will result in one network's rerunning portions of a program that is still appearing on a rival network, CBSTV has bought both old and upcoming segments of NBCTV's current Mystery Movie series for replay on The CBS Late Movie.

title: Majestic Histories: Not by Fact Alone
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass, No one ever questions the desirability of or the need for, rereading Pride and Prejudice, attending yet another performance of The Marriage of Figaro, or watching Hamlet and The Tempest once again. These are, after all, richly textured works of genius yielding new meanings, insights and pleasures each time one returns, to them.

title: Nixon Reported Retaining ExU.S. Aide as Attorney
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon has hired a former highlevel Justice Department official, Herbert J. Miller Jr., to represent him in connection with the Watergate coverup and other pending criminal and civil matters, reliable sources said today.

title: Printers Reach an Accord At Washington StarNews
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) The Washington StarNews and its printers have reached tentative agreement on a sixyear contract giving the newspaper virtually unrestricted automation rights while providing lifetime job guarantees for fulltime printers.

title: They're Off (3 or 4 Times) in Hambletonian Today
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Aug. 27Rural America prepared for its annual day in the big leagues today with 22 trotting horses ready to race for $160,150 tomorrow in the richest Hambletonian in history.

title: SPARSE AUDIENCE HEARS MRS. PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 27Only a few thousand trade unionists gathered today to hear President Isabel Martinez de Peron, in her first public rally since she took office, speak in the historic Plaza de Mayo, where her late husband, Gen. Juan Domingo Peron, had drawn scores of thousands of supporters on numerous occasions.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 28, 1974

title: 3 YACHTS HIJACKED, COAST GUARD SAYS.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) The Coast Guard said today, that it had confirmed that at least three motor and sailing yachts had been hijackedtwo by alleged drug runnersin the last three years but that there was no evidence that other yachts had also been hijackd.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange dosed lower yesterday for the 13th consecutive session as volume continued light. The same conditions also prevailed in the overthe counter market.

title: WNCN WILL DROP CLASSICAL MUSIC
description: WNCN, which has attracted an intensely loyal audience in the metropolitan area with its classical music programs since 1957, will become a popularmusic station on Oct, 5.

title: Campbell Needs 25 Holes to Advance
description: PARAMUS, N.J., Aug. 27Bill Campbell, trim and durable at 51 years of age, is competing this week in the United States Amateur golf championship for the 31st time. Only Charles (Chick) Evans, who played in his 50th and last United States Amateur in 1962, has competed in more.

title: Expansion of Health Care For Elderly, Is Envisioned
description: PLAINFIELD, Aug. 27An expansion of privately owned and operated nursing homes and healthcare installations, intended primarily to serve the state's more than 1.1 million residents over the age of 60, was predicted today by state officials and executives of the New Jersey Association of Health Care Facilities.

title: It's a Bad Year for Shrimp Fishermen As Their Costs Soar and Incomes Fall
description: ABOARD THE SHRIMP BOAT MISS DENISE, Off Cypremort Point, La.  The gulls gathered above the wake to watch the daily drama and, with luck, to share a little in its fruits.

title: Out of Doors Pieces
description: Lincoln Center Out of Doors brought Frank Ohman's New York Dance Theater to Manhattan somewhat prematurely Monday evening. The company, which has been performing in the outer boroughs, has yet to establish its creative voice, and all of its pieces hinted at stronger creative influences.

title: Turkey Rejects Soviet Bid For a Cyprus Conference,
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 27Turkey turned down today a Soviet proposal, for an expanded Cyprus peace conference and called on Greece to resume negotiations at Geneva without delay.

title: Otto Strasser, 76, Theoretician Who Broke With Hitler, Is Dead
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 27 (AP)Otto Strasser, a prominent Nazi spokesman who broke with Hitler over party ideology, died today in Munich. He was 76 years old.

title: White's Single Key in a FourRun 7th Against Twins
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 27  Aware that the next best thing to closing ground on the firstplace Boston Red Sox is at least keeping pace with them, the New York Yankees turned in one explosive inning tonight to register a 42 triumph over the Twins.

title: ANALYSIS IS ORDERED IN HOMESTAKE CASE
description: TULSA, Aug. 27 (UPI)Both sides in the $100million Home Stake Production Company swindle suit were ordered today to prepare a joint analysis of the litigation and class action proposals for review by the United States District Court Sept. 12.

title: Red Smith
description: Phil Bieber is a racing man who has lived in this world a spell and walked up and down in it and laid by a store of information on a variety of subjects. Some of his knowledge  such as littleknown facts about famous broodmares, the personality traits of Mexican bandits and the origins of American folk sayings  he has shared from time to time with readers of this column. Recently Mr. Bieber fell to musing on the fact that although names like Lyndon B. Johnson, Richard M. Nixon and Gerald R. Ford had grown more or less familiar, others whose owners could make similar claims on our memory had flipped into obscurity. That is, Thomas A. Hendricks, Charles W. Fairbanks and James S. Sherman served as Vice President of the United States, too.

title: West Germany Closes Down Another Small Bank
description: BERLIN, Aug. 27 (Reuters)The Banking Supervisory Board announced today it had withdrawn the banking license of Frankfurter Handelsbank, A. G., a formal step that is virtually simultaneous with the closure of a bank in this country.

title: 8,500 ARE LAID OFF BY BRITISH LEYLAND
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 (AP)The British Leyland Motor Corporation laid off about 8,500 workers today because of a strike by workers at its transmission plant.

title: Savings Banks' Outflow in July Reached a Record $602Million
description: New York savings bankers disclosed yesterday that the outflow of money reached new high of $602million last month, breaking the previous record set exactly a year earlier when the outflow stood at $472million.

title: Space Shot Postponed
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Aug. 27 (AP)The launching of the Netherlands' first space satellite from this coastal facility was postponed today until Friday at the earliest to allow for troubleshooting, a NASA spokesman said.

title: Malone Agrees to Turn Pro With Stars; Bucks, Robertson Fail to Reach Terms
description: Pro basketball has a new face, probably its youngest ever, and it may be losing an old one, probably one of its greatest.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Kissinger Is Expected to Visit Mideast To Discuss Next Step in Negotiations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Se cretary of State Kissinger will probably fly to the Middle East in the next two months to seek agreement on the next stage in the ArabIsraeli negotiations.

title: Newcomer Leads Primary For Oklahoma Governor
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Tuesday, Aug. 28A 33yearold fresh face held a lead early today in the vote counting in yesterday's Democratic primary for Governor of Oklahoma.

title: World Agency Proposed For the Fight on Hunger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The secretary general of a forthcoming United Nations conference on world food problems said here today that an international authority should be established to deal with problems of hunger in the poorer countries.

title: Israel Says She Has Arrested 4 More Guerrillas From Jordan
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27Israeli authorities, reporting an increase in guerrilla incidents over the last few days, announced today that they had arrested four infiltrators from Jordan.

title: Wall St. in Somber Mood As Stock Decline Persists
description: Stock prices plunged again yesterday, sending the Dow Jones Industrial index to its lowest level in four years. In the last three weeks, the widely watched market indicator has lost 102.24 points, and the mood of Wall Street recalls Depression days.

title: Turkey Rejects Soviet Bid For a Cyprus Conference
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 27Turkey turned down today a Soviet proposal for an expanded Cyprus peace conference and called on Greece to resume negotiations at Geneva without delay.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: World Agency Proposed For the Fight on Hunger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The secretary general of a forthcoming United Nations conference on world food problems said here today that an international authority should be established to deal with problems of hunger in the poorer countries.

title: Nixon Will Be Prosecuted If Indicted, Democrat Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) There would be tip alternative to prosecuting former President Richard M. Nixon it a Federal grand jury indicted him, Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, said today.

title: Forest Hills Opens Today With Stars
description: If Chris Evert and Jimmy Connors don't mind, John Newcombe, the defending champion, will start the tennis balls rolling today when the $271,720 United States Open championships begin a 12day run at the West Side Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: 400,000 RENTERS FACE INCREASES
description: The city's Rent Guidelines Board yesterday authorized landlords to collec rent increases of up to 8.5 per cent for renewal of oneyear leases in the 400,000 apartments here that the Legislature placed under stabilization in the spring.

title: UNIONS PRESS STATE ON HOSPITAL JOBS
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 (AP)Two publicemploye unions said today that they wanted to meet with Governor Byrne to discuss possible patient reductions at state mental hospitals. The unions said they were concerned about the welfare of the patients and the continued employment of 10,000 of their members in the state institutions.

title: 4 Networks Carrying Ford News Conference
description: All three Commercial television networks and the Public Broadcasting Service will broadcast President Ford's news conference today at 2:30 P.M.

title: Westvaco Raises Its Quarter Profit to Record
Revising Presidency: Why the Pace Is Slow
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27When President Ford was sworn into office on Aug. 9, he and his closest advisers were determined to reshape the Presidency he inherited from Richard M. Nixon. This would be done largely by making it more open and more broadly based and by removing everyone who had any association with the Watergate scandals.

title: Trunz Meat Plant in Brooklyn Is Closed Alter Sale to Krauss
description: The Trunz meatprocessing plant in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn has been shut down, with a loss of more than 200 jobs.

title: Cunningham Park Kismet Full of Fun Earnest Charms on West 18th St.
description: For fun, color, melody and professionalism, it would be hard to beat the production of Kismet now touring the parks by the Alliance of Latin Arts, New York's oldest musicaltheater wrokshop for Puerto Ricans and other Spanishspeaking talent.

title: INJUNCTION SOUGHT AGAINST THE F.T.C.
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 27 (AP) The Control Data Corporation and, its subsidiary, Automation Institute of America, Inc., are seeking an injunction against the Federal Trade Commission to force the F.T.C. to release certain records.

title: ROCKEFELLER GETS WIDE F.B.I. CHECK
description: Political friends and foes alike say they have found nothing bad to tell Federal agents investigating the background of the Vice Presidentdesignate, Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Art and Nationalism in Oceania
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, Aug. 26  Museums, as repositories of a cultural heritage, are a focus of nationalism in the emerging South Pacific island states, according to findings aired at a meeting of leading scholars from a dozen countries in this Canadian industrial city.

title: DEATH OF ANIMALS LAID TO CHEMICAL
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., Aug. 27Dioxin, the deadly chemical contained in a herbicide once used to defoliate forests in South Vietnam, has been identified as the agent that killed many horses and scores of other animals in Missouri.

title: William N. Creasy, 66, Led Burroughs Wellcome & Co.
description: William N, Creasy, who retired in 1968 as president and chairman of Burroughs Wellcome & Co., a pharmaceutical concern of Tuckahoe, N.Y., after 22 years in the posts, died yesterday at his home, 8 Oak Bend, Bronxville, N.Y, He was 66 years old.

title: Public Confidence in Congress Found Growing
description: Largely because of the televised impeachment sessions of the House Judiciary Committee last month, public confidence in Congress has increased sharply since April, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: FEATURE MATCHES TODAY
description: STADIUM COURTS

title: Opposition Leader In South Korea Asks Changes in Charter
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 27 (AP)The new president of South Korea's major opposition party called for constitutional reforms today only four days after President Park Chung Hee canceled decrees that made such demands a capital offense.

title: INFLATION CURBS URGED IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, Aug, 27President Valry Giscard d'Estaing called today for a tough fight against inflation. He made it clear that painful measures would be announced soon.

title: Bank Holdup Foiled As Customer Trails Suspect in Midtown
description: A man who allegedly held up a midtown bank was captured yesterday after a customer slipped out of the teller's line and followed the suspect to hotel, taking three taxis to keep on the suspect's zigzag trial through Manhattan traffic.

title: Bitter Dispute Between Electrical Unions Jeopardizes Completion of 18 Schools
description: Competition for members and jobs by two electrical unionsantagonists of long standingis jeopardizing completion of 18 schools in the city by Sept. 9, when the fall term begins.

title: Donald Cameron, 73, Librarian And Professor at Rutgers, Dies
description: Donald F. Cameron, who retired in 1966 as librarian at the Archibald S. Alexander Library at Rutgers University, died of cancer yesterday in Middlesex Hospital in New Brunswick, N.J. He was 73 years old and lived in Highland Park, N.J.

title: Nixon Hires New Lawyer, A Former Justice Official
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 Former President Richard M. Nixon has hired a former highlevel Justice Department official, Herbert J. Miller Jr., to represent him in connection with the Watergate coverup and other pending criminal and civil matters.

title: Stranded Passaic Girl Allowed to Leave Cyprus
description: PATERSON, Aug. 27 (AP)Lucy Savvides, a 14yearold Passaic girl who was stranded in a Cypriote village after the Turkish army had captured it, will be coming home, it was announced today.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Upholds Villanova on Disciplining 12
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug, 27 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Thrid Circult reversed today a lower court order and ruled that Villanova University had the right to discipline 12 male students who were suspended or expelled after a beer party last spring in a women's dormitory.

title: Intrepid Captures Cup Trial
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 27At the America's Cup scene here today naval warfare between Courageous and Intrepid took a new tack. Intrepid, the 7yearold wooden boat backed by public subscription of West Coast yachting enthusiasts, revived herself after four straight defeats and beat Courageous handily in America's Cup weather, a strong, healthy 15  to  17 knot southerly breeze. The margin of victory was 1 minute 12 Seconds.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Ending the Emergency
description: With growing selfconfidence in the reassertion of its constitutional prerogatives, Congress is preparing a fundamental legal reform to limit the power of the Presidency during illdefined states of national emergency.

title: Auto Union at Lordstown Votes Pact, Ending Strike
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, Aug. 27 (UPI)  A sixandahalfweek strike that forced a halt in the production of thousands of Chevrolet Vegas and vans ended tonight with ratification of a twoyear contract.

title: CONTROL FIGHT ENDS AT SUNSHINE MINES
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, Aug. 27 (UPI)  The scheduled battle for control of the nation's largest and richest silver source, the Sunshine Mine, ended today with a settlement that placed the chief dissident in a decisionmaking role on the company's executive board.

title: ROCKEFELLER GETS WIDE F. B. I. CHECK
description: Political friends and foes alike say they have found nothing bad to tell Federal agents investigating the background of the Vice Presidentdesignate, Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:15 P.M. (Television  Channel 9, 2:10 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 2:15 P.M.)

title: C.A.B. Chief Went to Europe With Vice President of T.W.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 The chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, criticized for accepting an expensespaid golfling trip to Bermuda from the United Aircraft Corporation, spent considerable time during a business trip to Europe earlier this year with a vice president of Trans World Airlines.

title: 2 on Raft Seek Landfall
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 27 (AP) Chuck Gore and George Sigler, Navy reserve pilots, attempting to sail a 15foot rubber raft from the West Coast to Hawaii, hope their 2,600mile journey will be over by Thursday, according to a radio report received by the pilot of a jet airliner. If they don't make landfall by Thursday, they said they would radio the Coast Guard for help, said Capt. Clarence Zahner, the pilot of a Pan American World Airways plane.

title: Local Residents Doubt Police Charges Against Fire Hero Youth
description: Residents of the East Third Street neighborhood, where dozens of families were routed by suspicious fires recently, were skeptical yesterday of police contentions that a youth who was recognized as a hero in a tenement fire a week ago might have been involved in the origin of a second fire last Monday.

title: SAMUEL ROSENBERG, FOUNDED MILES SHOE
description: Samuel H. Rosenberg, who with his brother Murray M. Rosenberg, founded the Miles Shoe Corporation in 1917, died on Sunday in Lucerne, Switzerland, where he was vacationing. He was 81 years old and lived in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: While We Fertilize Golf Courses
description: WASHINGTONOver the 25 years since President Truman committed the United States to providing technical assistance overseas, developing countries have been urged to modernize their agriculture by use of more chemical fertilizers and the better seeds that need them.

title: Latrobe Steel Dividend Set
description: The Latrobe Steel Company announced yesterday that it would pay dividends totaling 10 cents a share during the rest of this yearthe first cash dividends since March of 1970. The company is paying dividends because its lending banks waived restrictions on longterm loan agreements.

title: Portent for South Africa
description: With the signing in Algiers of an agreement providing for the formal independence of GuineaBissau next month, Portugal has taken its first major step to dissolve the empire that it established in Africa five centuries ago. This dramatic event furnishes a clear portent for coming events farther south in Africa, including Portugal's disengagement from its two other territories on that continent, Angola and Mozambique.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Selas Corporation of America said it had received three contracts for the supply of ethylene production equipment with a combined value of about $23million. Initial shipments would begin late next year. The company said it could not identify the customers at this time other than to say that they are major domestic companies.

title: DANIEL KAUFKAN, 63, QUEENS UROLOGIST
description: Dr. Daniel R. Kaufman, urologist at Queens General and Triboro Hospitals, Jamaica, Queens, died yesterday at New York Hospital. He lived at 24 Birch Hill Road, Lake Success, L.I., and was 63 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: ROSS AND TOM. Two American Tragedies. By John Leggett. 447 pages. Simon & Schuster. $10.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CAMDEN, N.S. Aug. 27 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury here indicted 23 persons today on charges of intentionally misrepresenting horserace winnings totallin'g $36,000 on Internal Revenue Service forms. The grand jury returned 19 indictments charging each defendant with knowingly misrepresenting the name of the real winner of a parimutuel wager on I.R.S. Form 1099 on a horse race at Monmout Park Race Track in Oceanport.

title: Enforced Prudence
description: If the House of Representatives has its way, the Department of Transportation will have to withdraw its regulations requiring auto makers to install either air bags or interlock seatbelts of the kind that have to be used if a car is to start. The 337to49 vote voiding these requirements for 1975 models is a setback to the department, which has on its own been moving in the right direction in trying to insure safety even for those drivers who will not take the trouble to act in their own best interest. The overwhelming margin in the House and the absence of any provision for restraints in the Senate bill make any reversal unlikely in the conference committee that will try to square the two versions of the measure. Fortunately, even if the House action is sustained, seatbelts will still continue to be mandatory equipment. There is every reason that case why their use should be mandated by state laws, on pain of a traffic ticket.

title: Expos Keep Their Elan By Downing Braves, 61
description: Gone are the days in Montreal when the Canadiens were revered as the Habs, and the Expos were merely the HabNots.

title: Democratic InFighting
description: With the Democratic state primary less than two weeks off, four candidates endorsed by the Democratic State Committee are confronted with such stiff challenges that there is at least a fair chance all four could be News defeated.

title: Recession: Some Criteria Missing, So Far
description: Is it a recession or isn't it?

title: Jersey Drug Panel to Ask End Of Certain Criminal Penalties
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27A legislative narcotics study commission was reported tonight to be planning to urge the end of criminal penalties in New Jersey for the possession of small amounts of hard drugs and one dunce or less of marijuana.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page ??

title: People in Sports
description: Hollywood may be drooling. London called them The Lovebird Double after each of them won a Wimbledon championship. In the United States it's The Chrissy and Jimmy Show because they have dominated tennis this year. Both are seeded first in the United States Open that begins today at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills. They will be married Nov. 8. And yesterday, Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert received yet another honor when they were presented the 1974 Dewar's Cup in tandem for their outstanding contributions to tennis.

title: EXPORT OUTLOOK WEAKENS GRAINS
description: Prices of farm commodity futures again fell on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. For the second time in two days trading was affected by Agriculture Department announcements.

title: 2 Missing Girls Found Unhurt By a Family Friend in Jersey
description: Denise and Angela Mayo, the 12yearold cousins missing since Saturday from their homes in Ridgefield Park and Saddle Brook, N.J., were found unharmed last night walking along the boardwalk in the seaside community of Wildwood, in southern New Jersey, by a vacationing friend of the Mayo family.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Dow Industrials Fall 16.59 to 671.54 as Turnover Slows
description: Soaring interest rates sent stock prices sharply lower yesterday in slower trading. The Dow Jones industrial average finished at its lowest level in more than four years.

title: Java Is Lush, but Not Rich Enough to Feed All Its 80 Million People
description: SAWAHREJO, Indonesia The name of this hamlet in Central Java means prosperous rice fields, and glance at the lush landscape is enough to reach the conclusion that the word hunger ought never he uttered here.

title: How to Beat the Inflation
description: LONDON, Aug. 27The British rate of inflation is now almost double America's, and the chances are that things will get worse before they get desperate, so the people are coming up with some ingenious ways to live through the crisis and even beat it.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Anonymous
description: I know a poem of six lines that no one knows who wrote, except that the poet was Chinese and lived centuries before the birth of Christ. I said it aloud once to some children, and when I reached the last line suddenly they understood and together all wentOoo!Imagine that poem, written by a poet truly who is Anonymous, since in the strict corporeal sense he hasn't existed for thousands of yearsimagine his little poem traveling without gas or even a single grease job across centuries of space and a million miles of time to me, who spoke it softly aloud to a group of children who heard and suddenly all together cried Ooo!

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BELMAR, Aug. 27Basketball is alive and well this summer at the New Jersey shore. In fact it's flourishing. The Jersey Shore Summer Basketball League, conducted on an outdoor court behind Jerry Lynch's Bar here four nights a week, is drawing an average of 1,000 fans a night. One reason: highcaliber games played by top players.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27 (UPI)A Los Angeles group threatening to sue the Soviet Ararat soccer team for failing make an American tour is laying the blame at the wrong door, Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today. The Soviet champion team was scheduled to play several matches in the United States and Canada Aug. 15 through 31. But Tass said Bernie Lantz, impresario for the tour, sent a cable Aug. 12, after the team already was in Moscow preparing to leave, and asked it to delay its arrival until Aug. 21.

title: Large Areas of Italy Suffer Power Failure
description: ROME, Aug. 27 (AP)A power failure left almost half of Italy without electricity today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is strange that none of your interesting letters concerning the possible trial and conviction of exPresident Nixon seems to discuss the situation that will arise if Richard Nixon is acquitted, which is certainly possible. Such an acquittal will mean that he had been forced to resign onmistaken grounds, and that President Ford was occupying a position to which Nixon was entitled. It must, however, be emphasized that no criticism can be directed against President Ford as the relationship between the two Presidents has brought great credit to both of them. Nixon appointed Ford Vice President, although he knew that this would make his own impeachment more likely, while Ford did everything possible to defend Nixon. His continuing association with Nixon since the resignation suggests that he does not believe in the terrible crimes that John Doar, special counsel to the House Judiciary Committee, described in such virulent terms.

title: Special Unit Urges Raises for Gibson and Council
description: NEWARK, Aug. 27A fivemember, blueribbon committee formed at the request of Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson to review compensation of the elected officials of the city today recommended an inimediate $10,000 raise for the Mayor and a $1,500 raise for each of the nine members of the City Council.

title: SAXBE SAYS CRIME IN U.S IS CLIMBING
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 27  Attorney General William 13, Saxbe warned today that the country's law enforcement bodies had lost the initiative in fighting violent crime and were failing to alter what he called America's most agonizing fact of life.

title: Woman Mugged on IND Loses $1,500 Jewelry
description: A 29yearold woman, on her way to work, was mugged on an IND subway train in Manhattan yesterday morning by a young man who fled with $30 in cash and jewelry valued at more than $1,500, the police reported.

title: Hiring DoubleStandard.
description: Although Congress a decade ago passed legislation forbidding most other major employers in the nation to discriminate in hiring, it apparently feels no obligation to follow that rule of decency itself. Last week, responding to press reports of widespread discrimination on Capitol Hill, the Congressional Office of Placement and Office Management acknowledged that 80 per cent of its current job orders from Congressional offices contained exclusionary requirements.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page ??

title: Portuguese Flag Struck And Rebel Banner Rises
description: CUNTIMA, Portuguese Guinea, Aug. 26On Sunday, 24 hours before Portugal agreed formally to grant independence to this smallest of her African territories on Sept. 10, the Portuguese flag was lowered at the fortified camp here.

title: VENEZUELA TOCUT OIL OUTPUT IN '75
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug. 27 (UPI)Venezuela, the single largest supplier of United States oil imports, will drop production below the mark of three million barrels a day in 1975 for the first time since 1961, oil industry sources reported today.

description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Rockefeller Gives Tax Data to Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller has turned over the first installment of his financial records to the Congressional committees that will consider his nomination, in the form of his Federal income tax returns for 1967 through 1973.

title: Greek Cypriotes Reported Forming Guerrilla Army
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 27Greek Cypriote military and civilian leaders of various political leanings are planning to wage guerrilla warfare against the Turkish occupation forces in Cyprus if they come to decide that there can be no peaceful solution to the island's crisis, according to sources close to the leaders.

title: FRANCE WILL LIFT EMBARGO ON ARMS TO MIDEAST LANDS
description: PARIS, Aug. 27 France, which is conducting a fundamental review of her defense policy, has decided to lift her embargo on arms sales to Middle East battlefield countries, it was learned officially today.

title: Interest on Small Loans In July Rose to 11.47%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  Interest rates for small shortterm noninstallment business loans rose to 11.47 per cent in July from 11.06 per cent in June, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27A new manned Soviet spacecraft circled the earth today, bound for an expected rendezvous with space station orbited late last June.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Connecticut State Police yesterday recovered $380,000 in rare coins stolen two days ago from the State Library Museum in Hartford. The coins were found in a flight bag stuffed between the radiator and the grille of an automobile abandoned on a Hartford street.

title: Bridge: Georgia Team LeastKnown Of 4 Meeting in Washington
description: Of four teams that will compete in the international team trials in Washington later this week, the leastknown to New York followers of the game will be the foursome from Georgia that won the Spingold knockout teams here last month.

title: DONALD C. HOPSON, BRITISH ENVOY, 59
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 27 (AP) Sir Donald C. Hopson, the British Ambassador to Argentina, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 59 years old.

title: Soyuz 15 Orbits Earth on Way to Docking With Salyut
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27A new manned Soviet spacecraft circled the earth today, bound for an expected rendezvous with a space station orbited late last June.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Administration is conducting a comprehensive study aimed at identifying dozens of different Government policies and programs that may be contributing to inflation by fostering inefficient operation of the private sector of the economy.

title: Great Neck Move to Oust School Chief Draws Fire
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Aug. 27 This affluent community, which was sharply divided five years ago by a busing controversy, is split once again by an attempt to oust the superintendent of schools, Mortimer J. Abramowitz.

title: Vatican Denies Report Of Big Banking Losses
description: ROME, Aug. 27A Papal spokesman today, denied West German press reports that the Vatican had suffered substantial financial losses in the collapse of a small private bank in Hamburg that is believed to have involved Michele Sindona, the controversial Italian financier

title: The Flotsam of the Storm
description: SPETSAIS, GreeceRight after announcing withdrawal of Greek armed forces from NATO, Premier Caraman lis overhauled the command of those forces, firing all top leaders associated with the previous junta and with the boomerang Cyprus coup that touched off Turkey's invasion. The odd thing is that the men now named to command have all been proNATO enthusiasts.

title: W. T. GRANT SKIPS QUARTER DIVIDEND
description: Growing deficits and decreased sales on top of other operating problems at the W. T. Grant Company prompted the directors yesterday to omit the payment of dividends on the common stock for the first time in its 68year history. Shareholders had received 15 cents quarterly on July 1 and April 1, a cut from the 37cent quarterly rate paid previously.

title: Advertising: United's New Spirit
description: United Airlines, America's largest airline, will begin its fall advertising campaign Labor Day with some of the spirit of previous campaigns and some new approaches.

title: Mrs. Dempsey's 79 Wins Senior Golf
description: SANDS POINT, L.I., Aug. 27Mrs. Thorne Dempsey of St. George's won the 12th annual women's Cross County Golf Association senior championship today with a 79 over the par73, 5,770yard Sands Point Golf Club course.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Administration is conducting a comprehensive study aimed at identifying dozens of different Government policies and programs that may be contributing to inflation by fostering inefficient operation of the private sector of the economy.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BUDDY SYSTEM Buddy Rich gets around. Chances are that he's appeared some place near you fairly recently, but the easiest way to catch him now is to stop by the club he opened earlier in the year, Buddy's Place (7525855), at 1220 Second Avenue, at 64th Street. After a fiveweek tour, he's returned this week with his jazz sextet for an extended run. Buddy Rich plays the drums, of course, with a fierceness that many people find unmatched. He'll be performing with Anthony Jackson on bass, Jack Wilkins on guitar, Joe Romano on alto sax, Sal Nistico on tenor sax, Angel Aaende on congo drums and John Bunch on piano.

title: PANEL ASKS EASING OF DRUG PENALTY
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27A legislative narcotics study commission was reported tonight to be planning to urge the end of criminal penalties in New Jersey for the possession of small amounts of hard drugs and one ounce or less of marijuana.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Residents of the East Third Street neighborhood in New York City, where dozens of families were routed by suspicious fires recently, were skeptical of police contentions that a youth who was recognized as a hero in a tenement fire a week ago might have been involved in the origin of a second fire last Monday.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27When President Ford was sworn into office on Aug. 9, he and his closest advisers were determined to reshape the Presidency he inherited from Richard M. Nixon. This would be done largely by making it more open and more broadly based and by removing everyone who had any association with the Watergate scandals.

title: 54 School Districts Lack Contracts With Teachers
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)With the first day of school only a week away, 54 New Jersey school districts have yet to sign contract agreements with teachers, a spokesman for the New Jersey Education Association said today.

title: Council Weighs Making Staten Island Official
description: The story, apparently originating in a burlesque hall, is that when Henry Hudson sailed the Half Moon through the mists into New York harbor, his Dutch first mate pointed to a land mass off the Jersey shore and asked, Iss dat an island?

title: Presence of U.S. Forces in Korea Again at Issue Amid Unrest in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 24Against a backdrop of political unrest here, the presence of American forces in South Korea has again become a controversial issue.

title: About New York
description: The mind rarely soars with the skyscrapers in New York. The eye is kept at ground level because the heights reduce the human dimension, as you might say if you're one who needs cosmic reasons. Or, the sights may be lowered simply because there's so much more of interest to see on the streets than in the architectural shafts that become a mere backdrop to daily life.

title: SIMON HINTS CUT IN SPENDING LIMIT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon indicated today that the Ford Administration had added $2billion or so to the amount by which it wants to ctit the current Federal budget.

title: Wings Acquire Grant.
description: DETROIT, Aug. 27 (UPI)  Henry Boucha, 23 years old, was traded by the Detroit Red Wings to the Minnesota North Stars today for a former National Hockey. League rookie of the year, Danny Grant, a 27yearold, left wing with an average of29 goals for his six years in the league.

title: W.U. to Kill GiltAmerica If Unit's Contracts Lag
description: MAHWAH, N.J., Aug. 27 (Reuters)  The Western Union Corporation said today that it would discontinue the operations of its GiftAmerica, Inc., subsidiary unless new contracts were forthcoming. Western Union has written off $28.5milion, including all GiftAmerica deferred startup costs, against 1974 earn, ings.

title: Brannen Lists Net Worth; Urges Ribicoff to Do Same
description: MERIDEN, Conn., Aug. 27 (UPI)James H. Brannen, the Republican candidate for the Senate from Connecticut, today disclosed his family's net worth is $41,000 and urged his opponent, Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, a Democrat, to do the same.

title: Logging Technology Is Carving Up Maine Wilderness
description: RANGE 5, NEW CANADA, Vle.Clarence Theriault ground the big yellow skidder forward, the chains on the huge treaded tires catching in the Fresh earth, and the blade leaved the pile of spruce trees up and apart, spreading them to they could be swiftly cut ??nto lengths.

title: PATRIARCH SEEKING PAPAL AID IN ARREST
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 27Patriarch Maximos V Hakim of the Greek Catholic Church flew to Rome today to discuss with Pope Paul VI the detention by Israel of the Most Rev. Hilarion Capucci, the Greek Catholic Archbishop of East Jerusalem.

title: Indus Dam in Pakistan Feared Near Collapse
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Aug. 27People living close to the giant Tarbela dam in eastern Pakistan are reported to be fearful that the world's largest rockfilled dam will collapse.

title: S.E.C. Prodding Exchanges on Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 27The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it would ask all national stock exchanges next month to modify or repeal rules or practices, requiring members to charge fixed commission rates unless action on their part should make this unnecessary.

title: Flemington Fair Bombards All the Senses
description: FLEMINGTON, Aug. 27It's noisy, it's crowded, it's indigestible.

title: Kuwait Expected to Invest 1.8Billion in British Bonds
description: KUWAIT, Aug. 27 (AP)Final arrangements are being worked out for Kuwait to invest $1.8billion in British government bonds, Finance Ministry sources said today.

title: Guyana Sugar Is Sold In New Venezuela Deal
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Aug. 27 (UPI)Guyana will deliver 12,500 tons of sugar, valued at $7.5million, to Venezuela in a new agreement hailed here as additional evidence of an era of friendship between the longfeuding neighboring countries.

title: MONOPOLY TREND IN MILK IS FOUND
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 27The Westchester County Attorney said today that he would tell Federal authorities about unhealthy trading practices in the milk industry.

title: CROWD WALKS BY, IGNORING MUGGING
description: A 66yearold New Jersey man walking to the Port Authority bus terminal was beaten I to the ground by two attackers Monday night, while a crowd of onlookers did nothing to assist him.

title: RESTRUCTURING ENDS AT MORTGAGE UNIT
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 27 (Reuters) Great American Mortgage Investors has completed a major restructuring of its shortterm bank debt into a $265million term loan, maturing August, 1975, with two banks, according to an announcement today.

title: Quaze Quilt Not Slowed by White Feet
description: Quaze Quilt, that filly with four white feet, returns to the races today by opposing six other 3yearolds in the $50,000added Gazelle at Belmont Park. Not only does Quaze Quilt have the white feet. She has a white face, too. That is a combination, old horsemen believe, that does not result in a champion.

title: Whale Has Slim Chance
description: MIAMI, Aug. 27 (AP)  A twoweek old, 1,800pound sperm whale is being nursed with artificial milk and hand fed with squid but has only a very, veryslim chance of survival, marine scientists at the Miami Seaquarium said yesterday. The baby whale was found stranded without its mother in the Atlantic off Miami.

title: LTV TO COMPLETE J. & L ACQUISITION
description: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation said in Pittsburgh yesterday that it had been advised by the LTV Corporation, its principal shareholder, that LTV intended to acquire the remaining publicly owned shares of the steel company. In Dallas, LTV said that its management would recommend to its board today the purchase of the J. & L. minority interest consisting of 2,963,441 shares, or about 19 per cent of the total common shares outstanding.

title: FRANCE WILL LIFT EMBARGO ON ARMS TO MIDEAST LANDS
description: PARIS, Aug. 27France, which is conducting a fundamental review of her defense policy, has decided to lift her embargo on arms sales to Middle East battlefield countries, it was learned officially today.

title: Henry D. Bomze, 68, Dies; Published Racing Journals
description: Henry Daniel Bomze, publisher of Racing Star Weekly and American Turf Monthly, died yesterday. He was 68 years old, lived here at 4 Park Avenue, and had a farm in Annandale, N.J., and a residence in Palm Beach.

title: SIMON HINTS CUT IN SPENDING LIMIT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon indicated today that the Ford Administration had added $2billion or so to the amount by which it wants to cut the current Federal budget.

title: 2 Convicts Boast to Police of Crime Wave in Texas
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tex., Aug. 27 (UPI)At the end of a ColoradotoTexas wave of murder, revenge and rape, two surviving convicts were described today as having boasted to the police that they stalked, then executed two persons to settle grudges and planned to slip into Mexico to live as soldiers of fortune.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Missing Girls Found in Wildwood

title: Duane Thomas Cut
description: CARLISLE, Pa., Aug. 27 (UPI)Coach George Allen of the Washington Redskins, saying talent was not enough, released his controversial running back, Diane Thomas today following a disagreement between the player and an assistant coach. We all tried to help Duane, the coaches and the entire organization, Allen said. He has made considerable progress and he can help someone. He is in great condition. I like him very much and wish him good luck.

title: Ford Signs Bill to Extend Overseas Investment Unit
